reviews.review: The food portions were rather large, which is a good thing but the quality or taste needs to be turned up a notch. I was really disappointed with the Cashew pancakes. Service was great as well, however I rate due to the taste because service is only relevant to the individual servers. I would rather go to Hash House or Mr. Mamas!

Came here on a Saturday. It was busy. Has a lot of seatings including outdoor. It was packed when we got there. We were told the wait would be around 15-20 mins. But we were seated within 10. 

Our waiter was nice and helpful. There were other servers that were helpful too even though it wasn't their table to serve which is a plus. The hostess could greet their customers better. Just a hi and how's your day, also Didn't smile much. I noticed it wasn't just us. I greeted them more. 

Food... Was great. I ordered the spinach Benny. Eggs Benedict with potatoes on the side. I'm picky with my poached eggs and they made it perfect. Not too wet or to cooked like some other places I've been to. My BF ordered original house burrito and he said that was good. I tried it and it was good too. Lastly we ordered chocolate chip pancakes. I've never had choc chip pan cakes before but for having it the first time. I loved it. 

Prices were good not too expensive. Would definitely come here again.

Very good service and great food.  I've had wonderful servers every time i had breakfast or lunch here. Chance helped me out and was delightful through it all. Raul is also has a great personality and was sure that everything went through smoothly. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast or lunch.

My husband and I are visiting Vegas for our honeymoon and wanted search out the best breakfast in town -- we found it! Our server, Carol Anne, was almost as sweet as the waffles! If we ever visit Vegas again,  we'll be back to Egg and I.

Thanks to Yelp and the good ol community of yelpers out there i know A LOT of places where 10 bucks can go a LONG way in providing some good eats.

My Buddy recommended The Egg & I after hearing some good things about it from other sources. I've driven by this place multiple times and it's caught my attention a few time while in the same plaza as B&C Camera. 

They have a diverse menu of egg related items. I was about to order one of the combo skillets because another table's home fries looked GOOD but ended up getting a Hawaiian themed plate which featured Portuguese Sasuage or Spam (went for the sausage), rice, two eggs any style (sunny side up), "sticky" rice (turned out to be calrose rice). Also came with a choice of what ever bread or the banana nut muffin everyone raves about. 

I choose the muffin and man oh man it did not disappoint. Blueberry's always been my favorite muffin and to be honest i havent eaten enough muffins in my life time. If i were in a situation where the entire fate of humanity rested upon my recommendation for a muffin it would be The Egg & I's banana nut hands own, sorry humanity you had your chance i'm throwing this one out and if it lands under the bus so be it. 

Overall the island favorite plate was good, obviously the Portuguese sausage made the dish but in all honesty it wasnt worth the price. Even with the banana nut muffin dreams are made of it still wasnt quite worth it. For the same price my buddy got one of the combo skillets and he ended up easily with three times more food then i did.

So far i do like this place. Outdoor seating was available immediately seeing as it was a cold morning but their heaters are very powerful and aside from a few gusts of wind there was very little outdoor discomfort. Looking at other people's plate was very easy on the eyes as their selection of food is diverse yet seeing common dishes amongst different diners makes me want to come back and get what they're getting because they cant all be wrong.
Really good!! Muffins are awesome. Great menu with a lot of interesting items. Can order half orders!!!!

Didn't even eat there. Waited for 20 minutes when a person parked there car in the front as we waited and and left 2 dogs with the windows up in the hot sun. I went in to talk to the hostess and asked her to make a brief announcement to the restaurant and she responded to me "that's not my problem. You call someone if you want." Our party of 6 immediately left, I will never return.

Whether you hear about the Egg&I through word of mouth, or through online posts, you cannot trust a review until you experience the venue yourself.  

Well, if you choose one place to experience, the Egg&I should be it.  This restaurant, provides great service and food.  The servers are knowledgable of their menu.  The food is deliciously prepared and served.  The busier times you will have provide your name to the host stand, the wait has been only fifteen minutes.  And if  your server asks your bread choice, ask for the Banana bread.

Food was fantastic. The portiins are VERY filling. Amanda was our server and she was so sweet and helpful. We were a large party including 2 crabby seniors and a fussy baby and she made sure that everyone was well taken care of.
Best omlette ive ever had, the server patrick was amazing! I think we found our new breakfast spot in vegas
This place is awesome. Good Quantity and flavor. Loved the banana muffin. Will defiantly make it a go to breakfast spot when I visit Vegas

Great brekkie place.  Its not uber cheap (average $8) but they do give you good portions, and their muffin is great. 

The coffee is just ok, but they bring a pot like IHOP and you pour to your heart's content. Lucky there's a Starbucks 1/2 block up the street. :D

Service is egg-selent!  Plenty of parking.  It can get crowded on weekends.

Me and my husband were visiting Las Vegas and I found this place on Yelp. We have it a try and the food was amazing, the service also was great.
We visited again for our last day of vacation and everything was great.
Great food and great service
I highly recommend here.
Sooooo delicious 
Thank you egg and I, you guys rock
Great variety, good food and friendly staff. I had the country fried steak skillet and it was 2 meals worth of food!

First time here in the multiple times I've been to Vegas, I wonder what took me so longggggg?  the food was amazing, especially the Yelp muffin and French toast. Our server Liza was such a loving lady always checking in every 3-5mins making sure we didn't need anything extra, because of her I'll be coming back every time I visit Vegas from here on. Thank you for your great service Liza! Hope you get those Disneyland tickets, you deserve them!!!

Egg and I is one of or favorite places to eat. Not only is the food fantastic but the service matches the food. Today we again encountered the service we have grown accustomed to. Although it was packs, Curtis continued to check in with us. My measurement of good service is I never have to go out of my way to look for the server. Our drinks were always full and he continued to check in. We were eating with a 4 and 2 year old, he understood the urgency. Curtis is fantastic!
Wow! It's great to get off the strip to eat at places like this! The portions are just right and they taste Amazing! Get anything with their sausage gravy and you will not be disappointed!!

We absolutely ADORED this place! Everything was delicious. There was no wait & our server was on top of her game. We had a party of 5 & enjoyed corned beef hash, tostada bowl, omelettes, French toast & a few carafes of coffee. Their muffins are hot, moist and delicious & their salsa is amazing! I'm not sure what they do their potatoes, but best we ever had! Such a gem! We will be back as soon as we touch down in Vegas again.

Have not eaten at this one in over a year, but all their locations make a great breakfast, its a chain with a family run atmosphere. 
bacon egg and cheese stuffed into french toast, with seasoned  potatoes on the side OMG!

Found this place thanks to yelp! Super friendly staff and the patio is dog friendly! Amanda our server was great! She was really attentive nice and always smiling! The food and coffee was awesome too! I definitely recommended it! You will love this place from the moment you walk in!
Amazing breakfast I had have in a while I appreciate the kindness of the waiters. Fantastic food they have ill definitely be back.

we yelped to find the egg and I while staying in Vegas. So glad we did . This place is so yummy. Nice warm banana bread muffins. Great variety of food choices for breakfast and lunch. Our family of 6 all got different items and we all loved each of our selections . I don't think you can go wrong with anything you choose. We received wonderful service from our waitress STACI. She was on top of refills and making sure we liked what we ordered. . I would go back again just because STACI's service was great. I would request her every time we go back. Definitely should try this place if you haven't already .

Jaime P. and I come here at least once during our stay in Vegas for breakfast (obviously).  Since it's a locals place, it gets pretty crowded, so don't come thinking you're not going to have to wait a bit before getting a seat.  It's totally worth it.  Located right off the strip, it's a great place to grab a bite to eat without hassling with the nearby hotels.  The prices are reasonable and they have a huge menu to choose from.  Even the pickiest of eaters have something to pick, no matter how difficult they might be.

It's a country style restaurant with a variety of egg dishes.  My favorite is the Eggs Benedict.  The hollandaise sauce is creamy and perfect and it's paired with some seasoned potatoes.  I like them, but they aren't my favorite.

Their biscuits and gravy are pretty awesome as well. A great dish to serve with the table, but if you're starving, you might want to try to conquer them by yourself.

Tamara has made a day. She had gone above and beyond for us. She has this great skill of making the best recommendations and so friendly. Brought everything we asked for and kept checking on us. Thank you Tamara because of you I'll keep coming back to the Egg and I.

I stopped by here when I was at a conference in Vegas. A friend of mine was also in Vegas and had his car and said he could take me off the strip to eat if I wanted to work of course I took him up on the offer. Browsed through yelp and found this cute joint. The good portions are HUGE and yummy. I also liked that they have the happy egg or sad egg card that you put on a stand to let wait staff know you need something instead of them constantly checking on you. I say if you're in the area or in Vegas with a car this would be a great breakfast stop. Also, if you check in you get free banana bread -- mhmmm.

So my brother and my best friend and I decided to have breakfast here. Was a bit disappointed that this location doesn't serve alcohol but oh well. So we walk in and request an outside table and were seated in a timely manner. The hostess seated us that had the tip still on the table and I thought that maybe she didn't see so I let her know oh the tip is still on the table and she had a bit of an attitude while telling me the server would grab it. The server, Amanda, came over to us and greeted us and we told her what happened. I wasn't that upset but I just thought it was kind of ridiculous. Anyways our server was really great! Bubbly and cute and super friendly. She even sent the manager over after we had told her about the tip thing and they gave us a free round of muffins! I love that! I guess it's company policy they leave the tip on the table due to bussers stealing tips. 

So on to the food. I got what I always do, it's just a platter with potatoes sausage toast and eggs and it's always delicious. My brother got banana but French toast and Biola got regular French toast and it was fricking fantastic.  

Once again I'd just like to say how amazing our server was! Thanks Amanda! Also I hope you win that trip to Disneyland!

Great breakfast. We had biscuits and gravy, omelette with avocado and bacon and couple of banana muffins. 
Food came out fast, hot and enough to fill us up. 
Service was great as well. 
I hope I didn't jinx myself for the next time i come again to get bad service and food. Haha

Best service ever. Answered our questions before we asked. Attentive without being overbearing. Thanks Alexa! 
Everything we had was great,  and had something special about it. Cinnamon French Toast had an apple chutney that was fantastic. 
The Italian scramble was great and made to order (light cheese,  egg whites). The Sundance special omlette was delicious. 
Rustic,  clean setting. Interesting,  large menu.  Huge portions. Great value. College football on the three large TVs 
Short wait,  and things moved quickly. 
Great experience.

Fast service and good food. Their country  potatoes are a little too salty but are tasty with some ketchup. I had the California crepe and it was so good. My son had the chicken strips and fries. He said the fries were too salty to eat so he didn't eat them. I'm giving them a 4 due to the salty items.

Great friendly staff and our party of 8 was actually seated within 5-10 minutes.  

Banana nut muffins. Get one free if you check in! They are amazing!!! Soft, not too sweet, super moist. 

Chicken fried steak skillet. Crisp breading. Gravy flavorful. 

Corned beef hash. Comes out on a skillet and was really good. Large pieces of shredded beef was in every bite. Very tasty. 

Habla Diablo sauce was really good. I put that stuff on everything and it kicked it up a notch.

Everything was good. We'll be back!

This place never disappoints. The only thing disappointing is the long wait, which only means one thing. Parking is also difficult. It's definitely worth the wait. The banana nut muffin is a must. I think the menu was made for hangovers. Anything you get on the menu would mend it. The only thing on my last visit I had an issue with was my potatoes. They were really salty. It wasn't just my potato it was also with my group. Everyone's potato was salty. Other than that everything was EGGcelent.

I am definitely a fan. Great, quick service, home - like warm ambience, and a hearty breakfast all make for a beautiful dining experience. 
We had the Fiesta Skillet, Vegetarian Crêpe, and Waffle Works with whip cream and strawberries. Traditional/Deliciously cooked eggs and food made to order. It has a loyal following so try to get there early if you can. :)

The food was good but not amazing, I'm not sure what all the hype is about. Service was great hence the 4 stars. Husband liked his works omelette. I ordered the stuffed French toast which had a little too much cheese and the kids' banana pancake was pretty dry. I'm not sure I'd come back.
This place blows broken yolk out of the water.  You have to get the potatoes with your breakfast.  It's off the main drag but totally worth the short trip.....

I come to this place every time I come to Vegas, no matter whom I'm with. They definitely have the traditional breakfast diner feel and the newspaper menus add to that feel. The waiters and waitresses are always friendly and conversationalists. The food is flavorful and you get a lot of it. I normally get the classic eggs (with cheddar jack cheese), bacon (it's crispy!), their country potatoes, and 9 grain toast. If I don't order that then I order their parfait. I know, parfait sounds lame but their parfait comes in a big old school milkshake glass with yogurt, granola, and a mix of fresh fruits. I actually couldn't even finish it last time. 

This place is packed on the weekends and they do not take reservations. 

They always have a deal a Groupon, it's worth it!

After a long night out in vegas lights, the Egg & I is just the right place to go afterwards. While the wait is bit long, its all worth it for the food and service they provide. Shout out to our host Earl, who took care of us perfectly! Those with  spicy pallet, the food is perfect for you. Combination of mexican spices and english twist on the spinach Benedict is finger licking good. Highly recommended #VeggieAbroad

I think it's really funny that I had no idea this place is the same as Egg Works. I probably wouldn't have came here had I known because I didn't much like Egg Works off of Rainbow. 

Surprisingly I thought the food and the service here at Egg & I were much more acceptable then Egg works. Boy was it busy though, I hate waiting outside...it's too damn hot in Vegas. Besides sitting in the heat waiting to be seated, I enjoyed the rest of my experience here. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the food was good (not amazing).
bomb.com .. And Alyssa was such a good server ... We'll be coming here more often not bad first my first time trying it

旅行者は車がないと不便な場所にあるので今回やっと朝食を食べに行きました。
人気店の為7:30頃に。
念願のエッグベネディクト。
主人はアボカドが入ったオムレツを。
繊細さはないけどオランデソースが最高!!

2人で完食は出来ませんでしたが大満足です。

Love this joint! We waited about 20 minutes on a Sunday which was shorter than I would expect for such a popular place. Our waitress (bummed I don't remember her name) was ridiculously sweet and friendly. She provided great service. The food was delicious. I'm really picky about eggs benedict and theirs did not disappoint. I had the prime rib benny and highly recommend it, came on a croissant. We were planning on ordering a carrot cake to go and when they were out of it they gave us a loaf of carrot cake on the house - it's gestures like that that make all the difference. Great place and will definitely be returning. They're doing it right :)

I stopped in after all the positive reviews, I must say it was right on par. The food was good, banana nut muffin was great, and the staff was awesome! It's actually the great staff that took the 4 star food rating to a 5 star overall diner rating. Thanks guys!

I would give a hundred stars if I could. Alexa was beyond amazing, I'm shocked she's not serving at the nicest most high end restaurant in Vegas. She has a smile that lights up an entire room and a personality to match it. We were being somewhat complicated with our order and everything came out perfect and tasted great. Will absolutely be back!!

This place is highly overrated. I've eaten at way better breakfast/brunch places that are also reasonably priced and give you large portions. The major difference is quality! I was not a fan of their potatoes and I normally love potatoes. But there's is clearly frozen potatoes that they just fried and added some powder flavoring. It also was overcooked. I got an egg omelette and they are suppose to be famous for "EGGS". So why was my eggs overcooked as well?! My whole family and I were not impressed whatsoever with the quality of food. The service was ok. Price is reasonable. But the quality of the food and the ingredients weren't that impressive. As mentioned, this place is highly overrated.
Carol Ann was great!!  Food is always good here. It's always super busy. I don't know how they get to everyone so quickly,  but they do. Just another great experience here.

I really like this place.  Casual, cheap and good breakfast.  Most of your breakfast dishes come with a choice of toast or banana muffin.  Get the muffin.  Their are so many choices, it's hard to make a decision.  I've had the Loco Moco, pancakes, omelettes, french toast, country style breakfasts.  Popular place so you will wait for your tables.  Parking is abundant.

So, so close to Five Stars, but given the fact that the coffee is weak and flavorless, I have to take it down to four.  Otherwise:

- STELLAR breakfast food
- Some of the best omelettes I've ever had in my entire life (the standouts for us were the chile relleno and the avocado/bacon)
- Biscuits and gravy are LEGIT

Prices are low, service is great.

Stopped in here for breakfast on the way out of town.  Wife had banana pancakes with pecans, and I had some prime rib/eggs benedict plate.  She liked her meal, and mine was good other than the prime rib being a bit too seasoned.  The portions were big, but the prices were a little higher than I expected.  It was pretty crowded, but we had good service.  Unfortunately, there are a lot of breakfast joints in Vegas, so I probably won't be back.  But worth a try - maybe it just wasn't my style.
Huge portions at reasonable prices.  Friendly staff and clean facilities.

We came here for the first time and will definitely be back. Great portions, good prices, and exceptional service. Tabitha was great, making recommendations for us and meeting all of ours needs. Thanks Tabitha!

Such a hot spot. This little dive lives up to its reputation. Best omelette I have ever had. The texture of my omelette was perfection. Being on a low carb diet, I opted out of the banana muffin and potatoes, but they both looked delicious. The wait for brunch was about 20 minutes for peak Saturday time, but so worth it. Our server, Liza was very personable and prompt with service. We got our meals hot, fresh and quick with the epitomy of service with a smile. Well off the strip so our meal for four of us was $55, which was what my husband I spent yesterday,  splitting a breakfast omelette yesterday at a breakfast spot on the strip.

Prime rib Benny! beeeeeennnnnyy... benny and the jets... ha...

ok, for reals tho - 

the GRUB:
- check out my pics, my wife got the stuffed french toast with eggs and bacon, french toast, powdered sugar, and maple syrup - like the kitchen sink of breakfasts all in one bite... pretty good.
- also pictured, i got the Prime Rib Benny - ala the meaty blackened spice prime rib, poached eggs, holandaise sauce, on top of an open faced buttered croissant like a traditional eggs benedict - but kicked upped... super filling and super delicious
- fresh squeezed OJ and hot cups of Joe

the JOINT:
- typical vegas locals crowd, a little bit of everyone
- old school decor on the inside (like a country kitchen)
- outside patio seating if not a scorcher of a desert day
- they had an LCD with local sports and AC too

the SQUEEZE:
- breakfasts are always too expensive to me, so im a little jaded... but anyways, those 2 dishes and fresh squeezed OJ = approx $50 after tax and tip
- friendly wait staff and hostess
- plenty of parking in the strip mall
- vegas blvd (the strip) close

FINAL SAY:
pretty good change up for breakfast, if youre starting to get tired of those casino buffet champagne brunches/breakfasts...

WOWWWWWWWIIIIEEEEEEEEE!

that's what I felt when I put the stuffed french toast in my mouth! and this is what I looked like O.O

I came here once before and got a healthy omelette. I wasn't thoroughly impressed with this place, but let's be real, how yummy can anything healthy get? But I decided to give it another chance and decided to try one of their signature dishes. THE stuffed french toast: french toast stuffed with egg, sausage and cheese topped with powdered sugar. It's a heavenly mix of savory and sweet, especially dipped in maple syrup.

Most of their entrees come with their homemade potatoes. They're lightly fried to give a french fry crisp and cajun-flavored that makes it taste like Lay's BBQ chips!!

This place is better than the all time popular Hash House A-go-go!! It's as good as breakfast can get!!

I ordered the classic. I love the potatoes. The banana nut muffin is delicious. I have it a three star because the wait is way too long. I came in with a party of 5 and we were quoted 20 min and we waiting an hr. I recommend a seating system so that they will be able to know how long the tables have been sat. So they can give an effective wait time.

The food was nothing out of the ordinary but pretty good. Although the whip cream they used for the hot chocolate and waffles was mighty delicious. 
Our server Brady was phenomenal. Even though he seemed to be overwhelmingly busy he greeted us with a smile and continuously checked in on us to make sure we were doing fine.

Definitely recommend this place for breakfast...the wait is probably better than Hash A Go-Go but the con are that 1) when you call in to out your name on the list, they tell everyone that it's at least 30 minutes wait but actually it could be 45 min to an hour and 2) their waiting area is very tight & a bit fire hazard. The pro is that is food portion is pretty large, and the staff are super friendly unlike Hash A Go-Go where the hostesses are super snobby because they think they have power toco trial when you could be seated. The hostesses at Eggs & I are super friendly & do their best to find tables for large party. They even gave us extra banana muffins for free for the long wait & the muffins are yummy.

Killer breakfast at this place, and I'm not big on breakfast. I definitely enjoyed the giant selection on the menu.  You might not eat the rest of the day though--generous portions!

It's also away from the insanity of the strip--which I found favorable.

The food was simply delicious. Service was impeccable. This is one of the best breakfast places I have ever been to.  The banana nut muffin was everything.  I can't wait to come back on my next visit to Vegas.
Great Food !!! Great service will come Back again. I would never order a banana nut muffin but this one was great a must try. Tamara was our server and she did and great job!!

Awesome breakfast and awesome server! Manuela was so attentive and probably the best server I have encountered in a very long time. I highly recommend the Crazy Chicken omelette! If your appetite is big get the whole thing (half portions also available). Best banana nut muffins too! You can't go wrong here!
Food was excellent as always. Definitely a must to come here whenever we're at Vegas. Carole Ann's service was amazing! Let's get her to Disneyland!

Good quality comfort breakfast food that comes in huge portions! Each entree is about $10-$12 and most  come with fruit or potatoes, and toast or a banana muffin- definitely big enough to share. (I would recommend choosing the banana muffin, it's freshly baked and absolutely delicious. Note that you get a free muffin with Yelp check in!) 

While I don't consider most of the menu items to be healthy, as is typical of many American breakfast diners, you are given the option to make your order healthier, whether it be by using egg whites only, no cooking oil, etc. There are also SO MANY menu items to choose from. 

Stop by here to have a great start to your day!

Awesome breakfast. Look forward to coming when I am in town. I always get the key largo crepe. Would love one of these in San Jose. Came on a Sunday once and it was packed so plan to wait. Week days are better.
The food was decent, it wasn't anything special. It took awhile for them to bring out the food and even longer to pay, their payment area was 7-8 people long, kind of annoying.

A decent,  not great, breakfast experience in a market  hurting for a good breakfast restaurant. Few truly healthy options here. Too busy for really good service. Prices are very good. Beware the at their sausage patties are rather flavorless,  pre-fab frozen breakfast sandwich patties.

I had the vegi-benny breakfast with their breakfast potatos, ie deep fried potato nuggets. The Benny was very good. Their cinnamon roll was very good. Not 5 stats for having to wait way too long for coffee and for few healthy options. A last note about all the televisions they have mounted on the walls. We enjoyed watching COPS while dining. Really guys? 

The fact that this place has long waits on weekends goes to show that Las Vegas needs better because even this greasy spoon with a homecooked image gets slammed.

Went here for breakfast with some friends after working all night. Nice family restaurant, and the service was quick and friendly. It is off the strip but it's worth the trip. 

Everyone's food looked great and I was happy to find out that the taste and quality were there. Some portions seemed big but most of them were good. 

I got the waffle combo plate and the highly recommend banana nut muffin which was awesome! Already planning on going back.

I haven't had breakfast in here in a while, not since we first move here around 8-9 years ago.  No one here this morning, our family finally left for home after a nice long visit, so we were up early going to the airport to drop off.  With plenty of time, we decided to stop in and give this place a try.

Good breakfast place. Size is generous, choices are plenty, and prices are average. Service was great.  I would recommend it.

Great breakfast and lunch.  My wife and I had the Cobb salad.  Very fresh ingredients and very tasty. Our server was Kathleen and she was very courteous and friendly.  This was the location at 2490 E Sunset Road in Las Vegas.

Had a great time - our server Bree was excellent too. However, she never brought out our disco ball, and thus I was unable to OFFICIALLY beat her in the dance-off I challenged her to. 

As a Cincinnati resident, their Cincy Style Chili was great. Their muffins are amazing. The egg dishes were wonderful and full of flavor. This was hands down the best breakfast I've ever had in Vegas!

My family & I came from Cali, which is like a 4 hr drive to this place & overall it is soo worth the drive! Their banana nut muffins are delicious! I recommend trying it. The place is kinda cramped but all that matters is that the food is yummy. Also our server, Tabatha, was really kind. Definitely love servers like her!

I've been here several times over the years and finally getting the thoughts down on Yelp. On my last visit I was a little peeved when the hostess passed me over when taking names for the waiting list. I know I'm not invisible. Once seated things calmed down and breakfast was on. I had a skillet which are always good but I was looking for a spinach & ground beef omelet with cheese but they don't have that on the menu but I'll ask next time. Not always my first choice for breakfast but its a good place to be.

Wow, what a great meal. I had the spinach Benny and shared a short stack of pumpkin pancakes (not on the menu). OMG the pancakes were out of this world. This place is definitely our new stop before we head home!
Corner breakfast shop with a family atmosphere and very welcoming staff. Our server was always attentive and made the experience exceptional! Will come back again:)

If your looking for a great Breakfast spot in the LV area, look no further.  This place was great.  I ordered 2 eggs over-easy, with Potatoes and bacon.  My wife got an omlet.  We also ordered a biscuits and gravy.  Everything was AMAZING!!!!!!  It can get kind of crowded in the AM on the weekends but its worth it.

Pretty good.  Local popular eatery.
Lots of breakfast food items to choose from, lots of egg items from american style to mexican style huevos rancheros.
A lot of american breakfast places arent that good, but this one was, so yay!~! since its rare i find an american breakfast place that i like.
very nice and friendly staff.  eggs were cooked right, not bland, and just the right portion.

So glad to have found this gem! The wait wasn't too long on a Friday afternoon. Everyone was friendly from the host to our server. I can't remember his name, but he gave excellent recommendations on the food. We had the Crazy Chicken omelette, Hawaiian French toast, and the Traditional Benny. ALL WERE DELICIOUS! I will definitely be back!
Great food, great service.   Found this place while visiting Vegas.  Great American and Mexican breakfast specials.  Great options, great service, great price - get off the strip.
This place is a must for breakfast! Every time we come to Las Vegas, it's a tradition to come here! Our server Koko was awesome! If we could give her 7 stars, we would!

I came to the egg and I in Las Vegas because I had been previously to the egg and I in Estes Park, Co. They didn't have the same menu items as they do in CO but everything was just as good. I ordered a breakfast skillet with potatoes and chili. The skillet was very good, I loved it. My wife had the breakfast burrito and she also loved it. The potatoes are seasoned with paprika and other ingredients and are very good, but I prefer the CO potatoes. The only thing that I didn't like about this place is that they don't use the egg and I brand hot sauce.
Amazing food and service! Tabatha was our server and she was awesome! Will definitely be back

Sooo hungover, and new in town, I could only think of this place.

It's cute inside, the waitress was nice, but not very attentive.

The plain waffle was flavorless, the bacon uncrisp and small, the potatoes were extra and toast did not come with the meal.

Once the headache subsided, I thought of two places that served a better breakast for half the price.

This is by far my favorite place to have breakfast and now lunch in Vegas. Their banana nut bread/ muffin is amazing!! The best! Very moist and nutty.

This was my first time ordering off the lunch menu and I got the Cinci Chili Burger.  It was delicious!  Great tasty chili with the Ranch Potatoes on the side.  Comes in an open bun with a large pickle, lettuce, and tomatoes.   I was very satifised with it.  

Usually the service is pretty good and friendly except when they're super busy.  Then it gets a little quick and snappy.  But overall, I definitely look forward to coming here whenever I go to Vegas.  And if you like the muffin, definitely buy a loaf to go and put it in the fridge.  It lasts for a while in there and its always moist and soft.
Great breakfast. Seated fast, great server her name was Paula and she was amazing at her job . very friendly. Very fast and very helpful.

Just found this place at random during a stop in Vegas, and now I wish I had one by my home in PA!  The service was excellent, the waitress was so friendly and the food was top-notch delicious. If I was creating a restaurant, this would be the one. I had been unable to decide between a crêpe and a waffle when the waitress suggested half a crêpe to go with the waffle. Perfect! So delicious and they have a cool concept of a tag on the table that you can flip up when you need service and anyone will come over, managers, busboys whoever. Brilliant concept. I had often thought a call light or something like that should be in most restaurants and they have one. So, five stars for this place only because I can't give them more than five stars. Stop by, you won't be sorry!

This morning my childhood best friend and I needed a spot to brunch and have a reunion after 2 years without seeing each other. And what better place than Egg and I? The environment and the staff are all very courteous and attentive. One of their employees had a brief conversation with us and he told us about his life and how he has been working for Egg and I for over 18 years. Peculiarly I felt like I never left home while eating breakfast. Spending quality time with BFF and having brunch were the best of both worlds. I cannot wait to come back. This place has the best stuffed French toast in Las Vegas. I will never forget their fast service and the way they made us feel when we were there. 
Egg and I is top notch.

This place is quite old but, they do great food and great service. the crew is so happy and you know you get good food. coffee is always brewed perfect and they have great seasoned fries i always love. their all the omelet are super good and, my wife always try for the breakfast.

I love the Sad Egg and Happy Egg face décor at the tables for service needs. When you turned the Happy Egg over to the Sad Egg a waitress comes over to the table in seconds. They work as a team at Eggs & I which I appreciate being in the service industry.

The food is wonderful. Whenever I visit Vegas we always stop here for breakfast on the way in or on the way out. I have never ordered anything I didn't like. The Eggs Benedict is my favorite followed by the chili omelet. Don't forget about the breakfast potato's, the best I have ever had.

I love how their menus are printed like a newspaper and I love that the service is always excellent. We will be back next month when we visit Vegas in April!

My fiancé and I stayed in Vegas for the weekend and we wanted an awesome breakfast not in the hotel. We yelped this place and it had 4 1/2 stars so we tried it. It was packed! 15 minute wait but we sat outside. Awesome food! Would definitely come again!
Karla helped us with an amazing brunch!  Food was tasty and plentiful.  Service was terrific.  Will definitely return next time we are in Vegas.

First time visiting the Egg and I, and I have no complaints or regrets!  The entire staff is polite and very inviting.  Special shout out to our server Brady,  he was fabulous!  And the food was delicious!  Definitely recommend visiting this establishment if you are visiting the area!

I was looking for breakfast off the strip and picked this place based on yelp reviews, but I cant agree with the consensus at all. I feel this place is way overrated. The food was smothered in cheese, the potatoes were from frozen and  we were handed the check when we werent even half done with our breakfast. We felt rushed and left feeling heavy (food) with indigestion (food and being rushed out). Will not be returning.

Generous portions, great service, and the food tasted amazing.
A special shout out to Karla who I hope goes to Disney Land soon. She deserves it :)

Also, the banana nut bread is a MUST try.

I'm from Los Angeles and there is no breakfast place like this. I highly recommend it. The breakfast dishes are very creative and mighty tasty. There is a huge variety of food to choose from. 

If you are able, ask to be served by Brady. He was a great server with a good sense of humor. He will make you feel like a welcomed guest.

As long as you like eggs, this is great! They have few non egg choices, but a plethora of egg creations!

I had their breakfast burrito (scraped out of its tortilla -no gluten for me ). It was very good. In retrospect I would just get a skillet but I was starving and not thinking clearly with all the choices! 

I went on a Saturday morning and even though it was crowded, it felt like the wait was fine. The staff is friendly and was obviously working very hard to be quick yet still friendly. I enjoyed this place.
The portions are big but they taste really good Karla  was an excellent server. Ask for her when you're seated . I recommend the Works skillet.
Excellent selection on the menu. It was so good we went back 2 days in a row. Reina was an excellent waitress very accommodating  and friendly! I would highly recommend The Egg & I.
Another great meal at The Egg and I. Always great food, fast service & very nice wait staff. Thaynara helped me today and she was fantastic!
The food here is amazing! Almost as great as Amanda's service! Highly recommend this place to everyone! Had the Country Benny- ermahgawd. So delicious!

Taste: 3
Creativity/Authenticity: 3
Atmosphere: 3
Service: 5
Bang for your buck: 3.5

Lets start with when your standing in line (with no one in it) and 2 girls walk up they will ignore you and seat them first so off to a bad start. The waitress is what made me change my mind very friendly and attentive (perfect service). Now to the food, not sure why this place got such high ratings but i wasn't that impressed. They seem to be all about the omelets so the other stuff might not be so good; to start i got a side of biscuits and gravy... more like stale dry biscuits with not enough gravy so again not off to a good start. So the main dish yeah i should have got an omelet but with so many choices i couldn't decide so i got the cabo breakfast burrito... bad choice the burrito was soggy smothered in sauce it was just very un appetizing and the side of house potatoes covered in that texas seasoning was one cold and dry so i don't know if i just got the last of that batch but my experience here was nothing short of just meh nothing that dennys couldn't have filled. Overall the service here at least from my waitress was what gave this a 3 star but the food was not what i expected; especially from the high reviews this place got. NEXT
Large portions, excellent variety and prices. Karla was an excellent host. Must try this restaurant at least once. Staff is friendly and helpful.
What is there to say....the food was delicious and the cost very reasonable.service was great and although it was very busy they quickly moved us to our seats. I would bucky recommend the experience.

Best breakfast diner experience! Karla was very sweet and polite. She helped me order my eggs perfectly to perfection. We had the banana nut muffin...AMAZING! Added some butter, even more yummy! I'm cheating on my Mom's homemade banana nut bread..shhhh don't tell her! What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas! Anyways my husband had the bacon avacado omelet and he added sausage.Very yummy!  I had country fried steak with eggs (medium over medium) pefect when I cut into the egg the yellow runneth gold over. It was amazing. I had the country fried steak it was good and gravy was definitely homemade, yummy. My only compliant is the gravy was a tad bit too salty for my tastebuds, and I love salty. ...other than that it was perfect. It was already buttered to perfection!  Attention to detail. At home I love my toast buttered immediately so it has time to melt. And they did that. This place is a must go!

Visiting from nc for a few days and of course my husband wanted biscuits and gravy. Our food was so good! He got the country Benny and I the corned beef hash. Amazing! The food and service was great!our server ulises was super friendly and the restaurant has a great system to let the servers know when you need something so they are asking you every 5 mins if you need anything. We will definitely be back here!
Found a really good breakfast place! Plus a great service! Our server was Tamara, shes really nice & friendly. We'll be back ^^
Great breakfast spot away from the strip and fantastic prices! Best vegas breakfast imo

This place is crackin' like an egg. Love the chile relleno omelet. So far this is my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. Friendly staff. Quick & pleasant.

Worth driving off the strip (Not too far). Opposite side of airport.

Food had a very home like feel to it. I went with a large party and everyone ordered various dishes. Not ONE particular dish stood out but the banana nut muffin... now that was pretty amazingly delicious!

Very accommodating to large groups on a Saturday brunch. We were seated almost immediately even with the packed house. Only down side was that they forgot one order from our big group and it happened to be our bachelorette. Also, the order was wrong. Double thumbs down!

Great friendly staff. I got here at 6am on a Sunday and was going to meet a friend. Friend was delayed by a lot but the server kept coming by and checking up on me and offering to bring me little treats and keep me company :)
The food here is top notch! I had the scramble which turned out to be an amazing choice. The food was not greasy and I felt comfortably full afterwards.

Keep up the good work!

Don't even debate just go! Great breakfast the skillets are one better than the next and their fresh banana muffins are so soft and fluffy! It is a great place just to get slightly away from the strip and see what else Las Vegas has to offer. Sure you can go to a buffet their is dozens but the Egg and I is a sweet little shop with great food. We go every time we visit Vegas!

If in Vegas you have to come here for breakfast! Had the French toast and enchilada omelet! Service, family environment, and food where amazing! Liza was great and all the  staff here were super welcoming! Can't say enough great things! Definitely bringing the family here again. And a generous military discount.
Good food for a good price! This would be 4 stars if we hadn't waited 10 min before even getting our drink order in.
Great food and amazing service from Tamara! She's has made the overall experience a good one!

Yelp guided us well! When we arrived, it felt like a breakfast place for the locals. They have plenty of choices. They have traditional American breakfast but we wanted to try something different (not pancakes, waffles or French toast). I had the Italian skillet and my husband had the Sundance omelet. It is a lot of food but we ate it all. I had no more room for my muffin so i took it to go. We loved the experience and would come back any day. This definitely a keeper in my book.

egg-cellent place for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed the eggs and complimentary banana muffins at the beginning of the meal. the blueberry panacakes were a bit dry however the omlette made up for it. i must also say the service was top notch and ended up tipping more than usual

It was good very basic food not every one was a fan like I was, but they ordered Mexican breakfast at an American breakfast spot. I had the Omelet with sausage and orange juice. All was good but the Banana Muffin was oh so nice.

Wonderful food and wonderful service. 

Thank you so much Reina!!! 

We will definitely come back :)

Trying out a new place for breakfast. Saw the yelp review so we went. 

Typical breakfast place. I has the corned beef hash and I enjoyed  it. Wife not so much. She has biscuit and gravy and she said it  was good 

Their muffins were really tasty and a must have.

Servers name was Brady and he was very attentive and a pleasure to have serving us.

Overall I would come back again.

We arrived early on a Monday morning and was seated right away.  Our waitress was very friendly and checked on us throughout our meal even though it had gotten pretty busy.  Our meals were enormous but so delicious.  Even though we were traveling, I brought my leftovers back to the hotel because I couldnt leave them - it was so good.  Best breakfast I've had in Vegas.
I am not from the Vegas area and we decided to try the egg and I. The food was great with large portions and the service was excellent. Our server Oscar was super nice and helpful!
Today we had the pleasure of being waited on by Liza... She was amazing. Her personality and customer service was 5 stars. The food here is always great! She made the experience that much better!

Amazing food at amazing prices, about $15 per person. Everything is homemade and delish. Service is just as amazing as the food, there's a wee wait to get a table but well worth it. Very clean, food is quite fast. They make fresh banana nut muffins daily that just melt in your mouth and you can even buy a loaf or two on the way out, yummy. I can't say enough great things about this place. I highly recommend that if your in Las Vegas you stop by and try The Egg & I.

Great food, recommending the Benny! Only minus is the orange Juice "fresh" is not Tropicana... Will definitely come back!

Thanks Reina for great service!

This is definitely a good example of a brunch place where what you order can have a significant impact on whether you love or hate the food. I ordered the California crepe, which was not made well and tasted fairly bland, despite how promising the combination of ingredients sounded. My friend, however, ordered the chicken fried steak, which was great. This brunch place has a HUGE menu so just make sure you order something that you will definitely like, and you're in the clear. Additionally, the free banana muffin is delicious.
Yum! Great food, homey atmosphere, pleasant service, good price for large portion... definitely coming back here. The banana muffin was super... and my omlete-crepe love child... who knew!
Delicious breakfast place just  off the strip. Service was super friendly, food was really good and prices we're reasonable. Definitely check them out if you have the chance!
Everything is great but for some reason I just don't care for their coffee. HUGE servings that I usually had to save for lunch.

First time eating here.  4 of us had 4 different items based off of our server, Patrick's,  recommendation.  Every item was unbelievable!  Patrick was very helpful ,courteous, and attentive to our needs.  Great experience and wonderful service!  We will be back.

Food is pretty average. Service is spotty at best. 

There are 2 girls working the front counter. One blond who was really stand-offish and borderline rude when I approached the front...I was standing there for nearly 1 minute wondering how to get on the list, when the other one, the brunette came by and asked the blond to put my name on the list. All this time, the blond was just standing around, twirling her hair. The brunette was friendly and made sure my name was on the list. The rude blond really did not care...wonder how many potential customers she has driven away already.

 So, I wont visit again, just due to the rude way in which I was treated at the beginning

Pros:
Chicken Enchilada Omelette is the bomb!
Home Fries are awesome, great seasoning.
Wife loved the French toast!

Cons:
None!

Service was outstanding from the beginning to the end of our visit. We were seated immediately after we walked in the full restaurant. The person who seated us also took our drink orders so we didn't have to wait for our waitress to get freed up. 

I ordered the waffle works with strawberries and cream on top, came with turkey  sausage,  and eggs. The waffle  tasted a little  like heaven it was cooked perfectly the strawberries were fresh and sweet.  The sausage were tasty, and the scrabble eggs which I ordered egg whites were nice and fluffy.  I even redeemed my free banana  nut muffin.  Apparently, everyone loves the muffin but honestly I'm not in to banana  nut and this one did not change my mind. They give you so much food that you don't have room to eat another bite if you can finish the meal at all.

Egg and I had the best food, value and service that I found in Vegas for breakfast.

great breakfast joint off sahara btwn arville and Decatur

think this was the original, they have a number of them in vegas now

buddy had the chicken enchilada omelette, which he said was pretty good
for some reason though, their hash browns are now patties, like you get at mcdonalds....no biggie, still looked good

I had the loco moco, which was good, not anything to write home about though
it was basic hamburger patty over rice with brown gravy and 2 sunny side up eggs on top....funny the waiter asked how I would like the eggs prepared, didn't know there was a choice with loco moco!  in retrospect, probably should have gone with standard breakfast fare or my go to key largo crepe
sometimes you shouldn't try new things
it wasn't bad, I just think their normal breakfast items are a lot better

noticed they have added quite a few southern/Spanish dishes, maybe to cater to changing tastes? I will have to try next time...I know, stick with what you like, but have to let you guys know right?

My family and I came here after finding out the Peppermill was closed for maintenance. The Egg & I was a great find and did not disappoint. 

It's your standard greasy-spoon dinner fair, with a ton of egg options and great service. 

If you're in the area, give it a try. Being off the strip makes it a nice choice outside of the chaos that is Vegas.

Tip: They let you call ahead for reservations as long as you have 6 or more in your party!

I ALWAYS end up eating here at least once every Vegas trip. The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge! The wait to get seated or to receive food is not long and all the waiters are pretty nice. Parking is never an issue since it's a big lot shared with other shops. 

Note that for any entree that lists sides .. they let you swap out the sides! As in, you can change out what's listed there on the menu [took me a while to realize I could get fruit/salad/etc.]. I personally am a huge fan of their seasoned potatoes and omelettes.

Don't forget to check in in for a delicious banana nut muffin!
Delicious breakfast here! I love the breakfast crepes they have! And the banana muffins are by far the best I've ever had! Great breakfast place for sure! Skip Blueberry Hill and head here!!!
Our server Oscar was awesome! Outstanding service & food! Our breakfast was delicious & portions generous.

Honestly the BEST breakfast spot in Vegas! Every time we go to Vegas we make it a point to go here! The potatoes are on point here, WAY better than any potatoes you can get at chain breakfast joints. I highly recommend the blackened prime rib Benny

I had the belgian waffle with strawberry and my wife had the omelette.  They both tasted verty good.  the fries were too salty.  It was easy to get in and people were nice and the one thing I like about this place is that everyone from the waitress to the person who refill the drinks to the table cleaner all want to help you if you have a concern.  They don't just say I will call your server for you.

Exactly the experience we were looking for. We wanted a place off the strip to fill up before catching a flight back to NC. This was the right place. Huge portions that had us fueled for our trip. Don't expect fancy, just a good solid breakfast with a local feel. They have an egg sign sort of thing on the table. The black egg means all is well at your table. The yellow egg signals the staff you would like assistance. We were getting pressed for time to get to the airport and wanted to-go cups for our coffee. We turned the egg to black and a staff member showed up immediately to help us out. Neat idea as this signal is not only for your waiter, but for the entire staff. 
We walked in around 8:30 on a Saturday morning and were seated immediately. By the time we left there was a line out the door. 
We had the Country Benny and Grandma's biscuits and gravy, both with the hash browns. Excellent choices. Anyone familiar with Bojangles on the east coast and their seasoned fries, the hash browns here have a similar flavor. Very good.

I love the egg and i but whats makes it even better is the service. Liza was our server and made sure we were well welcomed. She was attentive and prompt with our orders. She took care of us in every way to make sure we enjoyed our breakfast!  Thanks liza and thanks egg and I!

Love love love this place.  Came out to Vegas house hunting in July, this was the first breakfast I took my family to. Food, service, staff are EGGcelent! Get it? See what I did there?  was just there again yesterday and knew why I fell in love.

There's one thing I like in a restaurant, and that is..... I get exactly what I ordered and the way I ordered it.

The pancake's were still warm up to the last bite, how rare is that.   The staff was friendly and it's off the Vegas strip.......

If you're looking for a good, no frills breakfast spot.  This would be it.....

Delicious food and great service! We had the prime rib Benny and strawberry cream French toast. The potatoes that come with the Benny are soooo good; crispy and well-seasoned. Perry and the other staff were very attentive and friendly. :)
I recommend if you have a larger group, call ahead and make a reservation

And don't forget to check in and get a free, warm banana nut muffin!
Chicken Skillet ( where is my chicken??) hey seasoning is really good

We came in the morning for breakfast and we've been coming here for the last 3 years. We can't miss it when we come to town and every time the service is fantastic! 
This place isn't very big and it gets crowded on weekends. We arrived at about 10:30 on a Saturday morning, but we only waited 15 minutes for a table. Our food came out faster and we were in and out in a little over an hour including great conversation.
Before our food came to the table, our server, Stacy, introduced herself and brought us the delicious banana bread muffins with butter. 
I ordered the eggs Benedict and some orange juice. The hollandaise sauce was creamy and not too thick. The eggs were perfectly poached. Together with the Canadian bacon, everything was well balanced. Sometimes, if the hollandaise sauce is over seasoned, the combination of the hollandaise with Canadian bacon leaves the dish too salty. That definitely wasn't the case here.
Throughout our meal, Stacy was fantastic. She kept checking on us. At one point I needed an additional napkin and was about to flip the egg when the manager walked up to ask what we needed. Although Stacy did bring the check a little early, she apologized, ensured us that there was no rush and brought me the additional orange juice I wanted to order.
When we were done, one of the other servers noticed my injury and offered to help me up. I really appreciated her concern. This place is great!

From 2/25/15
Finally, got to try this place after seeing it on Google maps before I moved to Vegas. I know it's a corny reason to pick a place, but the name was what got my attention. We walked in, and the place was packed. 

Our server Carla was great. Even though it was busy, she was attentive, friendly, and our food came out promptly. My boyfriend got the three little piggies.I got the fruit parfait that came with the best banana nut muffin I've ever ate-ever!! I will definitely keep coming back here, to try out other things on the menu

Located "off of the strip" in a plaza, The Egg and I is definitely a local's haven. We only discovered it since our hotel (The Artisan) was nearby and we used our Yelp app to find the closet breakfast place that wasn't a buffet (by day 3 of buffet hopping, I needed major portion control).

Even though it was Mother's Day and the line was out the door, this tiny restaurant somehow managed to get everyone seated quickly and keep diners moving through the door. The menu was quite extensive for breakfast with everything from stuffed french toast to eggs benedict to the infamous breakfast burrito. I tried the eggs benedict, which came with ranch potatoes and a huge portion of fruit. The orange juice was the best part though, it tasted like it was just squeezed in the kitchen.

Highly recommended if you are staying "off the strip," in Downtown Vegas or if you are on your way out of town!
Liza was awesome , it's like she did the thinking for me  best customer service by far ! Food was amazing we will be back

The host was not good at all today this morning. My family had been waiting for a while and when she called us. She said my mom's name, since she was the one who signed in, and then "party of four" when I even heard my mom said party of six. The host seemed out of it & disinterested. She did not take down the correct number for my party. Her job is so simple & she could not perform. Bad service! Didn't get to taste the food so this review is for the service.
Terrible service wait for more than 1 hour, when it was suppouse to be a "15 minutes wait" . I asked if for sure was going to be 15 minutes! They said "yes" no more than 15 for sure!!

The service wasn't bad and the food came out super fast. However, I didn't like how the food was cooked. The banana muffin came out steaming hot as if they put it in a microwave. When I tried to eat it, it was so tough that a knife couldn't even cut through it. I asked for another one and asked that it not be heated in a microwave. They claimed it wasn't. I don't understand how it was steaming hot and so tough and hard around the edges. Then, when I got their potato scramble, the cheese all over the top was hard and not the soft, melted type of cheese. So if you ate your potatoes, you could pick up a whole layer of cheese. Again, it was overcooked. It's too bad because the flavors were there in both the potatoes and the muffin. The biscuits and gravy were good.
The food was great. Omelettes were huge and perfect.  Our server, Perry, was on the ball...hard worker and very friendly. Heade pur breakfast extra good!! Thank you Perry!!!!

this place is great. i would give it five stars if they had a tofu scramble or some veggie options but i know vegas isn't big on their vegan.

the portions are enormous. no one in my group finished their food, and we all love to eat. the ranch potatoes are good but a touch salty after a while. the egg salad was very good, the seasonal pancakes were amazing... i had a chicken sandwich with onions and peppers and it was delicious.

the place itself is adorable; there are some really great pig-themed drawings in the lobby that i wish i had in my house! my favorite was "swine on harvest moon" closely seconded by "tammy faye bacon." 

the service was great- they have a happy egg/sad egg table alert system so you can put up your egg to signal you need something. brilliant! and the menus were little newspapers, which is really fun.

totally going to remember this place and come back!!

That giant jug of freshly squeezed orange juice is totally the way to go! The spam personally was too thick for me it needed to be cut in half and cooked a little crispier however I was still happy because NO WHERE has spam for breakfast! The food was really good! Deff worth going to!!! I love hole in the walls and I loved it more that it wasn't on the strip and the customer service was amazing. Our server killed it!
We had a great breakfast here on our last day in Vegas. Our server and his manager/owner came by often and were very attentive.  Great locals-type place, away from the glitz and expense of the strip.

Good, but not the best.  Had the Ultimate Skillet and a waffle, and was satified, but did not leave raving about the food.  Was seated within 15 minutes even though the restaurant was busy.  Waitress was great -- friendly and on top of it.  I would recommend BabyStacks over Egg & I if you're looking for a truly amazing breakfast.

We loved there breakfast.
Alot of things to choose from and grt service.
from breakfast burritos and skilletS you cant go wrong with anything.

BOOM awsum place

E&I was definitely one of my favorite meals here in Vegas. Originally my friends and I wanted to eat at Peppermill for brunch before leaving Vegas but the wait for 6 people was over 40 minutes. Called in to check for the wait here and was happy enough to find that we would only have to wait for 20 minutes despite it being packed.

There isn't much space inside for customers to sit while waiting for their table; you'll most likely have to wait outside and that kind of sucks especially in the hot summer weather. When we got seated, we were promptly given the menu and starter drinks. Service here is on point. Karla, our server, went out of her way to make everything as easy as possible for us. Instead of having us go to the front ourselves to split our check, she went ahead and split it six ways for us. I LOVE YOU KARLA.

Food portion here is very generous. You definitely will get the bang for your buck because most of the food items costs $8-$12 and only one person in my group was able to finish his order. Whatever you order, make sure the potatoes are included or order it on the side! There's Cajun seasoning on it, I think, and it's amaaaazing. You won't regret coming here!

P.S. there's this cute egg centerpiece on your table. Instead of flagging a waitress/waiter down, just flip it from its black side to the yellow side and someone will come to your table. How cool is that??

More like 2.5 stars.  This place is ok.  Nothing special.  A bit pricey.  

Went here with my cousin and a bunch of friends on one of many Vegas trips.  My cousin was super excited because she had seen it on Rachel Ray.  I've never watched Rachel Ray, but if this is the kind of place she recommends, then I cannot trust her opinion.

This was another one of those "it's more about saying you've been there, rather than the food" type of places.  A lot of things on the menu sounded great.  
 got the Chicken Enchilada Omelet.  It was ok.
I forgot what my girlfriend ordered, but it sounded fantastic on the menu.  It was ok.
My friend ordered pork chops and eggs.  Looked great.  He said it was ok.
My cousin and her hubby ordered whatever it was that Rachel Ray had ordered.  She was spouting off about how great it was, but honestly, it didn't even look that good.  Her enthusiasm seemed forced.
The other members of our party weren't very pleased with their breakfasts either.

This place is only open until 2 pm.  So you better get there early.  Don't worry about me holding up your table though, because I won't be back.  I'll be at Blueberry Hill, on Flamingo Rd., enjoying a very good breakfast for about half the price.

Every time I go to Vegas I must go to egg and I. Chance is one of my favorite waitress's.  She fast, funny and always gets our orders right.  And we're always 5 or more. Make sure you ask for Chance when you dine here. But everyone is great.

LOVE THE EGG & I!! it has been my go-to place for all of my vegas trips!! and this time me and my BF justin whom has never been here... went there on a monday morning...and it wasn't packed @ all...which is a first time for mee!! :) and we were seated immediately....and our server was ALEXA and she was such a doll!! she was very attentive and she even hooked me up with a sausage patty...cuz i usually get my waffle and meat and THEY USED to be able to give mee one piece of bacon and the sausage patty...but she said that they didn't do that anymore...but being the sweetheart that she is...she brought me one!! and my BF got the biscuits and gravy which he said was good but them potatoes tho!! i would absolutely love to just eat a big ol plate of those all day!! but yeah we will be back there...since it is definitely our vegas tradition!! :) soo thanx again alexa!! you were awesome!! :)

Three of my friends and I, all hungry and a little hungover, came to the Egg&I around 2pm on a Monday so it wasn't busy at all. The banana nut muffins are soft delicious fluffy and warm, served to you before your main course comes. The portions are well sized, prices wern't outrageous, but the waitress forgot my friend's toast. I had a crepe, which comes with ranch potatoes. It was much more dough-y that I expected and would have liked. Makes me wish I just ordered a scramble. Overall I liked driving off the strip to see outer Vegas to get good food at not ridiculous prices.
Believe the hype. Omelet, pancake, biscuit and gravy, beef dip sandwich all on point. Excellent food all around. Awesome service!

This place gets crowded come early for breakfast or later like lunchtime. Their freshly baked banana muffin is fantastic! My sister doesn't like bananas but she ate it up. Everything I've ordered has been tasty.

Okay. Food and service used to be better.
Ordered buckwheat pancakes this morning.  When the cakes arrived they looked much lighter than normal.  Sent the cakes back thinking they were wheat instead of buckwheat.
Waitress returned with order of cakes saying the restaurant had changed the batter.  Now the cakes are cold.  Taste was not bad, but not as good as the original buckwheat pancakes.  Disappointing. The waitress did not ask how we liked the "new and improved" version.
Skillet potatoes are amazing.  Always quick and good service. French toast and pancakes were much better than the waffle

My fiance and I came to this place twice on our last trip to vegas.  I can't tell you how much we liked the place.  The interior was unique and so wat the menu.  The portions were big the coffee was hot and the atmosphere was great.  Good service both times as well.  If you're looking for a great breakfast or lunch joint that blows dennys or ihop out of the water here's your place!!!

I went here with a friend on Saturday AM. We arrived at 10 and it was packaged. Easy 30 minute wait which I find kinda baffling as the food and place is O-So- Average. However it seems like a popular stop for lots of locals. I ordered the Sicilian Skillet, and was not impressed. It was really bla and nothing to write home about for sure. The food was okay but not really anything you cant get at a Denny's IHOP, or countless other places like, that.

Last day in Vegas and decided to eat here for brunch. Wait was 15-20 minites to get seated for a group of 5.
Food took a while to come too but it's understandable since they were busy. 
Our server Oscar, was awesome though. He was very attentive and seemed like a chill dude. When they forgot to bring out my friends muffin that was included in his meal, Oscar apologized and brought out a plate full of muffins so that we could all try :) really appreciated it ! 
Food was also pretty good and satisfyingly filling. 
I got the rib eye Benedict and it was pretty good. Also came with a side of potatoes that were seasoned real well. Great brunch place to eat in Vegas !

Ive been in vegas for 3 days and wanted to eat a good breakfast place off the strip. I  looked on yelp and was immediately attracted to the amount of reviews. Upon arrival at 7am there was nobody there so make sure you come early if you don't want to wait. I checked in for the delicious free banana nut muffin. The menu was pretty big and after scoping for a minute I decided on the blackened prime rib benny. The benedict was perfectly constructed . Tender prime rib, poached eggs, and some gravy was served on a crossaint, the flavor was also on point! 30 minutes later I'm headed out the door! Mission breakfast accomplished.

First off, my expectations were pretty high for those banana nut muffins.  I prefer mine with more nuts in them so they were just okay to me - I've experienced better and probably will not get them again.

I ordered a scrambler and it was very good - the potatoes were okay - a little too much seasoning for me but they were crispy.  My grandma said the coffee was good and she enjoyed her corned beef hash.  The service was excellent, the prices reasonable, amount of food was a lot, and the atmosphere was good.  I would come back.

Oh, and free Wi-Fi which is great when your grandma you are visiting doesn't have internet.
Here on vacation great breakfast spot the employees are WONDERFUL so attentive to your needs. If you are in Vegas come to this place. Food was great got the Mexican omelette so spicy and yummy

Found this place on Yelp...thanks!

Whenever we are in Vegas we try to eat off the strip. We were heading out of town and this place hit the spot.

Just a little diner type place (nothing fancy) but the servie was friendly and the food YUMMY!

The menu is HUGE.

We sampled the pancakes, waffle, eggs and home fries.
 
The home fries were SOOOOOOO good!

Also since my son requested no meat (his came with bacon) they offered fruit.....a whole plate of berries, citrus, and melons....It was great!

We will definatly be going back next time we are in town!
Just wanted to say I love this place the food was great love the potatoes.  Amanda was awesome she was our waitress before and still was pretty awesome.
Great place for breakfast or lunch.  Variety of menu items.  I think it's a little pricey but the food is good.  Needs to be bigger, there is always a wait when I go.

Came here for brunch with a friend who's a local. The wait was about 25 minutes, but it was definitely worth it. I ordered the biscuits and gravy. Best I've ever had. The biscuits were melt in your mouth, and the gravy was so flavorful. I also had the orange juice, which tasted hella fresh.

The Egg and I is our favorite place for breakfast when we visit Las Vegas. The food and service is always good. But this time our waitress Ashley H. made it even more enjoyable. She was extremely personable and helpful .My  husband and I always share because the portions are very generous. But we always have to compromise because we each want something different. Ashley informed us about the dishes that we can get half portions of. So now there is no need to share. We can each get what we want. Everything on the menu is great. So be adventurous and  try something different.

My family loves The Egg and I!  We visit Vegas several times a year and have breakfast there at least once per trip.  The service is friendly, efficient, and fast.  The food is delicious.  We highly recommend the Fiesta Skillet (add chorizo) and the warm Banana Nut Muffin with some butter on it is to die for.  It's a small place, expect a wait, especially on weekends.
Far and away the best breakfast place in Vegas OMG huge portions and great prices, service was amazing and you always leave full!

We love love sitting out side and eating the wonderful food at egg and I it is a dog friendly.  Ask for Stacie she is a sweetheart out on the outside patio!    We love the green chicken enchiladas omelette :)
Great breakfast in Vegas, tons of egg choices. We have made this a regular spot each time we visit

I tried the mashed potato omelette and California crepe . Both was awesome and given in quite big portion. Worth for those eggs lover. Just that after you ordered , may need wait for about 10 mins for the dish to be served. The server is attentive after I accidentally flipped the mood chart . Come early to queue as they don't allow reservation.

2Nd time eating here today.1st time was great but now i dont think so. My husband ordered chicken fried steak. The gravey tasted very strange. He scraped most of it off & continued 2eat. I ate1/2half of 1 of his hashbrown paties which had some gravey on it . W/in 30 mins i threw up ,w/in 1hr he also did the same & has not stoped all day vomiting.  I finally called & spoke 2a manager, the lady was nice &suggested  i call the operarions manager. I said no . but u need thow that gravey shit away!!

This banana nut muffin has been WAY hyped in other reviews. Yelpers were making it sound like this muffin was the secret to life. Muffin lived up to the hype in terms of taste, but not size. If we are talking about a life-changing muffin, it needs to be a little bigger. I wanted 2 of these.

Shoulda went with the crowd and got the Eggs-cellent Omelette. Kay's Special caught my eye cause it sounded like spinach artichoke dip but made into omelette form. It was really tasty but the 3 Eggs-cellent Omelettes at the table kept overshadowing my dish. But that was my fault and not the fault of Egg & I. 

Potatoes were completely covered in a paprika type spice blend. It made them really dry. A good dousing of ketchup cured the dryness.

Overall your typical uber greasy breakfast that will make you feel ridiculously full all day long. The muffin made the experience above average.

Overrated. Corned beef hash had very little hash and too much beef. Usually, the opposite would be the issue. The problem is that the corned beef was EXTREMELY salty. Fried potatoes that come with many entrees are mediocre. Biscuits and Gravy are good. Mashed potato omelette is exactly what it sounds like. Ironically, I was expecting something different or creative. It was okay. Pancakes were really good. Service was great! Establishment is not that bad, but a little ronchy due to all the green...just weird.
Amanda was great.  The food came out in a flash.  It was very good.  The place was clean and busy, but no wait for 2 people.

I was introduced to this joint during my recent trip to Vegas. A friend who resided in Sin City decided to take me and my girlfriends here after a long night & morning of partying/clubbing/gambling. I told him I want a place with bomb breakfast & local flavor. Egg & I delivered just that! 

I had a slight hangover and the hustle & bustle of the busy atmosphere did not aid in it going away. However, I was cured after I had some OJ, Egg Crepe & superr delicious potatoes! I do not know what type of seasoning is doused over those cut up potatoes they servve but it sure did hit the spot! I even joked with our waitress asking if they sell the seasoning (which unfortunately, they don't). The portions are pretty huge so if you don't eat a whole lot like myself, think of sharing with a friend.  I couldn't let my food go to waste so I got a to-go box which definitely came in handy during the road trip back to Long Beach.

Maple Bacon Stuffed French Toast and the banana nut muffins were delicious! We were afraid it would be too sweet and overwhelming, but since you can just dip the French toast in the maple spread (it's not actually stuffed) and syrup it's just enough! Highly recommend splitting this with someone! We split that and the bacon, avocado omelet with potatoes which was also great. Portions are healthy and prices are very reasonable. Erin, our waitress, was an absolute pleasure!

Amazing breakfast with a break away from all the Vegas pricing at other restaurants. Our server was Lisa who was outstanding, always making sure we were well taken care of. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an awesome breakfast for a decent price.
I like this place. It's got a cute atmosphere and friendly service but it also gets busy and crowded.

Didn't really want to patronize the usual breakfast buffets in the hotels, so my husband and I set out to find a local breakfast spot that we'd really enjoy.  Boy did we find it!!!!!!The banana nut muffin was probably the best I've ever had!!!!!  Everything on the menu looked good so we really had a difficult time placing an order.  However,  I ended up with the enchilada omlette which was devine and my husband had a chili omlette and he loved his as well.  We were stuffed by the time we were done and promised ourselves we would return once again before we ended our vacation.

Yummy. I loved everything i got the flapper  with French toast.... YUMMY 

My boyfriend got the flapper with pancakes. He liked everything except  the pancakes were gummy. 

The fresh squeezed oj was delicious 

REASONABLE PRICES!!!!!!
The food and service were very good. Paula was very helpful and cheerful. It was a nice way to end our trip in Vegas

it was an so-so place. Greasy food and ok service. i wasn't expecting much. Diner food. The potatoes were seasoned far too much with seasoning salt. And my skillet was ok. I can't say it would be worth the trip here. Unless u are tired of the buffets. pancakes were nothing special. It was...meh...so i don't know how it got such high ratings.
The best eggs Benedict  around.  Also, great service....Karla is the best!  You might have to wait for a table on weekends but it's worth it.
Our server Raul was very good. Food was great and parking was easy. We only waited 10 minutes. Pricing? $50 for 4 of us. We left full.
The food here is amazing! Best breakfast spot of our trip. Great service thanks to our server Raul. I will recommend this place to everyone.

This place gets really crowded, but it was well worth the wait.  I came here on a Sunday morning for breakfast before leaving Vegas.  I ordered the eggs Benedict, which was very delicious.  I loved the Cajun home fries that it came with.  Everything was very tasty.  My bf had the muffins and gravy which he loved.  I would definitely come back the next time I'm in town.

Was a Fan of this place until recently. Stopped in real quick to pick up one of their delicious "homemade" blueberry muffins. Was quite disappointed when I was handed a Sara lee muffin still in the wrapper and sent on my way. They charged me $2.50 for this muffin I could have gotten at any gas station for 50 cents. Extremely underwhelmed today.

When we first walked in it was a bit overwhelmingly with the noise and it's a wide open space.  They seated us very quickly and got to omit drinks right away.  One server Erin came to our table slowly there after to take our order and answer any questions we had.  My wife doesn't eat regular sausage and we were very impressed with the vast ability to substitute. We were here for breakfast, but i peeked at the lunch menu and you can build your own burger with ground beef, chicken breast, turkey, or a vegetable patty.
