I had the fiesta green chili skillet and it was amazing.  Perfectly spiced and filling.   My wife had a burrito and substituted turkey sausage and fruit.  We each got one of the banana bread muffins which I highly recommend. Erin was our server and she was very attentive and pleasant.  This was a nice way to start the day.  I highly recommend making this past of your Vegas stay.

Another local find. Lots of regulars. Friendly attentive staff. We ordered the half skillet and french toast. Both were tasty. It is nice to be able to half an order because sometimes you just aren't that hungry so I really appreciated that I was able to finish my plate. Coffee was good as well as the fresh juice.
Plan to eat there again and will definitely try their other locations.

Superb, friendly service. Outstanding fresh food. Most breakfast places are ok...this is great. Leave your strip hotel and eat here. Prices are more than fair, portions are large. Biscuits and gravy were so yummy, fluffy ...omelette was drowning in wonderful cheese and veggies.
I really enjoyed this place! Great food and service! I ordered the fiesta skillet with chorizo, amazing!
Great food and our server Linnea was really nice and helpful! I ordered the chicken cordon bleu scramble and it was delicious! We will be back.

Ranch Potatoes - HOLLA!  

Need I say more?  Don't ask, just go, order it and eat it.  You'll understand.

Breakfast at this quaint eatery was delish!  I ordered the stuffed french toast with a side of bacon.  Egg bread dipped in a custard batter. Grilled golden and lightly sprinkled with powdered sugar stuffed with strawberry cream cheese.  My plate came with 2 helpings of syrup for reason i can't even fathom.  The goo of whipped cream and strawberry stuff was oozing everywhere and definitely sweet enough to ravage alone.

The wait staff was friendly, helpful and patient (we were a group of 4 adults and 5 kids who couldn't make up our minds with all the yummy food to chose from).

I don't know about you but I'm going back the next time I'm in town and eating the rest of the menu!

A great breakfast house is consistent no matter what. 
I only went here once, but it was disappointing. The food was on par to IHOP. 
I can't tell you how many people get a omelette wrong. Either the ingredients don't gel right and is tasteless, or the egg is undercooked, etc. 
The omelette I got here was tasteless. The potato o' brien was overcooked in too much oil to the point it was deflated and tasted more like leftovers. 
Not a fan.

I've been here since Monday and today is Wednesday FINNALLY some real good food! Chicken fried steak cooked to perfection gravy was on point and the potatoes works were seasoned and cooked just right! My husband got the egg sausage bacon and toast SOO GOOD!! Oh and the banana nut muffin!! YUM!!! 

I definitely recommend this place for the perfect breakfast!

This place always amazed me! Amazing food and amazing service. Liliana once again delivered an exceptional experience.  I recommend you to try the breakfast tostada, it is delicious!!! Viva the THE EGG & I..
I enjoy eating here they never disappoint although the service at this location is a bit slow at times

Now my second favorite breakfast in Las Vegas (Hash House is #1). The place doesn't look like much situated in a rundown strip mall several miles off the strip. I am thrilled we picked this place though, they have earned all their outstanding Yelp reviews. Excellent service and excellent food.

This place could get really crowded!

Why only 3 Stars?
1st star - originality of the place: the seating arrangement is really unique. the center dinning area is high up and the side dinning area is ground level. 
2st star - menu has a ton of choices! a lot of different ways to serve egg for breakfast and more: burgers, salad, sandwiches, and steaks. 
3rd star - service is good even though they could get so busy each server was alert and ready to serve customers who need help. Also, they have this EGG SIGN on each table where you put the WEIRD EGG FACE if you need service lol 

Food was okay, but I totally blamed my self for ordering my egg wrong. Apparently, I could order my egg "scrambled easy" so it won't be so dry. Oh well, there is always next time. Definitely will come back to try more of their stuff and of course! update my review for my fellow yelpers.

As we were leaving our hotel one morning I asked the Valet where the best breakfast spot is OFF the strip.  He immediately said the Egg and I.  He gave us directions and this place did not disappoint.  Its about a 10 minute drive from the strip but well worth it.  The portions are large, the service is outstanding and the food is great!  

Prior to arriving, I yelped it and saw all the great reviews.  We ordered the Banana nut muffin which was really good.  It was served warm with whipped butter.  Excellent start.

We ordered the ultimate skillet and a chile relleno omelet with a side of biscuit and gravy.  When the food came out I was amazed by the sheer size of the skillet.  It was was mound of food all served fresh and hot.  My chili relleno omelet was SOOO DELICIOUS.  It was topped off with melted cheese and a enchilada sauce with minced cilantro.  The omelet was one the best I've ever had.  The ranch potato's were crispy and seasoned well.  My biscuit and gravy was good but I was not really wowed by it.  

Our service was great.  The kept our beverage cups full and checked on us without being annoying.  The decor is a little cheesy but it works.  There are TVs on every wall so you can watch the news or ESPN.  

Definitely will be back the next time in Vegas.  Its a nice break from all hustle and bustle of the strip.

Came here with friends while on vacation. I appreciate the choices in coffee creamers and the carafe being left of the table, which saves the hassle of tracking down a server for a refill when you've got a small cup o' joe. Good coffee, but I come here for the eggs. 

I ordered the hash, but our table also ordered a pancake plate and a waffle works. The waffles look light and crisp, the pancakes are fluffy and have a variety of fillings (but I think we got charged a different-than-base-price for these, so ask or watch out? Our server suggested something after we handed over the menus), and the crispy little home fried potatoes are so tasty! (I got a half serving of these, half serving of fruit--which is plenty of both!) My hash was homemade and nothing like that cubed canned corned beef hash, but it was pretty salty for my tastes. My eggs came out EGGsactly right and were mouthwateringly delicious for something so simple--eggs. My fiance asked for tomatoes in his scrambled eggs, and those were extra too, and we weren't informed of that/how much until we saw it on the check (the pancake chocolate chips and the tomatoes somehow managed to be about $5, so I don't know how that stacks up, but it peeved me a bit).

If they ask you if you want toast or the banana muffin, DO NOT GET TOAST. GET THE DANG MUFFIN. It is sooooo good. It doesn't look like anything special, mostly because it's flat on top and served upside down, but it's soft and moist and tasty and warm and goodness gracious, so amazing. If you're counting calories, #1 you're in the wrong place, #2 put butter on it anyway.

The little eggy signs are so helpful for when you need to track down your server--a great idea instead of trying to get someone's attention in the (can be) noisy atmosphere. 

This place is fantastic, but I pulled a star because the server forgot a side order for half the meal and didn't notify us of the upcharges on the items at time of order and after suggesting (i.e. we order regular pancakes, he suggests blueberry or chocolate chip, but doesn't mention they cost extra) after taking the menus so we couldn't see ourselves. I know some things are extra, but how much sometimes influences people's decisions--knowing if it was $0.50 versus $2.00 would have made that difference, for example. Overall, will DEFINITELY come again.

We were looking for a breakfast off the Vegas strip & a friend told us about this place. Well, we weren't disappointed. I had the Santa Cruz skillet and it was great. Good size servings for a good price. Our server Oscar, was very good and kept checking on us. Great breakfast restaurant with great service! 
Cheers

While on vacation in Vegas, my friends had been going to the casino breakfasts, pricey and not all that. So we decided to give this place a whirl. 
Clean, friendly, great service.
WOW! What a great idea! Now it's not on "the strip", it's about 10 mins away by car, but oh so worth it!
Got the Santa Cruz Burrito- NICE! Filling was scrambled eggs, chicken, and other 'yummy-ness', tasty, great home-fries. Only $10 with lots of coffee.
Great portions, excellent flavor. Good comfort food. Everything that my friends ordered looked great. They loved theirs as well. 
Do yourself a favor, skip the breakfast buffets and casinos for breakfast. Go here!!!!!
The Pancho scramble was the best ever! Add the Salsas and it's a home run! Raul was a great server as well! He made some fabulous recommendations

This place is awesome! Anyone who had bad reviews obviously didn't get the right food or listen to the recommendations from the server. The skillets are amazing! I got the works skillet with everything minus peppers add spinach. it was delicious! If you mention you are a first timmer you get a complementary banana nut muffin. Let me tell you that is one good muffin! This place is great for the price. One breakfast was 11. The food is enough to where you can share without having to get any additional items. Although the hash house is equally delicious, the price of this food compared to the hash house I would come back to egg and I before hash house. My only complaint I have is the size of the orange juice for the price. Your better off going to 711 and drinking an orange juice before you go to breakfast.

Reina was our server and we had a great experience being that it was my first time at Egg & I.  We came on a Saturday and yes it was crowded but we got seated in about 20 minutes. The potatoes and orange juice was a highlight for me. I definitely would come back here again when I come to Vegas.

Wow that's a lot of reviews . I guess I came on an off day because the only thing that was good was the muffin . Service is very fast so fast that they forgot part of our order . We asked the waitress for our toast she said your order doesn't come with toast we said we ordered toast she then looked all around our table and looked at us like we were hiding the toast in order to get free toast. She said I will go look for it . When it arrived it was at the end of our meal . The house potatoes are heavily seasoned with what I guess is season salt way to salty to enjoy . The carnitas were cold . It wasn't very good over all.

Sat outside, but the misters and shade made it all work.  I had the Country Benny, which was really biscuits, sausage patty, eggs and gravy in a boat, with their Diablo potatoes.  In our group, loco moco, chile relleno omelette and country fried steak were popular.  Service was nice and efficient.

I was not impressed with this place at all. Coffee wasn't great, but drinkable (similar to hotel lobby coffee). My pancake was not very fluffy, too dense. I ordered it with fresh strawberries which were cooked into it, but I would have preferred them raw on top. My boyfriend's skillet (the one with sausage and ham) was ok and was probably the best thing I tried there. His mother's bacon and cheese omelette was not very good and she ate less than half. The bacon they use for omlettes is the same stuff Taco Bell does... shredded little bits that tastes like some kind of pork, just not bacon. Her friend's bacon strips were extremely overcooked, dark brown and crunchy vs. crispy. The homefries were terrible. Just potatoes with A LOT of some kind of cajun seasoning all over. I thought homefries were supposed to be seasoned with salt, pepper, onions and green peppers... The one good thing about this place was the wait time. 10 minutes for a party of four on a Sunday morning.

My husband & I visited this place once while we were visiting Las Vegas & after eating there we wished we had known about that place sooner so we could've had breakfast there every morning while there. The second we walked in we were greeted by the hostess & given a table right away (it was really early so it wasn't that crowded yet) and a couple of mins later our server Amanda greeted us & took our drink order. The menu had a HUGE selection of items and after minutes deciding my husband ordered the ciabatta breakfast sandwich & I ordered the French toast breakfast sandwich     (both sandwich came with a side of potatoes) and we were pleased with our selections. Not only were the portions big but they were delicious! Their potatoes are super good too, my husband isn't a potato guy he prefers hashbrowns BUT he really liked those potatoes. A good restaurant with good food is nothing if they don't have good service & our server Amanda was great! She was very attentive, she made us feel like locals which we loved because when traveling we don't like to be treated like tourists. Over all, I give this place 5 stars because of their delicious food & great costumer service! When visiting Las Vegas, this is must try spot!!!
Incredible skillet, eggs made just right.  The potatoes were delicious and cheese melted just right. Highly recommended!

Totally worth the journey off the Strip.  If I lived in LV I would come here whenever I wanted a good breakfast out.  Big varied menu, friendly service, great food, kid-welcoming, clean, and clearly very highly rated year after year as all the framed Zagat reviews on the front wall testify.  Great experience.

This place served the best corned beef hash I've ever had! Shredded corned beef, mixed with potatoes and maybe some onions and peppers. I'm not exactly sure but yum it was delicious. Definitely coming back for this dish next time I'm in Vegas. 
Their blueberry pancakes were packed with plump blueberries. Saved the banana nut muffin for the drive home immediately after breakfast.. Very tasty, once you start you cant stop. The place was packed on the Sunday we visited but the wait was not bad at all. Glad we came here instead of a buffet on the Blvd.

Tucked away in a little strip mall, this little gem packs a powerful punch. I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu, except they have Coke and not Pepsi. Ask to sit in Amanda's section, she took very good care of us.

The food here is amazing. It was hard to pick what we wanted because everything here tastes so good! Jessica was an excellent server very friendly quick and efficient. She was awesome ask for Jessica as your server.

Visiting Vegas and saw this restaurant on Yelp and we had to go and try it! Delicious! Portions are great! 
Alexa was our kind server! Great customer service and good food! Will came back when we're in town!

Everything was fantastic.   My server Patrick did an outstanding job.   The food was excellent and prepared to my liking.   Great place too eat away from the busy and overpriced restaurants on the strip.

One of my favorite breakfast places in Vegas .... My last visit there wasn't so great ... The waitress messed up the order 3 times and well the rest of the staff more than made up for it ... The assistant manager was great taking care of us and the bussers were the friendliest and most attentive... Will return but will refuse to sit with in that waitress' section

My omelet was so good! Make sure to try the hash brown potatoes the seasoning is bomb! Me and my husband found our new favorite breakfast place in Vegas. Our server Patrick was awesome! Thanks for the great service!

Friends finally came into town this memorial weekend and I've been reading good reviews about this place and finally got a chance to check it out today.

It was packed.. But hats off to Egg & I because we were able to be seated quickly ( when at other restaurants it would take about 40 mins to be seated) 

Make sure that if you decide to come here that you use yelp and check in to get yourself a banana nut muffin.. The muffin was super light and moist and delicious.

There are so many different things to pick from on the menu.. The menu is super creative.. I got the breakfast burrito and it was the perfect size for my appetite.. The salsa for it was delicious too (I asked for extra).. I left full and ready for the day.

So I would definitely recommend  this place if you are hungry, because of the price, the amount of food, and the service. Is it mind blowing you ask? No, but it is definitely better then average. Hence the 4 star. I'm going to definitely come back.

Came here after checking out of our hotel one weekend in vegas with a group of 4 on Sunday at around 1pm and our wait was about 30 minutes. We were all starving and all a little out of if @_@ (as you should be when devouring food in Vegas). 

I ordered the basic eggs, potatoes, and sausage breakfast. I opted for the banana muffin and was so glad I did. They make it in house and was warm and delicious. My main dish was really greasy and hit the spot good! They were generous with the sausage portions. I wasn't feeling that adventurous that day, but others in my group ordered the chicken enchilada omelette, Tacos Rancheros, and Huevos Rancheros and all loved their dishes. Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely be back on my next Vegas visit!

Went here for brunch on a Saturday and this place was packed! We waited for 25 minutes for a party of 2 which wasn't really that bad of a wait but we were really hungry by the time we got a table. I got the works skillet with a banana muffin (I swear, best banana muffin I've ever had!), my bf got the mashed potato omelette with 4 pieces of toast on the side, and we also got an additional order of waffles with whipped cream! 

The works skillet comes with works potatoes, bacon, sausage and ham, then topped with eggs (any style) and gooey cheese! So good and very very filling. The mashed potato omelette also comes with the works potatoes on the side. Seriously, the omelette is huge (4 eggs!)! It's filled with bacon and garlic mashed potatoes then topped with cheese and sour cream. The waffles are just okay, plain but tasty. We definitely enjoyed our meal!

Service was fast and excellent considering they were so busy that day. Our waiter is a pleasant guy and he's very efficient. 

Our order came up to 35 bucks. Pretty reasonable since portions are huge, coffee is bottomless, and food is really good! Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas!

Patio seating is nice, if u dont mind a few flies. Very nice staff so far. I really enjoyed my meal. The home fries are good and so was my veggie and bacon omelette. I will come back next time im in town.

THE breakfast place! The portions are always large and rarely have I found a breakfast menu with more variety. It's popular for many reasons so there may be a small wait, but the tables get turned over pretty quickly. The staff is always friendly from the hostess through the bussers. Our server, Stacie, was very nice and quick with the food. I work in the food service industry and usually have a very critical-eye when eating out. This place is outstanding!

We had the Chile Relleno Omelette and the Chicken Fried Steak. Both were amazing. We live in CA and I've never had a better Chile Relleno. The house made banana nut muffin was soft and delicious. Our hostess Chance was sweet and awesome.

Super delicious! Spotted this gem as we were driving around looking for a gas station. My mom had been to their other location, so we stopped in. 

The food and service were incredible! I had the biscuits and gravy with sausage patties. potatoes and scrambled eggs. It came on a huge platter! The biscuits were soft and fluffy with tons of flavorful gravy. My mom had the sausage patties, eggs and potatoes. The potatoes had a bit too much seasoning salt for my taste, by everything else was amazing.

The service really took things up a notch. They have a stand on the table where you flip the egg over if you need service. Different servers stopped in and refilled our drink while we were eating. Our glasses never got less than half-empty.

Definitely try either location. Every plate we saw being served up looked amazing!

I love this restaurant.  It's a GREAT American style breakfast, and an awesome way to start at least ONE of your Vegas mornings.  Yep, just like everyone has mentioned, the Banana Nut Muffin is amazing.  Soft, warm, full of delicious Banana Nut taste!  We would've taken some more to go if we didn't plan on going to the outlet afterward.

Our group ordered different items and not one of us had anything bad to say about anything!  We looooved ALL of it!  The potatoes were very good too.  It's a place everyone should try at least one morning here.  Seriously...GO TO EGG & I!!!!!  NOW!

I am a breakfast fan and this place is great. Very busy during peak hours but the service is amazing even in the busy times. I highly recommend the omelet with mashed potatoes or the enchilada omelet. Great food!
Don't assume because we're Hispanic we won't tip good! Got bad service... Won't be going back

Went to the egg and I for breakfast this morning wow is all I can say I have the stuffed French toast with strawberries and cream Yum also I got the muffin for checking in on yelp that was the best dog on muffin I ever had in my life very light and delicious also got the bacon and eggs along with the very good my server Amanda all I can say is awesome she was the best server ever...whenever you're in Vegas you need to stop at the egg and I just saying.

After a long drive from Southern Cali this morning for a quick weekend getaway We decided to stop here because the reviews were good. 

First off, the location is really crappy looking.It almost made me want to find something near the hotel we were staying at. Second,  the food is not that great. It's just big slabs of cheese basically on the omelettes, and there was no flavor. Where's the flavor?! I had a bacon and avocado omelete. It had little bacon bits cooked into the egg, and it was hardly noticeable. The avocado was in a big chunk in the middle. Then it was covered in cheese and had some sour cream on top. Maybe strips of bacon would be better. Then maybe it could be tasted. 
the potatoes are way too salty and taste weird. they definitely seemed like they were frozen. My husband was not impressed with his omelete neither. 

With all the reviews we thought this place would be better. The atmosphere was drab, and the attitudes of the workers was somethin else. Even the manager seemed real fake.
Brady was great! Very courteous and prompt with service. I can't wait to come back tomorrow!

Good food and nice service. I had a delicious pesto eggs Benedict. My father said the potatoes were too salty, but I liked them fine. The OJ isn't fresh squeezed, and I've definitely had far better hot chocolates. So if you are on a budget, rest assured that you're not missing anything if you stick with water.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!! Not only was the food egg-cellent but the staff was amazing!!! When you have a waiter sent straight from Heaven, you just have to bless him with kind words. This soft spoken angel, Brady The Key Manager, was the best we've ever had ANYWHERE!! Everyone was extremely friendly and it was truly a breath of fresh air compared to many other restaurants. If you love eggs and sincerely good people definitely try this place out!!!!
The banana nut muffin was so good:) Our server Chance was so awesome..great, positive vibe and super sweet:)

When my brother was in Kindergarten last year, he got some sort of award for some achievement I have since forgotten, which resulted in a coupon for the Egg & I/Egg Works. I don't think we ever used it, but I had looked it up on Yelp last year, and remembered it had good reviews.

Fast forward to yesterday, 4/2/11. While eating a breakfast of homemade blueberry waffles and chillin on the patio, Lawrence T. was telling me all about how much he loved breakfast foods - all kinds. I was trying to figure out where we were would eat before we headed off to The Adventure Dome later during the day (we ended up not going.) I was bummed when he said breakfast foods were where his heart was, because it's my least favorite meal of the day. 

Around 2 PM, after driving around and me not remembering the names or addresses of the places that I wanted to try on the west side (where he lives) I spotted "Egg & I." Despite the fact I'm not into breakfast, I decided to suck it up and offer this place as an option because Lawrence had told me he liked breakfast so much. It helped that I vaguely remembered that it had good reviews here on Yelp. 

Upon walking in, you get hit in the face with the "breakfast" restaurant smell. You know what I'm talking about. We were seated immediately and took it all in. Lawrence was all into the fact they had soccer on their tv and that they had a zillion choices on their menu. Despite the extensive choices, not too long after sitting down, we ordered. I got the tortilla soup and house salad with ranch, and Lawrence got some omelet and fruit... and was mistakenly given a humongous side of the most delicious skinny fries ever (the problem was quickly remedied by a pregnant lady who worked there bringing him the fruit he actually ordered.) 

The tortilla soup, while not the type I'm used to was SO good, I could not stop eating it. The house salad rocked, especially with the sprouts on top, and the ranch dressing was on par with that of The Mad Onion (aka DELICIOUS!) I didn't try any of Lawrence's fruit or omelet, but the few fries I stole off of his plate were the best fries I'd ever tasted. Yeah, they're that good. 

I have to agree with Bonnie G.'s statement that, "You know the food is good when you are so full and you keep eating."  Lawrence kept eating his fries, while saying he should stop because he was tired of fried foods... but they were too tempting, even when blanketed by napkins on top to hide them from view, hehe.  I was so full toward the end of the meal, but my salad was so good, it was hard to finally push the remainder away.  

For our meals + coffee + $5 tip, it came out to $27 and some change. We both confided over our meal that we weren't sure about how good this place would be when we pulled up to the place, but after trying the food, it was super bomb.

Pancakes are moist, fluffy, and delicious! The menu said they serve small pancakes but when I got my order it was almost as big as the plate :)
Sausage links amazing too!

I ordered orange juice which is freshly squeezed = YUMMY!!

Super friendly service.
Huge portions.
Decent prices.
Delicious banana nut muffin (comes with most breakfasts).
My husband got a skillet- he really liked it, though barely made a dent because it was so big.
I got a crepe omelet. It was ok... Too much avocado (don't say that too often!). The salsa on the side was yummy.
Potatoes were good... Just lots of them!
Overall good experience.

At some point during breakfast, my husband started laughing at me.  It was probably the look of utter ecstasy on my face as I made sweet love to the banana nut muffin.

... oh yeah, and the Italian omelette gave me such an upset stomach that the timeshare presenter freaked out and ended the presentation early.  That alone is worth the price of admission.  Five stars!

I loVe this place! My go to breakfast is an eggwhite omelet with veggies of sorts. I ordered one with spinach, mushroom&avocado...it was divine! I think they put at least 1 entire fresh avacado or more inside of it. Im talking stuffed fat with fresh slices of avocado. If you have a love for avocado, you will love this  egg dish. Their banana nut muffins are scrumptious & worth the carbohydrates, fresh, warm& so flavorful. This breakfast was so good, I could seriously enjoy eating here a few times per week.
Food is awesome and our server Chance was awesome! Strawberry cream cheese french toast is a nice thing to share.

This is the best place for breakfast around Vegas.
Nice size potions, yummy food and great service.

I go there all the way from Los Angeles!

Keep up the good work! :)

The wait wasn't too long even though it was prime breakfast time. The customer service was excellent! It seems that they're very service oriented. The banana muffins were delicious and good equality coffee. I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes because of my dire sweet tooth and I can say, it was a good choice. They were very rich I couldn't finish my food. I had some Portuguese sausage and it was a great balance. Nice and juicy. I'm coming back here.
We enjoyed the food and service was good! Skillet plate called Fiesta was good but a bit salty. This is a good one lace to go to be away from the Strip. We sat outside but the misters were excellent!
Great home style food served by a friendly staff. The banana nut muffin is awesome! Debra was a fantastic and friendly face. Great place for vegetarians! Will be back!
What a nice place, great staff my waitress Lindsey was very nice.  Always a treat to get a perfectly cooked sunny side egg, and the hash wasn't too bad either.

Eggzzzzzz lawd have mercy. I've been wanting to try this place for the longest and finally found myself stopping by for some takeout after a late night. 

Tried the strawberry cream cheese French toast and it was too bomb. To be honest the strawberry cream cheese tasted like it came out of the Philadelphia container but no big. I also could have done without the strawberry jam (or preserves?) smothered on top. Came with a generous portion of potatoes which were also soo so good!

Another breakfast staple I usually order anywhere is the corned beef hash meal. Egg & I didn't disappoint! Corned beef was super num and came with a side of eggs and potatoes. 

Literally drooling........... Coming back forever and ever. Long wait always so order to go and eat in the room. ;)

PPS: check in via Yelp and get a free banana nut muffin SO GOOEY AND GOOD.

We had so much high expectations for this place after reading all the reviews on yelp. Wow...we were somewhat disappointed. Here's my review:

Food: 3 stars - I'm not saying their food was bad but they were not exceptionally great either. There wasn't anything special. It tasted to us like your typical breakfast at a restaurant. We had the pancakes, eggs, hash browns, eggs benedict, potatoes, etc.

Service: 5 stars - the server was great and took really good care of us.

Ambiance: 3 stars - average

Will I ever return? Most likely not.

Breakfast off the Vegas strip.

No matter how much money I donate to the casinos in Vegas, it's all good when I stop by for breakfast before my drive back home.

There's a few things I look for in a great breakfast restaurant.  Coffee quality, food selection, and excellent service.  Well, they have it all!

I always get a half order of the ULTIMATE SKILLET.  Sausage, ham, bacon, mushroom, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and bell pepper - symphony of tastes!  Paired with a nicely buttered & toasted English muffin on the side and it's just bliss.

Their hot coffee served in their signature yellow mugs really hits the spot in the morning.  

There might be a bit of a wait, but the service is great, the food is great, and the coffee is great.  Totally worth it.

I know it was rather late in the day, around 2pm. The place only had a few customers. Waitresses were busy setting up for the next day. 
I was seated promptly, order taken quickly, and everything delivered on time.

The results? Blueberry pecan pancakes were large, yet a bit chewy. Ice tea here was horrible. My server Lindsay was wonderful, but sadly the food wasn't up to my expectations. 2 1/2 stars maybe today.

EGGsellent:
-Newspaper style menu that's fun to read and packed with choices.
-Cute egg stuff every where and fun little eggsquisite sayings.
-Huge Portions
-easy parking, no valet necessary as it's off the strip.
-They give you a big coffee carafe so you can refill your coffee as often as you'd like.

Not so EGGsellent:
-Ordered a skillet and it didn't really have the "bacon and onion" in it ... it was all potatos and eggs.
-The potatoes are not good.  They are the little cube kind, and they are just meh tasting.  Considering the potatoes take up the bulk of the portion ... this is the main factor that kept me from a 4 star review.
-Eggstremely slow service when paying.  There was literally a line out the door to give payment.
-off the strip
-Kinda pricey.  Total was $24 for 2 people.

Overall, it wasn't bad.  It didn't live up to the hype. But not eggsactly "rachel ray" worthy ... seriously rachel?  What the hell? (it was featured on her show once)

Terrible Takeout! Do not go!
I called in my order, simple two omelet, with some fruit and tomatoes on the side. Nothing crazy. So I got thought the extended diatribe on the phone clarifying and identify I understand the extra charges for a side of tomatoes, the cashier says 10 minutes.
I get to the restaurant about 6 minutes later only to sit and wait another 20 or so, the price of which had never been disclosed to me. $11 per 4-egg omelet. I was a little shocked, but then my order was also wrong, they missed my extras and wanted to charge me even more for simple stuff like an ounce of tomatoes. I'm trying to grin and bare it, when the cashier dashes off without a word to get her manager, because she doesn't actually know the cost of said side of tomatoes. The manager comes out with a half -ass-ed apology and an offer to "take care of me" the NEXT time I choose to suffer through this establishment's shotty service.
So now that I've arrived at my office a whole 3 minute drive away, My fruit cup was leaking all over the bag of food. Each meal was luke warm, the ranch potatoes nearly broke a tong of my plastic fork, which we received one less than requested. My crazy chicken  omelet, which is described as "Loaded with julienned chicken breast, fresh mushrooms and guacamole. Topped with muenster cheese and sour cream." on the website, had flavorless dark meat chicken, and mushy old guacamole that was terrible.
Don't trouble yourself with this establishment, food should be a delight, not a stressful experience.

Man... people freak out over this place, but I'm not really sure why.  It wasn't bad. Just not much different from dozens of other places.  Think Denny's.  There you go.  I will say this, though... great service.  I had the corned beef hash.  They top it off with an egg.  I LOVE CBH, but I wouldn't order this again.  I was with three friends.  They had scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, and a chili cheese omelette.  Scrambled eggs are the same everywhere.  The eggs benedict had WAY too much hollandaise sauce.  The omelette, though, was killer.  In fact, we stopped eating our dishes and ate from her plate.  What?  Now... the banana nut muffin.  I didn't think it was all that.  Good flavor, but mine was kind of hard.  The girls, though... I swear they had an orgasm.

This place was pretty good.  I know others have given it 5 stars but I only tried it once and had the corn beef and hash it was good, different then I'm use to.  I wouldn't reorder it however.  Its not like its from a can or anything, its shredded ham and the flavor is different then what I believe Hash should taste like  The Banana Nut muffin was pretty good, but again I have had better.  The servers are nice and the place is adorable.  

However if you want your Socks knocked of for breakfast go to the Hash House A Go Go, its a little further West up Sahara and on the right.  That place has the best breakfast I have ever had.
Overall I must say Egg & I is a good place.  A  decent breakfast, however for egg critiques take a look at the pictures, unless you order an eggs Benny they over cook most of there eggs.

Great little local breakfast/brunch or lunch place with awesome food and fast, attentive servers. This is one of my favorite places in Vegas to have breakfast and they're typically open until about 3 pm, 7 days a week. You have to try their potatoes and banana nut muffins, they so good and addictive! I usually go for the omelets when I come here, and no matter which one you order, they're all delicious. If you have ever been to Egg Works, this place is owned by the same people, but is just a little smaller in size and menu.
I love this place. We come every time we visit Vegas. The muffins are yummy, the coffee free flowing and the staff is nice. Alexa was great.

At a little before 7am on a Sunday morning, the place was almost deserted.  This was a little worrisome, but we soon realized that this said far more about the Vegas population than it did about the quality of the breakfast.  Here's the best recommendation I can give about the food: I came back for breakfast the next day!  And we would have come back the third morning except that we had to be on the road before they opened at 6am!

We got off to a good start.  When the waitress found out this was our first visit, she brought us a warm banana nut muffin to try.  It's a house special and well worth getting.

When you open up the newspaper-like menu, the first thing you'll notice is the words Habla Diablo in blazing red appearing in the descriptions of at least half the dishes.  My wife wanted the Spinach Benny, but was concerned about the Habla Diablo potatoes because the name sounded spicy and she's a self-proclaimed spice wimp.  The waitress explained that it wasn't spicy at all, that Habla Diablo is the owner's side company and he had just redone the menu to emphasize his products.  My wife went ahead with her spinach benny and I got the loco moco, with an extra side of the Habla Diablo potatoes.  (It turns out that the Habla Diablo seasoning is a lot like Lawry's Seasoned Salt.)

My wife really liked her spinach benny, but didn't care for the potatoes.  (But she's not a big fan of breakfast potatoes to begin with.)  I liked the potatoes and finished most of hers in addition to mine.  Plus the loco moco was the best I've had on the mainland!

The next day, I came back on my own, but with orders to bring back something good to my wife in the hotel.  This time I had the Biscuits & Gravy, which were great.  But, fair warning, they were pretty salty -- well within my tolerance, but if you are sensitive to salt, you might want to steer clear.   Then I picked out the California Crepe for my wife, which the waitress was happy to pack up for me to take back.  I asked to substitute some fruit for the Habla Diablo potatoes, and she packed up a huge container of fresh fruit.  My wife loved the California Crepe, except for one thing -- it was way too big for her to finish!
Egg & I is officially my favorite breakfast restaurant.  Great food, huge menu and excellent service.  Worth the drive from the Strip.

Wish you were so much closer to me! Better yet no I don't I would totally gain 20 pds by you lol! Love this home fashioned yet unique breakfast joint! I will make a stop here everytime for at least one breakfast if in the area.  Here is what I ordered:

MEXICAN OMELETTE
Chorizo* sausage, green chilies, diced onion, and melted cheeses.
Covered with salsa and sour cream. About 10 bucks and two biscuits on the side.

I don't know what they put in their seasonings but Y-U-M-M-Y!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I usually never finish a plate that has such huge portions but I gobbled this one all the way! And yup they have MILITARY Discount!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Their menu is full of things I am just dying to try in the future! We got here about 11:30 and only waited about 5 minutes before seating. Breakfast is served until 3:00 for all the late nighters! MMM..MMM.....Good!

My first impression was, "Cute sad and happy egg people everywhere!"

The decor of this breakfast house really caught my attention as I first walked in. Eggs are featured on everything from their tableware, to their menu, and their walls. It's too adorable. The menu looks like a real newspaper which is also a nice little touch to the theme of this restaurant. Bright yellow everywhere is a great way to brighten up and start your day in Vegas!

We went to Egg & I for brunch and I can say it loud and proud, this is the best American breakfast I have ever had. Hearty, filling, innovative, more than just eggs and waffles. Egg & I has taken breakfast foods to a whole different level. I ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine (featured on Rachel Ray) which had  spinach, canadian bacon, two poached eggs on a grilled english muffin, with hollandaise sauce. We also ordered an omelette, Both served with ranch potatoes...by far the best breakfast potatoes on this planet. I forgot the name of the omelette, but I know for sure I'd order the eggs benedict florentine and extra banana nut muffins on the side. The complimentary banana nut muffins are made fresh in house, and they are SO GOOD. The service was just as bubbly and friendly as this restaurant is. If you want to start your day right in Vegas, this is definitely one of your options.

The lasting impression? "Love my breakfast, let's get it on country style at Egg & I!"
Good Breakfast spot in Las Vegas!  We enjoyed it over the Thanksgiving Holiday.

I came here twice within a week and I regret nothing.

The first time I had the corned beef hash - my first time ever trying it - and it was the most delicious thing I'd had in a while. Because I'd never had it elsewhere, maybe I'm a little biased - but I know good food!

The second time I had the chili omelet. Uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh delicious. They have a meat/no meat option, which is cool. And obviously I opted for the meat option. It was all cooked perfectly.

My favorite item has to be the potatoes though. Perfect little square-cut potatoes that are seasoned with what I can only describe as a mixture of the Red Robin's burger seasoning and tiny little kicks to your mouth. It's spicy but...not, if that makes sense? Probably not. You really just to go in and try.

Some plates come with what they call diabla sauce and it's delicious but beware - they charge $1 for extra.

Another plus: you get a choice of toast or muffins and I think last time I was there I counted six different bread options LOL. Plenty of variety! And the menu is insane. Trust me, it will be hard to choose.

Every time I come to Vegas this place is a must. The servers are very sweet (shout out to Jessica, our amazing server, who told us to go for the waffle with strawberries and cream - it was amazing and fluffy and warm and oh man. Miss it already. Sigh) and their little egg notification for need something/satisfied) is adorable. Go. You won't regret it.

Get the skillet. Their potatoes are SO GOOD. 

Check in for their free banana nut muffin. It's also SO GOOD. 

What are you waiting for? Go!!!

I'm not too into omelettes and today is our 10 yr anniversary and I didn't want a steak for breakfast and dinner, plus we had plans to go to rise and shine steak and eggs tomorrow....tasted like any other omelette to me, but As I said I shouldn't be considered a critic of such. but the portions are huge! Seasoned potatoes are awesome!!! Banana muffin OH. MY. GOD. Delish! Atmosphere was great and friendly. Our waiter was great (don't remember her name which is probably good due to the fact she gave us two free muffins....don't want her getting in trouble, hehe. She was amazing though! Even tho I heard the muffin was good i settled for toast, and she brought me one anyway! And due to the portions, I couldn't finish it so I asked for a box for the rest of my muffin, she brought me a new one to go...A+++
Curtis is the one! He's a really pro service man. Go for it.. everything is superior.
Had the stuffed French Toast. A new twist to French toast. Absolutely delicious . Loved the seasoned country potatoes. I would definitely come back and recommend this place.

The chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes are to die for!!! This has to hands down be one of my fave places to eat in Vegas. I also loooove to get chocolate chip blueberry pancakes...I make up this combo every time I go (when then pumpkin pancakes aren't on the menu!) Best Breakfast in town and great service.

This restaurant really does not live up to all of its fabulous reviews. The service was very slow and the waitress with colorful hair  ignored us when we told her we were not satisfied with our food. Our orders did not come with all of their sides and they ignored our complaints about that. Also, the toast was burnt and they tried to hide that by placing the burnt sides on top of each other. I will never come back here. Rude staff and terrible service!!!!!!!!
Found this on Yelp and it was great. Our server Ashley was helpful and friendly.  The food was good and hit the spot.  It would of been 5 stars if there was Tapatio.

Breakfast was amazing! Even though it was busy, my party of 2 was seated within 10 minutes...on a Sunday morning!!

The biscuits and gravy were delicious, as was the chicken, mushroom, and spinach skillet. 

Karla was a great server. She was attentive and made sure we were taken care of. 

As for the banana nut muffin....you NEED to get it. 

Only thing: The hostess (forgot her name) wasn't too attentive. While I was trying to put my name in to be seated, she was chatting with her co worker even though I had asked her a question and was waiting for her to help me. 

But! I will return on my next Vegas trip!
When I was skipped over in line for a table someone immediately took care of the over sight. The food and service was excellent. Definitely will be back next time in Nevada

Definitely one of the better breakfast spots to try when you are in the area. I plan on making this place a regular stop on future visits. The location is off the strip and worth the drive. You know your at a good spot when people are lining up and waiting outside. The staff is very pleasant and they are quick to get you seated and fed.

It's a decent place for breakfast or brunch. I've had lots of different things here and none of them are incredible. The potatoes are pretty boring, honestly. The toast is always good. This last time I got the chili with rice instead of pasta. It was ok. I was expecting a small bowl but it was massive and it was covered in cheese. In my opinion, the food here is a 3 but the service is always really good. This last time, Amanda took care of us and didn't miss a beat. Nice job!!

Wow. Best breakfast in Vegas, hands down. Everything is a winner here, but I am a particular fan of the skillets and the Sunrise Mountain breakfast sandwich. Cincinnati transplants - if you're looking for delicious Cincy Chili, Egg & I is for you. Going to the Egg & I is the highlight of any weekend.

I would like to give a shout out to the amazing server Amanda. Last time I was at Egg & I, I ordered the delicious Cincinnati Chili skillet. My fiancé mentioned that I grew up in Cincinnati, and Amanda made sure I got extra chili. Yum!

I went here last year and wasn't super impressed. I don't remember exactly what I got, but I think it was an omelette. Decent, but I didn't see what all the fuss was about and especially for a place that isn't cheap. Well, I'm glad I tried it again, because now I see more of what people have been talking about. I went with a party of 8 and the service was excellent. Someone recommended the stuffed French toast and although it didn't really sound like my kind of thing I ordered it. Well, I'm glad I did because that thing is awesome! Perfectly cooked eggs with the right amount of cheese and sausage. The French toast was done just right as well. So, I suppose it really depends on what you have here and what your tastes are. For example, I tried those muffins everyone at our table was raving about and I didn't like them. Go figure!

We found this place on yelp and thought it sounded perfect.  We were right!  The menu is huge and we had a really difficult time making a decision.  We finally decided on the Country Benny and the Sunrise Mountain.  We asked about the Works potatoes.  They're diced potatoes that are heavily seasoned and then deep fried.  So in other words, heaven in your mouth.  We both loved our meals and the service was excellent.  Breeannda was friendly and took great care of us.  We are visiting from California, but we'll definitely make breakfast here a part of every Vegas experience!
Food was so good. I ordered the Country Fried Steak,very filling and tasted great. Lindsey are server was great as well.

When your in Vegas and want to venture off the strip of a great breakfast. Just down W. Sahara you will find this gem. 

The food is great the banana nut muffins are awesome. It has a very down home atmosphere and very friendly service. Excellent place for parents with kids and wont break the bank.

Almost without exception when I'm traveling I will use yelp to guide me to the best restaurants. You would think this restaurant with over 2300 reviews would be a slamdunk, but unfortunately it wasn't. My girlfriend and I drove off the strip several miles to a very unimpressive strip mall, waited in line for 20 minutes only to be thoroughly disappointed. I had the spinach eggs Benedict which was very bland (hollandaise sauce was mediocre), and my girlfriend had the works omelette. Both came with Diablo potatoes which are nothing more than fried, cubed potatoes with some seasoning salt on them. The coffee was good and the banana nut muffin was excellent. Everything else I give two stars for in setting my expectations so high and delivering so little.
This place was as good as the Yelp reviews say! Really really good breakfast place. Service was great, food even better. Will try one of the Eggworks places next time.
Our server was Lilliana, she provided excellent service, and the food was also excellent!! Highly recommend you try this place!

The food was great here, but the service was HORRIFIC. The server forgot to place my order all together, but his manager made up for it by coming over to bring something to eat in the meanwhile. We appreciated that much for sure.

The thing that got me was the fact that the server never apologized or even acknowledged the mishap. And even after that he wasn't around to refill drinks. It was very strange. 

I am still giving it a great review because the food was amazing, especially the banana bread.
Hot chocolate was wayy to sweet. Free muffin on check in and it was delicious! Had the waffles and eggs, kinda plain style though. Price wasnt all that bad. The muffin was nice and hot too.
We walked right in on a monday morning for breakfast and the food came quickly!  The potato's were amazing!  Highly recommend hitting them for a very satisfying breakfast!

This place is great for breakfast. Tons of options from eggs to sweets. 

The service was great my first time here. I messed up my order and they fixed it right away and were really nice about it. Amanda was our sever and she was really sweet and accommodating I would definitely recommend this place for post Vegas nights.
Outstanding Chili relleno omelette!!  The potatoes were perfect!!  Thanks, Jennifer, for being so efficient!!

stopped by sunday 8am
crowded but no wait yet
waitress friendly/attentive
food spectacular
banana muffin was tasty

This was another great Yelp find. Very friendly and quick service keeps this local breakfast restaurant moving smoothly. The food was great, no bad surprises. The banana but muffins have a great flavor, but the texture could be improved upon.

Great eggs, good chorizo, fresh fruit was sweet and hash was good too. Great place for a simple but tasty breakfast!
Amanda was awesome! Love this place! The food is delicious and her service was awesome!

this little place been one of my favorite place to have breakfast on special occasions,what I like about this place,is the staff,they are very friendly,the place is very gozy,I love the orange juice they serve,and the coffee of course,plus,I love their omelettes.they make it how ever you like.so glad I don't have to go to a casino to get a breakfast .for me and my family.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!! And we haven't even gotten to our food!!!! The banana nut muffin is EVERYTHING!!!! We also just got our food. Paula said everything on the menu is good and we just ordered 5 different plates and none disappoint!!!! Best way to start off our Vegas weekend!!!!! Paula is super awesome and so are all the staff!!! Ordering a loaf of banana bread for my toddler YUMMY YUMMY!!!! Thank you Egg & I
Menu promised exciting food but once it arrived it was just boring.  The staff was great and Ashley is a must ask for if you chose to dine here.

My family and I love this place and the waffles are really good but one day I had the burger there and it was gross the bread was soggy and I will never eat the burgers ever. The service was great and the people there are nice.

Found this place searching for a good brunch stop before leaving from Vegas.  Don't let the simple looking breakfasts fool you, these are down to earth home style cooked breakfasts.  There's a lot to choose from, making for more stops in the future.

My Gf got the standard and I the works skillet.  Definitely well done for the both.  I used the yelp check in to redeem a free banana nut muffin.  Omg, this was so good.  We went thru two, the one that came with the skillet and the free one with checkin.  

Our server Linnea was very attentive, and even with a packed house it was just a short wait when we needed some service.  

Very good place, will definitely have to make another visit when back in Vegas
My first time...enjoyed the stuffed strawberry cream cheese french toast! Coffee was piping hot like I love it. Atmosphere was good. LIKED OUR WAITRESS, CHANCE!!! Good service!

Well worth heading away from the strip for an excellent breakfast. About a 30 minute wait for a table on Sunday AM is a sign off somewhere good.
Lots of choice from simple eggs and bacon to full on skillet meals. Our omelette where great, as where the great banana nut muffins. Brilliant service from Genesis.
This place was awesome. Only issue was the wait but that's what u get when the food is great!

By far, the best breakfast in town! Our server today, Karla, was super attentive, quick, and very nice! I have been a loyal egg & I customer since moving to vegas in October and I have no plans to go anywhere else. Their hot sauce is amazing as well. Egg substitute omelette for the win!

I was going to give this restaurant four stars but it deserves 5, because not only is the food delicious, the customer service is outstanding.

There was a small group of us and we all had something different abd we all loved our choices. We all had the banana nut bread muffin; which was nice and warm and moist. I then moved on to my Blackened Prime Rib Benny. I was in heaven and did I mention the seasoned potatoes? They were a perfect accompaniment to the dish.

Portions are generous, so come hungry.

Great, great, great! I had Waffle Works. Crispy, light, tasty. Served perfectly by happy, smiling Stacie. 
Will be back for sure.

This place is a great place to get breakfast in Vegas.   Always packed.  Usually a wait no matter what day or time you go.

Locals as well as visitors and tourists keep this place packed.

They do everything great here.  From chicken and waffles to omelettes, benedicts, and pancakes.

Last time I was here I even saw a guy commenting to his waitress how great their taco salad was.

I love a place that is always good everytime I go, consistent with service and food quality.  I think they even sell their own hot sauces now.  

This is a spot I try to hit every time I'm in Vegas.

Great little local place for breakfast. The banana nut muffins are great! The corn beef hash is also very yummy. Bree was our waitress and she was wonderful, very attentive. Overall a great spot for breakfast.

This place is excellent, we have gone 2 consecutive days. The food is good and affordable, the muffins are amazing. The service is outstanding, from the manager to the servers. My server Alexa is definitely a great asset for the restaurant. I will definitely come back.
Excellent food! Linnea and the rest of the staff were awesone... Linnea is super friendly and helpful!  Will be back!
The breakfast was great Lianna our server was polite and prompt. the menu is vast and a bit overwhelming but those potatoes are so scrumptious
Must come here. Brady is one of the best waiter here. Attentive and friendly. Makes you feel at home. Food is GREAT here. Had the Western omelette and the muffin was delicious.

There are many locations from the same parent restaurant across Las Vegas and I am sure they are equally good. 

Egg & I does what any breakfast diner should do the best! They have great food at good prices with large portion sizes. All of their food is fresh and made without any apologies to clogging arteries or expanding waist lines. This is a perfect place to go for brunch in Las Vegas to get over some of the dieting and dehydration that had happened the night before or coming up that night. Also a great stop before heading towards one of the great national parks. 

You will not regret coming here as long as you are looking for what they have on the menu!!

I am a cartoonist, and when I was in town talking to the editor of the Las Vegas Review-Journal - which apparently has some sort of partnership with this restaurant, since you get a free copy of the newspaper with breakfast, and their logo is on the coffee mugs - I heard about this place but never had a chance to drop them. This time around, I finally made it and found out what I was missing.

Simply put, this is worth the trip away from the strip in order to get huge servings of incredibly fresh fruit, and delicious eggs and bacon and pancakes and French toast and anything else that your carb-loving heart desires for low prices.

Atmosphere is close to non-existent, but whatever - your stomach will thank you while your arteries scream in agony.

I don't think you'll be able to top this place in regards to price and portions.  The food is plentiful and the price is even better.  Best breakfast for under $10.  I got a half portion which was more than enough and it slashed that price by a third.  Their banana muffins are to die for and their wait staff is so friendly and sincere.  It's off the strip but well worth the trip.

The 3 stars is just based off of the food that I ordered at Egg & I. If I could rate just my sever or the customer service, he/they would get 5 stars!!!

I was in Vegas for the weekend and got referred to Egg & I by a local. After reading all of their yelp reviews I was excited to try them out! The staff here are really friendly and really quick to try and seat all of their customers. Our waiter was Patrick, and he was so friendly and attentive. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and my boyfriend had one of their scrambles. My boyfriend LOVED his food however, mine was not the best. The sauce was really "oily" which upset my stomach, and the rest of the food was extremely bland.

They do have their own branded hot sauces which are really great. I'm not too sure if I ordered one of items that is not so popular, or I just came in on an off day.
Best brunch ever! Love the banana nut muffins, yumm!

My husband and I were looking for a more hometown atmosphere and GOOD food...we found it. Yummy food, the Mexican Omelet was, Muy Sabroso, banana muffin was the BEST, but as CHANCE would have it, she was delightful, beautiful and over all we gave her an A+..... we will be back for MORE!

Awesome place!!  We were undecided between the Egg & I and another place we saw on Yelp with great reviews.  We'd gotten rid of our rental car the day before so we'd have to take a taxi to either.  At the spur of the moment, we picked the Egg & I.  Yay for us for picking an awesome joint.  We waited only about 10-15 minutes before being seated.  Once seated, we flipped through the newspaper menu.  I'd read so much about the muffins, we ordered a couple to start our meal.  They were banana nut muffins.  We both ate the entire thing.  So good.  And with a great cup of coffee, we could've stopped right there.  But we didn't!  Since breakfast is not my favorite meal, I love it when I find a place that has lunch style breakfast.  There were so many options I had to choose from.  I was stuck between the stuffed pepper and the Tacos Rancheros.  I chose the Tacos Rancheros.  It was a tortilla topped with refried beans, ground hamburger, two eggs (which I got fried) and topped with cheese and sour cream.  I would've liked some salsa with it but it didn't need it.  My partner got the garlic mashed potato omelet.  It was enormous.  She could only eat half of it to which our server, Karla suggested getting the half order next time!  Shoot, we didn't know you could do a half order.  But, my partner said she wouldn't gotten a half anyway because the portions would be all wrong.  We both loved the Old Bay seasoned fried potatoes.  As we waddled out, it was great that the front desk called a cab for us.  Very nice.  Oh, and there's a little egg face on the table that you can flip revealing a sad egg face if you happen to need anything.  That's a brilliant idea!  Karla was awesome and if we lived in the area, it would be our go to place!

Another wonderful breakfast at my favorite LV breakfast spot. Server Alyssa was delightful. Try the chili omelet. My only complaint: they should make a real dairy product available on the table for coffee instead of your having to ask for it. They serve real butter, so why non-dairy creamer? Spock and I consider this "illogical". Still always 5 stars for me and I've been coming here since the 80's.

Hubby had the Bacon and Sliced Avocado omelette and now he does not want to eat breakfast anywhere else in Las Vegas. The four eggs were fluffy and cooked to PERFECTION! It was generously filled with bacon and avocado and smothered in freshly grated cheddar cheese. The potatoes were diced and crispy with a great blend of seasoning. Wheat toast was done just right. Paula was our waitress and she was attentive and friendly. This is a not-to-miss breakfast stop. And the coffee was wonderful.

Had a great breakfast there yesterday morning. Service was great; Samantha did a great job. Food order was taken promptly and food brought to our table in a timely manner.  My wife had the breakfast burrito; which she loved and I had the Portuguese sausage and eggs with the banana nut muffin (a must). Overall very please with the food, service and will return again.

Let me start off by saying that this place has good food. 

Came for breakfast and had the banana muffin and stuffed french toast. I now have a go to spot for breakfast and will definitely be back soon

Great local breakfast restaurant.
Fantastic service, selection and prices.

Anything from basic steak and eggs to a selection of benedicts to loco moco.  All filling and oh so good.

Next time you are visiting Vegas, take a little drive and get out of the overpriced resort restaurants.
Great service here for breakfast. House made banana muffin was fresh and free and so yummy.

I guess I came here with too high of an expectation.  All the food was mediocre, nothing special that stood out.  

I got the vegetable omelette, good amount of 4 eggs, had spinach, mushroom, bell pepper and probably onion.  Nothing fragrant that stood out, but it did the trick.  The meal came with plateful of mini squared potatoes.  At first glance, you can see all the seasoning and it taste over seasoned. My only gripe, was they had MSG sprinkled all over it.  I didn't realize it until my thirst level started to slowly creep up.  I took another close look and felt sick to my stomach.  Why, do you need MSG in fried potatoes? Why?

To end on a good note, I really enjoyed my slice of grapefruit and honeydew and opted not to order the muffin or toast. 

I should have stuck with good old Blueberry Hills Family.

Came here at 11am to see a lot of people waiting outside, however the wait wasn't that bad as it was only like 25 minutes. The chicken enchilada omelet was good. Our server Karla was very attentive and super friendly. She needs to win the Disneyland contest that the restaurant is having for their employees because Karla is amazing.

Our server  was breeaanda? She was super nice and helpful. We were  originally sat outside but someone in our party had a fear of birds so they were able to relocate us inside. Our server was attentive and help and friendly. Chili Omelet  was the best!!

Food: Visited The Egg and I yesterday and had the Sundance Special, which is their veggie omelette. Spinach, mushroom and artichoke make this omelette absolutely delicious, even for the carnivores out there.

Decor: The restaurant itself is located near a strip mall. The interior seems kind of dated, but it's a trivial concern as the food more than makes up for that.

Service: Alyssa was our server, and she was very professional and attentive. Our food came out in a timely manner, and right the first time. My water cup was never empty and my girlfriend's coffee was never low. Great service.

What a great little breakfast spot!  I got the crepes... yummy.  Mom got the veggie bene, also yummy.  I liked that the juice was nice and big.  Not a little shot glass like some other places.  The service was really friendly.  We appreciated the little egg face at the table to attract the attention of the very busy servers.  

While we were in the Venetian, we picked up one of the tiny tourist magazines.  There was a coupon in it for BOGO entrees.  If you are planning to come here, see if you can snag one.  It makes it an even better deal!

Karla is the best!!!! Great service and very very very fast!!! Give her a raise guys and a big tip when you go!!! 



Food was good!!! Definitely coming back!

I went to this place with my boyfriend right after we arrived at the airport. What I loved about this place was the service. Our waitress Tabatha was attentive and friendly. Her service was top-notch but not overbearing. Their muffin was okay in my opinion. I didn't think it wow me. I like their potatoes cubes which were fresh and well seasoned. I also like their sourdough bread and coffee. The crazy chicken was okay. Nothing spectacular on the main dish. I'd return next time when I was in town again.
Delicious!!  The banana nut muffin is to die for.  The breakfast is delicious here.  The potatoes are flavorful very seasoned. Portions are pretty big - very filling.  Food comes out pretty fast.

I think it's hard to find a breakfast place that truly stands out, at least a cheap one. This breakfast place, I will remember and even recommend.

I had the banana bread French toast AND it was pretty damn good. Mind you that there were sooooooo many things on the menu I wanted to try.

The other people in my "party" had the:

biscuits and gravy - "this is legit" was the comment from the southern gal
Cinnamon raisin French toast - "mmm, this is good"
Seasoned potatoes - I kept eating it off my friend's plate. 

I actually don't remember what my dad got but he didn't say "junk" so that is a good thing.

Good service. Eh coffee.
Great Chicken fried steak & potato fries. Such good gravy, and seasoned potatoes! Thanks, Chris - a great server in Las Vegas on 4533 West Sahara!  We are leaving satisfied, and full.
Bad attitudes fair food too much comparison for poor employees thou I must say the chicken tortilla soup is good

Good food, lots of it. Our family of five walked in under the wire at like 2:58 pm and were treated to fast, friendly service and good food. My son, who is a big potato fan enjoyed the potatoes thoroughly. My daughter, the vegetarian, said of her omelette, 'that's a bomb-diggity-omelette'. Husband said the everything skillet was very tasty and shared the last bits with my son who ate it along with the pancakes and bacon he ordered...bottomless pit that he is.
Short wait at 9 on a Wed.  Great fresh fruit plate.  Chicken enchilada omelet was a hit.  Kids got chocolate chip pancakes and it was a big portion.  A great stop 10 miles off the strip.

Service here is great. They have this little egg sign on the table that you flip to black if you need service and its really like magic the way they appear when you try to change the sign.  I had:
Iced water- I had to write that their water tastes like they got it from the restroom sink. Its so bad i had to order a coke. 
Banana nut muffin- didn't see what the hype was about. I thought it was OK. 
Eggs Florentine with seasoned potatoes- good with Cholula. the potatoes are really good!

I would say everything was good/average.

This place is a winner on all accounts.  The food at the Egg & I tastes great.  The service is spectacular, the people working there really make you feel at home.  Both the hostess and waitress were very friendly and fun to talk to.  

As the name would imply there is a pretty good variety of egg dishes.  You get to choose from a good omelet selection, to huevos rancheros.  If you aren't in the mood for eggs they also have the usual sandwiches and burgers.

Get a side of the banana nut muffin its really good.

Vegetarian Rating: 4/5 lots of good veggie options, they even had a vegetarian version of Eggs Benedict.

Our first stop as soon as we land!!! Stuff French Toast is delish. You gotta try it!!! Today's server was Amanda, who was so happy, helpful and very personable... Actually everyone there are always happy and helpful!!!
Great service. Busy restaurant. The food was pretty good. If they had more variety of hot sauce it would have been perfect!

If you love eggs this is one crazy place. So many options and so many flavors that you wont get enough of it. I had their benny's and mexican omelette and we(2guys) could not finish it(pretty nice serving size). 
Our server OSCAR was amazing and very nice.

Super awesome brunch spot. Wasn't too crowded for a weekend. We got great service by Caroline, she was very sweet and on top of our needs. 

I had the Sundance omelette and I have no complaints. Wow it was tasty! I will be back.

This place is so tasty and delicious. I got the bacon and advocacy omelette with the seasoned potatoes, a small stack of chocolate chip pancakes and a banana nut muffin. 
The omelette was soft and had a dallop of sour cream which made it taste amazing. The pancakes were good as well, not too overbearing with the chocolate!
Our server Liza, was super nice, and very attentive to us and recommend a choice of combos for us. 
My group and I went twice because of how good it was. Everyone was very pleasant and I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!
My husband and I had a delicious brunch! Our waitress Stacy was kind, helpful, and made sure we had everything we needed. We will be back!

The hype doesn't lie. We were in town for a couple of days and wanted to find a great brunch place. We debated between this place and Hash House A Go Go. I am so glad we came here. Our server, Liza, was top notch and gave us great recommendations and service. We ordered The Classic and Texas French Toast works. The Classic blew me away. The Classic is just potatoes, eggs and your choice of meat. I got the links with it and they were amazing. So simple but bursting with flavor! The free banana nut muffin at check in is probably the most moist, gooey and orgasmic muffin I ever had. Please don't forget to order that to try. Overall, a wonderful and unbeatable brunch experience away from the strip.

The food:

Blackened prime rib Benny - prime rib is diced small, mixed with veggies, served over a slice of sourdough with poached egg and hollandaise on top.  Their habla diablo potatoes are  pretty good. Crispy on the outside,  soft on the inside and dry seasoned with a reddish spice mixture that is slightly spicy. 

New York steak and eggs - this is an egg based restaurant that served cold, browned (aka overcooked)  scrambled eggs?! The steak was thin, cold,  and lacking any flavor. Their signature habla diablo potatoes were probably the only really good part of the dish. 

(I know that there is no built in firewall against poorly cooked eggs at an egg based restaurant but c'mon) 

Mimosas:
You're given a small, unopened bottle of champagne turned upside down in a glass Mason jar. A cup of pulpy orange juice is served on the on the side.  I like that you can control the ratio of champagne to orange juice. 

The atmosphere:
Farmhouse chic. Packed with patrons. There is an open air patio in the back (pets allowed). Booths in the middle, tables along the walls. 

The entryway deserves a paragraph to itself.
 One. Big. Clusterf**k. People are waiting to be seated and are either sitting along the walls or standing (most likely in the way of someone). People are lining up to be placed on the seating wait list. People are sitting or standing along the wall just inside the dining room and outside of the front door. People are ordering food to-go. People are lining up or grouping together like a human barricade, waiting to pay their bill. Honestly, even the hostess could not tell me where the line ended to pay the bill. After being one of the few courteous people constantly moving out of others' way, a new line has formed and of course they want to act like you cut them in line.

This was the best breakfast food I've ever had before. I ordered the biscuits and gravy and the taste was phenomenal.  They gave me more potatoes than I needed (which is good). THEY TASTED SO GOOD. My whole family had clear plates. Also the service was excellent! Happy egg/Sad egg was a brilliant idea. Great restaurant.
The food here is on point! Also the service that we got from Amanda was incredible! I had the bacon and sliced avocado omelette which was the best omelette I've ever had. Check this place out!

I had a great dining experience at Egg & I. The server was quite friendly and attentive. This is a great place to have breakfast at an affordable price. I had the vegetarian skillet and added some bacon (I know...crazy). The dish was quite tasty. And it's true what everyone says about the banana muffins. They are to die for!!
Seated pretty quickly service was excellent very creative with the egg sign. Ordered the eggs Benedict with veggie, very good! and the country potatoes are fantastic!

Yelp! Comes through again.  This amazing, down home excellent good restaurant is a must-stop when you're in Vegas.  Our server, Karla, was amazing and helped to fine tune our culinary needs and desires as well as help us with our order.  The food is excellent and generous.  We ordered half omelettes and had plenty left over!  I highly recommend the Egg & I and ask for Karla, you won't be disappointed.

My favorite brunch place in Vegas!
The atmosphere is positive, prices are acceptable and the food presentation is creative.

HATE Nothing.

DISLIKE The location (not a great view). My waitress barely checked on me. Too much butter on each piece of toast (and I didn't even ask for butter).

LIKE The location (aimed at locals) and diner vibe. The fruit selection with your plate. Decent prices.

LOVE The Crazy Chicken omelet. Diverse breakfast menu items such as spam with sticky rice and cincy chili (chili over spaghetti).
Long line to wait...not good if you're so hungry already...But the food is good...Qould recommend coming here on a weekday and not on a Sunday morning...

Very friendly staff and delicious meals. The only problem is that is high on fat and you have to wait 15-20 mins to start eating. The banana nut muffin is overrated. If you check in with foursquare you can get the muffin for free.
So very delicious it's off the strip but worth the trip! You get so much food, you will definitely be stuffed when leaving this place .

Erin was great. Attentive, quick, and friendly. Would love to come by when I am in Vegas again.

I had the Waffle Works, which came with eggs and a choice of meat. I had the turkey bacon. Delivery was prompt and service came with a smile; always a good thing to see in the morning.

Good aside, this place has a large dining room and an outdoor seating area with mist, so you don't cook outside.
yum, yum! Im a fan.  Big portions, not enough room in my stomach, I will visit again. Besides the food being tasty, the services was spectacular.  :)

Banana nut muffin is probably the only thing I'd come back for. Service was great as well, but the breakfast was nothing that spectacular or out of the ordinary. I would definitely come again for the muffin though!

It's a cab ride off the Strip, but worth it!

I'm in Vegas two of three times a year, and Egg and I has become one of my regular stops. The Kay's Special omelet will change your life.

And the banana nut muffin will have you believing in a higher power, no matter how you've done at the tables.

This place is great and I hope this review helps Linnea win a trip to Disney California!

Oh any of the egg dishes are awesome too.
Love! The service, the food, the spot is perfection!!! Highly recommend!!! Parking is not a problem and everything on the menu is divine!!

Breakfast joint, hard to screw up but went based on reviews. I'm from jersey so menu was like a typical diner breakfast menu. Got the eggs and sausage, which was very good. Muffin was good but not sure I've had too many bad muffins. Easy to park, prices very reasonable, friendly attentive service. Good off the strip option
This place was just ok... over priced for what you get. If you want a really good breakfast spot try coffee pub!!

Packed (understandably), but we got the last empty table. Waitress, Genesis, was there instantly for drinks order, then food order--she made recommendations that we wisely accepted. Food came quickly and was great (skillet scramble & omelet). Next time, breakfast burrito (looked like 1.5x normal size).

Just about everything comes with Habla Diablo potatoes, which the waitress accurately explained as having seasoning salt, but they've not really spicy or hot.

Restaurant is very clean, has a huge menu (almost entirely breakfast fare), and is very well staffed. Table-to-waitress ratio was very low, and tables are bussed immediately. Tables also have a little placard on a ring that's normally black smiley face, for all is well, or yellow frowny face for service please. There are managers or expediters wandering around, and they pounce immediately if you turn the placard to yellow (service).

Excellent overall.

I went here for breakfast on a recommendation and I will be back every time I'm in Vegas, period. Portion size and price mean very little if the food is not worth talking about. This was breakfast heaven. The wait staff was outstanding (ask for Sam if she's there), the service was prompt, the portions were plentiful, the price was appropriate for the size of the portions and the food was absolutely phenomenal. Get the banana nut muffin whether it's included or not. It was so good, it tasted like a dessert. To add butter or anything else to it would be a crime, it was perfect the way it was. My wife had waffles with strawberries and whipped cream. Typically, she does not eat large portion meals without sliding some of it across the table to me. She polished off the whole thing. I had some kind of special that came with four scrambled eggs mixed with bacon, spinach, mushrooms and loads of cheese and some kind of side of potatoes that was eye-rolling awesome.
