I've been on this planet for over half a century and I honestly don't remember the last time I had a breakfast that tasted this good from start to finish. According to Sam, everything on the menu can be modified or customized to taste and size. This place is almost a reason to go to Vegas if for no other reason. I highly recommend it.

Food was excellent, and large portions.  Menu items can be customized to dietary requirements.  Our server Bree was friendly and efficient, providing excellent service.  We will be back again for sure.

I am not a big fan of Rachael Ray, but she doesn't get on my nerves nearly as much as she did when she was all unfiltered perkiness. Now that she has been homogenized and Oprah-sized and puts on make-up like Jack Nicholson as the Joker, I am somewhat sympathetic to her insatiable need to be the people's home cook, the pint-sized Paula Deen. Maybe that's why I was rather turned off by one of her Tasty Travels recommendations, the Egg & I on the corner of a strip mall out on Sahara Drive in Vegas. 

Even though it doesn't have the A-frame roof, it's really an IHOP with a country kitchen vibe that seems to draw the who's who of the Convoy-and-trailer-park set. Rachael was giving her thumbs up to this place for all the egg dishes they offer. That I won't argue as the menu went on with variations of omelettes and skillet breakfasts that span the globe and stretch the pocketbook. Jamie W. was being very good and ordered the Original Breakfast Burrito (see photo). However, it was quite a log that came out with a flour tortilla stuffed with four eggs, diced bacon, bell peppers onions, potatoes, cheddar and jack cheese. It came on top of a plate of cubed ranch potatoes and some salsa. 

It honestly tasted like any breakfast burrito, just more of it to justify the entree-level price. I went all self-indulgent and ordered the Blackened Prime Rib Benny, an Eggs Benedict variation which had little cubes of prime rib (whether it was blackened or even prime rib was quite arguable), sauteed spinach, roasted red bell peppers all chopped over what looked like a slice of Texas toast. Two poached eggs lay on top, and I asked for the hollandaise sauce on the side (see photo). Thank goodness since it was the congealed variety that clogs arteries faster than Drano cleans them out. It was on the meh side with nothing hofbrau-ish about the meat at all.

The dish came with the same cubed, packaged-looking potatoes Jamie got, and neither of us had any desire to finish them out. When you order coffee here, you actually get a little pot so they can charge $2.25 for it. Jamie had a glass of milk but it was $2 for just six ounces. Hell, I would have lactated myself for that price. Service was efficient, and even though they have a little egg sign you can flip over to get a waitress' attention, there was no need for it since they seemed interested in turning over tables lightning fast. I'm afraid I will need to second-guess Rachael Ray's judgments on what amounts to good eats on her travels, or else I may be doomed to high-calorie intakes of mediocrity. 

FOOD - 2.5 stars....just thought the dishes were just too generic despite the abundance...it didn't seem human hands touched those ranch potatoes 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...country kitchen quaint if that's your idea of charming 
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...efficient if rather impersonal, no need to flip that egg sign over on a busy morning 
TOTAL - 2 stars....right on the border between 2 and 3 stars, but I need to go with my bulbous, post-benny gut on this one

Egggxellent... Liza was our waitress...it was our first time there and she gave us great suggestions on the most popular dishes...we tried the loco Moco, steak and eggs and the eggs Benedict.  Food was homemade,fresh and lots of flavor.  If you are Hawaiian, you'll love the local food and the aloha shoyu and sticky white rice...so on.

My husband I had heard of this place and we just had to try it. Very cute interior we went on a Tues afternoon so definitely missed the weekend breakfast rush. Let me tell you this place did not disappoint, food was amazing. I had the wonderful Kay's omelet that had tomato, spinach and feta it was so good. When we are in town again definitely gonna go back!!

You won't go wrong with Egg & I. The waitresses are practically giddy with happiness, the portions are humongous, the food is fresh and delicious, and the prices are very fair. 

The location is about 5 miles west of the Strip, so this is primarily for locals, which adds a more normal vibe compared to the touristy traps that dot this crazy little town.

Dragged an unwilling family to try a new breakfast place while we were in Vegas. I was able to convince them on the basis of the high yelp ratings/reviews.  Unfortunately, the experience did not meet expectations.  

The wait was about 20 minutes on a weekday, at around 10:30am.  Not too bad.  A testament to the efficient staff and their ability to keep things moving.  BUT:  Pancakes were doughy/floury and heavy.  Neither of my kids could eat more than 1/3-1/2 even with coaxing and bribery.  I ordered eggs Benedict but it was nothing special. Worst part is there was a distinct fake butter/margarine aftertaste (which is a pet peeve of mine).  it was a definite disappointment.  My husband had some sort of corned beef hash but his lack of commentary tells me it wasn't great.  Maybe we ordered the wrong menu items?  

The free banana nut muffin for checking in on yelp was nice and the staff were friendly and efficient. Too bad the food didn't match.  We don't understand the hype...

Wow!
Great portions for a great price.
Service was great, very attentive by not annoying.
This location wasn't too far from the strip where our hotel was.
We wanted a descent price, tasty breakfast and thanks to fellow Yelper's I was able to track down this great place.
Our group of four were seated fast and by no time we were all enjoying our breakfast's. 
For our first visit I had the Egg's Benedict Florentine- Fresh spinach atop canadian bacon, two poached eggs & a grilled english muffin, smothered with hollandaise and served with fresh fruit garnish and ranch potatoes. We all left full and happy.
For our second visit I tried CHRISTY'S CINNAMON RAISIN FRENCH TOAST- Cinnamon Raisin bread dipped in a custard batter. Grilled Golden and lightly sprinkled with powdered sugar. Served with Sassy
Apples.
This is a great spot, it seemed like it had "The Regulars", so that's nice to see they have loyal and satisfied customers.

Came back here because I had a dream that I was in heaven munchin' on their banana nut muffin....ZZZzzZZzZZZ.. 

Came by for breakfast to try one of my favorite breakfast dishes, chicken fried steak. I had "Brad's corned beef hash" the first time, kinda salty..

And Of course, it wasn't hard to choose, "toast or banana nut muffin".. Is this a trick question? haha, banana nut muffin, please! Muffin was Awesome just not as warm and moist as the first time. There were many more customers dining this day and maybe they were a little busy and in a rush making them? 

Chicken Fried Steak: Nice portion with a good amount of gravy, I went with egg whites only and their seasoned potatoes. The steak had the right crunchy skin, meat was perfect and their sausage gravy was mild and heart warming. In my opinion, much better dish than their corned beef hash.

Upped the rating to 4 Stars because they deserve it.
Great breakfast..not a big long wait...probally were the locals go.....I'd go next time in town for sure

My hubby and I love coming here as a part of our Vegas trip. We always do the Yelp check in for a free banana muffin and take it to-go!

The service is always really good and the food is very good too! 

The only dish I've had issues with is the corned beef hash. It comes out way too mushy and too salty! I've ordered it twice and have been disappointed both times. :( hubby is obsessed with the country Benny. That's a biscuit with a sausage patty, poached eggs, and country gravy. He tries to get the same thing at other restaurants, but it's never the same :)

The seasoning on the potatoes is great~ We bought a bottle to have at home although we have yet to use it haha

Anyway, 4 stars for the general deliciousness and service!

I love the Egg and I and so does everyone else I know. It is simply the best locals oriented breakfast place in Las Vegas. Please don't let the name fool you this is not the chain "The Egg and I" it is independent and shows it. The quality is top notch. The portions are huge and the service is great. My personal favorite menu item is the Cincinnati chili. The have it as a omelet, a burrito ad as the traditional 3, 4, or 5 way. The best I have found outside of Cincy. As to the breakfasts the potatoes they include with almost every item are outstanding but if you ask for fruit they give you a huge plate of fruit that most places would call a fruit salad and charge 6-7 bucks for. This place is simply the best in Vegas

I've been coming to Egg & I for 3-4 years now. We come here for breakfast every year each time we come to Vegas. Now I can tell more about the dishes I've tried at this place. I even got a sweat shirt from here that I wear regularly to the gym in NY LOL. Cute shirt just like the logo. Hubby said that you need your ID to pay at the cashier (if you use your card). The service is one of the best in Vegas. They're fast without rushing you, courteous without over do it, polite and happy naturally. Never had one bad experience. Everything on the menu comes with eggs, what do you expect at "Egg & I"? They come with eggs but not with "U" of course, we don't eat people. The potato is amazing! I don't like potato but I like this type. It's diced-potato with tasty spice or could be just salt but very tasty. I don't eat much salt but I don't feel that it's salty, just tasty. I've tried different types of omelettes here and thought they're pretty big. Of all the omelette that I ordered so far, I liked Works Vege Omelette and Traditional Omelette. Not a big fan of Chili omelette. Last visit I had just the classic 2 Sunnyside up with toasted English muffin. Had something like this with multigrain before and fruit plate but this time I had it with cottage cheese. Hubby had eggs with potato but usually he would order it with bacon or ham too but I begged hubby to get something without meat for breakfast this time. Whatever you order here is great. I've tried many and highly recommended! Coffee is ok not so much on the "wow" side but they give you a pot for a table, so drink up your caffeine and then go play and win a jackpot!

Visited this place the last time in Vegas.  I have to say I'd recommend it. It's in a little strip mall way off the strip, but worth the drive. Everything tasted great and the service was really good.

EVERY time we're in Las Vegas we visit the Egg & I before going home. My friends and I wanted to have a home style meal during our last morning on the strip. Don't get discouraged by the lack of glam and glitz, this restaurant is definitely worth visiting. We were all immediately greeted upon entrance by vibrant and welcoming staff. Our waitress was personable, friendly, and didn't miss a beat, she always made sure we were all well taken care of. The food was out to us in no time and their home made muffins are to die for. Everything is cheaper compared to the strip and the portions are ginormous.

This is the second time I've eaten at Egg & I and this place is soo good for breakfast. I forgot what I got the first time I've been here. The last time I've been here I got a cold turkey sandwich with french fries. The sandwich was really simple with turkey, guacomole, tomatoe and etc. Just the usually stuff but it was good. Their french fries was a bit different, it is small and crispy...not like McDonald's or Burger King fries.  I love love love their banana nut muffin!! It is so freaking good! Everyone gotta try their banana nut muffin!

I would definitely come back here again.

This is my favorite breakfast place to go to when I'm in Vegas. I usually save this for my last stop before going home. Always making Vegas a yummy food destination. 

If you're a breakfast person this is the place for you. They have every kind of breakfast you can think of and they do it right. 

Also, a must is there banana nut muffin that you can also buy to take home as gift! Always really really yummy! This place never disappoint.

Came back again hoping for 4 stars on a Saturday morning but the service ..  how do i put this nicely - it sucked. Our waitress wasn't very attentive. We were seated right away since our party of 5 decided we would sit outside to avoid the wait (TIP!!!!) It was nice for a while until it started getting humid and nasty but we stuck it through.

We had the Eggceptional Omelette (3 stars), Bacon Avocado & Egg (4 stars) - these flavors ALWAYS mesh well together!, The chicken fried steak skillet (5 stars) and the cinnamon raisin french toast (2 stars).

A tip: stay away from the cinnamon raisin french toast. Couldn't taste the cinnamon in it at all and it was kind of soggy. Not the heavenly experience in your mouth you get when you think of french toast ... mmmm. BUT get the chicken fried steak skillet!!! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT. Scrambled eggs on top. So yummy.

And of course, the banana nut muffin is still my favorite of all time here!

My expectations were high after seeing and reading the reviews on Yelp. 

The inside was clean and cozy looking and they had several flat screens. 

My order the corn beef with scrambled eggs and the banana nut muffin. 

The food didn't WOW me. The corn beef was average although it was home made, muffin was cold and the potatoes tasted deep fried with a to much seasoned salt. The pineapple slice and honeydue were juicy and a nice extra to the plate.

Service was good and attentive here but I probably would not return here.

This was eggactly what was needed after a long night on the strip, time to realize there's more to Vegas beyond the main drag. Reasonably priced for decent portions and awesome flavors. I was blown away by the succulent carnitas dish served with country potatoes. Egg & I needs to franchise out so I can have this every weekend.

Visiting Las Vegas for the weekend and saw that this place had some pretty great reviews. People weren't kidding, it's FANTASTIC. Our server was Liza and she was SO attentive, kind, and helpful. True definition of a great waitress. Everyone's plate was clean at the end of breakfast. I was very impressed with this place and will definitely seek it out again when I'm back in Vegas.

LOVE this place! My friend turned me on to this "off-strip" gem on my bday.

Great menu, fast service and fairly cheap prices. LARGE portions so maybe split your breakfasts!
Great breakfast with the locals for 2 Aussie boys. Our server Linnae was wonderful as well. A sure thing for a great feed!

It was our first time and we were impressed from the time we walked in, ordered our food and left the premises. We were greeted and seated right away. Sasha our waitress was fabulous. She recommended the ultimate skillet which was delicious. Steak and eggs was great too. You have to try the banana muffin, it is to die for. You can purchase a loaf to go. Fresh squeezed O.J. & their coffee was tasteful and yummy too. This is by far the best breakfast place to go to in Las Vegas. We will definitely go back next time. Great food and great customer service!!! Thx Sasha and The Egg and I staff. :)

Must go to for brunch if you're in Vegas. Waited 15 mins to be seated but it was well worth it. Food is great and price is reasonable. And portions are HUGE. I couldn't finish half my The Works Omelette. Comes with banana nut muffin which is amazing.

Nice atmosphere. I loved the wall murals. Friendly staff. I enjoyed the food. I had the classic platter with bacon. Eggs, bacon, bread. 

If you want to depart from the chain restaurant and have more of a country restaurant atmosphere this is a nice spot. Sometimes I like to just sit and journal for a bit and they were ok with people "camping out" in the restaurant. 

Be mindful of the hours when you come. I believe they do their last seating at 3pm so give yourself enough time to relax and enjoy. 

I would definitely come back. Can you find better food elsewhere? Yes. But the atmosphere is really enjoyable and sometimes that's more than enough.
Amazing!!!  Best service and best food.  Omelets were incredible.  All food came out hot, which never happens at most places.  Erin our server rocked it.

Your typical greasy spoon, breakfast restaurant. Can't go too wrong with eggs, hashbrowns and toast. They're pancakes looked pretty good too. 

If you want a touch of the old, midwestern Americana diner service - you'll get it here. Service was friendly and quick. Atmosphere was as you'd expect of a divey breakfast joint. 

PS. Check-in on yelp and get a free banana muffin :)

Arrived worrying about too much salt and MSG (via previous Yelp reviews). But right away I knew I'd be disappointed when I learned that they didn't have real maple syrup for their pancakes. Its regular customer must be some one who likes the artificial sugar syrup they serve at cheap restaurants. It wasn't even an option for an additional charge.

To be fair, my kids didn't care their Mickey Mouse pancakes came with sugar syrup. And the prices for everything were reasonable. While I didn't find their eggs Benedict too salty (I am not salt sensitive), the MSG in the Hollindaise was palpable and the famous Diablo potatoes were "meh" (and I like spicy!). On the plus side, their banana nut muffins were delicious, as advertised.

great food family environment. They serve big portion , kinna unhappy with their coffee,  coffee should be real hot coffee not cold. Customer service is AAA , lucky we hvae Patrick our waiter.he's very attentive and  took care of our needs like a special guest.The sauce is also good. taste like real home made salsa.

Heard about this place from a local. While you'll need a car to get there (~15 min drive from South Strip) it's worth it. It's got a hometown breakfast diner vibe. Service was great and unpretentious. I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak skillet with scrambled eggs on top and it was everything my Southern Food-craving heart desired. 

Would definitely go back!

I order a half order of the bacon onion skillet, It was very good, and the right amount of food for me, orange juice was fresh, although they forgot my order of toast. Overall a good breakfast experience.

The food here was eggcellent! (Get it? Egg-cellent). Anyway,  the service here was awesome as the servers were polite and made sure we had everything we needed. The atmosphere was upbeat and inviting. The menu was an adorable newspaper that was almost like reading the funny section of the Sunday news. Portion sizes were phenomenal and the kids menu offered variety and portions were like mini adult selections. My 9 year old loved it. My husband and I ordered the Cabo and Santa Cruz breakfast burritos with the works potatoes. We were reassured by the wait staff that it was pure deliciousness and it was! Our burritos were made up of four scrambled eggs,  sautéed bell peppers and onions, cheddar cheese,  chorizo, wrapped in a warm flour tortilla and topped with their signature Santa Cruz sauce & a dollop of sour cream. My 12 year-old decided to be adventurous and order the stuffed french toast, stuffed with scrambled eggs, sausage and sprinkled with powered sugar with warm maple syrup on the side. Definitely, a taste bud explosion. Thank you Egg & I...we will NOT forget you!
Great service, food is pretty good. Defiantly get a craft of OJ if you have 2 cups. Potatoes are really good, Eggs Bennie not terrible.

In town for a week on vacation, used a Groupon and the service was so good first time I came back again with my buddy.  Chance was our server on 2nd visit and just as excellent as our first visit.  Highly recommend especially sitting on patio.
The Santa Cruz Skillet is really good, the banana muffin  are aswome,  thank you Tamara
Food was great. Best place for breakfast I've been to in Vegas. Large selection. Probably not a good place on the weekends as we waited 20 minutes on a Monday morning for a table for two.

Real good breakfast place.  Everything is fresh and they have a nice assortment of food.  I have been there a few times and nothing jumps out at me as GREAT but its all very good and the service is pleasant.  You really can't go wrong here.  I have had the meat eater skillet and a few omelets.  Good stuff.

I'm always happy to find a local place in LV to have meals.  Sometimes being on the strip is just too congested and I crave some sense of normalcy... and buffets are just too much food and too expensive.

Hence I visited the Egg & I.  And it was closed.  Computers Down. :(

When I was finally able to return I looked through my newspaper style menu and was torn between the biscuits and gravy or a omelet.

I tried the artichoke omelet and sub'd for some mushrooms.  I love the fetta cheese on top and the fresh tomatoes.  One thing that lacked... I couldn't taste the artichoke... and it could probably use more mushrooms.  It was a great idea however probably would taste better with bacon and mushrooms or ham or something to that effect... Something you can actually taste.  The potatoes were really good, home fries... and more of a fries taste since they had a TON of seasoning on it.  I would prefer less seasoning, and have a bottle to the side if you want more.

Servers were very nice, there was a line of people waiting to be seated.  It was a good experience, I think I like Blueberry Hill more, but I wouldn't be opposed to returning here again.

I wanted some American breakfast other than the breakfast I had in my hotel. So I came across this restaurant on Yelp. 

The restaurant is located in a plaza so there was plenty of parking. 

Luckily for me there was no wait time so I was quickly seated with the menu. I ordered the omelette with the home fries which was absolutely delicious. I also ordered the French toast which was also tasty. What I would recommend you getting is the banana nut bread. It is out of this world! 

The food came quick and the prices were very reasonable. 

My server was very attentive and helped me big time with my order because it was very complicated. I don't remember his name but he was a young Hispanic man. 

I'd definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegas.

Grrreat food!!!!
A trip to Vegas is not complete with out The Egg and I. 
Get there early they close by 3pm on most days

I love breakfast. It is my favorite... so Mama might be a little picky when it comes to it.

Obsessed with this place. Amazing service, kind staff, & delicious food! A ton of healthy options! YES! 

Not too far from the strip to check out... skip the buffets & overpriced crap and indulge in the homefries & the amazing banana nut muffins. The scrambles are ridiculous and i added the "sassy apples" to my cottage cheese. 

Just GO! It won't disappoint.  Only thing I would want is a larger selection of coffee type beverages like latte's, etc...
Great service! People are very friendly! And food is delicious!!!! The banana bread muffin is soooooo good!

Thank you Yelp!  We were looking for a place to have a good breakfast before heading out on the road back to Phoenix.  We had been in Vegas for four nights and were looking for something other than the options around our hotel.  I found the Egg & I using my awesome Yelp iPhone app.  Everyone agreed to give it a shot and we were all singing praises to both Egg & I and to Yelp at the end of the meal.

The special of the day was the Prime Rib Skillet, Prime Rib over breakfast potatoes, cheese, and eggs any way you want em.  Two people at our table of six went for the special.  Other meals included a Brad's Scramble, two Chicken Fried Steak Skillets, and mine was the Kay's Omelette (Four egg spinach omelette stuffed with a blend of artichoke hearts, swiss cheese, parmesan, garlic and cream cheese. Topped with fresh tomatoes and feta cheese.)  Everyone was raving about their breakfast, except for one.

One friend does not like mushrooms and did not realize they were in her skillet.  She started to pick them out and when the waitress same to check on us, she noticed the pile of mushrooms and offered to have them remake the dish.  Very nice customer service.  My friend didn't want to wait, so she declined, but it was still very nice of the server to notice and offer a new dish.

The standout of the meal was the breakfast potatoes with their special seasoning.  These are the best breakfast potatoes that I have ever had, and I love breakfast potatoes!  The seasoning had a really good flavor and the potatoes were in the perfect bite-sized chunks.

There are plenty of great reviews for this place, so I don't need to go on and on.  Just one more final thought.  When I am coming home from a trip I always like to look back and think about what I learned during the trip.  On this trip, I learned a few things . . .

1 - Don't hold your new cell phone over a pint of Guinness, chances are it may fall in.
2 - Cash out at roulette once you have doubled your original bet.  Even if you just walk right back and put down the original bet again.
3 - Add the Egg & I to the "must-have" list anytime I'm in Vegas!

So my boyfriend is a taxi driver and he gets all kinds of coupons, deals and freebies. He got a coupon for Egg & I.  I was so excited to try it because we're never awake for normal breakfast time. They stop seating people at 3pm, which is when we usually get there. 

The food is great. The chili relleno omelet was amazing. I'm not a fan of the ranch potatoes. I think they are a good filler though. Same about the Banana Nut Muffin. But the meal I dream about is Benedict's Garden. It's a 'vegetarian' version of eggs benedict. English muffin topped with guacamole and tomato, poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. it's the greatest thing!

Service is great. Everyone is friendly. Waitresses are attentive but If you need anything, just flip the egg on the condiment caddy.

I LOVE THE POTATOES!!!

I don't live in Vegas but whenever I come here, I make it  point to come to this place. Unfortunately the line is long and it's off the strip, but I honestly do feel it's worth renting a car to come over here. 

This place serves breakfast - and most of it comes with my favorite part (the potatoes) If it wasn't for a recommendation from a friend I probably would have never gone off the strip to make this my now regular pit stop when making it to Vegas!

Beyond that I try to get a bit of everything since I can usually only stomach only so much! I recommend this place!
Four stars because there isn't enough seating, and the seating they do have is kind of awkward. However, as for the food, yum, yum, yum, yum, yum; did I say, YUM?

This place is PACKED and for good reason - everything on the menu is delish! Crisp bacon, Rueben sandwiches on homemade rye bread, banana nut bread muffins dripping with butter, and oh by the way - the staff is exceptional! I would take a cab from The Strip for breakfast again at this place!
This is the best. Have not been here in quite some time. Eggcellent service from Raul.

This was a very impressive breakfast restaurant!

I came here with 4 of my other friends while we were in Vegas and all of us had a positive experience.  Both the food and the service were "egg-cellent."  

Anyhow, I try to be a little bit pun-ny at times and this is one of them.

First off, the SERVICE was great.  We came in around noon time and the restaurant was mostly crowded but our group of 5 was seated as soon as we walked in the door.  We were greeted by the hostess with a big smile and much enthusiasm.  What's interesting is that their menu is in the form of a newspaper, which is very creative and something I've never seen before.  Our waitress, Amanda, was very energetic and did a wonderful job.  She was very helpful with her recommendations, very quick, and very genuinely friendly.  I love it when the people at a restaurant enjoy what they do.  

As for the FOOD, my friends and I ordered different dishes but everyone enjoyed their meal.  I ordered a hawaiian dish that came with rice, eggs, and spam.  You could also have your choice of sausage.  Now, I know it sounds plain from the description but it was probably the best breakfast of those items I"ve ever had.  Everything was prepared perfectly and also presented well.  I had two eggs that were made over-well, hot and juicy sausage that was perfectly seasoned and two mounds of perfectly scooped rice.  Also, before our dishes were served, we were given complimentary appetizers in the form of a banana nut muffin.  It was the best banana nut muffin I've ever tasted because it came out warm and seemed to be freshly made.

My other friends ordered the country fried chicken breast skillet as well as a turkey sandwich that they happily shared with me.  I got to try it and it was just as excellent tasting as my dish.  The portion sizes were generous and all of us were stuffed by the end of the meal.

What I found interesting was that they had a little sign in the shape of an egg that had two sides.  It was used to signal our waitress if we were in need of some help.  One side of the sign had a smiling egg and another had an egg with a sad face.  Apparently you are supposed to flip it to the sad facing egg side if you needed service.  Anyhow, the last part might not make sense until you actually go there...but it beats any breakfast place on the strip that I've been too!

Lastly, the PRICE is extremely affordable.  An entire meal for one person was about $9-$10 before tax and tip.  I sort of wish they had one in Orange County but I'll definitely come back here with friends the next time I visit vegas.

Everything was EGGtastic. The long wait was worth it. All of the staff are super friendly and Alexa was awesome. She was very nice and attentive. I ordered the Chicken, Mushroom and Spinach and enjoyed it very much. My boyfriend for the must-haves stuffed French toast and he thought it was great. Make sure to check-in on Yelp to get the complimentary banana nut muffin.

I was introduced to this wonderful place a few years back by a family member and knew I had to come back next time I visit Vegas from LA. So on the way back home today we stopped by for breakfast. The place looked as I remembered and we were promptly greeted and seated by a very friendly hostess. The menus are quite charming as they look like your local newspaper and there are many delicious options. I ended up ordering Grandma's Biscuits & Gravy with scrambled eggs, home fries, sausage patties and a banana nut muffin. The muffin was soft and warm; slather some butter and it was great. I really enjoyed the gravy on the biscuits and the home fries, where are very well seasoned. The rest of my party got a ham and bacon omelette with home fries and a blueberry muffin, along with a chicken salad sandwich on rye bread with cranberries and walnuts. All three of us ended up eating half the plates so we have some food to go with us on the 4 1/2 hour trip back home. 
Overall, great food, nice service and reasonable prices. Will definitely make a return trip next time I'm in town!
Delicious food at reasonable price the coffee and banana muffin was delicous

OMG...!!! Everything was amazing. The banana nut bread is homemade and heaven!!  To die for Chili as well.  Lots and lots of options. I love local breakfast places and this ranks up next to my favorite one back home.  I wish they had this in Oregon!!
It was just ok,  the banana nut muffin was the only thing that really good. The potatoes that came with my corned beef hash was too salty for me.

This is a good spot if you like omelettes period
Our Mexican omelette was pretty good, potatoes were good not great. Overall i wouldn't rage about this spot but well worth it for the price and service. 

French toast strawberry cream was amazing.

Banana Muffin was superb as it came out so fresh

Service was A+

coffee was 3.8/5 good

After looking at reviews on here for another good breakfast spot, I choose The Egg and I. I was not disappointed, everything on the menu looked and sounded good!

I ended up getting a FRANCISCO'S SCRAMBLE and it was flavorful!

I will be back!
Tamara was really awesome, great service and attitude. Really helpful and meticulous!
Excellent food!!!  Great price!!  HUGE portions!!  Thanks Carole Ann for the great service!!!

We were originally getting a breakfast buffet at the Wynn and decided it was too pricey. Did a quick yelp search and Egg & I appeared.

To make the review short: the skillets were huge and nicely made. Prime rib benedict was on point. But the star? The warm muffin. Could just eat that for breakfast and nothing else.

Service is great too. Our server, Thay, took our group pictures voluntarily and filled our glasses and coffee mugs frequently. Awesome food and service makes for a great experience. 

Casino buffets move aside. Come here for breakfast but leave a spot open for me.

5/5 would come again.

In Vegas for a softball tournament & looked up a breakfast spot. Found this place on Yelp & decided to check it out. Had a great experience! The hostess was friendly, the waitress was great & the atmosphere of the place was awesome. Got our food quick, for how crowded it was! The food was perfect. Full of flavor and fresh. It was pretty crowded for a Friday morning but we got seated pretty quick and out of there within an hour.
The food was delicious and fast despite the very busy morning rush.  Our server Chance was lovely and quick with the refills! A wonderful stop away from the strip.
Fantastic breakfast, great service (thank you, Lisa). I had the strawberry cream French toast.

Awwww yes I love me some breakfast anytime of day!


Took my sweetie here for breakfast after hearing all of the glowing reviews. I am sure glad we dined here because it was eggceptional! Make sure you come hungry because their portions are large and in charge!

Her-
Denver Omelette 8.49
Diced ham, onions, green peppers and melted cheese. 

*Three-egg omelettes served with ranch potatoes and an English muffin or toast.

Him-
Mexican Omelette 8.59
Chorizo sausage, green chiles and onions, topped with Monterrey Jack and Cheddar cheese, salsa or pork green chili, sour cream and green onions. Served with a flour tortilla.

Their ranch potatoes are so good!

Wow we were very pleased with the service and quality/quantity of food! 

My coffee cup was never empty, refills galore from a catering staff!

We will be back indeed!

Yummy for sure a must stop for a lip smacking country breakfast!

Delicious hot food in a reasonable amount of time... I order eggs Benedict everywhere I go since they're my fave.. They never dissappoint... Service could be better with the waitress in the glasses but maybe she was having a bad day. Prices are around $10 to $13...good breakfast restaurant.

I've heard A LOT about Egg & I and in a quest to try different breakfast spots in Vegas my husband and I landed here on a Saturday morning. The place was packed, obviously very popular.

The menu is extensive, quite a few breakfast items to choose from. Obviously eggs are the feature here with a large omelette selection. The place is homey, and they have murals of farm lands all over the walls. 

I decided to get the Mexican Omelette - Chorizo, chiles and onions and cheese, topped with sour cream. Came with a heaping side of potatoes and choice of bread - I got wheat.

Overall I was kind of underwhelmed by the dish. Usually I love chorizo, but for some reason this omelette just did not meld like it should. 

Service was SLOW. Yes, it was busy on a Saturday, but there came a point when my husband looked up and said, "Where's the food?". Never a good sign when you actually start questioning whether or not they put the order in.

They did have a very yummy banana nut muffin, which I highly suggest getting if you come here. AND (as of this writing) if you check in on Yelp, you get one for free!

This is definitely a go-to breakfast spot if you live in the area. But, if you live elsewhere in the valley I am sure you can find a place that is just as good, if not better. I still like Black Bear Diner over Egg & I for breakfast.

You definitely have to try their version of a banana nut muffin. I've never eaten a banana nut muffin quite like it.  Now I know why they're famous for it.  I also love their newspaper-like menus, very creative.  

It is a comfortable atmosphere and friendly service.  This is a popular restaurant, and we went on a Saturday morning, thus we had to wait for about 15 minutes for a table, which isn't bad at all. It took a while for us to decide on what to order because everything (they had quite a variety of choices on the menu) sounded so appetizing.  After we finally ordered, our food came out quickly, and everyone was pleased w/ each of our orders.  Everything looked very good and tasted great too.    

It's not located that far away from the Vegas Strip, and it's definitely worth the short drive.  It's also a nice getaway from the chaos and traffic where the casinos are.  I certainly couldn't have gotten a decent and fairly priced breakbreast/brunch meal somewhere on the Strip. From now on, whenever I visit Vegas, I'll have to goeat at Egg and I.

This is the only place in Las Vegas that I will go for breakfast.  The food is great and the service is even better.  The homemade hash, and banana nut muffin are my go to items.  On my last visit, Carole Anne and her trainee Oscar were great, they were both polite, courteous, and professional.. Makes me feel at home :-)
Best breakfast joint in Vegas, hands down.  I will never visit vegas without going here at least once (more likely twice).  I even bought one of their mugs as a souvenir, and I rarely do that.

This is our favorite brunch spot!  They have the best service and the freshest, hottest, most scrumptious food in town.  We often bring friends and family for a special occasion, or not. :-)  We're never disappointed.  Be warned, they can be very busy, especially on a Sunday. So plan ahead, but even with a reasonable wait, you won't be disappointed!

Came to vegas for a week and decided to eat off the strip and found this place through yelp.  I was excited to see they served spam, egg and rice.  Came on Monday, June 9th for breakfast and from the time we walked in to the time we walked out we had exceptional customer service by Gia the manager and our waitress, Carole Ann.   They were both very personable.

We we're seated promptly in the back next to the kitchen by Gia.  Carole Ann came by to acknowledge us but would be right back because she had to sing happy birthday at a table.  No biggie as we were on vacation and wasn't in a rush to go anywhere.  

Gia came by and apologized but no need to apologize for the delay.  She came out with two banana muffins for us while we waited and took our drink orders and came out with it.  Those muffins were delicious.  Carole Ann came back and took our order.  I ordered the spam and egg over rice.  That came with a muffin or toast and since we already got the muffin I thought that was it.  But she offered me toast or another muffin to take home, but I declined.   My other half ordered a chorizo skillet.  

The food and service was great and I would have def gone back but my intentions while I was in Vegas was to visit a different restaurant everyday.  

They don't take American Express, not sure if it's just at this location. 

Thank you Carole Ann for great customer service, keep it up and I hope you get to meet Mickey Mouse!!!
Favorite breakfast in Vegas. Our server, Alexa, was efficient and pleasant. When we flipped the happy/sad egg face, she came right away.
Portions are HUGE!! If you are in Vegas, make sure you stop here!! I HIGHLY recommend this establishment!!

I absolutely LOVE this place!! I always come here whenever I'm in Vegas. The service is excellent and super fast, it literally took 5-10 mins for our food to come! My favorite is the works veggie benny. The potatoes are so delicious! Definitely recommend coming here, if you haven't been here, you're missing out!!

I'm a little surprised I didn't write a review for my 1st visit! Oh well...service on this Valentine's day was exceptional! The wait was a short 10 minutes around 10 or so in the morning (good thing because it was 10 times more crowded when we were leaving!) Our waitress was Lilly & she was the sweetest! She was so nice and attentive, with a cheerful disposition even tho she was so busy. And she brought my husband his free muffin even tho he was having trouble with his yelp app to check in. He did eventually but was very happy that she did that, cause that muffin, oh that muffin....I think it's the best banana nut muffin I've had in my life, and I've had my share! Lol...my husband had 3 of the blueberry pancakes w/a side of bacon. He enjoyed his meal but didn't even touch his bacon because the pancakes are a pretty decent size with fresh blueberries in the pancake and on the side was a blueberry jam sauce? It was sweet just as he likes it. I'm not a huge pancake fan so I don't make it much at home so he was happy. I ordered the chile rellenos omelette and I'm so glad I did!  I saw someone's picture of it and thought it looked good!  It was!  The sauce was tasty and everything just worked so well together with the pepper... Mmmmmm and my plate came with potatoes or toast and I chose the potatoes, I could leave that on the plate but my husband enjoyed it :)  and a muffin also came with the plate, BONUS!!  Will be back for more on our next visit!!

Came in today, 7/20/16 and had the absolute best experience. The food was excellent, atmosphere was great, and everything was really decently priced but what really put this experience above and beyond was our sweet and personable server Tamra. She was kind, quick, had perfect recommendations and maintained several tables with this level of excellency. I saw her make each of her tables laugh, and made my friend and I feel at ease even though we had kind of obnoxious and high-maintenance orders. I would return if I lived here just to be served by Tamra. I am impressed on all levels!
Egg-cellent food and great service! Can be busy at times on Sunday, but it's worth the wait!

Previously, I have written a glowing review for the Sunrise location, and every bit of it still rings true. I tend to go to this location more often though, and recently, it was the first time I had brought my husband and dogs with me.

Our server fussed over our pups and brought them water so major bonus points for that. She also made sure we had patio heater nearby. Even though there was only one other occupied table outside, we were still checked on frequently.

I had a lovely vegetarian omelette, but I was really crazed over my banana nut muffin. It was better than I remember, and it was actually steaming in the cold weather. I felt bad for all the yum noises I was making because my husband is gluten free. Speaking of which, when the waitress asked what bread he wanted on the side, he said none, and she offered to bring him a side of fruit. He was very appreciative. My husband declared his corned beef hash to be the best he's ever had, and he might have gotten a second order if he didn't have part of my meal to finish off.

The Egg & I will continue to be a "must-visit" when we come to Vegas.

Went for breakfast with my two young daughters, were sat immediately but the service was slow and sloppy. Liliana our server, was busy, in her defense. But the staff (hostess & other servers) who werent busy didn't bother to offer help and we sat asking and missing a few items...too often for my liking.

The location is about 2 miles away from the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites, which is where we stay always, great location right off of Sahara Ave. The decor is super cute, a bit country, yet not overwhelming and suffocating. There is an outdoor dining patio, it does face the busy street, but it was quiet. Surprisingly.

The food is great, fresh, came out hot and the coffee is good. A great variety of breakfast and lunch items, and I am looking forward to going back because as i said, slow service but great food. Good tasting. Fair prices. Liked this joint

Gave the 3 stars for the poor service and time we spent there despite non busy employees piddling around.

Has a large tv in the dining area, up high enough that you are not distracted if you choose not to watch. We were able to watch a bit of the World cup Soccer match, great in my opinion.

Went to Vegas and a cousin Yelped this place, which pulled it up first on her phone. The wait was not long, food was delicious and portions are big. The seasoned potatoes that accomodate the breakfast plates have a nce seasoning to it, and tasty. The banana nut muffin bread was so moist and warm, and we shared it w/everyone at the table just to get a bite; don't be fooled because it might look flat and plain in color!! The Egg Benedict was worth it, because it was the first time I've ever tried it at any restaurant. The waitress are attentive, and helpful. A very packed house, even on a Thursday morning for brunch.
Great food! Alexa was great, so patient with those of us new to the Egg and I. The portions are very huge so bring an appetite. I recommend the bacon and avocado omelet.

Tabatha was our server, such a friendly person! The banana nut muffin is so good!!!! So is the chicken, spinach, mushroom skillet! My favorite breakfast/ lunch place to eat. I always bring people here!!!

Everything yum for breakfast. Had Combo pancakes and eggs just the way I like'em. Cooked well with mushrooms and spinach, Chance is an awesome waitress -quite service. Will definitely return my next visit.

Saw this place on yelp and saw the review and decided to try this place. And guess what, this place is GOOD!! I tried the egg-ception scramble and with fruits and with banana nut muffin! And WOW! the banana nut muffin is so good!! I would definitely come here again! 

If you ever gonna come here, you gotta try the banana nut muffin!!

My new fave breakfast/brunch spot in vegas. Not on the strip but still not too far. Kind of a locals spot. They have really good omelettes and pancakes. Everything I tried was tasty. The servers are also quite courteous. Will go back whenever I'm in Vegas.

This great breakfast place is across the street from me, so I've eaten there many times. I actually go by there a couple times a month just to pick up their famous banana muffins, which my son devours!

I've ordered their oatmeal, their scrambles, their wonderful blueberry pancakes that they make with multi-grain (or was it whole wheat?). I'm not sure if I ever ordered anything that wasn't good.

Their service has been great so far. They have that nifty system of turning your egg sign on your table if you need service. I'd have to say their wait staff has always been efficient and attentive.

We often frequent Egg Works, Cracked Egg, I'm not sure if it's all owned by the same company. Their menus are slightly different, some serve coffee cakes, some serve muffins. You can't really miss with either one, they are all delicious.

Highly recommend for your family-friendly casual breakfast/brunch. Beware like many great breakfast places, the weekends get pretty busy, especially Sunday during the church rush. Definitely worth it :)

Eggsellent service! Get it? Get it?!!? This place is very popular, and there was a 20 minute wait when we arrived. It's in a small strip mall off Sahara Ave, and it is definitely worth going. They have a choice of various toasts or their famous banana nut muffins to start. They keep the bottomless coffee cup tradition going. To top it off, their eggs are all perfectly cooked! I got the hashbrown skillet, and it was fantastic. The potatoes were a little dry, but they had a nice seasoning. The prices are very reasonable, and the portion sizes are a bit on the large size.

Great food and service. Our server Karla was awesome, my ten year old said it was picky eater approved! Free muffins were "eggcellant". Visiting from LA and wanted something off the strip. The portions were large and prices were reasonable. Would definitely come back. Even the wait time was fairly short considering they were very busy.

My friends and I wanted to have brunch some place that wasn't a buffet so we found Egg & I off Yelp and decided to come try it.  I have never been more in love with Yelp.  

Their banana nut muffin is SO good and I never eat muffins because I don't like them.  It is so moist and you can taste the freshness.  Everything here is good.  If you like spicy food, add some Cholula sauce on it to complete your meal :D  Their hash browns are delicious.  The spices used to make it come together so well.  Anything you get here will be a party in your mouth.

Although it's off the Strip, it's definitely worth a try.
One word DELICIOUS!! Lots of breakfast choices, oh yea n lunch. If you're in Vegas you must stop by! mmmmm Can't wait to go back!
Wow... it is certainly worth the wait.  Paula, our server was great.  All the dishes look better than the last. Make this a stop when in Vegas
I was reading the yelp reviews and maybe just hyped up myself that this was going to be mouthgasmic. The food was good and from what I can tell so far is that it's better than IHOP or Denny's.

There was a 2 hour wait for our first choice restaurant, so we went down the street to Egg and I, and I'm so glad we did. They were able to sit our huge party (16 people) in only 20 minutes on a busy Sunday morning. The service was excellent, they were there to refill waters, coffees, and juices before we even realized they were empty. They have a helpful little sign where you can flip it to yellow if you need assistance at your table - we never had to use it once. 

The food was also amaaazing. I am a huge breakfast fan and have been to tons of breakfast places. They had the best chicken fried steak I've ever had, and there was so much of it I had the leftovers for lunch and was full all over again. Definitely worth the price. They give you so, so much food! And it tastes great. Everyone at the table loved their food. Whenever I visit Vegas in the future, I will be SURE to stop by again, because I was blown away!

We were looking for a new breakfast spot and found this one from yelp. We saw all the good review so we decided to try it. We were NOT impressed at all. Maybe they were just having a bad day? I got the basic pancakes with bacon breakfast. How can you go wrong right?? Well let me tell you, the bacon was hard and chewy and the pancakes were like chewing on their old recycled newspaper menus. It was like eating 100 crackers that you were unable to swallow. My BF got the eggs benedict that came with potatoes. The potatoes were like hollow skins with no meat inside and were salted beyond belief. I think we left swollen from all the water retention.. At least we can say that we tried it but we will definately be sticking to The Omlette House or Hash House A Go Go for breakfast when we visit Vegas.
The food was great!!! Two thumbs up. And Dariesia was exceptional! Great service.

First time here and will be making this a regular breakfast spot when in Vegas. Patrick was probably one of the best servers we've had in a very long time. He greeted us with a friendly smile, recommended their signature banana muffins (which were Ah-Maz-Ing), and always checked up on us.  

Their food is great too and the portions are enough to share so make sure you come hungry. Now keep in mind they can also do 1/2 orders on omelettes. So instead of four eggs you get 2 which was more than enough. Our family loved everything we ordered. 

This place gets packed so expect a wait. They have indoor and outdoor seating available.

I'll keep this review short and simple.  If you want a delicious breakfast, go here.  This spot is on point and we couldn't complain about the food at all.  I got the their special corn beef and hash, with two over easy eggs on top and a side of potatoes.  Their corn beef is pulled, not the typical chopped up kind you find most places.  The flavor of this was awesome and the texture was amazing too.  I can still taste it.  On top of that, bust the yolk and it's on!  Wifey had their special banana french toast.  This thing was like a cake, literally.  It didn't have a "bread" texture, but it was rather good, something I've never had before and I have to say I really enjoyed it.  It came with syrup, which was a waste because the taste in the french toast was just right.

Prices are cheap for what they serve, service is good, can't complain as the server stopped by a couple of times to check on us.  The place is BUSY though, so expect a wait, especially on a weekend morning.  Highly recommended and they NEED to open more of these breakfast type spots in this area (booo IHOP and OHOP).

We like to go off the strip for breakfast and eat where the locals eat.  The omelets were good, but not spectacular.  Kevin who is a carnivore went for their skillet with prime rib chopped in it and I got Kay's special.  The reason we'll come back though, is their banana nut muffin.  OMG it is soooo good we bought a loaf to take home.  I think we just picked the wrong menu items and next time will go for what everyone else gets.

Despite their glaring lack of proper grammar (Although Egg & Me doesn't really have that ring) I usually try to make it a point to stop by Egg & I...  usually on Sunday mornings nursing the hangover from Saturday's celebrations.

In the four or five times that I've frequented this establishment, I've noticed several things:

1.  Many of the female servers are quite attractive and helpful.

2.  The male servers that I've had have all been invariably incompetent, rude and sometimes a combination of both.

3.  For the price, (Bouchon's $18 version is slightly better) the corned beef hash is the best I've had in any restaurant.  The first time I came here, I tried it, and I don't think I've ever ordered anything else.

Beyond that, the owner/manager lady provides a stalwart presence at the cash register with that unique mix of friendly/surly grandmotherliness that only American women in their 60's can truly evince.

This restaurant had the best service on our trip. They made sure we were okay throughout the morning. Their menu was awesome with so many choices. I had the Huevos Rancheros with chorizo and it was great. I also loved their potatoes. They actually give a lot of food.

We sat outside on the patio and the weather was great and the experience was even better for our breakfast.

I would go here again or try their other locations hoping it's very similar!

We ended up here only because there was a power outage on the entire block occupied by Hash House A Go-Go.  Boo.

Huge omelets and other specialty egg dishes.  The boyfriend's scramble which was supposed to be topped with a couple eggs looks like it had 4-5 eggs.  He was pretty happy with that.

My chicken fried steak was good, but I couldn't touch the potatoes which were covered in way too much of their salty seasoning...they looked like someone dumped a bottle of Lawry's on them as a joke.

Speaking of jokes, the lady at the register thought it was HILARIOUS when my boyfriend said the food was "eggs-quisite".  DUMB!!

After weeks of passing it up saying "we really need to go there soon", we FINALLY took the plunge and stopped in for breakfast. I have no idea why we waited so long... It was one of the most enjoyable breakfasts I have had in a LONG time. 

I sort of built my own eggs Benedict and was pleasantly surprised by the hollandaise sauce that came with it! The hash brown patties were perfectly crisp (side order) and the coffee was quality. 

Great "default" breakfast/brunch place! Very casual demeanor and the staff is SO pleasant. Our server was Amanda; she was great! Will definitely be going back soon for breakfast, and will more than likely stop in for lunch!

Hello hungry people!! Yes, I'm back (again)!  Let's dig in...

So, my local bestie recommended this place to a friend and I who were in LV and I'm so happy she did!  This quaint little gem is AMAZEBALLS!!  They give you menus that look like newspapers and bright yellow mugs, awaiting your coffee, adorn the tables.  Of course, as the name suggests, eggs are their specialty, but they offer much much more!

The waitress suggested I try the "Loco Moco" and I was not disappointed!! It was a beautifully, delicious symphony on my tongue!! Sticky rice, eggs (any way you like), hamburger patty, and brown gravy. 

 I know what you're thinking..."is this chick pregnant?!" rest assured, I'm not (any more) and this dish really made sense once I took a bite!! Just wonderfully cooked and seasoned and all the different components played nice together in the tummy!
 (there's a party in my tummy...so yummy, so yummy yummy)

It's not in the nicest part of LV, but that's why I love finding these "off-the-beaten-path" joints!  What they lack in environment, they make up for in taste and ambiance!

Worth the stomach growling wait! Their portion's are huge and certainly makes up for lunch if you go all in. I hate supporting commercialized chains such as Denny's and IHOP and I had to force my colleague here. Apparently, he doesn't care what he eats but after a hearty plate of Omelette and potatoes, he has decided to boycott the inferior counterparts. Friendly staff and awesome service. I haven't gotten the chance to try other menu options but I shall on my next visit!

Breakfast menu is huge and is a little overwhelming with all the options. I had the western omelet and my husband had eggs benedict. The omelet was huge and the potatoes were a little overseasoned. My husband said the eggs benedict were just ok. Our waitress Paula was very nice, attentive  and just as sweet as can be!  If we could we would give 3 stars for food and 5 stars for service.

Came on a Friday morning with 8 girls so we did have to wait a little. Karla was our sever and she was amazing!!! Everything tasted great and came out pretty quickly. I'm from Los Angeles and whenever I come to Vegas I always come here for breakfast. I've tried lots of things and everything is great! Will definitely return!
Service was great, Liliana was on it, breakfast was delicious, and the banana but muffin was killer. Great little whole in the wall for breakfast at a decent price if you are in the area.

This was my 1st time here with my bf. I loved the Eggs Benedict Florentine with regular bacon not Canadian bacon. The potatoes were good. The little fruit on the side was bitter and I don't think they cared about the fruit. They just wanted to display it so it looked nice. My boyfriend got a crepe, it was good but my dish was better. The waiter Stacy, forgot my boyfriends English muffin so she gave us 3 free banana nut muffins to go. They were warm and moist and a little crunchy on the side. Even after 2 days the muffins were still very moist! This is a great place to eat breakfast and you must try their banana nut muffin! YUM-my!

I really enjoy breakfast food but going to breakfast eateries, they just give so much food.  

Anyway gotta eat breakfast so we came here.  Typical breakfast shop.  I ordered the Fiesta Skillet which was a layer of their ranch potatoes topped with a mixture of green chilies, onions, and salsa.  On top of that was a layer of melted cheese and two eggs over-easy.  The skillet was accompanied by two slices of wheat toast and two slices of fruit.  It was pretty tasty.  I really like the ranch potatoes, eggs were cooked correctly, no brown spots and yolks were runny.

There were three different types of Habla Diablo sauce on the table Original, Chipotle, and Verde.  So if you need a little spice in your breakfast you can choose your pain.  Well not really since none of them are that spicy.  

Overall  I enjoyed breakfast.  I have tried other items at their other locations they all taste good.  Would definitely be up there on the list of breakfast places to go.

My 300th review, and what best celebrates that then with a review for the best darned breakfast/lunch joint in TOWN! I'm from San Francisco, and I wanted to eat somewhere OFF the strip. (I was staying at Vdara). So I yelped Egg and I, and ventured off the strip with my rental car and my husband. My husband of course was a bit hesitant to venture off the strip, but he was SO happy I found Egg and I. (We ate here every morning of our 3 day stay). It was seriously that good.

We ordered-
breakfast burrito (ordered with egg whites and light cheese) A+
chicken fried steak: A (better to get sauce on side IMO)
chicken omelet (it had a "special" name to it) A+
Denver omelet (ordered with egg whites and light cheese) A+
whole wheat pancakes (HUGE ORDER!) A+
Portions are big, so don't order too much!

Service was great! We had the same server all 3 days. She was surprised to see us back on the 2nd day, but was just laughing when she saw us the 3rd day. A bit funny I know :) She made sure our visit was pleasant, asking if we needing anything. The only thing I needed was help walking out their door, since I ate so much. 

I hope Egg and I continues to serve great food. Sadly we don't live in Vegas, so we can only visit when we need to sunbathe and gamble :) So that's twice a year, hopefully more!

Thanks Egg & I, for a 5 STAR experience.

EGG-CEPTIONAL OMELETTE:

The Three Pigs (diced ham, bacon and sausage, topped with cheddar and jack cheese) $10.25
～ Love this! You will love it as much as I do if you like cheese. A lot of fillings and omelette is served with crispy cubed potatoes. 9/10

Mashed Potato (bacon omelette with garlic mashed potato, topped with melted cheese, onions and sour cream) $11.25
~ Mashed potato is very filling. Huge portion of omelette and mashed potato stuffed in it.
~ 6/10

EGG-CREPES:

Works Crepe (diced bacon, ham, smoked turkey, sliced tomatoes, onions, cheddar and jack cheese, served with poppy seed dressing) $10.85
~ Not too bad. This egg crepe has a lot of different fillings that compliments each other really well. Taste really yummy. 7/10

California Crepe (diced bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, guacamole and Swiss cheese) $11.25
~ Really really yummy! I love this dish the most! The guacamole makes it refreshing. 
~ 8/10

SKILLET BREAKFAST:

Santa Cruz Skillet (seasoned chicken breast, green chillies, onions, homemade Santa cruz sauce) $10.99
~ Don't like this at all! Too meaty, too saucy and too heavy for a breakfast. 3/10

1st visit:
Server Brady's service is really good. Our table is always on "Smiley Face" as he will constantly walk over and ask if we're doing ok. Good service! 

2nd visit:
Server Amanda is very attentive to our needs. Ensuring we had all we need. Great service!

Tips:
~ Check-in and get 1 FREE Banana Nut Muffin
~ Love the Happy and Unhappy Face on the table. If you need attention, flip to Unhappy face, if you're happy, flip it back to Happy face.
~ Write a review on yelp/tripadvisor and mention your server's name and they're one step closer to win a trip for 2 to Disney California to meet Mickey Mouse.

While on vacation in August 2015, we visited the Egg and I based on Yelp reviews.  So glad we came here!  The menu was extensive with so many choices, all sounding so delish. I had a skillet type breakfast with hash brown type potatoes and pancakes.  Pancakes were big and fluffy, skillet was huge and delicious.  Come here with a big appetite!  You'll be glad you did!

I like to visit restaurants off the strip and this was a Gem. I started with a banana nut muffin and it was the best, I followed with the 3 pigs omelet and it had plenty of meats and cheese, it came with plenty of the house home fries (which are good) and another muffin. Service was pretty good but it was crowded so we had to flag server down a couple times. Prices way better then the strip, I'd uber to this place if I had flown to Vegas

This place is over rated, looks like mostly locals go there but I see coupons that mostly target tourist around Vegas. We ordered pancakes and banana bread french toast. I was disappointed when I got the banana bread french toast, it's just banana bread coated with eggs....what else does someone expect, right? I guess after seeing the 4 stars, made my eggspection higher. For the price I could just get any whole loaf of ordinary banana bread. It came out greasy and you just can't enjoy and finish the whole plate.  My friend ordered the pancakes and we agreed that it was the worst pancake we have ever tasted.  Well, it;s an egg place but considering it being a breakfast place, we eggspect better.  I look around and see people not finishing their plate, no wonder why.  Maybe we ordered the wrong items?and should try the omelettes but definitely, it's a 1 time experience and will not go back to try other stuff.  I will not recommend this place.  Service was okay, just average, no bad experience.

Had the Eggs Benedict and the Greek Omelet.
Both were excellent.
Service was great. Prices very reasonable.

Just average. Ordered the biscuits and gravy two eggs over medium with bacon and potatoes. The gravy had no sausage in it as far as I could tell, the eggs were under cooked, sent them back just to get the same under cooked eggs, the only really good thing was the potatoes.
Only got two cups of coffee, the server took the coffee pot away when the eggs were sent back. I guess that was my punishment for sending the eggs back.
Most likely will not return.

This spot is 15 minutes from the Lad Vegas strip. You can't find breakfast like this on Lad Vegas Ave. The Banana Nut French Toast is simply amazing. Also, you can't go wrong with their homemade potatoes. They are seasoned with what they call " habla Diablo" and are to die for. If you are looking for a great breakfast spot in the Las Vegas area, you must try this place for yourself.
Good place to have breakfast. Good staff . Food was okay. Didn't like the seasoned potatoes. Homemade corn beef hash was okay.

On our way out of Vegas I decided to try this place. I love eggs for breakfast and found this place on yelp. Thx fellow yelpers. You didn't disappoint. It's not too fat from the freeway and easy to find

The banana muffin was awesome. I inhaled mine so fast. I had the Brad's special with the yummy ranch potatoes. The price was great too. I'm definitely coming back here when I'm in Vegas.

This had been our favorite breakfast place on two previous trips to Las Vegas. I'm only giving it 3-stars today because my breakfast (prime rib Benny) was awful. The croissant on the bottom was just a pile of mush, the prime rib was just little pieces of meat, and the hollandaise sauce had NO flavor (my husband, who loved his biscuits and gravy, agreed with me on the no flavor).  Service was excellent, but I'm really disappointed with my breakfast.
Amazing breakfast and even more amazing was the service! Amanda was sweet, friendly, and most of all genuinely happy to help. The potatoes are out of this world and so are the banana muffins!

Great FOOD!  I recommend the chicken fried steak. Hell I would've ate just about anything there. Great service, the servers were attentive and the food was great.  If you're in the area and want a good breakfast, go to this place!
Food tasty and generous and also a bit on the pricey side.

We've been to LV many times and we usually eat breakfast buffet near the strip. But this place is good. Lizete reserved our seats because we called in. Once seated Debra just made us feel special with her service. The muffin is sooooo fresh and tasty. She even accommodated our request to replace the ordered toast with the muffin. I highly recommend for visitors to have your breakfast at Egg and I.

We were in the area early in the AM and decided to get some breakfast and decided to try the EGG ASND I. We had never been.
Breakfast is my fav meal of the day and I really like to get or make a seriously good one. 
Wow, this one turned out to be great.. 
First, we had this great server... Thaynara... She was sweet, understanding, and smart! She has patience while we figured out what we wanted to eat, so many choices!  YOU HAVE TO SEND HER TO SEE MICKEY!!!!!!!
Since we were 3, two of us decided to split the Works Veggie Benny... and Pumpkin Pancakes.. and the third party got the Chili Rellenos. 
Everything was really good.. I always hesitate to get poached eggs since so many restaurants make them in advance and have them sitting in a water bath, so in the end either you get a medium to hard yolk or a watery mess.. these were perfect, the minute you cut into them the yolk spread everywhere, the spinach and avocado were raw not cooked to death and I just can't believe the potatoes.. They were spiced and hot and really good, and we had a  choice of potatoes or fruit and since we couldn't decided Thay suggested 1/2 and 1/2.. Perfect. 
The pumpkin pancakes were moist (which I didn't expect, usually they are dry dry dry) but they were really good, like a good pumpkin cake (not pie).. 
And the Rellenos were really good, not too much cheese (which I don't like) and he really enjoyed them.
All in all a really good meal! 
It's 3PM and I'm still not hungry..
Oh, and we tried the Banana Muffins.. we gobbled them up! 
Even the coffee was OK.. 
Definitely, will be heading back for more!
The ambience was good. Great people and great food. The menu was a but overwhelming. Other than that I recommend this place.

While on a family vaca, we decided to hit a spot off the strip for breakfast, and man this was a jackpot. Great for the kids.  They greeted us with balloons, and where extremely friendly.  I had the Chorizo skillet and it was the bomb!!  Super crispy potatoes.  Grubby mixture of everything else.  Also comes with a very good banana nut muffin on the side.  They leave the carafe of coffee at the table.  

Hit the spot and wish they had one near me in So Cal.

Awesome breakfast. Our server was Karla and she was very nice. 

I had the stuffed French toast and it was delicious. The seasoning on the potatoes was really good.

I had the huevos ranchero and was AWESOME! Sauce was fresh and tasted clean not greasy or oily , customer service was equal good, waitress very attentive and polite, even with it being busy they are still fast to respond to my needs while dinning, I will be back very very soon

Hands down, they are my favorite breakfast establishment.  I have been here three times and loved all the dishes I have ordered (eggs benedict florentines, taco rancheros, & omelette). Too bad, there is no Egg & I around where I live!

I premise this review that I'm not a big fan of American breakfast. For me, I can't differentiate the best of the best for this staple American cuisine. In any event, came to this popular locals' spot in LV. I tried the strawberry filled French toast with bacon and scrambled eggs. I also tried a free banana nut muffin (it's free with Yelp check-in). The French toast was overbearingly sweet. The French toast on it's own without the strawberry madness was moist and fluffy; however, the strawberry filling along with the strawberry topping and the whip cream really overdid it. It was hard for me to finish.

The eggs and bacon were standard fare. Nothing to note. I tried some of my buddy's chicken fried steak. Again, decent seasoning, but tasted a bit too heavy for my liking. 

What stood out for me was the banana nut muffin. It was moist and the muffin top was crispy. Even better that it was free. I liked how it didn't have too many walnuts in it. Nice balance between breading and nuts.

Service was fast and courteous. I would say if you're looking for a popular American breakfast spot, check out Egg & I.

This is our second time here and I must say it's delicious! Allan has ordered the Loco Moco from day one and says it's the best he has had. Their food has a lot of flavor. The staff is awesome! Sunshine thank you for always welcoming us with a smile! She's the best manager ever! See you again in a few weeks.
Got there early before heading to Death Valley. Easy to park. Cheap. Good service. Nice Eggs Benedict and tasty crispy bacon.

Looking for a hearty meal while in town, EGG and I does not dissapoint. Enjoyed the Bacon omelette w/ potatoes and side of biscuits and gravy. Split the meal with my wife. Omelette was good, potatoes seasoned and crispy and buiscuit was flaky and soft gravy perfect. Everything served hot and quick. Also checked in and got a free bannana muffin served warm and fresh loved every bite. Plenty of seating here come early gets busy on the weekend.
Very attentive, friendly staff. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. We will definitely come back next time we're in town.
Very good menu and service by Jessica outside.  The the three pigs omelette with wheat toast.
As always great service.  Our server Amanda is great and always has a smile on her face. Love coming back

Various choices of food to order! I used awhile for browsing the menu (want to try everything!) I'd ordered a blacken prime rib Benny and my honey got a egg stuffed French toast. Both are delicious!! And we've checked into Yelp to get each of us a free banana nut muffin which taste good too! Our server Amanda is great! She carries a big nice smile in front of every customers :) not that long waiting time (I arrived at 12:30pm and had around 30 minutes wait which is totally worth after I tried) will definitely visit again next time when I come to Vegas! Btw, hope you can win a trip to Disneyland Amanda! You deserve it ;)
This place has the best breakfast in town.  I totally recommend it. Our server Tabatha was great.  Get her to Disneyland !!!!!

This place is a hidden Vegas gem...pretty sure all the locals know about it, but this place was brought to my attention from my friend..after a long and drunk night out...this is the perfect place to come to drench your hangover lol....the food was so fresh so delicious...and I even ordered freshly squeezed OJ...omg so freaking good...really recommend this place if ever in Sin City! lol

Everything was delicious and I LOVE that they offer 1/2 portions! Everyone was so nice, especially our server Breannada.  She kept checking on us to make sure everything was ok, or if we needed anything.  She was warm, and had a great smile.  We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas! Oh! Banana muffin was awesome!! We had to take a loaf to go :)

First the banana muffin I was questioning why this is a automatic side with each dish lol but it's amazing and warm when it comes out  highly recommend!! It's like a small cake!!! 
Anyways, I had the chili (the hot one not the cincy sweet one) on egg white skillet without cheese, so yummy and amazing. My husband had the island favorite which he really liked. He describes the spam as something he would eat everyday if he could, I'm not a spam eater so I trust him if you like spam get it :)
Coffee is good here also, and they're not cheap on their sauces, or creamers. Plenty to go around here.
Good price. Good portion, good location. There can be a wait though it's worth it.

always a great place to visit for breakfast :-D
I highly recommend ranch potatoes! small, bite-size, seasoned potatoes are sooooo good! 

I also love their banana nut bread. it comes with a lot of the entrees and it's so moist and delicious! 

they have a similar service style like bumba gump (where if u needed assistance, u would turn your sign to "stop forest, stop!"). they have a happy egg face and sad egg face if u need service

Just ok breakfast.  All too often, I believe people mistake quantity for quality.....They just serve a truckload of potatoes and make them seem exotic by putting a little paprika on them.  Everything is ok, but average.

Me and my girl were in Vegas and as usual Yelp really came through. This place has really good breakfast at a very reasonable price. The potatoes were some of the best I've ever tasted. The seasoning they put on them is the bomb! We also tried the spinach mushroom omelet and the chicken tortilla soup. The only complaint was that the soup was way too salty but the omelet was worth the drive out.

Egg & I has become a recent tradition with the future in-laws.

It's a nice change-of-pace versus the Strip and a mere ten minute drive but not worth the added expense if you plan on cabbing.

Parking is plentiful and there is a delicious bakery with some of the stickiest baklavas in the same strip mall to warmup while you wait (ranging from 10 to 30 min).

Prices are reasonable, service is shoddy, and luckily one cannot mess up eggs.  Food wasn't greasy for whatever's thats worth.

As you may have guessed menu is egg-centric but fear not.  I decided to change things up during my latest visit and ordered hawaiian food.  Yep, you read that right and my internal organs as of a week later remain intact.  They offer: loco moco, spam and eggs and portuguese sausage and eggs.  Ordered both the spam and portuguese sausage and had no regrets.  Forgot the name of the breakfast burrito with the chorizo but it was dense AF and subsequently awesome.

Their homefries are also a must.

Egggggsellant breakfast! Come early....long lines if u out don't come by 9ish. I had the Benny, husband had the biscuits and gravy. He's southern and picky about his gravy. He gave it two thumbs up. Highly recommended this place.

My husband and I visit Las Vegas pretty regularly and wanted to try a restaurant the locals patronize for a change. It was really busy when we arrived but the wait wasn't too terrible. We were seated inside, and it was really bustling. 
With our Yelp check-in, we each received a free banana nut muffin, which was REALLY tasty. I ordered the Vegetarian Benedict (with bacon) and my husband ordered the Biscuits and Gravy and Blueberry Pancakes. My Benedict was really, really good, but I will say their hollandaise is seriously lacking in lemon juice. It didn't seem like an authentic hollandaise at all, but it tasted good. They know how to poach an egg beautifully, which made up for the sauce. The breakfast potatoes that come with every entree are very flavorful and crispy. My husband really liked his biscuits & gravy (he said the biscuits were very light and fluffy), but the pancakes were a huge bust for both of us. They were way too dense - the texture was pretty awful. I'm assuming that's how all their pancake batter is, so I'd hard pass on pancakes there. 
It was fun to venture off the Strip, but we'll probably stick with breakfast elsewhere in the future. HOWEVER, they offer an extremely generous military discount of 30%, which we appreciated. We didn't even ask for it, but when I opened my wallet, she noticed my military ID and offered it up.

Große Auswahl an Eierspeisen aller Art. Für unseren Geschmack hätten die Portionen etwas übersichtlicher ausfallen können. Freundlicher und zügiger Service. Achtung: Schal einpacken, die Klimaanlage tut's!
Pretty darn good...a lot of food.  We all liked the Maple Tree better though.

Reina, Reina, Reina I hope that gets her three steps closer to Mickey Mouse !!
Food was eggselent. Place was busy which means the food is worth the wait.
Food was really good and it comes out quick.  Our server was on top of it and very nice (Lindsey).  The "works" skillet was delicious.
