Our server Raul was great! He was courteous..kept the refills coming without asking and was very friendly with my son.  Great service and great food is a winning combo!

Average greasy spoon that would make you not hungry, but not worth the trip from the strip.

Service: Excellent
Food: Average to below average
Price: Fair for what you get, but with added costs of having to uber it there and back, it isn't worth it. 

Preliminary: We went on a Monday morning and there was no line and service was great. Other than that, the restaurant was lacking and not worth the trip from the strip. Just FYI, these Egg & I restaurants are independent from one another as I heard the staff tell another customer.

My wife and I went on a Monday morning. The reviews said their would be lines, but we encountered none. 

We got a variety of food. She got coffee, pancakes, scrambled eggs, and turkey ham.  I got OJ, hot tea, biscuits and gravy, potatoes, and turkey sausage (they only have patties in turkey sausage).  

She said her coffee was good, the eggs were as expected, but nothing spectacular, and she liked the turkey ham. The pancakes were not cooked all the way through. She ate about 1/3 before she got to the middle to discover the undercooking. The restaurant offered to toss them back on the griddle, but she declined as she wanted to eat my potatoes (which were very good).  They brought out a chocolate muffin to make up for it. It hasn't been eaten yet, but I suspect it's pretty decent. 

As for my food, the potatoes were really good! Like really good.  Well seasoned and smaller and crispy, the way I prefer them to be. My wife liked them as well.  My turkey sausage was  undercooked and cold when served.  If you like hot tea like me, savor your first tea bag, because that's all you'll be getting for the $2.50 it costs to get hot tea. And perhaps it was my mistake for ordering biscuits and gravy; as a southern man, maybe my standards are too high. The meal was reminiscent of what you get at a Holiday Inn continental breakfast in the south. Seriously, no joke, and I feel bad about saying it like that, but it's true. The biscuits were hard and as if they were precooked and then microwaved when the dish was ordered. The gravy was ok, but nothing special. 

Overall, with the cost of breakfast, plus the uber there and back, it would have been just as cheap to do the Bellagio buffet and gotten better food and more options.
Oscar was our waiter. He was quick as well courteous. Got us our check in muffins in a jiffy. Helped us with getting our orders correct since the menu has a lot of options. Very awesome place.
So glad we found this great breakfast spot before leaving Las Vegas. The food was great and the service was excellent. Thanks Amanda

I usually don't give 5 stars, but I just had to! Great food but also awesome service!! Our server Lilly was very welcoming and gave us such great service! After eating some brunches in the LA area, I can say that this place was one of the best brunch places I've had!! If you're in Vegas, you must come here!! Also the banana nut muffin is amazing...

Came to Vegas to celebrate my boyfriends 21st birthday.. And today we go back home :( but before we leave we decided to track down an awesome place for breakfast to keep us going for the ride back! My boyfriend chose this place because of all the great reviews he saw on Yelp. And we weren't disappointed! The omelette was so cheesy and delicious and my tuna melt was perfect! The seasoned fries and breakfast potatoes were awesome too! Lily was our server and she was super sweet and brought us whatever we needed right away. We will be making it a tradition whenever we come out here to eat at the Egg & I! Thank you!! Now for the drive home..... :( lol

What an EGGcellent breakfast we had this morning!!!    We had never been here before but tried it based off all the positive reviews.    We were not disappointed!!  

It was a crowded Sunday morning but we only waited about 10 mins.   

We had the chicken enchilada omelette and the stuffed French toast.    Both were OMG!!  

The omelette had grilled chicken, green chilies, enchilada sauce, cheese  and sour cream.    Came with crunchy potatoes.  

Stuffed French toast was filled with sausage, eggs, cheese and topped with powdered sugar.     Unique combination and it all worked.  

Waitress was very fast and super friendly!   Thanks for a great meal.

If you want your monies worth, this is the place to go. Almost always a long wait but worth the wait. The eggs are just amazing, menu has a great selection and service is warm and friendly. Great place for a weekend breakfast with friends and family.

Went here because of the great reviews, and was not disappointed. Long line out front, but surprisingly only waited 15 min for a table. Food was excellent. Lindsey our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back on my next trip!
Staci was just great and the food is so worth it. Great prices, everybody working together to help get people in and out. It's a breakfast wonderful

Yelp 100 Challenge 14' * 6/100

Be sure to arrive early (before 9am) if you want to be seated within 10 minutes because those banana nut muffins are pretty amazing!

Servers are always busy and it can be hard to get their attention with a never-ending inflow of people so what you can do is turn your eye to your table stand. Flip from a black to a yellow egg as an indicator that you're ready and a server would be at your table in no time. I found it unique and utterly adorable. 

After taking a while to eye the vast newspaper style menu, I got a huge portion of tender country fried chicken served with over easy eggs, home fries and their iconic banana nut muffin while mommy got the chicken, broccolli and mushroom skillet. It was the best thing that happened that morning. 

A point to take note of; the skillet is blanketed with a layer of cheddar cheese (wink to the lactose intolerant). To my fellow mint-lovers, do not miss the caramel peppermint candies available at the cashier. Slip a couple more of em' in your pockets if you can.

Best place in Vegas for breakfast. Big menu big portions and excellent service 

Doesn't look like much from the outside but breakfast nirvana inside

Good food, good prices and a wonderful atmosphere. Glad Google showed me this place. Was just what I wanted after dinner at my hotel last night.  My server, Lilian was prompt, friendly and quick to make sure I had everything I needed.

Summary:  Perhaps the best breakfast restaurant I've ever found.

Long version:  So I'm on vacation with my two adult sons (and one of the boy's GF).  Since we're at a timeshare I'm enjoying making breakfast most of the week.  On a lark I decide we're going out, and I google "best las vegas breakfast".  #1 on the list is "The Egg and I".  So we map it and off we go, without a lot of expectations or knowing what's on the menu.  

So first of all there's a bit of a wait - 15-20 minutes for a table.  Staff is friendly, place is clean, and every table is filled.  We are seated outdoors on the patio and there are heaters set up (the stand-up propane ones) every couple of tables so we're nice and cozy.

Coffee comes and guess what - it's really good.  I'm a bit of a coffee fanatic - I roast my own beans at home and can distinguish varietals between African and South American by taste - and it's surprisingly lively on the palette for a breakfast joint.

Between the four of us, we order a vegan breakfast, two different omelets and biscuits and gravy.  Each entry is under $10, and the portions are absolutely ginormous.  It's a quarter to midnight and I'm still stuffed.  

But most importantly, every thing on the plate is absolutely delicious.  From the specialty omelets to the potatoes to the gravy, everything is simply first rate.  

Apparently the place has won several awards and is Zagat rated.  I have no reason to doubt any of this - if you're in Las Vegas for breakfast, you absolutely MUST search out and try The Egg and I.

The food was really good! My wife's tortilla shell was stale but other than that I have nothing but good to say. I have to say that Genesis our server was really sweet and was an absolute wonderful as our waitress.
Great place to have breakfast.  Fast and friendly service.  Arlene was very courteous and attentive. Hefty servings at a reasonable price.
Great breakfast and great service from Tabatha! The Traditional Benny was awesome (soft yolk) and loved the banana nut muffin. Definitely will be back next time I'm in town.

It took me a few trips to Egg & I over the years for the place to grow on me. I can finally say I'm officially a fan of this place after discovering their breakfast crepes. Can you say yum

The service is just all right and I always end up with a weirdly small fork compared to the rest of my party, haha. 

All in all, a great little place for breakfast.

Overall my expereince with Egg and I has been pretty good. They have a good selection of Omelets and their potato browns are enjoyable. I'm not completely blown away by this place, but if you can find an entertainment book, you can get a coupon for Egg and I at a buy one get one free rate.
GREAT breakfast in Vegas.... eggs, muffins, skillets... you cant go wrong!  Worth leaving the strip for this gem.  Be sure to try their verde sauce.

Pretty good, but not enough for more visits.  No matter how creative you are, eggs are still eggs.  We ordered all dishes recommended by the waitress.  Beautiful, delicious-looking but in the end... the impression doesn't last.  We party of 5 (who eat out quite a lot) all agree that we won't come back.   Excellent service.

Great breakfast!!!! Rented a car in Las Vegas and decided to getaway from the strip for breakfast. Found this place on yelp and had great reviews. So glad we did!!! John was an awesome server and loved the table egg flip card if you need anything :) great idea!!!!! Best pancakes and he even gave us a bowl of blueberries and whip cream if we wanted it. Yum!!!! Great food, prices, service and worth the trip!!!! Can't wait to go back.

love this place! first ate here a few years ago before Yelp.
Got to go last week and it was so good my mom wanted to eat there 2 days in a row! and my mom NEVER eats anywhere 2 days in a row.

highlights: giant portions, strong coffee, FAST SERVICE.

First day I ordered biscuits and gravy with potatoes and eggs. Was a little weirded out by the orange potatoes but when mixed with the gravy they were very good. The biscuits are freshly made and are amazing! Coffee was really good and strong here too.

I was very curious for the Cincy chili and got a side of that but I had to taste it and take it to go. It was AWESOME. Brought it home and ate it on a hot dog! AWESOME.

the service here was VERY fast and it was great but definitely hard for everywhere else we ate in Vegas to live up to.

lets see my other families food choices were all GIANT and everyone was really happy which is very unusual for us.

Second day I ordered the spam, rice and eggs. I think they called it Hawaiian special. Of course it was great. My niece tried the apple cinnamon pancakes but they were seriously big enough for 4 people to split. I think she finished 1 whole pancake. VERY fluffy and good.

By far the best food I have tasted in my entire life. Every time I come to Vegas I HAVE to eat here if not everyday of my stay then every other day. I can't leave without paying a visit. Staff is amazing and service is quick. I recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Tried this place for the first time this weekend. We had high hopes, but alas, salt did us in.
Hub's scramble (prime rib) had some tough meat. My chicken fried steak was ok.  Here's the catch.  It was ALL salted so heavily that we couldn't finish anything.  The potatoes were coated with an orange, seasoned salt, the gravy could have easily floated a ship. My two scrambled eggs, which HAD to actually be four because they covered half the huge place, were browned and chewy. I ate the steak after scraping off the gravy.
I've never eaten in a restaurant where the food was uniformly Over Salted. Since I have high blood pressure, this was extra-problematic for me.

My husband & I found it on YELP and we were not disappointed.  Loved it!  We had to wait a few minutes but it was worth the wait!  I ordered an omelette with bacon, cheese and avocado & my husband had something else (ha...I was so into my breakfast I didn't notice) and he loved it.  The  seasoning on the potatoes was wonderful and I tried the "Pepperdoux" sauce.  Loved it so much I asked if I could buy some and they said YES!  Thanks for giving us a reason to leave the strip!

Never in my life have I polished clean an entire breakfast of steak, eggs, 4 pieces of toast, and hash browns!  The food here is absolutely delicious.  The service is extremely friendly.  Our coffee was lukewarm and they immediately brought out a fresh pot and continued to apologize when I didn't think it was a big deal.  No charge for substituting hash brown patties for potatoes.  Perfectly cooked sunny side up eggs.  delicious, buttery toast.  I have no complaints about this place!  It's just awesome!

Everything about this place is perfect! Mashed potatoe omelet is lit! Seriously if you come to Vegas you have to try it. The muffin is also essential to life. Please do yourself a favor and come here! egg&i for president!

Even better than the other reviews said. Ordered prime rib omelet and banana nut French toast with real maple syrup. Outstanding. Our server Oscar was truly the best. We felt like we were at his house and he would do anything to ensure we had a comfortable stay.

Favorite breakfast/brunch place when in Vegas. But, you need a mode of transportation because it's not on the strip.

TIP: If you check in through Yelp, you get free of the delicious, moist Banana Nut Muffin. (Do it! It's worth it.)

Be prepared to wait in line before seated, ALWAYS busy. So don't come here starving because you'll end up hAngry. 

FOOD: I love everything I ordered from this place. Oh, if you eat like a bird, share The food with someone because they serve big portions. (My son and BF always finish their plates though.)

They also have rice plates, 3 choices, Hawaiin style. YUM!

DRINkS: Mimosa is not unlimited. But soft drinks and coffee are. Also if you order juice, they'd give you a carafe.

PRICE: decent price. They accept Amex. Pay at the cashier once you receive your receipt. 

RESTROOM: small but clean. 

SPACE: big space, good for groups. They also have outdoor seating.

SERVICE: fast (once seated) and efficient friendly staff.
Excellent portion which two people can share n reasonable prices but even more important, very courteous service
It was my first time having breakfast at the Eggs & I. I ordered a Brad's scramble which was super tasty! Curtis had been very nice and helpful to me. He was patient and helped a lot, thank you!

First time eating breakfast in Vegas off the strip....best breakfast in town! Got the Fender Pender, bf got the Flapper, everything was delicious! Karla was an amazing server, she made the whole meal even better :)
Great casual breakfast place. Huge menu and great food. Service is excellent and fast

DEFINITELY WORTH THE DRIVE
We found our way here by accident last year and made a point of going back this year. Everything is delicious that we have ordered. Pork carnitas skillet was perfection. Apple cinnamon pancakes were delicious as was the often-mentioned banana nut muffin. Come hungry or share...they are generous with their portions.

I made a call-ahead for 7 people for around 10:30am on a Sunday....good thing I did because there were about 15-20 people waiting out front to be seated. We arrived about 15 minutes early so we reviewed the menus as we waited. We were given an 8-person table in the back corner of the restaurant.

After being seated I notified our waitress (larger woman with Hispanic accent) that two members of our party were not going to make it so we broke the tables up so more people could sit. Our waitress was helpful in executing the table move without any impact to our comfort. Throughout the meal, our waitress provided us the best service possible, despite the busy conditions of the restaurant. 

The wait for food was nothing extreme and actually pretty quick considering all the people eating there. The food itself was fantastic. Most people at the table did not even finish their plates. My friend ordered the omelette with mashed potatoes....sounds strange but I tried it and it was amazing. 

In the end, everyone from my group was satisfied with their meal and especially with the service. Egg & I seems like one of the go-to places for breakfast in Vegas. I recommend it for anyone...just come early or call-ahead if you have a large group of people.

Awesome experience here. Chocolate chip pancakes were great, homemade muffin fantastic and amazing service. Waitress offered to grab us to-go drinks and food was out within 10 minutes of ordering (even with the restaurant full). Great dinner feel and exceptional service. Highly recommend.

Hearty breakfast where locals go. It's got a country-side vibe. Relatively cheap and large portions. Service was really quick, in and out in 30 mins. Great place to go if you're in Vegas and on a budget or if you don't wanna wait 1.5 hours for a trendy brunch place.

Recommend: omelettes are okay, get a skillet. Crappy OJ is $3.25!

Food quality is not that great so I always stick with egg options. Cute homey decor. It's in a convenient location for breakfast and lunch. Salads leave a lot to be desired. Wish they just had a few more healthy options.

This place is easily the best breakfast place off the strip in Las Vegas. I have been coming here for a few years my favorite menu items are the Loco moco and the biscuits and gravy. Also my server OSCAR gave pretty much the best service you can give!! I am a huge fan of this place I definitely recommend this place for anyone who loves breakfast!!
Really good food, super fast service!

This place is great. Omlettes, pancakes stuffed french toast its all great and they have something for everyones taste.  Our server Karla was awesome!  She described everything we asked about with great detail. I also like that they leave the coffee pot on your table so you never have to ask for a refill.
My wife and I love getting "Kay's Special" whenever we go there.  We love this place!

Honestly the place was busy, clean, and expedient. Our server Alexa checked in frequently but not so much that I would be irritated. She always showed up with a smile and I love that in a waitress... the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is I wasn't the biggest fan of the food seemed a lil over seasoned.

Our server Karla was great! Friendly and very attentive! I started off with the Banana Nut Muffin and coffee. Oh yum! You MUST try this at least once although I'm sure it won't just be once! I also ordered the Stuffed French Toast and eliminated the meat. Before I can ask what are my other options Karla recommended veggies! Stuffed French toast with scrambled eggs, spinach and mushrooms. It also came with deliciously seasoned potatoes. I can't wait to go back to Vegas, so I can come back to this place for breakfast! 

I'm saying good-bye to brunch at the buffets and saying hello to Egg & I! I found my Vegas breakfast spot!

We are visiting Las Vegas from Boston and this was an amazing brunch meal for our first day here. We decided to check this place out after reading the glowing reviews on Yelp, and we were not disappointed.

We arrived around 10:15am on a Sunday and the place was packed! There was a line outside the door of people waiting. However, the wait was quite fast and our party of 6 was seated in about 20 min. The service was excellent - our waitress Alexa was super friendly and took our complicated drink and food orders with ease. Any one with a Yelp account can also check in to receive a free banana nut muffin, which was huge, warm, and full of banana flavor. It was one of the best banana nut muffins I have tasted. In addition, coffee comes with unlimited refills! 

Our table ordered:
Bacon and sliced avocado omelette ($11.25): excellent. The omelette was huge and stuffed with ample chunks of whole avocado, bacon bits, and topped with a generous amount of melted Jack cheese and a dollop of sour cream. There was also a side of buttered toast and a choice of home fries, cottage cheese, or fruit (I think this is offered with any egg dish). Delicious, and a large portion size for one person. 
Heart stopper skillet special ($10.25): this was my favorite dish that our table ordered. It was one of the specials and consisted of a layer of works potatoes topped with bacon, ham, and sausage and smothered in homemade country style gravy and two sunny-side up eggs. The gravy and the runny egg yolks mixed with the potatoes and meat created a delicious creamy explosion of flavor and umami. 
Southwestern Cobb salad ($10.50): a huge salad with a ton of toppings. I was impressed that there was very little lettuce, and instead a lot of delicious toppings such as taco seasoned chicken, black bean and corn relish, tomatoes, black olives, bacon, cheddar cheese, tortilla strips, and a whole sliced avocado (amazing!) with chipotle ranch dressing. 
Sundance special omelette ($11.25): veggie omelette with spinach, mushrooms, artichoke hearts and Swiss cheese topped with tomatoes and feta cheese. You can also add chicken for an extra $2.50. The feta cheese melded perfectly with the creamy egg flavor and the various vegetables. 

Overall, I highly recommend this place for brunch. Service was super friendly and efficient, and the food is great value for the portion size and the price!

Ive lived in Las Vegas about 3 months now and drive by here often and have always wanted to stop and try it.  Especially, after seeing all the amazing yelp reviews.  Unfortunately i wasn't very impressed.

There were a ton of people (as i expected) and my son and i only had to wait about 5 min., the entrance is horrible.  Seems like such a fire hazard to me....way to many people in and out and standing in the door way.  

The seating was way too cramped for me.  But the waiter was right there and got our drinks right away.

Our food was brought out in great time.  

Iam on a very strict diet, so i ordered whole wheat banana pancakes.  They were HUGE !!! but tasted like something i could have very well made at home.  My son had Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes with a fruit face and bacon mouth.  He loved that part but that was about it.

All in all it was 'ok'.....i may or may not go back....im reading about all the yummy stuff that my diet doesn't aloud perhaps on my next cheat day ill try again.

Huge portions, quick service, pretty good food, grumpy waitress!

The muffin we took to go and ate it on our way back to California, and it was delicious, warm or cold, quality is quality!

Took my daughters and her friends here for a breakfast birthday... Carole Ann was our waitress she went out of her way to make our visit awesome from singing happy birthday to my youngest daughter to recommending the two younger one share a meal because it's soo much food... Thank you again we will return soon .. ;-)

Had the prime rib Benedict with the seasoned potatoes and their homemade banana nut muffin.  The service was very quick, and we had our amazing vanilla cappuccinos within minutes of ordering. Definitely coming back
Food was great split a skillet and stuffed French toast with my wife. Carole Anne provided great service. This will be a spot to always come back to when in Vegas.
Had breakfast and everything was great.  Highly recommend the stuffed French toast.  Linnea was a great server !

Liliana provided excellent service for our breakfast visit. My wife had the classic breakfast and said the bacon was very good. I had a special, the Hobo Scramble, which was exactly what the description said and really hit the spot. Their potatoes are deliciously seasoned. We both also had their tasty sourdough toast. Had already had coffee so can't speak to that but the iced tea was good. It was Memorial Day so there was a pretty good line but it moved quickly, only about a 15 minute wait. Hostesses were great, too!
First time there. We had great eggs and stuffed French toast!

food was good service was uh-may-zing!...30 people and fast friendly and efficient service. stacie rocks!

oh yeah they got loco moco and portuguese sausage island style!

TASTY!!  We went here twice for brunch during our 3-day vacation.  On the first day I got the ultimate skillet (no cheese) with Portuguese sausage instead of regular sausage (reminded me of Hawaii).  It had bacon, sausage, peppers, ranch potatoes and other deliciousness topped with 2 eggs over easy.   Super great! Also, the server gave me an ice tea to take with me.  The service was pretty good - it was packed but it seems the staff actually pays attention to the system of "frowny egg"/ "happy egg" because when we put the frowny egg on for more coffee, people came immediately.  
The second day I got the prime rib benedict but with guacamole instead of hollandaise sauce.  That was awesome!  They were actually too generous with the guac and I had to leave some behind on my skillet.  Service was again pretty good, but we got the same waiter who remembered us.  Everyone else at the table was also very pleased with their meals.  Can't wait to return on future Vegas trips.

This place is eggcellent and I will definitely return! 

Ulises was my waiter and he was courteous, helpful and quick.

I got the corned beef hash meal and the homemade corned beef hash was awesome and the eggs were well prepared. The banana nut muffin was good, I liked the fact that it wasnt as oily as many muffins. The toast and coffee were just ok, but I'm not complaining, this is a fantastic restaurant and anyone would be lucky to be nearby.
Half order of Mashed Potatoes Omelet and an ice tea is how everyone should start their day!

Our server Patrick was exceptional and the food delicious.  I had the chili rellano omelette and it was a flavor explosion!  The Diablo potatoes that come with it are amazing.  Couldn't stop eating them!Yummy! You get a free banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp.  It was warm and tasty.

We had an awesome breakfast! There was a wait but that's what you get when you go to an above average dining experience! Our son was being difficult, and at first did not want to order breakfast. Then when our food arrived he decided he wanted something . The waitress was able to get his food to us so promptly, it definitely provided customer service that we were not expecting! Also just a tip, they have half orders on certain items - unless you're super hungry their food portions are humongous!

I was looking for a great place to have breakfast in Vegas and this place was one that came up. I am so glad I went here, the food was great with much larger portions than what I am used to for breakfast and the service was pretty good as well. I definitely will be back on my next trip.
Just a regular breakfast spot. Nothing special or out of this world. The service was excellent though. That's y I gave it 3 stars

This was our first time in the Vegas area and we found this place on Yelp. The portions are generous, the food is delicious, the prices are low, and the people are awesome ! Manuela was our server and she was so sweet! Would definitely recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

We were a group of 7 and we waited for a table. Typically, the food is worth the wait. We'd eaten at this spot before and have always had a good experience. That's why this is so frustrating. The server came and took our drink orders. Then he took our food orders. Then we waited and just when we started to get a little antsy, they came out with one plate of blueberry pancakes and a side of bacon. (Not for the same person.) The rest of us continued to wait with no word from our server or anyone else. The pancakes were gone and still no one else got food. Then they came out with a second plate of blueberry pancakes; not the plain ones that were ordered. Four other orders came out shortly afterward. Two from our table continued to wait for their food. The server came by twice and assured us the kitchen was fixing the orders. The rest of us were finishing our meals by the time one came out. It was wrong and was sent back. Several minutes later, the correct order came out. The seventh person was still waiting for his plain pancakes. When they finally came out, they were blueberry and undercooked. He was so frustrated and hungry, that he just ate around the blueberries and batter. At this point, FINALLY, the assistant manager comes by...with our check (with the two messed up meals taken off), a weak apology, and a loaf of banana nut bread. I pointed out that I never received the banana nut muffin that came with my meal and the assistant manager brought out another seven muffins for the table. As much as we appreciate and enjoy the banana nut muffins, they can not make up for the frustration from our experience. That it took that long for a manager to approach us and apologize is seriously disappointing. That he could give no reason as to the horrible experience was even worse. We were left hanging for most of the meal with no explanations and no assurances. I don't think any of us will return to this location again.

The best places to visit are the ones where locals go. If you see locals going to a restaurant, then you know it's amazing. I was guessing we were the only travelers because no one else was taking pictures of their food. It is a rather small place. They said the wait was 20 minutes but we were seated much quicker. All the workers are very friendly and will assist you, even if they aren't your waiter/waitress. The menu resembles a newspaper and my parents were happy at the large clear print. I ordered the classic plate. The eggs were cooked to perfection, the bacon was not too crispy and not too flimsy, and the potatoes were just heavenly.

Egg and I is a popular breakfast / brunch spot in Vegas. Using my trusty yelp app I found this joint when looking for a hearty breakfast off of the strip where locals go. When driving into the strip mall I noticed the abundance of cars and line outside right away. We didn't have to wait too long, about 20 minutes and the staff was friendly, and the coffee was really good.... I don't know what they put in it, but it was waay better than the average coffee. 

My boyfriend had the pancakes and they were fluffy and flavorful, I was somewhat disappointed in my artichoke frittata...The feta cheese was overpowering and seemed like an afterthought dumped on top and I ended up scraping most of it off. It was a daily special item, so it wasn't on the main menu. I would definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas and try one of the basic menu items such as pancakes or omelets, all of the other dishes being brought out looked great... they had good intentions with the frittata but it was less than desirable....

** The banana muffin everyone writes about lived up to its expectations.

Having breakfast at one of my favorite breakfast places in Las Vegas. Had the banana nut French toast which was fantastic. Service by Amanda was exceptional. She was very pleasant, attentive, and helpful in helping with making choices on food selection.

Popular place about a 30 minute wait for a table for 7. Staff is really nice and the menu is detailed I got Benny country with poached eggs and seasoned potatoes. The gravy is out on top of the sausage eggs and biscuits and it was delicious I was not fond of the seasoned potatoes a little too salty seasoned for me great will looking forward to coming back to try new things.

Get the heck out of the strip and take the 7 miles drive to this EGG & I all American breakfast joint. Open for breakfast and lunch only 6 AM to 3 PM. They located on Sahara and Arville. Plenty of parking spaces. 

When we arrived on Friday around 11 AM there was no wait and were seated immediately. 

SERVICE:

It was prompt, friendly and out waitress was great. Coffee was brought to us right away after we asked for it. One pot of coffee.

THE FOOD:

We tried the the ham and cheese Omelet. Bacon, mushroom, sausage Omelet, Eggs Benedict and side order of corned beef hash. Omelet's come with your choice of bread or muffin. All orders came with their delicious cut potatoes. Food was tasty and flavorful. Omelet's were moist and the Benedict was wonderful with enough tangy  hollandise sauce. The corned beef hash was delicious as well. 


This is really a nice spot for breakfast or lunch and it seems like the locals favorite spot.  Give yourself a break away form the casinos and gambling joints and try this place.

we decided to have a fantastic breakfast/brunch while on vacay in Vegas and we thought we give egg and I a shot.  Oh man, I knew I was in for a special treat because clearly this is popular breakfast spot in vegas with all the wonderful reviews here on yelp and zagat reviews.

we both went with the egg white western omelette's, ham, green peppers, onions and mushrooms. we both were given a complimentary banana nut muffin since it was our first visit..and the husband loved it and i thought it was OK.  the breakfast arrived and everything tasted wonderful and was prepared the way we requested (we asked our omelette's to be cooked with pam spray vs butter-and they were happy to oblige). service was great and fast.  I would definitely return to try some other breakfast items.

Such a well crafted chicken country steak, amazeballz. Ashley was key to the deliciousness, loved everything she served, including splitting my bread order in 2. Got the sour dough and rye. Non nom nom

The Egg and I used to be my favorite breakfast place in town. It is now crowded and thefood taste so manufactured.

What keeps me coming back is breakfast with the girls, the banana nut bread (OMG, it's SOOOOO good), and the ranch potatoes.

During the weekends, the wait is up to 30 minutes. The staff is super friendly, they are great at keeping your coffee cup full. Also, what's cool is that when you have an issue or need something they have an egg on the table, you can flip it to reveal a sad, yellow egg. Someone is usually at your table within 30 seconds. It's like they have sonar for these yellow eggs.

The Egg & I serves breakfast and lunch and they close at like 3 PM.

We had breakfast here by chance (stopped as we drove past) and am glad we did! Huge portions of delicious food, served up by smiling friendly people. The breakfast wrap was HUGE, tasty and oh so filling - I couldnt come close to finishing it, and was barely hungry for a late lunch. My husband loved the little crunchy home fries (think small, seasoned steak fries cut into cute little squares) as well as his omelet.

The Egg & I is on the short list of places to eat breakfast in Vegas.

For those who are super hungry and craving for eggs, this would be a good place.

This restaurant is packed even on a Monday morning. It sells every breakfast dish that has to do with eggs. We ordered Grandma's Biscuits & Gravy and Stuffed French Toast. Both tasted good and homemade.  Service was excellent (thanks Jessica!), portions are humongous, and price was reasonable.

Will definitely return if in the area again.

The Egg & I is an outstanding local diner with great service and great food.   It's the perfect hangover cure and refreshing escape from the strip.   We usually visit this place when en-route to Utah for road trips.  Definitely check it out.

Oh don't get me started on the fresh baked muffins they are amazing! And the food comes out faster then you can say "sunny side up!" I was getting bored of the same old breakfast joints like Denny's or iHop, they're just not the same! I took a risk with Egg&i and it's a risk I'll take again and again! They're menu has literally everything! From eggs to burritos, skillets to forgein! You name it! Trust me you won't regret spending your hard earned money here. I've never wanted an establishment to take my money so bad.

Used to be my favorite place, now i'll never return :(. The service was fine but there was a hair in my skillet and I got food poisining as well. So disappointed as I used to love this spot but I have no tolerance for a dirty restaurant.

This restaurant was a great find! The omelette were delicious an buttery and the Diablo potatoes were amazing!!! Be prepared to wait in line but it is WELL WORTH IT!!! Oh and you must order the banana nut muffin, wonderful!!! I'm glad we found this spot! I'm sure we'll be back when we visit Vegas again!
Good breakfast food, great service. Highly recommend.

It was worth the over 30 minute wait....great breakfast.
It was nice to get away from the strip :)
Great food and service! I got the classic. Warning: orange juice is $3.25 and you only get one small glass of it.

Such a great find! When we arrived, we knew it was a popular spot because there were people waiting outside to be seated. They got us in quickly and we were seated in under 15 minutes. The staff are all super friendly! Our server Raul took great care of us. The food did not disappoint either. I had a delicious breakfast burrito with carnitas and tomatillo salsa. We will be back for sure!

I was here on Sunday 2/12/12. OMG let me say I'm so glad I got the blackened prime rib benedict. Rich, oh yeah, but I've never seen an offering like this on any type of breakfast menu. Who cares about the seating being a little bit tight (there was plenty of seating outdoors BTW) when the food is so good. It's a vacation after all :)    large portions, so worth the $. Wish I had at least tasted my niece Amaya's muffin, as I also heard other customer's rave's as I was exiting. Definite return next trip!

Amanda was amazing and greatet us with a huge smile. She gave us vegetarian tips and we actually had our best breakfast of our entire vacation! 

Highly recommend. The potatoes was amazing! 5 stars for sure!

Best Breakfast in town.
Had their Chicken Fried Steak Skillet, was to die for! Their awesome potatoes on the bottom, next cut up chicken fried steak, then smothered in the most flavorful country gravy I have ever eaten, then topped off with your choice of eggs and a side of toast or banana muffin. I went with the Banana muffin, which was absolutely delicious.

I ended up revisiting for the country fried steak skillet before I left Vegas to go home.  

I give 2 thumbs up all the way and would recommend this to any and everybody.

We decided to try something other than IHOP - and, we're really glad we did! Food was fantastic - and, the service made it a perfect breakfast! AMANDA was very pleasant, attentive & we loved her suggestions.....We'll definitely be back!

It's all about the banana nut muffin. It's five stars all on its own. One comes with the meal, but you get another for checking in. Sadly, I forgot my phone in the hotel room so I wasn't able to get mine, but my friend got his to go, and we ate it in the room later on. Yummmmm.

He got the chicken fried steak, which was good, and I got some chicken, mushroom, avocado omelet with added spinach. I loved all the avocado in it, but there was something lacking in flavor. Also, there was way too much cheese. I love cheese, so for me to say that, it's a big thing. Also, I wasn't a fan of the salty seasoning on the potatoes. I wish there was less of it, or none of all.

Don't wait for your server to collect your payment. You have to do that at the front counter.

First time at this location went here because of all of the good reviews... Was pleased that they offer  a free banana muffin with checking into Yelp. Ordered the half stuffed French toast with turkey bacon and seasoned potatoes and that is really enough for 2 people. Would definitely come back if around this area.

Absolutely love Egg and I been coming here as long as I can remember!!! The staff is amazing as well as the quality of food and the menu is quite selective!!! Their motto is eggsactly  what you want and they mean that!!! We eat here at least four or five times a week and it is always a homerun!!! Best breakfast and lunch in Las Vegas as well as a very well ran business!!! Brad is one half of a business owner and as you can see there is never turnover in any of his four locations soon-to-be five!!! In this town you are as good as your last meal!!!

It was Easter Brunch with a car full of 4 girls starving and ready to eat....after visiting Hash House A Go-Go down the street and being told the wait was about 45 min- 1 hour we used yelp to find another breakfast spot was we drove on over to Egg & I. 

The wait wasn't as long as Hash House...it was only about 15 minute for an outside table. The menu is huge and appealing that none of us could make up our minds on what to order. Eventually we did, 2 friends got the eggs Benedict and pancakes, another got the steak and eggs with rice and I got the spinach and avocado omelet with fruits and I shared the strawberry creme french toast with a friend. The ambiance is like any ordinary breakfast joint with that "home" and "granny's house" feeling. 

Everyone loved their foods, but it was so much that they couldn't finish it except for my friend who got the steak and eggs. I for one cold not even eat half of my food, regardless of how delicious it is....and I can eat a whole lot. I loved that my omelet was full of fresh huge slices of avocado and spinach inside my omelet. The fruits were fairly fresh and sweet. My whole plate cost me about $118 with tip so not bad considering I had a yummy Easter omelet, fruits and a huge delicious stack of french toast. Sadly, none of us took our food to go because we were on the road doing errands that day. 

Next time I hit up Vegas, I'll be sure to come here for breakfast!

Came here with friends for brunch. The restaurant  has a very cute newspaper style menu, a kids menu that children can draw on, and a dog friendly patio.

Their egg brunch options are PLENTY! I ordered a stuffed french toast and it was heaven! The portion was huge and served with warm syrup. Yummy stuffed eggs, ham and cheese. I substituted potatoes with cooked spinach yay^^ My friends all loved their habla Diablo potatoes too.

We also checked in with Yelp and got a free banana nut muffin. The sweetness was just right and it was served hot!

Perfect brunch choice in Vegas!

A favorite of skeptical locals who have seen their share of bargain and selection!

I'm not usually into American breakfasts - typically pricey (for the cheap ingredients and unskilled cookery) and consisting of bland big portions. 

The Egg & I made me eat my words, plus some kickass Huevos Rancheros and coffee. My co-eater had the Country Benny - Buttermilk biscuits grilled and topped with sausage, two eggs any style, doused with "homemade sausage gravy" boasts to be a "heart stopper". 

Not close to the Strip, but then, no good cheap eats is.

Love this spot for a nice Sunday Brunch!

...And I am obviously not the only one in town who feels the same way.

Its always nice to know that a place you love so much is appreciated by others, and thats the feeling you get as you pull into the Egg and I on Sahara. Immediately you will notice a group of people waiting patiently outside of the restaurant for the next available seat. When I go, being a smoker, I usually go out on the patio to enjoy the fresh air and a smoke with my coffee and book. The staff is so welcoming. I am a frequent visitor so they know where I would like to sit, escort me to a table of my choosing, provide an ashtray, and offer the heating lamp if it is cold outside. Always friendly, you are not just communicated with by your server, but others in the staff that notice your presence. Nobody walks around with blinders on. You feel as if they are there to enjoy your breakfast with you. 

Speaking of the breakfast; it is the best in town! The wait is never long, and the food is always fresh and hot. Makes one wonder what kind of army is stacked away in the kitchen. Spinning out plate after plate of unique dishes that dont only taste great, but are piled high on your plate, makes me want to walk into the kitchen and give its staff a huge hug. There is something on the menu for everyone's taste, and, unlike many chain breakfast places who will remain unnamed, you actually get fresh ingredients, and flavor without frou frou toppings of berries and whip cream to try and doll it up. I find myself looking at others plates and wondering what they are having with delicious anticipation of trying it the next time. My signature dish is Brads Special, and I almost never stray from a favorite, but the fact that I feel safe to do so at The Egg and I says a lot.

A pleasant "hello how are you" greets you at the door, and a friendly "Thank you, have a nice day" assures a future visit. If The Egg and I added a few floors atop its building, and offered rooms like a Bed and Breakfast, you better believe there would never be an available occupancy.

This place is definitely amazing this is one of our favorite breakfast spot so we always come here if you come here I would definitely suggest getting the banana nut muffins because they're delicious also the key Largo crêpe is really good as well

Linnea our sexy server was cute and friendly with a sassy voice.  A jug of coffee with refills provided.  Such a large variety of items for breakfast. Banana nut muffin was warm and yummy. Something new was a mashed potato omelet with jack cheese, green onions, sour cream.  So good.  The potatoes were nothing special.   Overall a good choice for breakfast off the strip.

This is a great breakfast option off the strip. Took my family here for breakfast recently and had enjoyable experience. 

It's about a 10 minute drive from main casinos, located in strip mall. Popular dining spot for locals and gets packed on weekends. Luckily, we arrived early before the breakfast rush and were seated immediately. Good thing too, 20 minutes after a bus load of people arrived and place was full.

Country style atmosphere and décor provide the perfect backdrop for their food. Both indoor and outdoor patio seating is available. Old-fashioned breakfasts are the specialty here, including huge omelet platters, pancakes, eggs benedict and a large selection of house specialties. Prices are reasonable and large portions. I highly recommend trying their famous banana nut muffin. OMG, so good! Super moist and the flavor profile is off the charts. I got mine free with my Yelp check-in. You can also substitute the toast that comes with your breakfast entrées for a muffin. 

We ordered "The Works" scramble, Fresh Veggie omelet and the Hawaiian breakfast spam and eggs. Everything was fantastic! Served in large skillet, the scramble was yummy. It's loaded with sausage, ham, bacon, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers and mushrooms, served with hash browns and topped with the fluffiest scramble eggs. Enough for 2, I literally devoured everything and no regrets. I loved the taste and texture of the hash browns, lightly crisp and tender. I usually prefer shredded kind, but this was equally nice. Of course, who doesn't love spam and eggs for breakfast? Simple Hawaiian-Pinoy breakfast done well here, served with steam rice. Just the way us locals love them.

Most of the time we usually dine along the strip because it's convenient. Egg and I was definitely worth the drive and waking up early for. Service was excellent too. Our server did a phenomenal job, friendly and refilled our coffee regularly. Still thinking about those banana nut muffin. Looking forward to coming back.

Eggcellent food, had the breakfast tostada and it was fantastic! DH had a skillet with corned beef hash. He liked it very much. Most of all the service was top notch! Raul was great! Friendly, funny and personable. This is a busy place, we are out of towners and this place treats you like family. Must visit while in town. Will return.

Don't let the outside appearance fool you! This place is the bomb! We went and check-in via Yelp and got a free banana nut muffin and it was delicious! It was warm and moist. Not to mention you get one with your meal that you order!! We tried The Works Omelette & The Crazy Chicken Omelette. You get tons of hashbrowns with your meal....it was so much I had to get a to go plate. Service was alright, nothing extravagant but the food is delicious and their menu is huge! I would definitely recommend it.

Great service
Banana nut muffin (really really good)
Chile relleno omelette (a little on the salty side)
Chicken fried steak skillet (good but not as good as Ellis Island chicken fried steak)
Strawberry cream cheese french toast (too sweet, bread was very moist though)

not a fan of their seasoned potatoes

Our party of 6 only waited about 5-10 minutes before being seated at around 11am.  Service is quick and friendly.  Between Hash House and Egg & I, I'm leaning more towards Egg & I now because the service was more friendly and accommodating while the wait was significantly shorter.  Of course in Vegas you'd think there'd be something special about the eggs... like a dinosaur-size egg over easy... but in the end the eggs are pretty standard eggs... nuttin' too special.  If you mess up eggs, you've got no business serving food.  My 5 stars are for the hash!  Something about that homemade beef hash makes it stand out over all others.
We wanted good breakfast and we found it here. Really good food. Big portions . Friendly service. When in Vegas .......go ......you will enjoy it :)

Super tasty breakfast spot just off the strip. Their menu is like a newspaper and is a couple pages long so there is something for everyone! Our server, Karla was very friendly and the service is fast!

Best breakfast place in Vegas, hands down!! The food was outstanding and service was extraordinary. Our server (brody I believe) was amazing. He went out of his way to make our  experience one of a kind. Definitely would go back just cause the service!

Great! Cream cheese French toast is delicious (maybe even too sweet!!!) the bandito scramble was spicy with a great salsa. Probably can't go wrong here.

Our server Karla was fantastic!

Food was delicious!! Portions were huge, could have easily shared one plate! I had the stuffed French toast which is basically an omelette between two large pieces of French toast, yummy. The potatoes were crunchy, the only way to have breakfast potatoes.
The banana but muffin was heaven on a plate, a must try for sure.
Amanda was our server and she was not only efficient but friendly and made our visit perfect! We will be back and hope she is there when we are.
Love this place! Oscar was our waiter and he was very friendly and attentive. Love the service and especially their banana nut muffins! I always order extra to go!
Excellent breakfast, excellent service. Veronica was amazing! We come here all the time and are never disappointed.
The Strawberry Cream Cheese French Toast was SUPER delicious! Also, their breakfast potatoes are really good because of the seasoning. I recommend those two items.

The best restaurant meal I have ever eaten was at The Egg and I in Las Vegas

I thought about this long and hard to make sure I am not exaggerating. The best meal I have ever eaten was the breakfast I ate on my trip to Las Vegas t at The Egg and I on West Sahara. This is a locals eatery.

I ate the standard, eggs, sausage, bacon, toast, and hash browns. On the menu it is called "Eggs - Plus". I added the sausage à la carte. As I was eating, the taste of the meal brought a smile to my face.


 The eggs were very good. Not greasy or salty. Very tasty.

 The bacon was the best I ever had. Not too salty, not soggy, and not overcooked.

 The turkey sausage was the best I ever had. Not greasy or salty. Tasty.

 The hash browns were the best I have ever had. These were the square pieces of potato type of hash browns. Usually this type of hash browns is greasy, heavy, and dense. These were light, airy, and had some type of paprika seasoning.

 The toast was the best I ever had. Light and fluffy whole wheat bread. Not dense.

 The oj was great as well.

It is located about 10-15 minutes from South Las Vegas Boulevard. Well worth the trip!

Yummers!!!

I loved this restaurant.  We only had to wait 15 minutes on a Sunday morning and were kindly seated.  The restaurant is a good size and was cutely decorated.  It's a really good family and brunch place.  

I ordered an omelette and enjoyed it a lot.  The portions are generous here.  The best part of this place is the service.  Our server (older Hispanic lady) was very funny and recommended different things for us.  I was being picky and she let me.  Thanks, ma'am!  The roasted potatoes here are really good.  I like hashed browns a lot and never really like home potatoes, but for once the potatoes trumped the hashed browns.  They were crispy and lightly seasoned.

I tried the chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes and the tasted absolutely AMAZING!  I couldn't stop eating them even though I was full.  I also had a bite of someone's French toast sandwich, and oh my gosh, did that taste like heaven in my mouth!!!!!  If you're ok with a heart attack on a plate, this is it.  It was a huge portion of eggs, bacon, ham, and sausage goodness.  This was probably the tastiest thing on the menu, and I had only a bite.  Definitely something you can share if you're not too hungry.  Great service and good value for the dollar!

Egg & I, I will be back!

Wonderful breakfast! Unique offerings! I can't believe I would say this...but the best sour dough toast I've ever had! Excellent fresh fruit too. But you gotta have the eggs! Waitress Alexa did a great job explaining her faves. We will go back tomorrow.
Tried this place this morning after reading glowing reviews.  I found the food nothing to rave about.  It falls far short of the food at any of the Cracked Egg locations.
Paula is a great server- very considerate and helpful. Banana nut muffin is good. Skillet of bacon ham and sausage is filling and satisfying. Good place for brunch!
Yum Yum! Great breakfast, great service, homey and friendly. This will be our choice from now on when in Las Vegas.

I was a little skeptical when I walked into this place at first but once I saw the menu I realized this as a lovely surprise at Vegas. The place was bustling with people and the food was excellent. The coffee was great. A great b'fast place to go at Vegas.

This is the type of breakfast i love. Delicious simple foods. I got the egg scramble and it was huge for the price. The taste was great as well. I did make one small mistake and i guess i should have ordered the banana bread but grabbed fruit instead. 

Overall this hot everything i love about diners, great food, good price, and good dark coffee. Also our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful. Will visit again in the future.

We drove up and saw a horde of people waiting to be seated.. Thats how you know foods on point! When i checked in at the front desk, i realized no one was sitting outside(it was like 50 degrees maybe thats why lol) so i told them we dont mind! Even though it was effin cold! Coffee warmed you up anyways so its okay, we ordered 2 country fried steak plates and some blue berry pancakes, the steak plates were delicious i was so full i skipped lunch and had dinner at night lol! The pancakes were good very filling!! Overall this place is good, and the best part was when your ready to pay just go up to the front desk! Last but not least those banana muffins are the best!!!!!! Make sure to try them with a yelp checkin its free!!
I love it here! The food is always amazing and the banana nut muffins are bomb! I also had such great service this time from Chance, a waitress there.

We found this hidden gem before leaving Vegas. Saw it had a lot of stars so we thought we'd check it out. Our waitress Amanda was super nice. Be sure to check it out when ur Vegas. Definitely better than the generic places inside the hotels.

After waiting for 35 minutes waitress comes and tells us she forgot to put in our order. Used to love this place but the past two times I've eaten here you can tell that they don't care about customer service anymore. Go to egg works or jamms because The Egg & I has went downhill. What give no stars. but that is not an option. Really miss the good ol Days when people actually cared about getting the customers served. And she started off by saying she was going to take a couple of dollars off the bill for making us wait for 35 minutes. I have no problem waiting for good food. I have no problem waiting in a long line. But when your customer has placed an order and you just completely checked out from putting in the order there is something wrong and you really need to look at what you're doing.

First impression: very loud and raucous. I'm not really sure what all the fuss is about. The food was pretty standard diner fare. Nothing remarkable at all.   Had a BLT with their home fries. It was average. 

To read some of the review here you'd think this place was heaven on earth. I'm here to say that the food was just okay. When you calculate in the above average prices then this isn't a very good value in my opinion. 

The service, on the other hand, was very good. Staff was great.
Excellent service by far! BRADY was very attentive and helpful wish more people in the food and beverage industry was like him. Hope he wins the trip to Disneyland
Reina have us perfect service! Prompt courteous. Great selection and quality of food. Endless coffee. Muffin was soft and flavorful. Nice to sit outside and people watch.
Great breakfast! Had the chili omelette and our server Ulisis was very polite and professional! Send him to Disney, part of an in house promotion for them!

Great breakfast spot when you're in Vegas! Off strip so you avoid strip traffic. Eggs everything!!! Plus lunch if you're not into eggs (weirdo). Their omelettes are perfectly done with great flavors, fresh veggies and tons of cheese. Eggs Benedicts were perfectly done. Portion sizes were spot on for an Merican. Works potatoes are freaking delicious! They taste like seasoned French fries. I love all things potatoes- If this place was called potatoes and I, I would probably give it 10 stars based on potential alone. Service is great- quick, efficient, and friendly. 

Must try's: works potatoes, banana nut muffin, eggs of all kinds.

Yummilicious factor- A

This breakfast joint is a must have for anyone visiting Vegas. When I go on trips that involve Vegas, I've started planning the itinerary to let me go to Eggs & I for breakfast. It is a slight trek from the strip, but totally worth it.

For my most recent visit I got the Ensenada Burrito and my wife got the Banana Bread French Toast. The Ensenada Burrito was a recommendation from my server Amanda and I'm so glad I listened to her. The burrito was delicious. Tasty meat and eggs in the burrito and topped with a healthy amount of cheese. Plus, it came with a side of their potatoes (what they call habla diablo seasoned potatoes) which are some of my favorite breakfast potatoes. So good. My wife's french toast was sweet and delicious. The service was top notch. Amanda (our server) was cheerful and seemed genuinely excited to help us figure out what to eat.

Oh, and they have this black/yellow egg heads on each table to notify the staff if you need help (Black smiley face = you're ok, Yellow frowny face = need assistant). The staff watches this like hawks. Each time we flipped it, a staff member (not just your server) is right there to help. We were in a rush and needed the check... flipped it... 5 seconds later a staff member was there... 30 seconds later our server gave us our check. It was awesome.

Overall, I can't say enough about this place. It is one of the best breakfast places in Vegas (if not THE best). The wait is quick, the service is great, and the food is top notch.

AMBIANCE: 4 - It was okay inside, kind of a cross between homey restaurant, diner and cafeteria. It was bright inside, lots of families, and it felt nice in there..like when you went out for breakfast in the 90s on a bright Sunday morning.

SERVICE: 4 - I thought that the service was good. The servers are always smiling and genuinely kind. They are constantly concerned about your food and if everything is tasting good. 

FOOD: 3 - My disclaimer: I really only came here to eat eggs. I did not want any meat other than bacon. I strictly came here for really, really plain ol' breakfast food, and not anything else.

I got a really boring item called "The Classic", but I really wanted just eggs and bacon, so that's what I went with. My over easy eggs were cooked perfectly. I mean, they were absolutely perfect. Some cooks leave the yolk barely runny on the inside, but they are experts at eggs here..and I have no complaints. 

The banana nut muffin was soft and moist, but I just didn't like the taste of it. I think I'm just picky, but the banana in the muffin tasted a little ripe. The potatoes were good, but they weren't great. The bacon was a little overcooked and a little too hard for me. 

I totally forgot to check Yelp before ordering, but next time, I'll order a healthy omelet and see how that goes!!

Monday morning breakfast of steak and eggs.
Options included egg preparation, toast type, meat temperature, and potatoes.
I ordered over easy, sourdough, medium rare and potatoes diablo.  Of course I had to have coffee as well.
Coffee and water arrived first.  The coffee was in a hot pot with at least a quart of delicious coffee.  Water was reverse osmosis and highly drinkable.
My steak was cooked to order, but cold.  The waitress rescued me and soon a nice hot steak and eggs order was in front of me.
I enjoyed it for the duration of everything on the plate except I could not finish the potatoes!
Assorted jellies included a rarity: mixed fruit.  Nice!
Good Breakfast stop!
Stacie did a great job serving us. Delicious potatoes!!! We'll be back on our next trip to LV
Carole Ann did a great job!! Love me the eggs Benedict.. She served me with a smile and attention. What a perfect way to start my Monday!

While the food is good this place has the worst service.  We walked in to the 2 hostesses who seemed annoyed we came and then waited until after they finally finished their conversation to seat us.  Needless to say they had no other customers besides us.  The server came over and when I asked if I could get the Works Scramble as a Works Skillet he rolled his eyes and said they already had one and it was the same.  However, it is not the same.  It has 2-3 of the same ingredients and all the rest were completely different.  After we got our check and went to the front there were 3 ladies up there, who again, completely ignored us until their conversations were over.  THE WORST SERVICE.

I don't know why I waited so long to leave a review because this is one of my favorite breakfast places that always aims to please! Victoria will make sure that if your coffee is not strong enough, she'll get you a part that is! I love this place.... vanilla creamer and all :)

The service is good as is the food.  This place is a solid 4 in the breakfast world of LV.  I wish the coffee was a little higher quality and would prefer to have an option of regular hash brows over the seasoned potatoes.

Just moved to Vegas and heard great things about this place. Went for the first time and they offered a delicious banana nut muffin, complimentary, since it was our first time! It was great. 
Our food, however, was not. The server said our potatoes were fresh, but they didn't taste nor look fresh. They put wayyyy too much cheese on everything and it completely covered up the taste of everything else. So we decided to give it another try.
Came back on a Saturday morning, had the banana nut muffin that tasted stale, again, way too much cheese and our food took forever! I don't know why I thought this place would use fresher ingredients... Definitely disappointing.

Great place to have some breakfast!

Banana nut muffins are delicious and service is prompt, courteous and friendly.

We had Oscar as our waiter and he was great to provide recommendations and was super friendly!

A must stop on our next trip back!
Everything's awesome. I had Mexican omelette. Potato works and fries are spicy. Dont't forget to try their delicious Banana muffin rocks...

Been coming to Egg & I for over 10 years and the food and service is always excellent. 

Today, there was an issue with the bill where the server accidentally gave our check to another table. We had to wait a while to get it handled with the manager but it was no big deal - we were in no hurry. The manager ended up comping our meal and all we paid was tip. Wow, thanks so much Egg & I. We will always be back!!

Really great place for breakfast/brunch. 

The banana nut muffin is the moistest I have ever had in my life.

I've also tried the corned beef hash here, the loco moco, the chicken fried steak, and all were delicious.

The coffee comes with unlimited refills and is pretty strong. You will get the tremors after a couple cups.

Good food, good service!  We had the banana bread French toast, fruit plate, corned beef hash and steak and eggs.  We were all stuffed and satisfied with our yummy meals!  Oscar provided great service, too!

First time here and what have we been waiting for!?! We were seated quickly and our server Alexa was great. Very helpful with the menu and she even made a point to get the kids' food out first. (Big plus for parents with kids that get bored quickly) the food was great. The classic Eggs Benny was amazing (best Canadian bacon I have had in as long as I can remember). We'll be back... Soon!

Great food and great service. Portions were large but too good not to eat! Breakfast menu is expansive, hard to choose. Traditional eggs Benedict was awesome, and the chili relleno omelet was spicy, they didn't skimp on the cilantro or the potatoes! Our server Chance was very attentive and efficient!
Food was crazy good and service was exceptional. Our server Amanda was extremely helpful. Her smile seriously made everyone's day.

Very good spot for breakfast food in Las Vegas!

I ordered the Brad's Scramble:
Brad's scramble is diced tomatoes, fresh spinach, sliced mushrooms, and cheddar and jack cheese.

I skip the cheese... I know, I'm weird, but I like the eggs mixed with veggies.  It's not overwhelming.  Also, the banana nut muffin is delicious!  Choose this over toast, 100% of the time.

Most plates come with their diablo potatoes, which I really like as well, they taste like seasoned french fries.  Yum!

AMAZING. Words can't express how much we loved Egg and I. We had a 30 minute wait for Sunday brunch, but it was well worth it. The food was all absolutely delicious, and Alexa made us feel like we were the only table that mattered despite having a completely full restaurant and extensive line. She even went out of her way to offer substitutions to accommodate my dietary restrictions. Even the coffee was exceptional. Definitely stop in for breakfast -- you won't regret it!

O-M-G!! Get yourself the banana nut muffin here! It was so freakin good, I ordered a banana nut bread to go! Yes, they sell a loaf, if you want to take it home and savor it. The banana nut muffin comes with some of the meals, but if it doesn't order it. It comes to you very warm and moist and it was one of the best things I ever ate! I swear you not. 

Anyways, enough of the muff fin because the food was good and service excellent. I ordered the stuffed french toast which included scramble eggs & ham stuffed between 2 thick toast. Man of man, it was alot of food cuz I think they used 4 eggs and then u top it off with syrup. They also had the alot of ranch potatoes that came with it. YUMMY! 

My friend ordered the chicken fried steak skillet. I tasted some of it and it was delicious. The gravy that came with it was just really tasty. I was hearty and I would order it next time...=) 

The service was great with a egg-sign on the table if you wanted a server to come by if you needed anything. You flip it and any of the server who sees it will come to you. NICE! 

This was a great place for brunch and I will be back for the banana nut muffin alone!  A much better brunch place that Hash a go go.

Great food! Big portions! Good value. My wife and kids all had something different and it was generous and good. Lilliana was excellent! Super sweet, prompt and took care of us well. Glad I finally found a Vegas breakfast place that is local and great!

The cashier/hostess Caresia must've been having a bad day. She was not friendly or personable at all. The food wasn't good. I ordered the strawberry cream cheese french toast. There was so much cream cheese, whip cream and artificial strawberry sauce that you couldn't enjoy the French toast at all. It was soggy. No need for syrup at all because it was so sweet. Definitely won't be going back to this place. The only thing good was the hospitality by the waitresses that's why I give it 2 stars.
This place is amazing. Loved the food.  The banana nut muffin is a must try. Carole Ann was awesome. We had 13 people in our group and the service was still amazing.
My breakfast was disappointing. I disliked their potatoes. The bacon was hard, and old. The whole thing was a little over priced.

My favorite place for breakfast in Sin City. Our server Amanda is great! Very attentive to all our needs. According to the receipt, mentioning her name here increases her chances to win a trip and we hope this helps her out; she was that good. Will definitely be back as Egg and I will continue to be a Vegas tradition for us.

Egg and I is currently the best spot for breakfast so far. It's usually very crowded but there is an obvious reason why: it's good. Everything from the service to the food, is outstanding. Our server was extremely humorous and friendly and provided a few laughs here and there. The coffee was good, nothing to be complained about. The atmosphere had a medium to loud ambiance level but it is tolerable, in a sense. The food was great! I had the French Toast sandwich, which is exactly as it sounds. French Toast with egg, sausage, bacon and  cheese inside with a side of syrup. Amazing flavor and everything is well done. Their potato's are fantastic as well.

Perfect breakfast place! Our server Oscar was awesome! I had the bacon and avocado omelette and my fiancé had the bacon ham and sausage skillet, so delish! Definitely check this place out of you're looking for a hearty breakfast after a fun night out in Vegas!

I always eat here when I am in Vegas. The food is always fresh and they have a huge menu. If you can't find something on the menu you like, you really have something wrong with you.  I've never had a bad breakfast however I have had a few service snafus but they were easily corrected.  Not far from the strip and well worth the effort.

Would have been a perfect but the air was blowing right on us, we turned the fan off, so it worked.
Between the three of us we have two with food issues, and one cranky woman. Liza checked the kitchen for Soy free foods, and read the ingredients to double check. Really great service. Never an empty cup of coffee, food hot, all cooked great.
 The Prime Rib Benny was a tad salty but I expected that from the Prime Rib. It's delicious. The Original Benny was great, too. My daughters Fruit Plate with yogurt was fresh and a much different variety than the usual fare at other places.
  I think we'll add this to empty breakfast place slot that was opened Baby Stacks told us to freeze so the servers would be comfortable later in the day.  :/
 Parking lot large enough, bathrooms clean, and tables stocked and condiments full.
:D

This is the place you want to go if you really want an awesome breakfast! And I mean AWESOME! I came here with some friends on a busy Friday morning, the place was packed. Luckily, there was outside seating in their patio where we can be seated. The menu itself was very extensive from the benny's, omelets, crepes, pancakes, waffles, etc. I honestly felt getting my monies' worth from the Works Omelette that it filled me up. If you haven't been here while you're in Vegas, you're definitely missing out! It's a place known for it's breakfast and just open during breakfast and lunch hours.
This is my second time eating here. Both experiences where exceptionally pleasant. Shout out to our server Lindsey. You were great.
Everything is great here. Food is great. Server is really nice. I ordered bacon and onion skillet. My friend order omelette and classic. We really enjoyed our brunch here.
Good food and good service. Erin was very attentive to us. Will be back the next time we are in town.
I'm ready for brunch now. :) The banana nut muffin was amazing though. Especially with butter. mmm...

Gets packed around 10. You can call ahead to get your name on the list, but they will only  honor it for 30 minutes in advance. The banana nut muffin is delicious with coffee. The potatoes were also delicious because of the seasoning they used. Service was friendly and fast. I recommend their original breakfast burrito.

This is one of our family's favorite restaurant's. Not just because the food is great and the prices are fair, but because we have the most amazing waitress on the planet, Karla. We are even willing to wait longer, in order to be in Karla's section. She is always friendly and is a great waitress in that our order is never wrong, our drinks are always full to the brim and she eve has time for a little chit chat with us to catch up! Egg and I is definitely one of our favorite breakfast places to dine at, but what makes our breakfast the best is having Karla (who is truly unique) wait on us! She literally has become just like a member of our family! Make sure next time you are there that you ask for her, she was also awarded by the mayor of Las Vegas, NV for her skills!
Breakfast this morning was very good both in size and cost. We were immediately seated and our waiter, Ulitis, was very good. We will come again.

If you are ever in Vegas, you gotta try this restaurant out! They are only open for breakfast & lunch. Excellent value, fast & friendly service with
a big smile! I wanted to try everthing but couldn't this trip. Even if you can"t eat eggs there are alot of options. Can't wait to go back! 
Thank you Rachel Ray for the recommendation!

Amazing! Great food at great prices. I definitely recommend coming here if you're hungry and tired of the ridiculous food prices found on the strip. I discovered this gem on my last Vegas trip and I definitely made sure to come again & write a yelp review. Kelcey was our waitress and she was awesome! Definitely recommend if you're wanting a lot of food for $10-$14 bucks

I had the steak breakfast and it was delicious. Potatoes were amazing alone but on another level good with the Habla Diablo Verde salsa. even ordered the banana nut muffin which was equally awesome. I definitely recommend this place when your in Vegas.

Always a refreshing relaxing event to dine here. The most valuable part is having the great fortune of being served by Server TABATHA! So positive, spreading joy with her fantastic smile and direction!

We seem to have arrived at exactly the right time, about 9:15, and immediately got a table.  Afterwards every time I looked up the on-deck bench was full.  Our order was taken promptly but there was a bit of a delay before it came.  I had the Works Skillet and my wife had a California Crepe.  We thought both of them were delicious, and there was plenty to eat.  So much that about half of our order came home in a box.  It was open seating and a bit noisy so don't expect much privacy, although that wasn't a big issue with us.  The staff was courteous, and prompt with the extras we asked for.  The cashier was, to use and old phrase, "bubbly" while checking out a line of people, a trait that we found refreshing for such a busy place.  We were very satisfied and agree that they lived up to the positive reviews that we used to chose them.
Had a great breakfast. I always come for the prime rib Benny. Tabatha was our server. She was super friendly and gave egg-cellent (get it) service.

First of all, thanks for the reviews on the stuffed French toast guys, best breakfast decision ever. The biscuits and gravy are delicious also. Secondly, my server, Amanda, was seriously so sweet! She checked on me and made sure I had everything I needed. She had a full section and she was so nice to every single guest. I will absolutely come back again, and again. Thanks for the awesome service, and kick ass breakfast guys!

We came to visit family for the holiday and able to find this "groovy" diner. 

First tip when dining here is 
Bring a dolly to roll you out of here when your done with their delicious food. 

Count on waiting for about 30 to 40 min but believe me its so worth the wait.

We had the privilege of having Veronica as our superstar waitress and her team of bussers who couldnt be more helpful and nicer. 

I had the traditional benny that was cooked to an ooey gooey of egg perfection 
Our girls had the mouse pancake that were super cute and fluffy 
Hubby had a french toaat sandwich 
He did wish he had asked for sunny side up but was still 
Satisfying and huge might i add. 
My son had a club style burger which was a monster serving 
I would say he was happy because there was not a piece left behind. 

When visiting Vegas this will definitely be our go to breakfast spot.

And before i forget order the banana muffin with some coffee. Thats a must!!

Thank you Egg and I team for welcoming our family into your restaurant.

I tried the Banana bread french toast because I like banana bread but it didn't do it for me. The bread tasted good all by itself but the french toast didn't make it. Wish I had ordered breakfast burrito my friend had ,now that was good. Took a small bite. I will give four stars because all my friend's food was very good. Yes  I sampled lil bit. service was good and the place was clean. good to go I will be back.

great breakfast! portions are a bit more than the average breakfast spot. the hashbrowns are the highlight in their food selection! perfectly cooked and seasoned just right! above everything else the service was superb. very homey feeling as soon as you walk in the door. not sure if it's family owned but sure feels that way. waitress was very attentive and made sure to check on us but also did not over do it and bug us. overall great spot. will definitely return on our next trip to vegas!

Delicious. Loved the staff and the decorations. Four egg omelette! We did not even eat lunch. The chile rellino omelette tastes exactly like an enchilada. The mash potato omelette is very filling and my sister who loved mashed potatoes absolutely love it! I ordered the feta, mushroom, and tomato omelette which was good as well! Warm banana nut muffin delicious and you can get a free one! The side signature potatoes are delicious I loved the seasoning and not greasy! Would recommend this restaurant to anyone and the 15 minute drive from the strip is well worth it! Best food for your money value.

Great experience with my family for a breakfast before a long trip to grandcanyon, prime rib Benny was the best, other food was great as well.
