Had a great experience venturing off-Strip for weekend brunch! This place was super popular on Yelp and won so many local awards, we were forced to check it out. Arrived early afternoon, there was pretty much no wait, even though there were some customers lingering near the entrance inside and the place was still full! Service was extremely down-to-earth, friendly, and attentive!

This place has a huge menu (in the form of a "newspaper"...if that gives you some idea). There were so many choices it was really hard to decide on just one =( The variety is vast, but the bulk of the items were simple, straightforward, typical breakfast dishes with unique modifications/twists or add-ons. My husband's chile relleno omelet was such a great idea for an omelet...the juicy chile and the cheese tasted amazing wrapped in egg! My benedict's garden (vegetarian version of egg's benedict) was superb as well. Even though one of the items listed in my dish was guacamole, I was SO pleasantly surprised when it arrived NOT as guacamole, but pretty much a whole avocado sliced up!!! You don't get that often, even in California! +10 points for that! The whole combination of poached eggs, hollandaise sauce, and avocado was such a delicious creamy mix, and perfectly-balanced by the crisp freshness of the tomatoes. I basically devoured it in under 5 minutes...and then had to wait for the husband to finish his plate *rolls eyes.* We both agreed that their seasoned potatoes were freaking AMAZING. We don't know what kind of seasoning they use, but it reminded us of Cajun and it was to die for. I wish they sold it by the bottle!
 
Wonderful place, with reasonable prices (total with tax came out to be $27) and a great cup of coffee as well. The awesome staff makes it even better!

I went here based on the yelp reviews.  Lots of locals mixed with tourists.  Seated right away and even on a Monday morning was jammed packed with people. I had the Cheese, Spinach & Egg omelet. Even though it is not on the menu, you can design your own omelette.  so I designed one just for me, I asked for fruit rather than potatoes no extra charge to change the sides the fruit was amazing -big pieces of  pineapple, orange, grapefruit, watermelon, canteloupe and honeydew.  Everything was yummy including the home made Banana Nut Muffins and we took a few to go.  Good place for breakfast, nice menu selection and Carole Ann was a great waitress.  The total cost including two breakfasts, 3 muffins to go, 2 hot teas, = $31.00 with tax & tip.  Very good breakfast & service.

Bacon and avocado!!
This place is fantastic.

WARNING: It is usually busy. While the staff does a great job of managing their tables and seating, expect to wait. It is just that popular.

I love breakfast food, especially pancakes and omelets.  So when a friend recommended trying this place, I was down to give it a try.  I had high expectations and I wasn't disappointed!  I like how they give you a carafe of coffee when you order a cup (like IHOP) so you don't have to constantly wait to get refilled.  Since I usually drink 3-5 cups every morning, this was a plus.

As far as the food, it also met my expectations.  I decided to try the egg-ceptional omelet (has bacon, mushrooms, ham, peppers, onions and sour cream) and not only was it delicious, it was more than enough food to last me through lunch.  I wanted to try the pancakes as well but I couldn't get it as a side so i tried the banana nut muffin that other reviewers had recommended - it was good but not great, but I'm not a big fan of banana nut in the first place so others may enjoy it, i don't know.  

The overall price was reasonable and I prefer quality over quantity and other than a handful of a few breakfast places on the strip the Egg and I is one of the best breakfast places around Vegas.  Highly recommended!
Our server Karen was fantastic. Very helpful with our order and service was quick. The prime rib eggs Benny was delicious !

Great Vegas breakfast place.  The food is great, the service is great, and the whole place has personality.

If you're looking to eat breakfast somewhere off of the strip, Egg & I has you covered.

I'll make this quick and simple.

Me and my girl came here for breakfast during our visit to Vegas and being the type of people that check yelp for everything, we had to come try this place for ourselves. My opinion ? Amazing! We both had the skillet and it was perfectly balanced with seasoning mixed with all the meats, eggs, and potatoes.

It's probably other places that are good out in Vegas as well but this was awesome! Thank you to our waiter Reyna for making our visit enjoyable.

I love, love, love the Egg & I. I could live on the Works Ranch Potatoes for the rest of my life.  Today I wanted a salad. I looked at the menu online and decided I was going to order the Twin Salad. When we got to the Egg & I, the salad was not on the menu. I told our waitress, Karla, that I saw the Twin Salad on the internet but not on the menu. She said it was still available and that it is one of her favorites. Thank goodness I asked! The tuna salad never disappoints and the chicken salad was terrific too. Karla made sure there were no sprouts on my salad and was super attentive. I accidentally left my banana muffin on the table and she called me back. If I could give Karla more than 5 stars, I would. I will always ask for her.
We ate here 3 mornings out of our 6 day stay. Excellent service, fast seating and you can't beat the food!!!

The food was good and the service was great!

Amanda was our server and was flawless! It's rare to get perfect service, being friendly, attentive, and timely all at the same time, but she did it. She was genuine and deserves a vacation for working so hard ;) Thank you for a great eggsperience!

This was my first time to Egg and I. It was busy and we were quoted a 20 minute wait and sure enough, at 20 minutes we were called. We sat down and the server Karla was amazing, attentive, and friendly. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs...the gravy is excellent! I definitely will come back here when visiting Vegas.

Find a 2 for 1 coupon before coming here!  They are in coupon books handed to you the minute you cross the Nevada state line.  For some reason, food tastes better when it's free.

First time guests get a free banana nut muffin.  IT WAS AWESOME!!  I even bought an $8 loaf after my breakfast. I had a chicken sandwich and it was just ok.  My girl had a spinach omelet w/ feta cheese (the Kay special) and thought it was just ok.

I guess after eating the muffin it was just a slight let-down from there.  At least I enjoyed my loaf for the next couple of days after.  I would come here again and order the pancake stack.  It looked really good.

Service is excellent and prices are pretty decent.
This place is racist. Went there this morning with Asian and Mexican friends. And we got passed up by 4 groups of white people. Then they want to seat us outside.
Bree was so attentive and we loved our Breakfast; delicious seasonal fruit bowl and endless carafe of awesome coffee!

A group of us are visiting here from New Jersey and we heard about this restaurant. The food was fantastic and our server, Chance was phenomenal!  Liza was a sweetheart as well. Highly recommend the mash potato omelette, but don't tell anyone about it. Lol

Amazing for breakfast/brunch. Staff were very friendly and portions are huge! I did not run out of food. The banana nut muffin was the best I've ever had. Shame I live in the U.K and this will be the last time I visit it

We came here because of the reviews and we were absolutely impressed. The reviews speak for itself and there wasn't an empty seat in the place. Don't let the old style mom and pop restaurant scare you away. Amazing home cooked food and top notch wait staff and the prices were right on budget with what you'd want to pay. You have to try it!
Traditional eggs Benedict was very good! Our server, Amanda, provided excellent service.

We had breakfast there several days ago.  Excellent food and service!  Their banana nut muffins are also wonderful.  Our server Juan was terrific!  Although, he had only been there a week (?) he was very friendly, helpful, and pleasant, all the qualities you would like when trying someplace new!  We visit 3 times a year, and will make the Egg & I, one of our standard stops.  Nice to see a place with no slot machines!
Had the classic burrito and banana muffin. Muffin was delicious! Burrito came with a side of potatoes that was yummy. Didn't care much for the sauce that came with the burrito. The service was great!

Great breakfast for lunchtime. Breeannda us a great waitress.  It was worth coming out of the strip for some normal restaurant time.  Turn around is quick. No waiting despite all the people at lunch rush.

This is probably one of the best breakfasts out I've had in recent times. Everything's was good and fresh. One of the best things was the banana bread/muffin. I had the pumpkin pancakes (which are not on the menu, so ask) which were so delicious that I didn't even need syrup. 

My wife, who I love so much (just in case she reads this), is a finicky eater, and she wanted to come back the next day before we left (which we did). She got the skillet breakfast both times. Word to the wise, get a half order if you're not a big eater.

One last thing, went with friends so I tried the biscuit and gravy, stuffed french toast and two different skillet breakfasts. I would have been happy with any of these other orders. 

Ok, I lied, this is the last thing, try the Habla Diablo verde on your food, it is very tasty. So much so, we bought a bottle to take with us.

The banana nut muffin is to die for! A must have when you're here. We had the Country Benny and The Classic and both were great - the potatoes especially surprised me! Portions are generous though; so us three girls shared the two portions with more than enough to go around.
The portions were large and filling and our waiter Raul was attentive and fun!  Definitely a nice spot for a local or someone who wanted to get away from the Strip!

Tamara, our server was awesome! Meticulous and fantastic service! 2 THUMBS UP   

Food here was delicious, like I'm really serious about it man... Hop on over to try it out, you'd definitely not regret! Not does it only taste amazing, it looks wow! Ps I had the prime rib egg beny
I love Leaving Las Vegas.. with Stuffed French Toast in the stomach!
I love this place! I always get the vege Benny cuz it is soooooo delicious :) and our server Staci was the best!! I would give it 5 stars if it wasn't always so friggin cold in here.

This place is a gem, nice break from the hustle of the strip. Good cooking, the banana but muffins are awesome, and as for service, we had excellent service two days in a row from Carla. Moderate prices, generous portions, happy customer. Check it out.
Awesome Banana Bread, great Eggs (obviously).  Really friendly staff!

Food was good. We came off the strip to eat here. They got us seated quickly even though it was busy. 

Jessica our server was cool and nice. Send her to meet the mouse.

Only con, was that they didn't bring all the food out at once. I had to wait to eat until my girlfriend got her food. NBD.

Exceptional!! From the minute we walked in until the minute we left. Amanda was our server and I would have to put her in out top 5 best experiences with a server. She was very sweet but very quick, efficient, and attentive. Definitely a great asset to the company. I don't normally post reviews but it is people like her that deserve recognition so I promised the general manager that I would do this. Great job Amanda!
Great service, fresh, generous portions and so cheap! Great locals spot if you want to get off the strip. So glad I found this little gem while visiting Vegas.

Our first time here and the food is good. The gave them at 4 star. The only thing that I didn't like so much was the crazy large menu. It's a bit too much. The service was good and the people are really friendly here. It seem like everyone Who worked here asked us how was the food and have we been helped. You don't see that kind of service anymore unless you are eating at a fine dining. We definitely will come back when we visit LV.
Cute spot. Has their own touch. Nothing special, but still good. They used very nice fruit, too. I'd eat here again for sure.

4 stars for the food and 5 stars for Karla our server.  She is awesome, she hustles and makes sure we have everything we need. We had the Mexican Omelet and French toast with a side of bacon. When you check in on yelp you also get a free Banana Nut Muffin.  Food had a lot of flavor and came hot and fast.  Definitely a place to come back to.
Amazing service, friendly atmosphere, and a great place to visit for tourist.

This place is one POPULAR and PACKED breakfast spot on weekends that's for sure.

Although they were super busy and packed the one weekend day we showed up, we were seated immediately near the back where the patio seating is. 

I ordered one of their scrambles I believe and I got the banana bread on the side as well. Banana bread was seriously super moist and very buttery. I loved it!

Service was very friendly and efficient. 

Pricing is obviously very affordable being that it's off The Strip. Once again, we love eating where the locals eat. Best bang for your buck fo sho! Thanks Vegas Yelpers for helping us find this decent breakfast joint.

Delicious! Great variety of breakfast dishes. From different benedicts to a variety of scrambles and omelets. Also non egg dishes like french toast and burgers and sandwiches. Have the country potatoes, they're seasoned and cut into perfect bite sizes. Well worth the 20 minute wait

The woman at the front counter welcomed us with a smile & a good morning. We were seated immediately. The service was REALLY fast & perfect. They even have a little black egg you leave out when you don't need anything & you flip it to yellow so the waiters know when you need anything! I think that's a great concept & they should start something like that at all the restaraunts, ever. But anyhoo. I had 'the works.' 2 eggs, their country potatoes(they have a specific name, but it's escaping me right now), your choice of meat and toast. I opted for scrambled with cheese(my go-to), ham steak & cinnamon raisin toast. Everything was perfect! Wonderful after a long night of Vegas drinking. The prices are so affordable too. I will definitely be back, this place is great.

Wow , break fast was FANTASTIC! Carol Anne was a superstar server ! I think anyone who would rate this place one star probably works for the Mackers across the street. I wish I had four stomachs because because one   Sunrise Mountain wasn't enough! Delish.

That banana nut muffin tho! It came out nice and warm AND free! Aye! We checked in, showed our server, Oscar, he came swiftly came back with the goods! Though we were quoted a wait time of 15 min, we were seated in less than 10min. Food was REALLY good. Generous portions, I had the Prime Rib Benny and my husband had the Crazy Chicken omelet. I'd definitely come back on my next trip to Vegas.

My friends who frequent Las Vegas highly recommended this place to me! Thank you Maria M. and Dave O.!!

This breakfast joint is cute, welcoming and homey. It gets pretty packed during the weekends, especially with big parties, so be prepared to wait! But if anything, the food is worth the wait.

The selection of different types of dishes included dozens of omelettes done all kinds of ways, eggs benedict, eggs florentine, egg crepes, skillets, and i could go on and on because they also have sandwiches, french toast, and seriously I can go on.. 

I got the ham and mushrooms skillet with blue berry muffin. The muffin was moist and fresh! The skillet was their infamous ranch potatoes topped with ham and mushrooms with a layer of melted cheeses and two eggs done however you liked. Honestly, it looked super huge and I thought I would not finish it, but it was so good I annihilated that sucker!  My friend tried the ultimate skillet which had ham, bacon,  sausage and other goodies, but he said that it was waaaay too many things going on in one dish. So unless you like something super hearty and packed, try the ultimate skillet, if not, choose one or two ingredients to put into it.

Service was super friendly and kind. On the table there are these flip cards with a happy and sad face. Put up your happy face is your party is doing fine, but if you need anything put up the sad face and a server will attend to you quickly.

When I come back to vegas, this is a definite visit, especially after a big hangover!

I go to Las Vegas a lot for vacation, and I frequently rent a car so I can get off the Strip a bit. Until recently, I didn't really know of anywhere to get a good breakfast off-Strip. Then I found the Egg & I and now I eat there. Every. Time.

The food has always been delicious. The banana nut muffin is to die for and if you tell them it's your first time at the restaurant, they'll give you one for free. I love free things.

The portions are huge and - how shall I put this delicately? - perfect for when you're hung over. My friends and I ate here the morning after the Rock & Roll Half-Marathon last December and it was like being in hangover heaven. 

If you live in LV, or you're visiting and have a car, go to the Egg & I. Heck, it's even worth the cab fare. Trust me.

My husband and I just came across this place last weekend and I must say although we waited 30mins to get seated it was well worth it. After a long weekend in Vegas we wanted to get away from the strip and Long behold....was the Egg and I. The service was good and the breakfast was delicious. They have the best banana nut muffin! We ended up ordering a few for the trip back home!
Great place, great food and amazing service. very traditional and a must try in Vegas. Alexa was great, she was super nice and supper fast very kind. We Will defiantly come back again.
I'm a big fan of this place. They have wonderful service and amazing breakfast food. Try the Carnitas with the Salsa Verde and egg. Coffee was HOT and Abundant.
Manuela was my server and she was very sweet and down to earth. That's the thing about this place, the food isn't the only awesome thing, the people are too.

This place was awesome for a city , packed at 10am, but we got in rather quickly.  I got the Green Chile Breakfast Burrito, and it arrived on my table before I finished my coffee. Great burrito, Huge and tasty! The staff was top notch, and friendly! If I am in Vegas again, I would defiantly do eats here again!
Super yummy food.  I'm not an adventurous eater here but I love the omelets and the skillets!  So yum!  The service is usually great, though there is always a bad seed.

If you want some American style breakfast that gives you real proportions, this is the place to be. I was thinking about going to Ellis Islands for their $6.99 steak and eggs, then I changed my mind thinking about dealing with the strip crowd. The best advantage I always have in Vegas is my own car, and my own GPS. I can have the same options as a local. 

This place is a Zagat rated breakfast joint. The food did not disappoint either. I tried out their waffle plate which came with 2 eggs and a large slice of ham or sausage. The waffle could've been a little warmer, but it tasted wonderful. $2.25 for all you can drink coffee has Starbucks beat. This was the perfect place for my stomach to get all that alcohol soaked up and out of my system for the long drive home. I now have a new off the strip favorite breakfast spot.

For someone that is out of town I recommend this place... u get your money's worth.. I'm writing a review while eating that's how good this place is, I couldn't wait to write the review... I'm coming back for more, next time

"Great breakfast in Vegas for a resonable price."

Great service, food and price. It's not easy to find really good and affordable dining choices in Las Vegas... but, this is one of them. The menu is diverse and you have some good people watching too. My favorite in Vegas.

Seemed like a long line when we got there but it moved fast.. Seated, server was helpful and informative and very friendly. She suggested the Santa Cruz Skillet(added grilled jalapenos) and it was perfect. The kids got pancakes and an omelette, both great and the wife had a veggie scramble, which she loved. Will  return next trip to Vegas for sure.

Maybe my expectations were high due to all the great yelp reviews, but I found my experience disappointing. The restaurant was very crowded and noisy which isn't conductive to a pleasant experience. Our waitress delivered our food quickly, but my muffin was mostly cold and the food was rather plain. We also agreed the potatoes were way too salty. Overall I wish I had just stayed on the strip.

So I'm from Cali and found this spot on yelp. . My experience was good, I enjoy the food very much. I had the skillet, the works.. with avocado on the side. I got to say that plate was very good. Well portioned, extra avocado was not a little but a lot;), service was ok. The only thing I dislike was I set outside on the patio and there are some ugly birds that come around to eat what you drop. Kind of a distraction from enjoying my breakfast.. Positive side was it is a lot quieter then inside. Also might not be a good idea if it hot out tho. My visit on the day was just right to sit out.

I was impressed with both my breakfast, Kay's Special, and my husbands, huevos rancheros. Kay's special is an omlette with artichokes, spinach, parmesan cheese, cream cheese topped with fresh tomatoes and feta cheese. I was looking for something different and not what I would usually order, which is 2 eggs with toast and pancakes. I was pleasantly surprised! It was flavorful, and delicious. The feta cheese on top which I was concerned about was fantastic. I think that might have actually been the best part. I really really enjoyed it. My husband's dish was equally delicious. I was worried there would be too much salsa, but not at all. The side of potatoes were a touch salty. I would have preferred just a little less seasoning however, everything was really really good. They serve a muffin of the day before they serve your order. Todays' was banana nut muffin. It was good. I was happy that the wait was rather quick, especially for a Saturday morning. The menu has many offerings so really, no matter what you like for breakfast, I'm sure you can find it there. Our server was also very nice and quick.
Hard to ruin breakfast, but they managed. Dry burnt eggs and tasteless food. May have been convenient but would not recommend it.

Pleasant place to grab breakfast.  It's not on the strip.  It was nice to get away from the strip and have breakfast in a place that could be in almost any town I suppose in most of the states.  Service was fine, food was alright.  Not sure the food was that great to make a special trip out to this place, but if you are looking to get some good reasonable breakfast this place was fine.  

Had the avocado and bacon omelet, which was good.  Potatoes were a bit dryer than I would have preferred.  

Kids had the mouse pancakes, which they liked.

Been coming here for the past couple of summers, at least twice a week.  Considering that I'm only awake these 'early' hours (the place is only open from 6am to 3pm) a few times a week, that's a fairly high ratio, now that I think about it.

Menu items of note:
Crazy Chicken - simply a well balanced omelette

Eggs Benedict Florentine - not a fan of eggs benedict in general, but I am when I come here

Banana Nut Muffin - this thing might be enough of a reason to come here just by itself

Haole (sp?) loco - on the back page, under the Hawaiian section, it's one of the more fattening things on the menu, but very tasty.

Not a fan of their homefries, so I substitute them out with fruit instead

Service:
The servers are usually quite friendly, helpful, and attentive.

Reasons why I come here:
This is one of the cheaper and healthier breakfast options in Vegas, yet there is no sacrifice in quality for the food.  Much better than the overrated Hash House a Go Go.  Oh, and if you are coming here for the first time, do yourself a favor and get the darn Banana Nut Muffin.

We came to Vegas for Spring Break and for a Basketball Tournament.  Looking to escape the casino for breakfast I Googled "the best breakfast in Vegas". The Egg and I came up a winner!  

Place was busy for a Tuesday morning.  Service was prompt with only a short wait to be seated.

I had a two egg chile relleno omelette. It was delish!  I chose to get fruit instead of potatoes.  My husband got potatoes with his chicken fried steak and eggs.  The potatoes were yummy and perfectly spiced.  The fruit I had was all fresh sliced pineapple, grapefruit, honeydew and cantaloupe. The fruit combination was a perfect complement.  

Kids ate mouse pancakes, one with chocolate chips the other without.  Both kids said they were better than my homemade!  

Coffee comes in a carafe to the table.  Took what was left in a to go cup.  :-)

Service was very good.  Our server was "Karen." She was super friendly, patient/understanding with kids ordering, and very attentive.

I've only been here for breakfast/brunch and lunch, but it was an "egg"cellent experience every time.  Big portions, really friendly service, casual homey atmosphere.  They did a great job accommodating our large group (we called ahead to warn them we were on the way). It's a nice spot  to get away from The Strip and have some comfort food.  http://www.eggandi.com/

Come HUNGRY.  Seriously, you will get more food than you can handle.  The place is packed so plan on waiting.  The skillet breakfasts are delish.  I had the chicken, mushroom & broccoli skillet but also tried the country fried steak.  The banana nut muffin that comes with most dishes is also quite very moist and tasty.  No alcohol so one ding for that, but otherwise, a very good place to get your grub on.
Huevos Rancheros was incredible. Also the biscuits and gravy. The wait staff are so nice and the food came out fast. Its totally worth the cab ride off the strip to get breakfast.
Amazing food and service! Bring your appetite! If you are military, they give a discount for each military member in your party. Just make sure to take care of your server and give a larger tip!

Such an amazing place for brunch! Call ahead and ask if there is a wait just because when we got there, there was quite a line. Waited for about 15-20 mins, not bad for a Sunday, specially for Mother's Day. 

Ambiance is a homey relaxed vibe. They serve a variety of eggs, pancakes and chilis. They have a lot of options and vegetarians too so check out the menu! 

Price is about comparable to Denny's or IHOP. 

I ordered chile relleno omelet with banana but bread and the hubby got 'the works,' with toast. We enjoyed our food and both finished it in no time. 

Will definitely come back. 

Our server Erin is very upbeat and personable, made our dining experience a little extra special!

Great service, fast food, great taste and atmosphere is great....(the restaurant is a pokestop which i love) Liza, our server, definitely made my vacation start off beyond great.  I would definitely recommend

We were in Vegas over Thanksgiving (2012) and found the Egg & I on line. Ended up eating breakfast there 3 out of 4 days. Both my wife and I had some of the best breakfasts ever! The chicken enchilada omelette was awesome! Service by Janeen was the best! Ask for her and you will start your day right.

Spent a few days in Vegas and wasn't feeling like a "buffet" style breakfast or our normal Hash House a Go Go meal. Found Egg and I in a coupon book given to us at our Hotel. 

Located in a strip mall with a lot of parking, there was no wait on a weekday morning, but the place was full of patrons. Took a while for our server to take our order and asked us twice what we wanted to drink (amnesia maybe ?..no she was just busy, trying to tend to everyone), so after about 10 minutes, my husband flipped the sign with the un-happy egg, to show we needed attention. The sweet lady at the register quickly came to us and asked what we needed. Our server quickly came to us and apologized for the wait and also brought each of us the BEST BANANA  NUT MUFFIN ever !!! 

I had the Blackend Prime Rib Benny, A Grilled croissant with  prime rib, sauteed spinach and roasted red bell peppers, two poached eggs, then covered with hollandaise sauce. Also came with home fries and 2 slices of fruit. This dish was AMAZING ! All the flavors tied together so well and that Banana Nut Muffin will make me a return customer ! The hubby had Crepes filled w/ Mushrooms, that I take was also delicious, since  I didn't get to taste it ! 

The coupon for a "buy one meal get the other for half off" made the whole experience even better.

 We'll be back in 2 mos..EGG AND I but this time we won't be alone.

The young waiter with the arm tattoo who looked like a young Art Garfunkel was awesome. 

Good food. Exceptional service. We'll be back.

So delicious! Eggs were creamy, cheesy, and delightful. Banana nut main doesn't look like much but it was pretty good! Plus, yelp gives us a free muffin. Service was fast and friendly. Nice family environment. Would go here again.

This place was great! It is not located in a hotel so I didn't have to walk through a maze to get there.  A little bit off the strip but that's what I liked about it.  There was a ten minute wait but that's how I knew it was going to be good, and it was completely worth it.  I had a skilled and banana nut muffin.  My girlfriend had their eggs "benny".  All was exceptional.  Wait staff was great.

Looking for breakfast on our way out of Vegas and happened by this spot. There were people waiting outside so we figured there would be a long wait...nope! We were seated about 15min later (as promised). So many great sounding entrees to choose from! I decided on the stuffed French toast. Wow! The food was delicious. The service was amazing. Manuela new the menu like the back of her hand, so when my husband attempted to create his own dish (banana nut French toast), Manuela knew exactly what he needed to order. This was the perfect ending to a great weekend! Oh, don't forget to check-in and get a free muffin!

Wednesday morning, breakfast time in Las Vegas - what to do? I Yelped it and decided to try The Egg and I based on the reviews. Great decision! This is an old fashioned, cozy breakfast place with fantastic food and great service. I tried the Eggs Florentine or, in my case, "the usual" - and the hollandaise was just about perfect. 
Highly Recommended!
Outstanding breakfast with eggcellent service! Liza is a terrific waitress who will take great care of you!

This place was horrible! Did we come on a bad day or what? 

The 4 of us decided to stop in here for breakfast before making the 10 hour trip back home. We decided to give this place a try as it had really good reviews. 

We got in and got seated pretty fast, there was quite a few people. I ordered a vanilla latte coffee whatever and it was way too sweet. I feel like I might have gotten diabetes from that coffee. 

Aftwr looking at the newspaper menu for a few minutes I decided on the chicken fried steak skillet since I am a big fan of all things chicken friend. The 3 others got the Mexican omelet, I believe that is what it was called. 

The food came out pretty quick, first glance at my chicken fried skillet made me queesy but I was hungry and I thought it can't be that bad. The country gravy was gelatinous. It was weird. Like a slime blob of gravy exploded all over my food. Whatever. Give it a try. 

It didn't taste that bad but it didn't taste good. It was very salty and I just couldn't get over the slime gravy so I stopped eating. Everyone else with their Mexican omelet had tears streaming down their face. Apparently the omelet was too spicy to even enjoy. My partner is Mexican and loves her spicy foods. She is obsessed with all things spicy, tears will be streaking down her face and she will still say it isn't spicy enough, but even she struggled with the omelet. Maybe not that it was too spicy but that it tasted like crap spicy. 

Anyways, about 10 minutes after trying to eat my slime it hit me like a brick, I made a beeline to the bathroom and was in there for about 10 minutes only to return 5 more times. 

As you can imagine the 10 hour car ride home was horrible. Never again.

This place is awesome! We had Erin as our server, she was great! She was very sweet and attentive to our table.

My boyfriend and I got two dishes to share because we couldn't decide! We started off with banana nut muffins (this is a must, they are home made!) I got the Texas toast French toast and my boyfriend got, 'The Crazy Chicken' Omelette both were very tasty and cooked to perfection! 

I would definitely go back here!

After indulging us too much the day before at the Bellagio Buffet, we looked for a nice and decent original coffee shop - or such. The day before my lady had found a voucher in a tourist magazine together with the notion of a review that this place (i.e. both) we're very liked with the community and the reviewers, in fact best liked.

Being a no brainer it turned up trumps in reality: The place was VERY busy (which we took as a good sign to start with) yet being seated only took a moment and the service was very fast and attentive. Food variety on the menue is almost too big ;-) so I quite took my time to decide. Got an italian influenced omelette which turned out to be very tasty. 
One more thing about the service: Our little boy didn't like his fries because they came spiced (paprika or the likes)... they were replaced with plain ones in no time - comped !

A little before the food arrived a nice and cheerful lady of the staff came over and chatted us up a bit. Her expert eye didn't fail to note that we were out-of-towners. Later, I found out that she was actually the manager (owner?) and had the same first name as my darling ! When she heard that I failed to order the banana nut muffin (house specialty) she had one sent to our table immediately - again, complementary !

I guess I don't need to say more. Prices very reasonable, yummy food with a lot of variety...wish we had breakfast places like that in Berlin lol.

Since I guess we will return to Las Vegas at some point in our lives I can clearly see us going there again !

Banana nut muffin, will you marry me?  My husband may object, but that's ok.  We won't tell him.

The wait on a Sunday morning was 25 minutes.  Obviously, it's a good place if people are waiting.  We didn't mind the wait at all.

We shared the stuffed french toast (stuffed with eggs, cheese, bacon) and the collision course (a cross between a crepe and omelet).  Mine came with a banana nut muffin.

My coffee was never empty.

You know the food is good when you are so full and you keep eating.  You know you're going to get sick, but you just don't care.

I came here for the first time with my girlfriend. I ordered the traditional Benny (eggs Benedict) and wow. This place is great! Besides the long wait time ( which was worth it) our servers name was Reina and she was great. If u need anything u just flip the little egg guy on your table and they're there to help you! Great food, great staff. Definitely coming back!

Alexa was fantastic. Breakfast was delicious. Definitely worth the wait. Omelettes are huge, corned beef hash amazing, and biscuits and gravy delish. Somewhere off the Vegas strip where the locals eat. Not a bad place to be!
Erin was an exceptional waitress.  Her suggestions on the food were very helpful.  Only downfall is that they don't accept American Express

The BEST breakfast I had in vegas so far and I will come here every AM I'm in town.. I had the skillet works! It was amazing and you get PLENTY of great quality ingredients inside! First time there? You get a tasty banana muffin.. Tabitha was awesome and explained the items on the menu I had questions about. I'm so happy to have found this place! I wish there was one in Los Angeles but only in Las Vegas areas for now...They close at 3pm so get there early and get your grab on! I came here on a Tuesday morning and it wasn't as busy as people say here.. Fantastic!

I'm guessing a little wait time is typical here, because the food here is really good.  Its worth the short wait.  Moderately priced and off the strip a few miles.  I had the Rellanos omelet and it was really good.  Great Service.

The food was delicious!! Portions were really large. Our server Jessica was super friendly and very attentive. I will definitely be coming here again on my many Vegas adventures! Off the strip, not a long wait, dog-friendly patio.
Erin was an amazing server we went with a group of 15 and she did great! Everyone's food was hot and delish!

Great service, great egg dishes. When you order coffee they give you a pot so you don't have to constantly ask for refills. This particular location has more locals so you know it's a decent place to grab breakfast.

Definitely worth a trip out for breakfast if you are an out of towner like I am, or if you are in the area. So many dishes to choose from, that's probably the most annoying part about this place!

This place is awesome . Food was incredible and our waitress, Chance was just as awesome. 
She was very personable and quick to serve and made sure we had everything. 
Highly recommend this place for the service and the food.

Very pupolar place for breakfast lovers. Exceptional must-have-to-die-for banana nut muffin & habla diablo potatoes, friendly service & generous portion. Highly recommended blacken prime rib benny & stuff french toast.

Karla, was our server and she is top notch!!!  As busy as the place is (Mothers Day) she is frequently checking on us to be sure we are happy. Everything is delicious and we'll all definitely be returning!!!!
Best skillet I've ever had. My picky-eater kids ate everything on their plates. The muffin was excellent. Just found my new favorite breakfast spot on Vegas!!

I was in carb heaven at the Egg and I, had the biscuits and gravy and the banana walnut muffin which were both very good. Service was very good and our food was delivered quite fast. Crowded, but the wait went very fast. Look like a new favorite in Vegas for me.

Food is oily and covered with seasoning. Toast is burnt. What's non dairy creamer? However the service from Samantha is completely awesome and makes up for everything. Samantha gave me some real milk to go with my coffee.
Our server Arlene was eggceptional!! And my haole loco moco was so so good. Reminded me of Oahu!  Thank you for a great experience!

If you want the best American breakfast in Vegas, don't eat where the tourists eat...yeah, don't eat at the local Casinos, long-wait Buffets or the Strip. 

You eat here. 

Probably the best, highest quality "comfort style" breakfast offerings I've seen without being overly ostentatious in the presentation, overpriced or over hyped. 

Being good at what they do, there is a slight wait for a table but since efficiency is the norm, local families get in and out without a hitch (with full tummies and smiles on their faces). 

The service and offerings here are top shelf, you're met with kindness and courtesy that accompanies a moist, warm banana muffin. 

I gotta say, because our banana nut muffins were so good.... we ordered a banana nut loaf to go. It didn't last long after we arrived back in SoCal. :)

Definitely one of our highlight meals while in Vegas.

The locals have it good here and this is one of the big reasons why.

Outstanding.

Everything was delicious! Our server, Karla, was amazing! And, despite being slammed, we didn't wait an unreasonable amount of time for our food. Oh, those banana muffins people keep mentioning 

I'm only giving 4 stars because it was a bit dirty and the creamers on the table were all nasty and sticky.  However, Karla was a sweetheart and brought us a fresh dish of creamer.

Best breakfast potatoes I have ever consumed in my life. The salty diablo seasoning (not spicy) is amazing and the potatoes are always perfectly cooked. While this may seem to be a rather strange thing to rate, a lot of breakfast places overlook the breakfast potatoes, even though half your plate comprises of these carbs.

The other breakfast foods are solid. I got the eggs Benedict and they drowned it in hollandaise sauce. I hate it when places drizzle that delicious egg butter concoction and am so glad to have found a place that isn't afraid of it. My husband always gets the typical egg sausage breakfast and he is always happy because in all honesty, he really comes out for those potatoes.

I've also had a few of the spicy omelettes and they have all been amazing. I watched my brother in law devour a four egg omelette. He ate through the pain because even though it's rather large, it was so delicious that leaving any behind would have been a crime. 

Check in for a free banana muffin that's warm and goes to wonderfully with a cup of coffee.

Also, it's always busy here, even though it's a bit off the strip and the middle of the week. It doesn't matter, it's worth the trek

The banana nut muffin looks like a mushroom.  The muffin top is so big it just falls right over!  But that being said it's moist and warm and delicious.  

I was brought here because I wanted breakfast food at 12PM and the omelettes were mouthwatering and the those homefries were something else!  I've never had homefries that were so crispy before....they probably deep fry them.  But deep fried anything is great usually.  

Service is great too.  They have a system similar to what you would find at Bubba Gump's where you flip the egg to get the wait staff's attention.
Kat was a doll and the food was incredible. Must try! I recommend trying the stuff French toast with strawberry and cream. Delicious!!!!
The food was delicious, service was great, and price was reasonable. You must try the banana nut muffin so good !!!
Everything our party of 4 ordered was delicious!! Try the banana nut muffins!! Linnea was an incredible waitress!!
Karla is the greatest!!!!!!!!!!!!! Everyone at the table enjoyed their food. Huge portions and for a good price!

Great start to my vacation! The food here is excellent. This is definitely the best eggs benedict I've ever had.

Fantastic service from our waitress Tabatha! I hope the other places I visit have wonderful staff members like her.

We ordered veggie skillet and veggie crepe. Genesis was our server. She was very polite to us. 
Restaurant is really good. I would recommend it to a friend

The Egg and I, and Chicken Fried Steak!

Experience:  I met some friends for early lunch or late breakfast.  It was pretty busy for 11:00 on a Thursday.  

Facility:  fairly good size place with a dinner atmosphere. There were murals on the walls,  and typical tables and chairs with some half booth seating too. 

Service:  not the best service I ever had, but not the worst. Doesn't seem to be one set waitress per table...this can be a good or bad thing. It took a good 10 minutes before someone took my drink order, we had to flag someone a few times, and after the food came, no one did the check back to make sure we didn't need anything else....but when they did help us, they were friendly and quick. 

Food:  a girlfriend and I decided to split two meals, so we could try more.  We ordered the "Chili Relleno Eggs Benedict" special, and we got the "chicken fried steak with over easy eggs and banana nut muffin."  
The muffin came out warm and it was pretty tasty.  Would have been perfect if they served some butter with it. 
The Benedict was good. I love the chili taste that cut the richness of the Benedict. 
The chicken fried steak was good, but not the best I ever had. It was crispy outside and a nice southern white gravy on the side to dip it in. I really did enjoy the hash brown potatoes on the side.  When they first came out, I thought I wouldn't like them because they looked to have too much seasoning on them.  However, they actually had just the right amount, and it had a Lawrys season salt flavor. 

Overall:  I would definitely come back here again. They have so many good things in the menu I want to try.  See yah soon!!

If you're visiting, this restaurant may not be walking distance from your hotel, but it is very much worth driving to! Also it is not overpriced like most places in Vegas. Do not surpass the banana nut muffin! Order it, it is delicious.

Very friendly welcome and service by Thanayra, food excellent: Waffle works & sausage verygood, "half" pancake stack (half is a szrong understatement though...) but pancakes a bit on the heavy side, could be more fluffy, Veggie crepes with avocado fulling excellent, chili omelett really very good well spiced, i particularly liked their "works potatpes"...
Ulises was a great server, and the food.... AMAZING! Prime Rib Benny is a must have ;)
Corn beef hash from scratch is the ish

Excellent breakfast spot! Vast menu--almost too many choices--with plenty of vegetarian options. Large portions, and everyone's dish came with a healthy serving of fresh fruit. I had the veggie benedict. Good choice with the grilled tomatoes and fresh avocado, although my eggs were a bit overdone. The home fries are amazing though! Crispy and great seasoning. The bottomless coffee wasn't that great, but good enough for a bottomless pot to wake you up in the morning.

Service was incredible! Fast, attentive, friendly. I wish I could remember our waitress's name to give her a 5-star review. The service is definitely what would keep me coming back. The food is good, but the pricing was a bit high (I think bennie + coffee came to $14 + tip) to make it a regular go-to breakfast.

Who knew that making over easy eggs was an artform?  This place has mastered the art of making eggs.  I was visiting Vegas with family and actually craving pancakes, but I couldn't eat at a place called "The Egg & I" and not have eggs.  So I ordered a simple breakfast the Eggs Plus (over easy eggs, grits, toast, and bacon).  I had never seen such a perfectly cooked over easy egg, and it definitely tasted that way.  The white of the egg was so airy!  My mom was willing to share a bite of her eggs benedit, and they were soooo good!  I felt I had to commemorate the visit, so I bought my mom an "Egg & I" coffee mug.  :)  Oh, and the staff was very friendly.
As always "Breakfast for Champions" with Karla the amazing, attentive & vivacious waitress!!!

My wife and I had discovered Egg and I 18 months ago when we decided to have breakfast after a late night out away from the Vegas strip. After reading all the good reviews on Yelp..we decided to try this place..and we love it so much that we have breakfast here everytime we come to Vegas from San Francisco - Bay Area. 

We have tried several breakfast places on the Vegas strip and it does not even come close to the service, price, and quality of food at Egg and I.  

The Banana Nut Muffin is a MUST try!!!

Came here over the weekend and wasn't impressed! Why would you have to use a picture of an egg to get service? Service should be an automatic thing. Service is slow and my waitress didn't seem like she enjoy her job much. As for the food, it has an unnatural flavor. The omelette tasted as if they don't use real eggs. I wanted to venture out but I think I'm going to stick to my number 1 breakfast spot mr. Mamas, their food and service are more worthy of my money (subpar)!

I read all the great reviews on Yelp for this place and recommended it to the group I was with.   Long story short we went twice in 4 days, its that good.  I want to know where they get their sausages, outstanding flavor....service great...we waited less than 10 minutes the first time and walked in the second.  I will definitely be going to this place again...The only thing I could recommend would be that they fix the latch in the restroom.  Also they really need to put a Rooster for the Men's room and a bunch of chickens for the Ladies Hen house...;)

This family oriented restaurant is a great place for brunch.  The menu selection is vast (6 pages!) and offers dishes for both vegetarian and non-vegetarians alike.  I ordered the veggie good omelette.  The yummy omelette (I requested mushroom, spinach, and cheddar on mine) came with well-seasoned potatoes and their infamous banana nut muffin.  You must try their banana nut muffin!  It was probably the best banana nut muffin I've ever had and I'm not exaggerating.  It tasted like there was a slight hint of buttermilk in the muffins but whatever this restaurant did to them made them amazzzingggg.  

All the portions sizes are huge and I liked how I could easily substitute items that were orginally in the veggie good omelette to make my order just the way I like it.  Great prices for what you are getting as well.  The atmosphere is also fun and filled with egg puns!  Egg-static!

We live in California and have been here 4-5 times over the course of several years. The reason for my 5 star review is that I'm at a loss to come up with a single negative. Every server has been 100% on top of it. We (myself, wife and two kids) have raved about every entree. The prices are low for strip-area Las Vegas dining. The ambiance is more mid-west USA than Las Vegas but I have no issue with that.

I'm not one to freely give out 5 star reviews but the Egg and I has earned one.

This quickly became my favorite go to breakfast/brunch spot on my way out of las Vegas. The kays special, banana nut muffin, and the coffee are all fantastic. The waitress tells me the skillets are where its at as well.

I ate at Egg & I and had a food server (Victoria) was absolutely amazing! She treated everyone in her section, including my party as if we were her only and most important table. I will definitely come here and ask for her specifically next time.

Very impressive Egg menu. I'm from the south where breakfast is an all day food item and this place would do well in the south. Worth the drive off the strip for breakfast. Excellent service thanks to Liza.
Eggs Benedict was delicious! Loved the banana nut muffin... Must get if you eat here!

Oh. My. God.

I want to marry this place. I want to have its babies.

Stuffed French toast -- more like a French toast sandwich with eggs, bacon, and cheese -- total party in my mouth. The combination of sweet and savory was enough to make me die happy right there. The bacon and the scrambled eggs were perfectly blended (no limp strips of bacon criss-crossed on top of your eggs in THIS joint!) and the whole concoction dipped in syrup was like a MIRACLE.

Jess got a skillet and I have never SEEN more beautiful over-easy eggs. OHMIGOD! I wish this place were local, I would be here every weekend. The iced tea was good too, and the staff is friendly and helpful. This is probably where we'll come for a farewell brunch the morning after our destination wedding. Mission accomplished!

The number 1 reason we come here is for Amanda. She's such a doll & always goes above and beyond!! All the girls here are great but Amanda has our heart! Foods always great and coffee is always fresh! Egg and I is a most come!!!!
Loved the prime rib benny and banana bread French toast minus powdered sugar. Service was great.

I went in feeling nervous about trying a French toast sandwich. The bread was French toast and the inside was ham, egg, and cheese scrambled. It was deelish! The food was great and the waitress was sweet as pie. 

We sat outside and enjoyed the patio that allowed a soft water mist fight against the Vegas heat. 

I would have given them a rating of five but the patio tables needed to be cleaned because there were cobwebs on them. I Don't PLAY with spiders!

5 stars does not even come close to how amazing this food is!  I highly recommend ordering their pork carnitas rancheros with a side of work potatoes!  It is consistently busy,  but service is very fast and efficient!  Also, for your sweet tooth cravings try one of their homemade banana nut muffin!  It's just heavenly!

We've been waiting for almost 20 minutes and still no one came to our table to take our order. They just walk by and continue to go as if we are not waiting. We flipped to where they said if u need service n still nothing. If you are wanting to eat I suggest going somewhere else. Never again. We ended up leaving not ordering anything

I'm so happy I stopped in for brunch today.  I came in with a group of 7.  We were seated quickly  & our waitress, Bree, was awesome!  It was obvious that she loves her job.  Her friendly attitude had a big impact on our experience.  We felt very taken care of the whole time & the food was delicious all around.

Oscar was the bomb: He recommended the 3 Little Pigs Omelette and the Green Chile Relleno omelette. Both were served hot and were absolutely awesome. Relleno sauce was super flavorful and not too spicy. I selected the warm fresh-out-of-the-oven banana muffin (YUM). We ordered fruit on the side which was in large chunks and consisted of pineapple, 3 types of melon and an orange slice. Very fresh and tasty.  I would love to come back to try other menu items.  It looks like this place can be pretty busy, so allow for time to be seated.

Oscar was very sweet and attentive, letting us know our order was working and did frequent check backs. Plates were cleared and check promptly dropped. Thank you!

I gave Egg and I a 4 star because it was delicious but not extraordinary. As first timers we were given complimentary banana nut muffin. It was delicious but too oily for me. We went on a Sunday morning and waited about 20 minutes to be seated for a table for two. Our server was very polite and actually everyone there seem happy to work there. You can tell everyone was working hard and had a a routine that works. As for the food, I was satisfied and left full. I ordered the stuffed French toast with bacon and potatoes. The potatoes were tiny and well done with extra seasonings (average). My BF got the biscuits and gravy with potatoes as well. The gravy had the right amount of sodium not too salty and not to bland.
I always love coming here after a weekend in Vegas. Great food to help the hangover. Our server Brady was excellent and the food came out very quickly. Will definitely be returning.

AMAZING, amazing experience here. The food and service was top notch here. They were able to accommodate our party of 10. Regardless of our party size, they provided amazing service. We gave them a big fat tip. Their banana nut muffins were to die for and possibly the best one I've ever had. I got the spinach benny and it was delicious. The other foods looked good and none of us had any complaints during our meal. I think I will need to visit this place every time I'm in Vegas. It's delicious with amazing service. Can't go wrong!

Classic Benny was great. our server Paula was fantastic! This was our first time there. But we did come back for breakfast two days later. Great food, great service. Loved the patio. Recommend for breakfast anytime. Thanks for making our time in Vegas a great one

This place has always been amazing. The food quality is outstanding. Clean friendly staff. But today was wired. Our waitresses Liliana made us feel like we were being rushed. This would have been ok if they were busy but that so wasn't the case today. Got to the table and she was there asking "what can I start for your drinks today?" Girl let me sit and look what you have before you rush me. Then she comes back like 30 sec later with drinks. "Are you ready?" I just opened my menu. Dang can we have a few mins to go over it? Sure." Then food comes then like 2 mins after that. "I'm not rushing but I will leave the check on the table. Ok now we feel rushed. But the food and everything else is amazing.
There's a reason this place has great reviews! This place is awesome!! Our server Amanda was so friendly and pleasant!! This now one of our must haves when we come to Vegas.

I wish I came here with a group of 10 people so I can make everyone order a different dish for me to try. I can eat eggs everyday and every meal and not get sick of it. So Egg and I pretty much describes the story of my life. This place is roughly 10-15 mins away from the strip so there was no wait like all the other crazy famous Vegas brunch spots and that's 10 extra bonus points!

Like I mentioned I'm a crazy egg person so ordering brunch was never difficult for me. I would always always ALWAYS order an omelette but no joke, it took me more than 10 mins to decide what I wanted here since almost everything had eggs in it and there were so many choices! But of course i ended up getting the work omelette and we also ordered carnitas something (I was so hungry and forgot to note the name). The omelette was okay nothing special or different for everywhere else but the potato on the side was AMAZING! The other dish was also super good- I've never had carne asada that's so flavorful and delicious! I cannot wait to come back again and try the other dishes they have!

Oh did I mention, instead of stretching your neck out to track down your waiter/waitress, you can flip the "egg sign" and someone will swing by to attend to your needs. Awesome!

One of the best breakfast spots I've ever had. I ordered the "Stuffed French Toast" It had sausage and eggs stuffed between two pieces of french toast. The potatoes were slightly mild in seasoning and full of flavor. The coffee is great; the price was great for las vegas; and Maggie my server was incredibly approachable. 

Oh, also free banana muffin when you check in via YELP!

5/5
Good breakfast spot! Our waitress was Stacie and she was awesome!! Definitely try the banana nut french toast and the egg-cellent omelet... sooooooooo worth it and it'll feed 2 people no problem!
The Works skillet was simply amazing! Yummy homemade salsa and the homemade muffin finished everything off nicely. Biscuits and gravy was too too

This was our first visit here. I wanted to try something new for breakfast this morning so after a quick Google search I found The egg and I. It was amazing! Service was amazing! We were seated immediately and after ordering out food it was out waiting a matter of minutes. If you like hot sauce be sure to try their hot sauce that they make! Yum!!! 

Thank you Liza for being an amazing server!!!

A wonderful place for a great breakfast. We go there and Genesis is the best waitress by far and we plan on asking to be seated in her area every time. She remembers us by sight and has a delightful personality. This is becoming a regular breakfast place for us.

This place is an "egg cellent" place to have breakfast.  It is a little bit crowded, but I believe it is because it IS such an excellent restaurant.  The waiters and waitresses are friendly and let you substitute fruit for sausage or ham; which is healthy and a very nice option.  I highly recommend this fabulous breakfast spot!

Since my sister first introduced me to this place last year, every time I come to Vegas I HAVE to stop by and have myself some breakfast before leaving back to L.A.

The Banana Nut Muffin is so delish! They bring it out to you nice and warm! They also sell them in a loaf for $6.99 and I always buy a loaf home. And they wrap it in clear color papers that makes it look very nice and presentable. The Brad's Very Special is good. It comes with a side of potatoes and eggs that are scrambled together with spinach, mushroom, tomatoes, and cheese melt together. 

I definitely recommend this place to anyone that visits Vegas.

Absolutely delicious! Vanilla cappuccino is amazing, iced or hot! The banana nut muffin is so tasty. I had the veggie skillet and my boyfriend had the blueberry pancakes. Both were extremely good! Our server, Maggie, was so sweet and attentive! Overall a very friendly place!
The food is amazing, & out standing service! The banana muffins are the BEST in town!  Server:Karla
Must stop here for breakfast if you're in Vegas! Awesome food and great service, Thank u Carole Ann!! Try the corn beef hash.. Homemade and delicious!

Ok, imagine that you've just left South Orange County (Ladera Ranch to be specific) and you've made this great plan to beat the traffic in the Los Angeles area.  Part of the plan has you delaying breakfast until you get to Las Vegas, and the plan is working pretty well so far.  At Barstow you get out your phone and you begin to review the non casino options in Las Vegas when 'Egg and I' leaps out with these great reviews and a fantastic star rating.  Sold!  That's where we're going to go.

When we check-in on yelp we get a free Banana Nut Muffin, and things seem to be fantastic.

Our server is charismatic, checks in often, provides us with a pitcher of water (its something like 100 degrees outside and rising), and was efficient throughout the meal.

Our omelettes arrive in a timely fashion, and so what is their to complain about.  

First, I like cheese, and so having cheese is always a good thing, and for you this may be a big plus, but there was so much cheese it was hard to taste anything else.  I had ordered the chile rellano omelette, and it arrived as advertised, but with just a ton of cheese.  

Second, the potatoes looked to be cubed by a machine, frozen, de-frosted, and then lightly seasoned prior to arrival.  They were very disappointing.  

Third, my expectations were way too high.  My fellow yelpers love this place, and so I was expecting this amazing breakfast that just didn't live up to my expectations.

In a nutshell, I'd probably go back, but with a whole different set of expectations, knowing that I'd ask for sliced tomatoes instead of the potatoes, and I'd probably not choose an omelette.

Be sure and check in, a free muffin is not a bad thing.

Great service.  Huge portions.  Please ask for Amanda.  She is a great server; attended to my table with her professional service.  I will definitely ask for her everything.  U will not be disappointed.
Fast, friendly, and fresh... All 3 qualities I like in my food establishments. There's a lot of items in the menu for breakfast, lunch, & dinner.

1st time here and it was really good.  Although it looked like there was a lot of people waiting to be seated, the time we waited for a party of 4 was about 10 minutes. The staff was very friendly and very attentive.  The food was good and big portions.  The banana nut muffin was so good.  Got a free one just for checking in with yelp! I would really recommend this place.

Apparently this is one of the best breakfast joints in Vegas.  I can't really agree with that but it's pretty darn good.  I ordered the corned beef hash and what came wasn't your standard canned mushed beef stuff. There were real pieces of corned beef in this mixed with potatoes, onions, red, green peepers and topped with 2 eggs of your choice, which should always be over easy eggs with super sloppy running yolks. The flavors were spot on and the side of potatoes were nice.  The banana muffin that is served is awesome too.  It's probably microwaved before getting to your table but it's still very decent.  Prices are a little bit high like $10.95 for the hash and the wait can be long.  The annoying thing about this place is paying at the cashier!  When it's busy, the wait can be 10 minutes to pay your bill... minus a star for that.

Emily was a great waiter, and I was very happy with the banana moffin free for doing check in, it was as delicious as the one I make, but, I did not like my food, chicken enchiladas has to much flavor, it make you thirsty, the rice was good, the fried beans more less, my husband husbandhad a Bandito Scramble, he liked it but said it was nothing amazing. The coffee was good. The restroom is awful pretty small.
Really great tasting food very busy day so service was alittle slow but i was ok with it the price was decent.

I've been to some of the other egg works locations in vegas and have enjoyed them all. I got the Santa Cruz skillet and it was very tasty. I've had some better dishes at other locations (carnitas skillet!) but this was pretty darn good. The service was great and very accommodating even though they were busy, and by checking in on Yelp we got free banana nut muffins - a must try! Won't hesitate to go back next time I'm in vegas.

Just finished eating our meal here. Wonderful place with a good location. Always a pleasure to come here. This is my favorite breakfast place by far! Spent $80 on breakfast at the trump and it doesn't compare to this $26 dollar masterpiece! Definitely a place to stop at!

Off the strip but soooooooooooooooooo good. Love this place --- and it's in Las Vegas only!

Just a few words that you need to heed:

Fresh. Banana. Nut. Bread.

OH YES.

The other items are great --- everything we had was so good. Skillets, omelettes, home fries (oh mmmmmmm yum), and eggs done to perfection. Wonderful service, friendly smiles, and great directions on the phone when we were trying to find the restaurant!

And their little egg logo is just SOOOO CUTE. What can I say? I'm such a sucker for branding!

Best breakfast i ever has in my life. Lol. But for real its the best breakfast ever.. server Kat is very nice as well,she's the best. Thank you!!  And Great job. Make sure you look for her and you'll be in good hands.

We're from Cali and never been here before but from the moment we sat down Linnea made us feel right at home! She was so polite and helpful, with excellent advice on the menu we ended up with 2 delicious plates for breakfast! Linnea made our last morning in town eggcellent!

Sin City is the playground for to-be-brides, burned-out college students, and exotic dancers galore.  But with the bright lights and a full schedule of gambling, shopping, and drinking you definitely need to start your day right with the most important meal of the day--breakfast. Egg & I is a local favorite and contrary to the restaurant's name they do serve entrees san eggs. *gasp* 

The offering:
*Reuben Sandwich w/ Fries: The meat was perfectly seasoned between two toasted slices of bread. mmMmmm... Oh and they gave an extremely generous offering of french fries. yum yum! 
*Fender Blender: Some type of egg and crepe contraction which was light fluffy and all around delicious. It came with an asian-inspired sauce which complimented the main course perfectly. Oh and the potatoes were spot-on!   
*Florentine Omlette (Daily Special): Ironically the daily special was not special at all . Instead it was a complete epic fail in my party.  Way too cheesy as the produce was drowning in the gooey sea.   

The food is great, the price is right ($8 average entree), and I'm definitely coming back!
Outstanding breakfast spot!! We go every time we visit Vegas. Our server Tabatha was great!!

Very good breakfast food. Waitress was very friendly and the food came out quick and hot. I had the bacon and avocado omelette which was great but the best part was that banana nut muffin to go which I ate later in the day and was still melt in your mouth good!

Seated right away on the patio even though it was busy. Our waitress was a gem..her name was Liza.  Very very friendly and attentive !!! I had the parfait...so good and my husband had a skillet..the hash browns are to die for

The waitress was really nice, and even suggested some dives to check out while visiting, and brought each 4 of us one of their banana nut muffins on the house. Not only was it a sweet gesture, the things MELT IN YOUR MOUTH. If this is how they hook you, so be it, they are AMAZING. 

Everyone was more than pleased with their order; I had the philly cheese steak, great meat to veggies ratio, very tasty, and their fries are killer. They put a little something special on them, my guess was season salt. 

For how expensive Vegas can be, this place offers a refreshing break!

The veggie Benny here is absolutely amazing but not as amazing as our server , Chance! She is probably one of the best servers ever . We will definitely be coming back because of our great experience and Chance's excellent service. 
Thanks Egg and I

Delicious  food. Excellent service. Affordable price. U must try the banana muffins. They are very moist and hot bake from the oven. Talking about it makes me want more. I'll definitely come back when I'm in Vegas.

We went there yesterday for brunch. First time there but not the last. The customer service was great and our waitress Chance was amazing and very very friendly. The food was out of this world and very big portion so if you don't eat much you might want to share or at least take a doggy bag home. So, while in Las Vegas stop by the egg and eye and enjoy a great meal.
This is a wonderful breakfast spot!!! The customer service is impeccable!! This place is always crowded but worth the wait.
Great egg, mushroom and cheese scramble.  Banana muffin yummy. Waitress, Janeen very bubbly!

We used to come years ago more often, but since we've moved to the NW I just seem to never be around this area when it is open so we made a trip to come eat here. 

So I saw they had loco moco on their menu which is something I wasn't expecting. I decided to order it anyways though I wasnt sure about ordering a item at a non Hawaiian spot. It was actually really good, even better than most of the fast food style Hawaiian places as everything tasted much fresher and the gravy had good flavor. 

The fiance got a apple walnut chicken sandwich which he seemed to enjoy. I took a bite and it's solid as far as cold chicken salad sandwiches go. 

The thing I like is they are always friendly here. I really liked our server as she was just chipper. 

It's always busy here so I avoid the peak times to not have to wait, but if you go later in the afternoon like we did, there's no one there. 1 hour wait for breakfast time or no wait for breakfast at lunch....I'll pick the no wait! 

It's been a long hiatus, but my next visit won't be so far off again.
Excellent! Service was great, food was awesome, lots of variety and great looking place. This is a great place to take your family to when in Las Vegas. Loved it truly deserves 5 stars!
This place was awesome for breakfast.  I'd go back to this restaurant.  Service was eggscellent!!!  Food awesome.

So today after a long days of work, my coworker and I stopped by the Egg and I. We were seated promptly and our waitress Reina greeted us and took our drink orders. In less than 30 seconds our server brought us our drinks. She talked to us as if we were friends and made us feel at home!!! Will be back specifically to this location just because of her service! Thank you Reina. If they don't send you Disney I will!!!!!

I wanted to try something new for breakfast. I had no idea where to go or what to eat. I came to Yelp like I normally do. Mostly everyone had something positive to say about this place, so my friend and I packed up and headed 15 minutes away to get some good breakfast.

When we arrived, we could tell that it was going to be a long wait and a headache. I sent my friend in, ahead of me, so that I could park. As soon as she walked in, she called me. She said that the place was a mess and she was going to have to come out and wait the 15 minutes it was going to take to be seated. Nevertheless, the hostess pointed out some empty benches, around the corner. So, I walked in to wait.

Upon entering, I was discouraged because a lot of people were standing around waiting. I just knew it was going to take 30+ minutes. Surprisingly, it only took 15 minutes before we were called and seated.

The place is really small and packed to capacity, so I was thankful that we got to sit around the corner where there were only about 4-5 tables. We had plenty space.

The server came around fast to take our drink order. She was quick to bring our drinks back too. She asked us if we were ready to order and we said, "No, we're looking at Yelp pictures and we need some more time." I did ask about the stuff French Toast dish that someone shared on Yelp. She smiled and pointed it out and said that it's a popular dish. Then she left and took orders for people that was around us.

As soon as she walked away, we decided what we wanted, but it took her about 6 minutes to make eye contact again. When she did stop back by, she asked if we were still looking at pictures or if we were ready to order. We went ahead and ordered. It totally slipped my mind to check in and get a free muffin for myself. The waitress said, "You were on Yelp, did you check in to get the free muffin?" I was happy she reminded me to do that.

She came back a couple minutes later and brought 2 muffins. I don't even like banana nut muffins but I took it anyways because it was free. I took a bite of it and fell in love. It was so warm and yummy lol. My friend got emotional lol. She said it reminded her of childhood, when her mother used to make them. They were just delicious.

About 12-15 minutes later, our food started to roll out. I order the Stuffed French Toast with eggs, cheese and sausage on it. It also came with seasoned potatoes. It looked incredible. My friend ordered the 2 pork chops that came with 2 eggs, the muffin, that she had already ate, and the seasoned potatoes. Her's looked delicious too.

I LOVE potatoes so I ate those first. I put ketchup all over them and had a ball. My friend didn't like hers, because they were kind of crunchy, so she gave them to me. I put ketchup on them and finished them off too lol.

Next, I started in on my French Toast sandwiches. I didn't like the sandwiches. The sausages, eggs and cheese didn't have much flavor. I thought I made a big mistake. Being that I'm so smart, I thought to scrape the sausages and eggs off the French toast and season the filling myself. I did, and it was 90% better. I ate the filling separately, and ever so often, I would dip the French Toast in the warm syrup that came with my food.

My friend said that the pork chops were Just okay. They were really thin, for sure. I don't know why, but we were expecting some big juicy chops vs the breakfast chops. I wanted to taste the chops for myself, so she took a bite of mine and I took a bite of hers. They tasted as if onions were the main and secondary seasoning. She was right. They were just okay. She did enjoy my mixture of filling and seasoning though.

The good thing is, we got really full and still had a bunch of food left. I'm sure it has something to do with a humongous portion of potatoes we got and the muffin we were served in the beginning.

The service was like a 3/5 because there was a little piece of hair in my water when the server dropped it off. I asked for another one and she just stared at my full cup for like 10 seconds. I guess she couldn't understand my reason behind needing another one. I didn't even mention it because it wasn't a big deal and I didn't want anyone to make a big deal over water.

But also, I took some points off service, because it took my sever a long time to refill my water, once I had actually finished it. It took her maybe 4 or 5 minutes to check on us, after we finished eating too. We just wanted a box to pack up leftovers. When she did stop back by, we asked for the box, she quickly picked one up, dropped it off and walked away. She came back around maybe 3 or 4 minutes later and told us to pay upfront. We were just sitting there, waiting for her to come back by so that we could pay and leave. I'm glad she did stop back by because we probably would have been sitting there for a while.

Although I'm in love with the potatoes and muffins, I probably won't go back because the rest of the food was just average.
I love this place !! Delicious food , and our server Tamara was exceptional! She was a sweetheart and We will definitely be coming here again next time we come to Vegas !
Great food! Excellent service! Linnea was so helpful with the menu and made sure our whole dining experience went well.

Recommendation from my sister,  even though she's never been.  Went for breakfast in Saturday morning and it was a 15 min wait at 9:30 am.  Within 15 min the wait turned into 30-45 min wait.  So if you're going to check this place out come early.  First time?  No problem, you get a warm banana nut muffin. Regular, check in with yelp and get a free muffin. Lots to choose from. The portions are big enough that you can share with someone else.  Shane was our waiter ABC be was so nice! He recommended the rib eye benedict. So good!  It comes with home potatoes that are seasoned to perfection. The Mexican Crepe (made out of eggs) is pretty good to.  My boyfriend and I shared the rib eye benedict and the biscuits and gravy. Come on an empty stomach, trust me. Prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly and eager to make your experience a pleasant one.  This one is definitely going  in my book as one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas for breakfast!

In search of that last good meal before heading back to California, I decided to give The Egg and I a try due to recommendation of a family member.  Yes there were people waiting outside to eat due to this place being so popular for breakfast.  The wait was 15 minutes which wasn't that bad.  I tried the waffle works, which consisted of a huge Belgian waffle with 2 pieces of bacon and 2 eggs.  I did request whipped cream on the waffle, which made it taste even better.  The waffle was huge.  I enjoyed every bite.  The portions were very generous for the price.  Worth every penny.  The server Lindsey was wonderful and made sure I had the meal of a lifetime.  

     The Egg and I taught me a lesson that the best places to eat are not always on the Strip or Downtown Las Vegas.  There are good places to eat all over Las Vegas and you have to dig deep into your soul for the best food possible.  The Egg and I has a small town feel to it which provides an intimate dining experience.  This is one of the few places in Las Vegas you can eat at everyday and not get tired of it but wouldn't do so simply due to the fact that you don't want to spoil yourself.  This will become my new go-to spot in need of a good breakfast while visiting.  As far as the food quality and atmosphere goes. the Egg and I destroys Denny's and IHOP by all leaps and bounds imaginable.

I ate the Chicken fried steak and tasted the homemade corn beef hash. Both dishes were good and reasonably priced.  The potatoes seasoning was too salty for me to eat more than a few bites. The seasoning resembles Lawrey's seasoning salt and just overpowered the crispy potatoes.

Food:
We had the fender bender crepe and the strawberry cream french toast. Both were pretty good. I was not too into the bean sprouts in the crepe. We both thought the french toast was too sweet and started to wear on you haha.

Service:
Our waitress was awesome. We got a seat outside but it was about 95 degrees outside. I asked if she could move us inside and she did without any issues, and it was pretty busy that day. After that she was all smiles and our coffee was consistently full.

This is my second visit; the first one was 5 years ago. The food and service are still as good as I remember. The choices here are endless so it's hard not to find something you'd fancy. I had the Country Fried Steak with 2 sunnyside up's, and polished almost everything except a small portion of the potatoes. If I had to point out anything, I would wish for some veggies on the plate.
