Three of us came here after a night of partying in Vegas.  One of my friends found Egg & I on yelp, so we tried it out.  I had the chicken fried steak. My gf had a stuffed French toast with ham and my friend had an omelette.  Everything tasted perfect!  I would highly recommend this place, and we will definitely come back, the next time we are in Vegas!

Total breakfast fan here and this is one of the few in Las Vegas that truly does breakfast right.  Prices are pretty good and there are always coupons to be had.  Love the Pumpkin banana pancakes and Carrot Cake french toast in the fall!

Recently ate breakfast here on a Sunday morning in mid Oct '13.

Wait : 20 mins for 2 patrons at 10:30am. : 3 stars
Dining room : simplistic but acceptable appointments (furniture, wall decor) : 3 stars
Menu choices:  plenty of options, and menu was easy to read : 4 stars

Food : my party ordered :
breakfast burrito - 5 stars, 
pancakes - 5 stars, 
scrambled eggs - 4 stars, 
bacon - 3 stars, 
'work' potatoes - 4 stars, 
fruit plate - 4 stars

Value : reasonable prices for quality of food, good prices for quantity of food

Summary :
I enjoyed my visit and would visit again.

One of the best place to eat breakfast or brunch in Vegas. Foods are great price and taste really good. They have a lot of servers so they don't drag you down. Paula was our server and she gave us great service!!

The best thing is the Banana Nut Muffin! OMG it is TO DIE FOR! How good is it you ask?  My sister made me bring it back to San Diego for her on a business trip! I had to lug the goodness in the car all the way back to OC and then back down to SD! See the love for the muffin and for the sister! I delivered a muffin from so freaking far! lol

Yes, it is THAT GOOD! I still think about it that I drool and want to drive to Vegas again just for it! lol The muffin top is flat so more chewy crisp surface area.  We all know that is the best part! 

Here are the dishes I recommend.  I have had a bunch of different ones but I only order the Piggy Skillet.  It's the best of all the meat worlds! They put Crisp Bacon, Diced Ham, Pork Sausage, Potatoes, Cheese, and Eggs.. how can you go wrong! Mmmmm meaty cheesy goodness! Yes you can easily make this at home but I want the muffins! lol

The Chicken Enchilada Omelette is pretty good too.  The chicken inside is tender and flavorful paired with all the condiments on top.  All the dishes are huge and plentiful.  I can never finish it, but that can also be that I scarf down as many muffins on the table and more! lol Still the food is pretty good and the seasoned potatoes are delicious! ^_^ Yum Yum.

If you are ever in Vegas, be sure to come try it out.  I think the design of the place is cute too, very wholesome! I like the mom and pop feel with cute sweet servers that are very attentive.  I have been back many times since and will keep coming back! Muffins!!! O=p
Great service! I didnt like the waffle and the wattress took it off my check. The seasoned potatoes is a must have!
If you're looking for a good hearty breakfast, come here ! Linnea was our server and she was very attentive. I'm from California and every time I come to LV, I'll definitely come here for breakfast.

Yes, being in Vegas you would think the best places to eat would be on the famous strip. However, I've found that the restaurants worth pilgrimaging to are actually on the outskirts of the strip! I can't help it, I like to eat like a local. Being a breakfast/brunch fanatic I figured I'd look to Yelp to find a breakfast spot with big portions that won't break the wallet! I found Egg & I as one of the best places to go to for brunch so I thought I'd give it a shot. 

The ambiance has a small-town diner feel to it which I loved! The menu had way too many amazing options which made it difficult to decide what to eat. I chose to get the eggs benedict while the boyfriend had the country benny, both which were AMAZING! The portions were huge, the gravy is perfectly made, the banana nut muffin is to die for, and the staff is always friendly and pleasant. Now this is our "go to" brunch place to eat on Sundays before we make the long trek back to California. This place is a MUST!
Found this place driving through to Utah. We had a party of 17 and everyone loved their breakfast. The food and service were awesome. This will be our new go to breakfast spot while in Vegas
My new favorite breakfast in vegas!  Country fried steak was awesome!  The potatoes and muffin were very good!!

I don't get it.... I thought the food sucked. The people weren't very nice and the food was mediocre at best. Yeah the banana nut muffin was ok but not like wow! The seasoned potatoes were kinda nasty. I like season salt on my fries but theirs was GROSS!  Maybe I just didn't want breakfast that day... I do try to have a rule to try a place out 2x before I say no completely. I just don't think I will be trying it soon.
Our server Linnea was awesome and so patient, she answered all our questions. The corn beef hash is also amazing.

Great place for breakfast and the price is just right.  Plenty of parking since it is away from the strip.  Dining area is immaculate and bright.  Servers are always hanging smile on their face.  They are friendly and attentive, always give you suggestion if you have a hard time to choose your breakfast.  Food serve hot and they are very home-made.  Portion is good and they are not too greasy for my taste.

Their menu is printed on a newspaper, very creative and interesting.
Dariesia is a great server!! We loved her!! Food is amazing!! My husband and I both had The Classic- sausage and eggs with potatoes and toast. This place is highly recommended and we will be back!!
The beef burrito was perfect for the Vegas hangover. Our server, Earl kindly answered our questions and served us quickly.
We had Ashley. We had an awesome experience. She made sure everything was taken care of in a timely manner.
This will be your little secret breakfast restaurant. It's amazing. Try the steak and eggs. If you get a waffle get it with whipped cream and fruit

Had time for breakfast before leaving Vegas and decided to give this place a try!

The food alone I would rate a 4 but the overall experience was easily a 5.

We had the beef hash, eggs Benedict florentine, New York steak, and veggie omelette.
Nothing really to note on each item, all were satisfying and enough to fill us up.

We were seated immediately upon arrival.
Our waitress took our drink orders and came back quickly to take the rest.

Food was prompt and I was asked right before the food was brought out if I would like Tabasco or any other sauces with my food. I did.

Oh. And they gave us an extra banana nut muffin because only 3 of our meals came with one. (Party of 4)

Great experience! Will return

This place use to be one of the best places for breakfast, but while in Vegas decided to take my husband and he wasn't really impressed by the food and neither was i. In the past the food was hot and good, instead we got warm potatoes that had way to much seasoning salt on them cold sausage and banana nut muffin that tasted like cardboard. So my question is what has happen to this place.......SMH
Food was super good, had a very good waitress, very polite, and generous. First time going, definitely get the banana muffin

This restaurant has great food. I had the New York steak and eggs with their special potatoes. It was great and I also enjoyed the banana nut muffin. Will definitely stop in again next time I'm  in Vegas. Our server Ashley did a great job.

With over 2,000 reviews and nearly 5 star rating, I'm not sure there's much more I could say that hasn't already been stated by others but I tell you what, this place is truly worthy of the raves and ratings. 

Located about two miles passed Palace Station casino off Sahara Ave, The Egg & I is a wonderful breakfast/brunch place that is continuously packed. The service is quick, efficient and friendly. Our server Perry was right there ready to take our orders and food arrived shortly afterwards. 

We had the prime rib benny, grandma's biscuits and gravy, corned beef hash and Island Favorite. Everything was delicious but I found the benny to be a bit salty for my preference....the banana nut muffin was sooo good and moist. I highly recommend this place and will be back here the next time I come to Vegas.

I'm not sure why I haven't written a review before today, I've been here like hundreds of times.

I will say that there are a few things this visit that I wasn't too pleased with though. I ordered a classic 2 egg breakfast with a side of salsa and unfortunately they changed the salsa.

It's not the same they use to make and I'm not sure why they did that. This new salsa they use is just down right yucky tasting.

Also when I've ordered eggs here before they usually scramble them soft and this time they were kinda dry. 

Maybe this visit was just a slip up so I'm looking forward to coming here again and giving them another try.

Let's review. Two days in a row. Two different items off the menu. Two reasons to smile. Janeen was great and attentive BOTH days as well! Can't wait to come back for some more banana nut muffins either! Everything is so fresh and delectable. I could seriously try anything on the menu and go home happy.  Hopefully I'll be back in a couple of weeks!

So I found this great little restaurant on Yelp during one of our many Vegas trips and I have to say that I am in love with the french toast sandwich!!!! I'm a huge fan of savory and sweet and this place nailed it to the wall!! Great place to have breakfast after dancing the night away on the Las Vegas strip! I just wish I lived closer because the food here is amaziiiiing and totally crave-worthy!

The husband and I were in town for the weekend looking for a good spot to have breakfast at. Good thing I looked up on yelp first because it was so good!! I had the chile relleno omelette with the works potatoes on the side and it was very good. The husband had the works omelette and it was tasty as well. If your in town try this place out. We will definitely be coming again when we are back in the area visiting. It was packed but all worth the wait!!
Our server was Alexa ! It was our first time here what can I say DELICIOUS the potatoes  were perfect definitely coming back again on my next trip to Las Vegas
The food was fantastic, and Alexa, our server was fantastic as well.  We had a great experience.  The reviews on Yelp led us in the right direction.

For the hungry, this place serves up the nice sized portion.  For the picky, the food tastes great.  For those who like flexibility, these guys entertain reasonable substitutions!  

I just happened by this place on a Saturday morning.  There was a 15-20 minute wait for a table, which can be an annoyance, or it can be an excellent endorsement for patience.  My wife had a four-egg multi-cheese omelette, and tiny as she is, she ate every bit, washing it down with coffee (that was attentively refilled!).  It came with choice of potatoes and a super-delicious muffin.  I had a specialty omelette that was filled with spicy veggies and cheese.  When it came time to kick the spuds to the side, the waitress offered fruit, tomatoes, or fruit and tomatoes!  The fruit was chosen, fresh, sliced, and nicely arranged.  I had the coffee too, and the waitress was never stingy when more creamers were requested.  Such good service.  I can see why this place has people waiting for a seat.

This place has the best egg-dish menu I've ever seen.  The price of most dishes is in the $10.00 or less range.  They have plasma TV's strategically placed on walls, so you can watch sports if the conversation crashes.  It's all good. This is the best non-buffet breakfast I've had in Las Vegas.

Amazing food and service. Probably the best I've tried. A true all timer.

Earl, hope you get to meet Mickey Mouse soon. Lol

Confirmed: the banana nut bread was AMAZING!  Buttered it up and inhaled it in about 2 seconds flat..........ok a bit of an exaggeration, lets call it 20 seconds.  Had one of their scrambles and it was pretty darn good too.  Would have given 5 stars, but the one thing missing from this place...........is character.  Like alot of other really good breakfast places, it is located in a strip mall.  Food is still great, location not so much.
The Egg and I is one of our favorite places to come to every time we come to Vegas. The banana bread is the best.  Erin was very helpful and attentive.

This used to be our go-to place for breakfast when we hit Las Vegas.  For some reason, we started eating more on the strip.  But this morning we happen to be passing and decided to renew acquaintances.  Why did we ever stop going there for breakfast?  All menu items are well prepared.  The omelettes are huge.  My wife orders the toast and I the muffin, then we share.  Good coffee and plenty of it.  

You always leave with the warm glow of a great breakfast and the entire bill is less than a normal tip  for a Strip breakfast.

Thought this place was great...favorite thing was definitely the free muffin we got for checking in on Yelp! I also had the corned beef hash which was really good. Service was great and I overall would love to visit this place again!

It is so good this is the second time I've been here since Las Vegas services and they are very attentive they always come back to your table and make sure that you're good, the food is really good. The atmosphere is nice and cool inside it's an all-around good place where you should bring your family

We came in on a crowded Sunday morning, but the wait for 2 was only 20 minutes. Service by Karla was phenomenal. She refilled my iced tea 3x without me needing to ask. Had the waffles with whipped cream and blueberries but the best part was the link sausage. Perfect amount to flavoring. Definitely will return to Egg & I on our next Vegas trip!
Had the veggie benedict and the biscuit and gravy. Perhaps we ordered the wrong this. I was not impressed with the quality of the ingredients or the way they were put together.

Most amazing breakfast restaurant. My boyfriend and I are in Vegas for a much needed vacation and this restaurant was awesome. We love going to local hole-in-the-wall breakfast places when traveling and this was the best we have ever had. This was due in no small part to the service. Roman is an excellent waiter who can anticipate guests needs. Awesome food did not hurt either! The potatoes are incredible! Looking forward to trying the banana nut muffins.

I am really big into customer service and everyone here hits that out of the park. I do come here quite frequently and it never fails that I get excellent customer service. 
I always get a coffee with only Carmel Macchiato creamer. (The waitresses never have a problem with my requests, by the way ask for Bre she's the best!) Than I always get the half order of chicken, broccoli, mushroom skillet, its awesome that they offer half orders because there proportions are already huge! They have awesome skillets!!! I also get a side of sourdough bread with apple jelly (once again the staff always gets it to me in a respectful manner)  
I don't have anything negative to say about Egg & I. I want to say thank you to this AMAZING staff. I truly feel like home there!
Great food with big portions! Very friendly stuff, Amanda was amazing! Just perfect, we loved it!!!
The wait time was not bad at all, Sunday morning only about 15 min. The staff was super friendly. Get the muffin.  My omelet was ok.

vegas breakfast?..afternoon flights and up early...last meal for some...egg & i extra large breakfast platters...enormous sizes...literally mountain of potato cubes with heavy seasoning salt sprinkling...a brad's special...eggs, spinach and meats loaded and large...hungry?...egg & i will deliver a tummy expanding plate for $ten...comforting homely interiors...casual diner atmosphere...friendly service...

Awesome food and great service. The food was a little slow to come out, but we were advised of that by our waitress... I loved my Chicken Fried Steak a lot, the gravy was very delicious. My partner's omelette was also delicious. The Diablo potatoes are crispy and flavorful. I will definitely eat here again and again...

This is currently my favorite place for breakfast in town and I have a feeling it will stay that way! They have a huge menu and I want to come back many times to try all of the tasty-looking options.

I had a gigantic omelet full of avocado and bacon. It doesn't get any richer or more fattening than that but it's okay because there's no way I could have finished that thing (despite its yumminess). My husband got this ridiculous stuffed French toast monstrosity- stuffed not with marscapone cheese, or some fruity filling, or whatever else you'd expect French toast to be stuffed with, but with eggs and sausage! It was hugely filling but delicious.

They have good coffee, too, and the prices are right, and the heavily seasoned potatoes are probably loaded with sodium but who cares because they're delicious.
I don't recommend the steak & eggs.  Tell them it's your first time and they will  give you s free banana bread muffins.  It is so good.
Our server Maggie was awesome as so was the food. This is one of our favorite places to eat.

The Egg's Benedict Florentine is a great breakfast to start your day with. They have several TV's on during the morning, with the volume turned down and closed captioning turned on so you can still catch the news.

Went back...nothing changed but the service!! TOP NOTCH! The servers were super friendly and our food came out withing minutes....yummy as it gets for cheap...fast and big portions. Please try the french toast sandwhich with eggs and bacon!!

The Veggie Skillet! A meal for 3! Everything made to perfection! Meal hot, cooked to your liking, eggs over easy!  Expect a wait, but we walked up the street to Starbucks, walked back & were called to sit down. Lots of parking!

I ate at this place yesterday before heading back to San Diego and had the best Chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes ever!  Okay, maybe they were the only ones I've ever tried, but still, I thought the pancakes were great, yet maybe a little on the sweet side.  I had no idea that this place was going to be so popular and after eating there I know why.  The staff was pretty friendly as well.  I wouldn't mind coming back to this establishment for breakfast next time I am in Vegas.

This place was so good and totally unexpected! They have gluten free options and are aware of how to prevent cross contamination which is ALWAYS so helpful! I had their chili relleno omelette and my fiancé had the stuffed French toast. The only bummer was that they did not serve mimosas and bloody Mary's.
4.5 . Got seated immediately for a party of 3 at 12:30 on a Sunday. Awesome service, unlimited coffee, attentive waitress, yummy eggs, warm toast. Exactly what you need for breakfast! I'm a fan!!

Went to breakfast this morning and everything was fantastic.  I had the Brads scramble and my husband had an omelette with mashed potatoes and bacon.  They were both AMAZING.  The coffee was good and the server was friendly and engaging.  We couldn't have asked for anything more.

I haven't been to an Egg & I/Egg Works since I was in Arizona back in '07.  I love this place!!   It's one of those bfast places where there are mugs on the table and the server brings you a giant pot of coffee and leaves it with you at your disposal.  There were different types of pre-packaged cream and sugars, including hot sauces, ketchup, and a little egg sign which you can flip over if you need servicing.  Not as ingenious as the button at Korean bbq places, but it works!

Most entrees come with a side of toast or homemade banana nut muffin.  I'm not a big fan of banana nut but my god, theirs is just divine. Spongey, soft, moist, slightly sweet and with just the perfect flavor of fresh banana flavor and a little hint of crunch from the nuts.  The nuts aren't bitter either, as some walnuts can be and it was just pure perfection.

BH and I went a little buckwild (as we always do) and we ordered three dishes: eggs benedict florentine, a half order of corned beef hash, and the stuffed french toast with eggs and bacon.  The benedict was awesome and was smothered in creamy hollandaise sauce.  The eggs were soft and runny but the English muffin was still crispy and chewy.  The stuffed french toast was pretty good.  BH gobbled up the entire plate whereas I had just a bite or two.  I thought there was too much egg and not enough bacon, but BH told me it was great with maple syrup.  I like sweet meats and breads, but I haven't gotten accustomed to sweet scrambled eggs yet, so I never tried it dipped in sticky sweet maple. Finally, the corned beef hash was very fresh and I could definitely tell it was homemade and not from a can.  The chunks of potato were creamy and starchy while the chunks of meat were flavorful, salty, and a little reminiscent of dog food (but in a good way).  The over easy egg on top made it even more delectable.

Finally, one of the best parts of the meal, besides the banana nut muffin, were their ranch potatoes.  They are roasted to a perfect crunch and seasoned with some sort of red powder - possibly paprika for a bit of smokiness?  They were so damn good, that even past my stuffing point, I kept stabbing at the potatoes so I could get every last bit in my mouth.  Needless to say, BH  and I were nearly bursting by the time we left Egg & I.  I call that a sign of good breakfast and a good start to a day.

Service is always awesome!! Generous portions and down home feel.  Bomb greasy hangover food thats cheap.  They are not skimpy with the CHEESE or the AVOCADO which I love... And i like their cheesy nicknames.  I always try to go when I'm in da big LV.  Be careful if you are staying on the strip and catching a cab there.  They will take some EXTRA long roads.  Its actually easy to take the bus there if you are riding the deuce its free to get on bus.

All hype? We waited a good 15-20 minutes for a table of 4 on a Saturday, and were all less than blown away by each of our meals. Darn.

The traditional eggs benedict was simply drowning in a very creamy and underwhelming hollandaise sauce and tasted like a somewhat soggy mess. Unappetizing.

The sunrise mountain, which was a croissant underneath scrambled eggs with bacon and cheese, didn't taste too spectacular either and can probably be easily duplicated at home. It looked better than it tasted.

The potatoes, on the other hand, were seasoned well and tasty. Probably the highlight of our dishes.

Service was very friendly and attentive, and once you get your check, you can go up to the front register to pay and split checks as you please.
Good food. Great service. Our server Chance was the best. The banana bread is a must. Also the chicken fried steak

Delicious! 

Veggie skillet had seasoned potatoes on bottom, then veggies, topped with cheese and egg. I would've used red onions instead of white but still delicious. 

The banana nut muffin was great too.

By far THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACE so far in my life! Very simple & great service! The waffles w fresh fruit was phenomenal & biscuits & gravy - don't get me started! I don't know why this place isn't 5-stars on Yelp! It's probably because of losers or snobs who just want to make a statement. If I could I would give it 6-stars!!   I've been to breakfast places all over the country and this place is THE BEST!  "Johnathan" was awesome!!! Hope I'll see him in Disneyland! Cheers to the owners of this place, they know breakfast! :)

The Egg and I was good but unless you have a car, not worth the trip off the strip.     Perhaps we were spoiled by our visit to Hash House a Go Go earlier in our visit but the Egg and I was a bit disappointing after all the good reviews that we've read.

The banana nut muffin is worth a try and the omlets and skillets were good but definitely nothing special.    As others have noted, the potatoes in the skillet were very salty and definitely not the highlight of the meal.
Loved this place! The french toast favorite stuffed with egg scramble was BOMB. Good portion and worth my dollar. I would definitely go again!

First time here and it was great. It gets extremely packed but we (2) were seated within 15 minutes. I had the HALF order of the veggie skillet and it was HUGE and delicious. Hubby had the enchilada omelette. They give you huge portions. Our bill was $21 and change. So cheap and delicious.  
Its in a shopping center off the strip. 
Must try their muffin! Amazinggggg
Will def  be back next time we are in town.

Great breakfast spots are my favorite and this is one of the best I've ever found, thanks to YELP.  One of the most innovative breakfast menu's I've seen and particularly impressive is the ability to execute so many offerings to perfection.  Service was outstanding, our waitress, Jessica, was fast and efficient.  

The feature here is undoubtedly their banana nut muffins.  They were excellent, rivaling the best homemade I've ever tasted.  What amazed me is how they can produce as many as they have to do to supply this very busy and fairly large restaurant.   They were warm and obviously very fresh and tasted as good as most any homemade.  They have a slight gingerbread taste to them so I suspect molasses is a part of the recipe.   I know how much work they are to make homemade which is why I really admire their dedication to featuring this treat.    The food was really good as well, because they wouldn't earn any points from my son who doesn't eat anything with bananas in it.  I feel my opinion was well founded and based on a total of three banana muffins- mine, my son's, and a free one as a YELP check-in bonus.  I carried two out and enjoyed them later in the day.

I had the three little pigs omelet which was great.  The potatoes were done to perfection- crisp on the outside, evenly done throughout with a nice seasoning on the outside.  My son had a western omelet with tomatoes substituted for the potatoes.  A nice patio is outside with misters to help battle the Vegas temps and low humidity.

It's no question this is a premier spot to enjoy a wonderful breakfast in Las Vegas with just a little drive from the downtown strip.

My sister and I had been pretty excited about coming here after reading all about it on Yelp.  It seemed to be really busy with lots of people waiting outside (on a Sunday afternoon), but we luckily only had to wait about 10 minutes before we were seated.  

Our server was super nice.  She really helped elevate the entire experience.  When we asked for banana nut muffins to go with our entrees, she asked if it was our first time there.  We told her yes and she said the muffins were free for first timers!  Hope that's true and I'm not getting anyone in trouble by posting that info here.  

I ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine & it came with those little (obviously frozen) and highly seasoned potatoes.  Overall I enjoyed the dish, but there was so much Hollandaise sauce that the English muffin got pretty soggy and the ham was really quite bad.  It was cut in thick slices and was very rubbery.  It almost tasted canned or something.  I took the ham off and it was much better that way.  However, the whole thing was a runny, saucy mess.  The poached eggs were cooked perfectly though.  My sister unfortunately didn't enjoy her blueberry pancakes too much.  This might sound strange, but they were way too fluffy for both of us & just didn't taste that great.  We both loved the muffins though.  That very well may have been the best part of the whole meal.  

Despite the rubbery ham, I'd definitely come back.  The service was excellent and I feel confident that we'll both be able to find other dishes on the menu that suit us better.  Plus.... those banana nut muffins!  You'd be a fool not to try one.

Mother's Day, 10:00 AM, people all over outside... They tell us our wait will only be 20-25 minutes, and for once, a busy place didn't lie. We were seated within 20 minutes, got our asked for drink orders immediately upon being seated, and waitress took our orders as soon as we were ready.

We went to breakfast because my dad loves breakfast (and so do I, but not as much as him). He got the biscuits and gravy meal (as he does at most places). I got stuffed french toast, which means eggs, meat, and cheese inside.

I ate past the point of being full, while still leaving a little on the plate, and my dad finished his pretty quickly because it was so good. He said as we were walking to the car, "That's about as good of a breakfast as I've ever eaten." That's a top-level compliment that he doesn't use lightly.

It's about $8-10 for most meals, service is great, food is even better.

On our last morning in Vegas, we decided to have an American breakfast and found Egg and I on Yelp (of course!).

I had the pancakes, bacon, and eggs combination (around $7.00) and my friend had the eggs, muffin, and potatoes combination (@ $6.75).  Both were excellent and the vibe here really brightens your day.  The people working are cheery, friendly, and serve your quick and come back when you're not happy.  How do they know when you're not happy?  Well, you turn the egg over to the unhappy face!!! haha.  great customer service!

I enjoyed my breakfast here and all the way into the parking lot until Jeff Rose (of Boston, MA) backed into our car and left a dent.  sad face!  We got the car fixed, but so far Jeff has not responded and looks like Jeff's going to bail on paying for an accident that was his fault.

Xie Xie!!
Aloha! Spam and eggs in Las Vegas! Very nice restaurant. Good food and service. Located very near to the strip.

At Egg and I.  My 3rd time here.   The service is great.   Better than the strip restaurants.   Brady has good timing and was attentive.  When I go to Vegas I always go there on Sunday morning before the painful drive back to Cali.

I'll recommend anyone that is willing to venture off the strip to go there.

Eggcellent! We've been twice and enjoyed every bit of this great breakfast place! The place is packed and there is always a wait, but 15 minutes of my time is fine by me as long as I am going to enjoy the food. If you know my reviewing you will see that service, and location are not heavy factors in my rating. I am a total foody, so what is most important is the taste, the quality, and selection of foods offered. What I ordered this time was the Bandito omelette, I enjoyed it. The last time I ordered the Chile relleno omelette, it was delicious! I liked it more than the Bandito. it came with a banana but muffin, which I finished even I told myself to fight the temptation. my kids ordered the strawberry stuffed French toast, I forget the name of it but it was stuffed with cream cheese and strawberries. they wanted to lick the plate. When we go to Vegas we won't have to think twice about it, we will be there.

Breeanda, is a wonderful and the most ever best waitress I ever seen and met in a long time here in Las Vegas. This was my first time in the egg and I and well I have to say, the service was so amazing that Disneyland should have an egg and I too! My and I ordered the Hoele Loco. Let me tell you something it was Delicious and Tropical and FULL OF AWESOMENESS! !!!! Felt like Hawaii came to my mouth and give it a big kiss!!!! The dish is $9.25 and hey you get eggs and a hamburger patty on top of rice and toast and a pineapple.... what kind of deal is that. .... great huh? Just a reminder the portion are HUGE!!!! So, come over with a BIG APPETITE to the EGG AND I! !!!! Take it from me,  you will not be disappointed!
What a cute little resturant. Great food, great service! Oscar was our waiter great server and free banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp!
The place is okay. The potatoes are way over-seasoned...ruined them. Guess I should be glad, saved me calories.
Great service, decent biscuits and gravy. But I wasn't quite as impressed by the experience as I was led by friends to think I would be. I think I prefer Cracker Barrel.
AMAZING!!! We got the chicken enchilada omelette and the carnitas breakfast tostada and of course their banana nut muffins, holy heaven so good!! DO NOT SKIP THIS PLACE!! and KARLA was the BEST!!
The stuffed French toast was amazing! 2 massive pieces with 4 eggs in each one. Big portion at a good price. Banana Nut muffins to die for. Came after breakfast so there was no wait.

The food and service here are amazing! Even though it looks like it may be a long wait--it isn't! The place is large and worth the wait anyway! Their muffins are fresh baked and their food is delicious! Also, I love their happy egg/sad egg to get the server's attention--genius! And did I mention wonderful service? Highly recommended!

Thank you Earl for fantastic service! Food was delicious and plentiful . Our group also appreciated the affordability since we are budget conscious travelers highly recommend to anyone looking for "a locals best breakfast"

Great breakfast! I always struggle to find a breakfast meal that is healthy and not drowning in cooking oil like most omelette/egg restaurants. I had the veggie Benedict and it was delicious! Fresh spinach, sliced tomato and a perfectly ripe avocado..Jessica our server was great and I hope she wins the trip to Disney!

Egg & I, Good food and great service!  I can't ask for more.  I'm not sure if this is a mom & pop store, but it definitely felt like one.  When my party and I got there at 1pm on a Saturday, we didn't have much of a wait.  The portions were big enough to share.  Ambiance is diner style, but neater.  I love the fact that they have a yellow & black egg attention sign on each table so you won't need to wave down a waitress.  I left very satisfied and I intend on going back whenever I am in town again.

This place was so good. They have a wide variety of options, but went for breakfast based off the name alone. I got the Eggs Benedict Florentine. It comes with the crispest seasoned potatoes.  FYI. The portions are really big. I wish I knew that before I went here. I left so full but happy !

I haven't been here since 2011. Service and food is still excellent.
My server REINA took great care of us. Thank you!

We ordered an pork chop hash with two eggs portion, and a chile relleno omelette. The portions are VERY BIG! Everything was good. I loved my omelette. Maybe next time we will try something else more spectacular! I definitely recommend the banana muffins, they were the best muffins I've ever had in my whole life!!

In Vegas it's hard to find somewhere that feels like home. This place seems to specialize in doing just that. Away from the hustle and bustle of the strip is a huge plus. Greeted as soon as we walked in with a smile. For a small place the menu is large and diverse. I didn't know you could do all that with eggs. Reina was friendly and genuinely gratefully that we chose her establishment for breakfast. The food was fantastic! Exactly what we ordered, even with my dietary restrictions. Will we return in the future? With everything to do in Vegas, this place is a must do as well!

Our meal at Egg & I was the saving grace of our Vegas trip. Although when we pulled up I was doubtful, I held faith in my Yelp brethren--and I'm so glad I did. We were seated immediately for a group of 5 at 1pm on a Sunday, but that was just luck as it was a full house. 

The menu is huge and a little overwhelming because there are so many options, but I finally settled on the Huevos Rancheros with carnitas, both sauces, and breakfast potatoes. I also used the Yelp check-in for a free banana nut muffin, and she kindly brought one for each of us at the table! The muffin is so moist--we're talking stick to your fingers moist. Our meal came relatively quickly and there was silence among the table as we all dug in. The huevos rancheros were probably among the best I've ever had. It came with so much carnitas and melted cheese--it was exactly what we needed after two days of Vegas, if you catch my drift. I was wary of the breakfast potatoes initally; I'm a hash browns girl precisely because breakfast potatoes are often underseasoned. Not the case here in the slightest. Each nugget was a little crispy, but soft on the inside and packed tons of flavor. The portions are huge though, so keep in mind when you're ordering! I split the huevos rancheros and it was more than enough for two!

My friend got the chocolate chip pancakes and they were also very delicious, but super thick and rich so not what my dehydrated body was in the mood for. Gimme dat salt!

Right before we left we were commenting on how good the muffins were, and she brought us two to go in a box because they were about to close up for the day and they make them fresh every morning. I will definitely keep this place in mind next time I'm looking for brunch in Vegas!

Fabulous place to have breakfast. We are eggterians and wanted break from food at the strip. This place was so refreshing. Very welcoming staff, great selection (menu has so many items), good quantity and fresh food.  Kids loved the place!

It definitely made our day!

Every time we go to Vegas we have at least one meal at the Egg and I.  The best breakfast joint in town.

They have this chicken enchilada omelette made of eggs, chicken, green chiles and cheese.  It takes EXACTLY like a chicken enchilada... you can't even tell it has eggs in it.  Damn good.

My last visit I had the pork chops and eggs, and my stomach wasn't even upset during the drive home.

I'm a biggggg fan of breakfast! This place is so so so so good! Went to Vegas for the weekend and we wanted to stop by for breakfast and we are so glad we found this place! Their signature muffin is out of this world good!! And this is coming from a person that doesn't like bread, cake, or most things that have some type of bread. I'll be going in May again to Vegas and we will defitnelty come here again!
Breakfast here was great. Eggs over easy cooked just right and the biscuits and gravy were tasety. Chance, our waitress was funny and attentive.

If you're looking for a cheaper breakfast option off the Strip, I'd definitely recommend coming here! Call ahead of time, to see how long the wait is. They usually seat people fast, but because it is SO good, you should definitely expect to wait. 

I'm so glad I took a group of 10 of my girlfriends here at the end of our Vegas trip. The portions were humungous and I had to challenge myself to finish my plate. Yes, the banana nut muffins do live up to its hype!! So delicious and so fresh. Most plates actually come with the banana nut muffin as an option, but they'll give you another one if you check in!

Their menu is EXTENSIVE. So if you are an indecisive person like I am, it'd probably help kill your wait time if you take a look at that menu to decide what you want! They offer breakfast sandwiches, french toast, egg bennys, OMELETTES, specialties, and more. I went for the chile relleno omelette and I'm SO glad I did! It wasn't too saucy and the sauce they offer is super good. Their POTATOES. SO GOOD. Thank god they let me get half potatoes half fruit, because the full portion of potatoes is HUGE! 

My girlfriends and I all ordered different items on everyone enjoyed their meal :) I would say you probably can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Definitely coming again to end a Vegas trip. 

Service is great. The interior decor is super cute. Very family friendly!

I spent $15 including tip for a HUGE breakfast so, yes, I'd say this is a very good breakfast deal located off the strip!
Curtis was a great & attentive server!! Food was delicious. Our dishes so good!! We'll be back!!
Above all the service and staff were amazing! The food wasn't shabby either;) our server Sunshine brightened our morning up! And the outside patio is dog friendly!

Large plates! The corned beef hash was really something. Coffee was a bit pricey but the staff were friendly and the food came out faster than i expected. Should definitely eat here at least once if youre staying in the area.

I was immediately sat down by the host. This restaurant normally is very busy and wait times can be up to 30 minutes but it is well worth the wait! My dining experience was nothing short of amazing by Perry. He was very patient and willing to help me choose the best plate on the menu that suited me. I chose to go with The Classic. First, Perry brought me out this FRESHLY BAKED, OUT OF THE OVEN Banana Nut Muffin. By far, the best muffin you could taste at such a great establishment. Also the entree plate was huge when Perry brought it out to me. I ate every bite and Perry smiled at me asking if I enjoyed my meal.

If you have read this far, hopefully you are waiting for your food. You won't be disappointed!

Egg and I is truly delicious! The banana muffin is a must try and you really can't got wrong with anything you order. When you come ask to be seated with Tamara, she is exceptional, sweet and very attentive!

It can be a long wait but it is definitely worth it!  I've been here twice on Saturday's and usually wait between 15-30 minutes and that was for 2 people.  Can't remember what I got the first time but I know I enjoyed it because I came back for seconds. The service is great, and they even have these placards on the table to let your server know you need service instead of being that person to flag them down. Very useful. Highly recommended!

Yummmm! Food portion is great! I usually eat all of my food, but needed a to go box. I got the chicken mushroom and spinach skillet and it was delish! Hubby got the sunrise and he loved it so much, he wouldnt give me a bit. And he had leftovers. Oscar waa great and attentive. Will definitely come back when we're in town again.
My experience here was perfect, Karla was an amazing waitress and I look forward to coming back. LA all day !

Such a great place! We ate the haole loco which was sticky rice, ground beef patty that was juicy and big with an over easy egg with gravy! We also had a delicious Banana French toast! Our server Carole Ann was sweet and funny!!

I don't know what draws the crowd here. It could be the portions, the banana nut muffin or the people.

The portions are big enough to share. They're not skimpy on their omelettes and pile on the Works potatoes, easy to split. Banana nut muffin is so moist, leaves you wanting more. The house special burrito, hubby says, is the perfect combo of egg, cheese, bacon, Works potatoes and green bell peppers that just melts in your mouth. Kid's meals were big too!

Most likely it's the workers who create such an inviting atmosphere here. To the corporate manager: Caresia should win the Disneyland trip because she was such a friendly server! She was still smiling as we made our mutiple requests.

Thank you Egg and I, our bellies are full!!

This place deserved 6 stars but I am limited to 5 stars (yelp limitation). The extra star is for the service. The service was amazing better than any other 5 star restaurant. The food was also equally amazing. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking to venture off the strip.

My boyfriend and I were visiting Las Vegas for a convention, we wanted breakfast before we headed over to the convention center, so I asked him to find something.  He found Egg & I.  It wasn't far away, the parking was good, we were seated immediately, and after we ordered we had our food in under 10 minutes.  Our waitress was friendly and fast.  I love this place because you can ask anyone to get you something, you aren't just tied to one wait person.  You have an egg posted by the table, you need something you flip it to the unhappy yellow side, you are happy you leave it on it's happy side, when they see the yellow side they come over and see what they can do for you.  We had biscuits and gravy, which were piping hot and tasted good and served different ways.  We also got coffee, and they left the pot at the table for us.  How cool is that, no waiting to refill that cup when it's empty.  Love this place and will def come back when we visit Vegas again.

Definitely a local hangout which I  like because I will try to avoid the Strip for food when I visit.  The Egg Crepe was good, but I like their potatoes.  I  didn't try the banana nut muffin,  but am kicking myself for not doing it.   There's always a next time!

Looking for breakfast outside the strip! Look no more. This place has it all. Most importantly than the food, COFFEE is really good too. Don't get overwhelm by the the line of people waiting, it go by fast and in the meantime you can read their newspaper menu. It has variety of assortments! We loved their banana nut muffin. Enjoy!

Ate here while in LV on business and was blown away. Had time in the morning, so decided to get off the strip, and found this gem. Got the Mexican Eggs Benedict, and it couldn't have been any better. And their potatoes are the best I have ever had.  I wish this place was in Indy!!

Great bfast after a nite of boozing. The banana nut muffin was spectacular. They have half portions which is great if you are not super hungry or are watching your figure. Service was top notch. Ask to sit in Thaynara's section. She was one of the best servers we have ever had!

Just your basic breakfast place, what more can I say? Nothing to write home about, not too unique. Prices are decent. It's dependable. If you want a decent breakfast without the frills and hooey this is the place. Seem to be around the valley in different locations. 
Good, clean establishment!
Nice good great service!!!! Love their half portion menu, great for girl who wanna keep their shape up!!! Also their banana muffins is the BEST!!! Love it;)

Yet another delicious breakfast spot in Las Vegas. This place offers a warm banana nut muffin that is out of this world. They serve large portions I had the bacon avocado omelette with the crispy seasoned potatoes very yummy. I will be returning when in Vegas.

This place was slammed but the seating was fast, the service excellent and the food great as always. Just crowded and noisy at times but that is to be expected. I've been to a lot of Egg & I locations and the menu on this one was huge. If you cant find something you like there is something wrong with you

This was probably the best spot we hit on a recent trip to vegas.  It's always a good sign when a place is packed midweek. 
We were sat immediately and there was no wait to receive drinks and menus. 
Our waitress was Chance and quite honestly one of the best servers I've had in a long time. She knew her menu and was open to giving suggestions. She was also VERY attentive and upbeat in general. during a pretty good breakfast rush, mind you!
Firstly, as I said before, it's busy. But you never have to flag down a waitress or ask when your order is coming. There's a little sign on the table which lets you flip between a happy egg and a frowny egg. If the frowny egg is showing, the waitress/waiter is supposed to help you right away. I never had to use this sign because the service was so prompt. 
First thing I loved was the bottomless cup of coffee. You're given a full thermos pitcher of coffee all for your table and there's plenty of sugar (or substitutes) and cream at hand. 
I usually ask for a recommendation on what to order when traveling and Chance was eager to help. She told me about the Chile Relleno Benedict and said that it's not normally on the menu (special days only) but that it really was a must try. Honestly, I'm not huge on chile relleno but hey she seemed enthusiastic and I went ahead and ordered it. 
It was amazing. And it SHOULD be an everyday menu item. I'll go into both dishes and what was so awesome about them below. 
Chile Relleno Benedict:
Wow. The dish was amazing. Benedicts make just about anything better but this was no joke. REALLY well thought out and balanced. First thing I noticed was that the eggs were PERFECTLY poached. The whites were soft but not slimey or runny. There was zero cooked yoke. It was warm and ran smooth just the way god intended. 
I don't know what was breaded in the dish but it was either the Chile itself or the thinly sliced (and tender as all hell) chicken breast. The breading was really what made the dish I think. It added just enough saltiness that I didn't need to add salt or pepper to my breakfast. I always add salt and pepper (unless I get chicken fried steak) and that was a pleasant surprise. The chile and the chicken were topped off with the poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. There were home fries on the side which also needed no seasoning beside what was already there but honestly I would have been ok just eating the chile relleno benedict. It was really that good. 
My GF ordered the veggie pesto sandwich with Cajun fries. I didn't try the sandwich itself but she said the bread was very tender and the pesto was really tasty. I DID sneak a few fries however and loved them. Thinly cut shoestring style potatoes covered in seasoning. Another instance where salt was not necessary. Really they would have been fine without ketchup. 
I fully intend on visiting this place every time I head to Las Vegas and can't say enough good things about it. Thank you Chance for the awesome recommendation and thank you Egg & I for turning out exceptional food and service at a great price!

Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, so I'm glad I searched this place out on our last trip out to Vegas. I'm so over the pricey and mediocre food at the buffets on the strip for breakfast. So we came here based on the yelp reviews.

First, they have a huge menu, which makes it hard to decide what to get in the first place since I love all breakfast foods. So I went basic with buttermilk pancakes and eggs and bacon. Everyone's eggs were cooked perfectly. Bacon crispy as I had requested. Short stack of 2 pancakes was more than I could finish. My husband and a friend each got some sort of skillet concoction, and I probably didn't finish my pancakes because my fork kept was always in his skillet because it was so good! The four of us were all pleased with our meal.

The place is busy, but we were seated after about 20 minutes. Service was good, portions were large and a reasonable price. I would probably come back to this place next year on our annual trip!

Place -- Family friendly, smiles all around! 

Food -- The banana nut muffin. I saw the clouds parting and sunshine came through.

Service --   All of them were so nice. So, so nice. 

Go back? -- Hell yes. Yes.

I had the country Benny and it was awesome. Hubby had the piggy skillet and he said "lets add this place to our list of good breakfast." We will be back. We didn't realize they closed at 3p and got in about 2:50. They were nice and didn't rush us even through we were obviously keeping them open. I'm so glad we found this place.

Delicious food! We're from Orange County, Cali and every time we come to Vegas we stop by the Egg & I. The food is great and it's always busy definitely worth the wait. Our waitress Carole Ann was so sweet and very attentive. She made us feel welcomed and comfortable right away. I would definitely recommend asking for Carole, she'll make your dining experience great. Thank you for the wonderful service and kindness Carole! We ordered the original breakfast burrito and pancakes both were soooo good! I added spinach to the breakfast burrito and it seriously looked like work of art when it came out, you could see the layers of bacon, cheese, eggs, spinach and potatoes. The salsa that came with the burrito was the best salsa I've had in a while and of course the Diablo potatoes are addicting. The pancakes were moist and fluffy. So much yummmm!
I just had breakfast here. Outstanding service! Great food! Nice atmosphere. I will be coming back. Their banana nut bread was amazing.

I ordered the Turkey Cheese, Avocado, Crepe with a banana muffin and a coffee. The service was quick, loud and friendly. A home town feel for breakfast to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. The menu was on a newspaper style paper which was neat. 

First the Banana Muffin came out and was moist and great!. I would want that muffin at the casino buffets. Then the food came out and it was huge. The potatoes were seasoned with some sort of lawry's seasoning flavor, pretty good, didn't need much ketchup, i didn't use any. The crepe was huge, it too up half teh dish, but was more like an omlet than a crepe. Still tasty and filling. 

I like breakfast and I usually get a chicken fried steak for breakfast, but that crepe was definitely a head turner walking in to our seats... I'm sold on Eggs and I.

Had the biscuit and gravy.  It's served in an oval baking dish.  Biscuits are fluffy soft and the gravy is perfect.   I like the way they serve it in a bowl type dish (as opposed to flat plate) because it keeps the heat better.  Good attention to detail.

Just off the Strip, this place is a great find. Even though there was a line waiting to get it, we were seated very quickly. The food was excellent!! You couldn't go wrong with anything you ordered. And added plus was the service was super., We had a great waitress Chance that always checked on us but didn't make us feel rushed.

This place is about 7 minutes from the Grand Hilton Vacation Resort (the one on Vegas Blvd).  I visited here on Tuesday.

Upon arriving, there was a wait of about 15 minutes.  When i was finally seated, I was giving this big menu of items.  I ordered the southwest omelet & cup of coffee.  Once I received it, coffee was okay & the omelet was great.  Service was okay, but not great.  I guess because they were busy, it took longer for her to check on me especially to bring my check once I was done.

Overall the place has good food, but needs to work on service.

Potato omelette. ..delish! Eggs, garlic mashed potatoes and bacon...topped with cheese and sour cream! Oh yeah...get the banana muffin instead of toast! The service was SPOT on awesome! Our server Elizabeth was the greatest ever!  Definitely coming back next time we're in town!

This place is AMAZING!!!!!! Our server, Liza, was so sweet and took such great care of our table of 5!!!! Everyone ordered something different and were in absolute love with what they got. I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet which was heaven in my mouth, and so filling I could only eat half! Their banana nut muffins surely live up to the hype!! I want to eat here every morning we're in Vegas. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!
A great place to get a hearty recovery breakfast.  Friendly staff. Flipping the egg at the end of the table for service is great, no  need to flag down your server.

Went there this past weekend with the GF and my NY friends.  We had:

Blackened Prime Rib Benny - Blackened Prime Rib with onions and peppers and 2 poached eggs on a croissant with hollandaise sauce - Pretty good, but the prime rib was a little dry.

Eggs Benedict Florentine - Pretty good

Eggs Taliano - Very good, tasted like a pizza with a soft egg crust.

French Toast - This was ok.

All the egg dishes came with ranch flavored home fries which were geat.  This was a good breakfast place.  Very quaint and clean inside.  I would definitely go back there again.

Homey, tasty, and friendly. 

Every dish I've tasted has been great. This is the homey eggs and toast place you're looking for. Large portions and good prices only add the fantastic value.
The Diablo potatoes are great, especially crispy. Toast is nice and chewy. Good choices
Amanda was fantastic!  Cheerful, pleasant, smiling! Could not ask for better service.

I guess you wouldn't come here if you were looking for something healthy. Everything here is pretty heavy. I'm usually quick with my selection because I know what I want, but it was the opposite this time and now I know it's because I was hungover. I opt for a chilli omelette because I wanted more protein and it was decent for under $10, came out exactly how I expected a chili omelette to be. I'm not a fan of potatoes but the house potatoes were nice and crispy! We had a big group of 10+ and they quickly sat us outside in the patio! It was a relaxing breakfast : )

We had a great time at Eggs & I! A country, "at home" feel inside with lots of happy chatter and flavorful food. We had Patrick, who was very kind, attentive and patient with our indecisiveness on what to order. We had the Cincy Chili omelette with fruit, Cincy Chili spaghetti, and Banana Nut Muffin. Filled us up perfectly - next time we're in Vegas, we'll certainly be back for another positive experience!

I'm all about yelping places to eat. Came across this place so I took my family and brother here. I went in to place my name on the list and went for first available meaning we might be seated outside. It looked okay since they had mists going on and it was pretty shaded. My brother didn't think it was a good idea so I went back and they had no problem noting we wanted to sit inside. It's busy but people go in and out quick. We waited for about 5-10mins. 
As usual we got seated, got menus and they asked for what drinks we wanted. So far so good with service with Amanda. She took our orders and talked a little to my 1 1/2 year old niece. Drinks came out quick. The banana nut muffin that came with our meal came out as well and it was so delish!!! My daughter and I got one each and we saved one for later. We didn't want to get full so we shared one. 
Our food came out. I had the corn beef hash with the side of potatoes. Potatoes were good. I don't know why I got the corn beef. I'm not really a fan of it but it got a lot of reviews. My daughter ate half of her omelette and saw a hair in it. We bothered one of the servers about it and she took it back and made my daughter a half order of the same omelette. Almost done with our meal, they forgot to t bring out the banana pancakes my bro ordered. We reminded them about it too. 
The lady that took back the omelette came out with a complimentary plate of these banana bread with custard filling goodness. She probably gave it to us because of my daughters omelette and forgetting the pancakes on time. Omg! It melts in your mouth!! 
I love this place and they have the best customer service. Especially when it's crazy busy in there. When they brought out the pancakes, they told us they did not charge us for the omelette and pancakes. How awesome is that?? 
They're super nice! Thank you Amanda! I'll definitely go back but not order the corn hash for me.
Really great breakfast. The Mexican omelette and the bacon avocado omelette was the Bom!!! Banana nut muffins were delicious.
Karla the  old bitch  is the best . I recommend the  Denver omelet . The food is great . Ask for her by name.

Items selected:

Coffee
Cinnamon Roll
Banana Nut Muffin
Chocolate Chip Pumpkin Pancakes
Carrot Cake French Toast with Sassy Apples

With a house full of boxes waiting to be unpacked and a long run already in the morning's rearview it was with carbohydrates on my mind that we descended on venerable The Egg & I just after 6:30am and finding only a few regulars inhabiting the space as a half dozen holiday-clad servers stood in waiting I can only assume that both food and services rendered were as good as the restaurant gets...and both were pretty darn good.  A whimsical concept with a plethora of breakfast staples "eggceptionally" categorized plus a number of seasonal specials it was without hesitation that eyes turned to things autumnal and with a full pot of coffee in hand each dish that followed was exactly as expected - fresh, comfortable, and delicious; the sort of thing you 'could' make at home but never do...though if you make banana bread this light and moist or carrot cake pudding moldable to crispy French Toast I'll gladly come over, bring the coffee, and do dishes.

Works Veggie Benny was really good, Chile Relleno omelette was incredible. Our server John was a sweetheart and gave us free banana nut muffins and said our drinks (Diet Coke and coffee) were on the house.

rise and shine 702!

Thanks for all the wonderful yelp reviews~ I finally had my first experience at Egg & I this past Thursday.

My gf & I had breakfast around 11am. It was really crowded but there was only a 10 minute wait.

We ordered the croissant sandwich, I had mines with turkey sausage and fruits and she had hers with bacon and potatoes. 

Service was great, food came out fast. Casual dining, indoor/outdoor seating, private lot. meal for 2 cost around $26. 

I'll be back for more.

Egg & I makes my breakfast in 702 list! If you're looking to get your morning fix, stop by Egg & I! 

-Miss Yelp 2011
First time at this location and it was great. Food was amazing good!! Tamara took great care of us. It's our first time and we're thinking on coming back gain tomorrow!!

Usually go with breakfast selections, but wanted to try something new so I ordered a beef burger. I typically pick at bread since it's so filling, but ate everything this burger came with. Includes the seasoned potatoes :) 
Typically you'll have to wait to be seated, but they also have the patio option so tons of seats. Great service, just don't expect too much if you are seated outside. It's a pretty noisy atmosphere, but has a homey feel to the place. Check in on yelp to try their homemade banana nut muffin!!

This is a nice place to take the family to eat the food is nothing special there price range is alright but they seem to always have so many people there and there staff cant handle it they might forget some stuff.

Send Genesis to Disneyland!!! She was an awesome server! Very kind, attentive, and quick! 

Also, food here was amazing. I don't think you can go wrong over here. 

We'll be back!

So, I've come to the Egg & I on about 7 of my last 8 trips to Vegas after initially discovering it, but this was by far the best service I've had, even though service has been wonderful each and every time. Today, I just wanted to give a couple of shot outs to Brady, the Assistant Manager, and to Jesus, whom I discovered is a 20-yr  employee of the Egg & I. 

Jesus is a busboy. On my last two visits prior to the one I'm writing about (this past Monday, Memorial Day), Jesus has asked me if I needed anything to let him know, which he did again on this visit. Jesus is ALWAYS willing to help, and has gotten me coffee, filled my coffee and even scored me an extra banana nut muffin or two before. Not really his job, as his is to clean tables and make sure their customers have somewhere nice to be seated, but Jesus ALWAYS goes above and beyond what is expected of him to do, and I appreciate his hard work.

Which brings me to Brady, the young Assistant Manager. Brady is definitely young enough to be my little brother. Brady is a genuine, bonafide talker. He shoots the shit with you, but real talk. Not fake talk like I'm only here to make it look like I care about you talk, but good ol' fashioned back and forth banter. He has a tattoo on one of his forearms that says "Family First", and Brady made me feel like family! While shooting it with him, I told him that we had just come from Laughlin but had to detour cause one of my wife's uncles fell ill and ended up in the hospital and guess what Brady did? He sent me home with a loaf of their bomb ass banana nut bread to take to my uncle at the hospital since I told him that's where we were heading after breakfast! THANK YOU AGAIN BRADY! I'LL NEVER FORGET YOUR KINDNESS!

I'll end this review with a little bit about the food.........my Italiano skillet was on point, AS USUAL. Onion, bell pepper and sausages were all cooked to damn near perfection, it had just the right amount of marinara and cheese that didn't drown or overwhelm, and to be quite honest, have they every messed up a batch of their famous potatoes?
The banana nut muffin was delish, a must have! Service was wonderful thanks to Karla for making our experience wonderful!

Great food great service! Our server Alyssa went out of her way to make our visit awesome! Great place to eat off the hustle n bustle of the strip with good prices for quantity. Will definitely be back to visit Alyssa!
Yum! Great place to get some great food! Big portions to fill your belly, good prices, and fast service! Carole Ann was a sweet and efficient waitress.. Thanks!

This is as good as it gets! I ordered the steak and eggs with a banana nut muffin. The muffin was excellent, made in the restaurant. The steak was properly prepared as were the eggs. The potatoes were well prepared and not greasy. 

The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and clearly happy to be employed by this establishment. The waitress was patient and friendly outgoing and concerned about the service she provided us. The other patrons in the restaurant were professionals and a delight to be around. 

The restaurant was clean. The service was great!

If you come to Las Vegas you should check this place out. I am going to return before I leave.

Had the Chicken Cordon Bleu skillet. Was a great breakfast. Jessica the server was awesome. She was her attentive and was always there when we need something. If your in the area stop by for an eggredible breakfast.

Everytime I come to Vegas, this is a definite must-go. The service is fast and the place is always packed. But they have a lot of tables and the food comes out relatively fast, so you don't wait hours and hours. If you check in, you get a free muffin- which is amazing to munch on before your meal comes or after on your drive back home :P

I only eat from the breakfast menu and the selection is immense!
You need to just commit and order. 
This is where we come to de-brief on what happened during our Vegas trip lol.

BEST BREAKFAST EVER.

So good the wife and I went two days in a row during a recent visit to Vegas. 

4 Star Breakdown from two days:

WAIT TIME: 4*
Day 1 : Long ( We were told 15min , and it ended up being over 30min wait.) 
Day 2 : Quick ( seated in about 5- 10 min. )


Food: AMAZING!!!! 5*


Service: 4* ( They have clever yellow / black eggs as signs that you need help)

Day 1 : Had a server by the name of Amanda, who ROCKED!!! She was the perfect      host, and made the experience great. (she gets 5 *+ )

Day 2: Never got the servers name( skinny preggo chick), she never came buy often, and when she did, she would completely forget about stuff we asked for. The guy next to us sat there for a good 20min before she took his drink order, and even longer to get him his meal. I had asked for a refill of water, and she seemed to bring water to everyone around us, except for me. The she abruptly brought us our bill that we had not asked for , while we were still eating, and didn't even ask if we wanted anything else. Oh yeah I still hadn't gotten my water, so I asked her again and finally as we were getting up to leave, she brought water. 



Overall, This is a MUST when I'm in Vegas.

Great! Have came to this place several times and it's never disappointing! 
There food is amazing!!! And the muffin is to die for! 
The service is great too. Everyone is so nice and the food come out at a decent time. 
A must have when visiting Vegas!

The food is good. It can get very crowded at times. They have a statue egg on every table, so when you need something you can flip it to show an unhappy egg face. Pretty cute. Over all we enjoy coming here.
Best breakfast in Las Vegas.  Alexa was a very friendly server.  Great coffee and delicious potatoes. You sure you try the banana nut muffin it's warmed up perfectly

Best breakfast ever!!!!!!
Banana but muffin!!
Eggs Benedict!!!
Blueberry cashew pancakes!!!!
Everything's awesome here!!!!

Been here twice on two separate trips and both dining experiences have been great. Excellent food and even better staff! They seem to really care about customer service and I've noticed that all the staff helps each other out so the customer has everything they need without ever even asking. I'm all about the little details and love that they bring you lemons with your water just in case that's how you like to drink it. I think our waiter's name was Patrick this last time around and he was great! My wife and I both had the country gravy (country fried steak and the country benny) and it's so good!

I write this review with a very heavy heart. I absolutely love the food here. This used to be my local breakfast spot every time I came to Vegas. Unfortunately I will not be coming back here anymore. I was dining at the restaurant with a friend a month ago. When who white women came into the restaurant and were seated in the table next to us.  They were having a very loud and expletive filled conversation which included the use of the N word several times. People at other tables could hear them too and where just as disgusted as I was. My asked the waitress could she speak to the manager these 2 women. I thought she would ask the two women to leave considering they had not even placed their orders yet and where disturbing the other patrons. He just looked at me smiled and said do you need anything else. No thank you there are plenty of other breakfast places in Vegas.
At first it looks just like a local non-special restaurant... It turns that the food was great and fairly priced (I had a pork carnitas ranchero). It was quick and the service was satisfactory.

WOW!! You HAVE to come here for breakfast!! The homemade Banana-nut Muffin is to die for. It comes to the table warm, spread a touch of butter (not that it needs it) and succumb to a pleased palate. 

Our server was Stacie. She's from Boston originally, so give her a wicked awesome shout out!!! 

Will definitely be back this trip. You can't come only once. Those muffins and great service are addicting!!!

Everything positive you hear is true.  Come hungry and ask the hostess to call you a cab before your bill comes so you don't have to wait outside awhile.  Only negative is that its a little off the beaten path.

Cute hole in the wall place.  I got the Traditional Benny, it was good but my only grip was the Canadian bacon was super thick, we are talking half an inch.

Pancakes are super big and generous.  Delicious and just airy enough.

Be sure to check in so you can get the yummy banana nut muffin!

I decided to stop here since we landed at 7:30 AM and wanted breakfast.  All the reviews raved about this place.  The food was good, but the waitress was not very attentive.  The muffins were alright.  The portions were good.  I felt that the potatoes stole all the seasoning and everything else was a bit bland.  Maybe next time I will try something else.

We came here by default because the Pepper Mill had a 2 hour wait.  The wifey found this on Yelp, and we were so glad we came here.  Great breakfast food at very reasonable prices! I had the prime rib benny and the wife had the veggie benny. Both were delicious!  The wait was not bad and the service was quick.  If you're looking for good breakfast without going broke at the buffets on the Strip, I highly recommend this place. Way better than the Pepper Mill.

This place is amazing. Their muffins are the best. I have been here two times and have not left disappointed. Our server was attentive and the food beyond amazing. The first time I got a scramble and it was great. The second time I got the chile relleno omelette. It was amazing a little heavy on the cheese but the flavors were still able to come through. Really good would recommend as their prices are great and their portions amazing.

This was my second time here and my girlfriend's first. Amanda was our server and she was prompt as well as very helpful. I ordered the chile rellenos omelette and my girlfriend got the country fried steak. The food was absolutely delicious and my girlfriend is excited to come back on our next vegas trip.

1500+ people couldn't be wrong, so I checked this place out for breakfast. My experience was in line with the rest of the reviewers. Great food and service with a smile. Food comes out quickly, and their menu is interesting enough to come back several times. My new go-to breakfast place in Vegas since my previous favorite is now gone.

This is one of the best breakfast joints in town and they are always busy but they seat you fast and service is great the banana nut muffin is one of the best muffins there is it's huge delicious always fresh as far as the food concerned well I have my favorites and I never try anything else so I can tell you their menu is perfect for me the price is great the coffee is hot and I always leave with a smile on my face

My family's FAV breakfast/ lunch place.  Love the servers and could eat the fresh banana nut muffins all day long.  Fav dishes so far are the Tuna melt with avocados and the hubby likes all the skillets.  Extensive menu with lots of variety.  We've been here multiple times and have never ordered anything that wasn't really tasty.  Portions are big so don't be surprised if you have left overs.  Ordering some extra banana muffins to take with you will be worth it! If you're wondering if it's worth the drive since its off the Strip, you should still try it.  We're locals that would love to keep this place a secret, but it's too good to not share.

Tired of all the Vegas buffets, I decided to use my Smartphone and search for a breakfast place outside the strip.  I was directed to "Egg & I".  Loved the name and read some reviews which were positive.  This was my birthday breakfast so I had high expectations.  I am pleased to report that they surpassed them.  Unlimited breakfast options and very attentive staff.  I ordered an omelette and the hubby ordered strawberry waffles with tons of whip and bananas.  YUMMY!!!!!!  A must- go- to place when in Vegas.

I came to this establishment with a craving for some biscuits and gravy.

The hostess and waitress were both really pleasent. The waitress did a excellent job explaining the menu to me and letting me know how I could customize my order. Everything I asked for was promptly brought out.

While not the best sausage gravy I have had in Vegas, it was still decent on it's own and still better than most of the sausage gravy I have had in Vegas. Nice amount of sausage throughout with a nice homemade flavor. I do believe it was made in house. But it still had the consistency of being out of a packet. The biscuits weren't as soft and tender as I would have liked, but still passable.

The bacon I got was on point. They were straight and crispy. I asked for the eggs to be extra soft. They were okay, but it was weird, the top half of the pile was cooked how I wanted, but the bottom half was cooked hard. I'm  guessing they were left on too long and not continually scrambled. 

All together, I enjoyed my meal, but I am still looking for well made biscuits and gravy in Las Vegas. I will come back to try other items on the menu.
The Strawberry Stuffed French Toast is amazing! We got seated right away even during the lunch rush. And the service from Alexa was great.
Eggcellent! Food is delicious and service from Chance made for a great experience.  Great Vegas spot just off the strip.

Came down here from Los Angeles for the weekend and we decided to stop here for breakfast. It was probably the best part out of all my trip. The food was great and our waitress was the sweetest friendliest lady we came across. I would definitely come back to Vegas just for this place!

My husband is a big Vegas aficionado but I resist sin city as much as the religious right. But alas we had to attend am event so we came together and he's been trying to show me the other side of Vegas.  So far a success. And a key contributor? The Egg and I. 

Lianora seated us within 5 minutes despite large crowds - very efficient! Kelsey and Gia were most attentive servers. Even sending us on the road with some muffins and butter. Along with some non gaming locals only recommendations. 

And the food... Enough has been said about the egg dishes. But someone please try the buckwheat pancakes! With cashews and fresh blueberries. And REAL mar syrup. 

I'm just saying.

They have extensive menu. Menu is printed newspaper liked. Service is friendly & fast. Restaurant is clean. Even 7 am the restaurant is almost full. A great hang out fir breakfast with friends & relatives. The foods are delicious.

I love Egg and I and Egg Works. Great food, plenty of choices, nice presentation, moderately priced. Very friendly servers and nice ambience. Great tasting Traditional Benny! Would be a 5 star if not for a long wait.

We were out of town and stopped by. Breakfast was good! I got the biscuits and gravy and my boyfriend got the spinach Benny the potatoes on the side were delicious and the coffee was good. Customer service was outstanding as well our waitress was on top of everything.
Great breakfast and a good sized portion. Quick and friendly service. Food was great. The banana nut muffin is a must. It's also free when you check in through yelp!!

Pros: Pretty good breakfast
Good service
Get a free banana nut muffin with yelp check in

Cons: had to wait but hey that means the place is good
the diablo potatoes were really salty....which they replaced with non seasoned potatoes
my wife's omelette was really salty...I would have sent it back.
I don't get the hype over the banana nut muffin....it is what it is...it's ok

I have read some reviews that the place is salty and I agree it is salty. They need to cut back at least 30% of the salt.
The server we had was absolutely amazing and sweet and very informative about the menu, it was my first time here, and I will become a regular,  the server's name is Chance, she was a awesome server
My husband and I went here with a groupon  to check it out.  It was very good.  The service was wonderful.  I would definitely go again when we return to Vegas!

Good service. Amazing food. Had the works breakfast skillet and it was scrumptious combination of breakfast meats, peppers, mushrooms and their spicy house potatoes. I would eat here again. P.S. Their banana muffins are awesome and it comes with your meal.

My wife and I were looking for a place to celebrate our anniversary. I found Egg & I by looking on here. 

We had to get the bus as we were staying on the strip but it was well worth the journey! This place is amazing! 

My wife had the breakfast burrito and I had the corned beef hash with poached egg. My wife devoured his and said it was fantastic, mine was so good that I can't find the words. 

I was expecting the sort of corned beef you get in a tin, I was soooooo wrong! This was real pulled beef! My eggs were perfectly poached and I cleared my plate which is rare!

Our server was a real asset to the restaurant, so good at his job. When my wife told him how we had found out about the restaurant he brought us complimentary muffins which were mouthwatering. 

We had a massive jug of coffee that was just perfect! I can't recommend this place highly enough, the food, service and value for money are spot on! 

We will most certainly be back here.
Short and simple good portions and amazing food definitely recommend it Chance was our server and she was exceptional!

The BF and I were looking for a good place to get breakfast/lunch in Vegas before the drive back home. This place is off strip, but was pretty awesome! Great food, and probably the best service in Vegas. Our waitress was very friendly. I love how they have a little stand with a happy egg on one side and a sad egg on the other.
