Flip to the sad egg if you need anything from the wait staff, and they'll be at your table in a jiffy!

When in another city eat like the locals. Don't stay on the strip in Vegas, sometimes the best food is worth driving for! And this place right here is no exception.

Even on a busy morning we were seated quickly. Our waitress was super friendly and quick to come by and see if we needed anything before she took our order.

The food came out and I was pleasantly surprised at the amount and the quality. The scramble I got was basically overflowing from the dish it was served in and the pancake, I shit you not, was spilling over the plate! haha.

Definitely going to be a stop in spot each time in LV.

I love this place! Preferably because they serve turkey products. This is my second time at this location. I ordered the waffle works (w/ strawberry & cream,eggs and turkey bacon), Habla Diablo season potatoes and cranberry juice. I purchased a Groupon for $13 for $20 worth of food.

First of all, I have to say 'THANK YOU' to all the Yelpers out there that recommended this place.

Now the review...

The family and I were in Vegas to cash in on a Giants World Series bet.  I really didn't want the usual buffet, so we did a quick search on Yelp and off to the Egg and I we went.  

We stepped in and were quickly seated.  The televisions on the wall was great.  I could see who was playing and not playing for that Sunday's Fantasy Football Lineups.  We ordered coffee and looked over the menu.  (Note- Coffee was ok.  Better than IHOP, but not my favorite blend.) 

We looked over the menu and what a selection!  It took us awhile to figure out what we wanted.  I ordered the Egg-Ceptional Omelet, my wife ordered the Two-egger, and my son had the Chocolate Waffles.    

The food quickly came out and as far as portions...  they were HUGE!  My wife's Two-egger was like 4 eggs.  My kid's waffles were shaped like Mickey Mouse, which was a nice touch.  My omelet was one of the biggest I've ever seen.  Our only problem was that the chocolate waffle was without chocolate.  We had them bring out some chocolate chips and all was well again.  

The omelet and ranch spiced potatoes were yummy.  You could taste freshness of the ingredients.  The omelet had sausage, diced ham, bacon, onions, tomatoes, portabella mushrooms and melted cheese all topped with sour cream and green onions.     

We finished all we could and off to gambling we went.
Thanks to Tamara! She was an amazing server! She made us feel welcome as we walked in. Way to go gurl!
The food is delicious and the customer service is great. I feel like I'm down south.
The first time I was here I got coffee and the banana nut muffin.  They are an awesome combination.  I've gone back since. 'Nuff said.

The Egg & I is like THE BEST place to have breakfast. I always bring my visiting family & friends here. I love their method of attracting a waiter's attention -- Face cards that showed the current mood! Genius. I do grow tired of trying to wave down a waiter.

A new Must when visiting Las Vegas!! 
The food was absolutely delicious!! And the portions were extremely generous. The staff was very friendly and very attentive. Our server Earl made sure we were well taken care of as well as Carole Ann. Definitely coming back!

Egg and I is awesome, it has great food and prices! I ordered an open faced croissant and it was really good. What I can't get enough of are the Ranch potatoes! They're sooo delicious! I really like he seasoning they use on them, and I think it makes it different than the same ol' potatoes you would get anywhere else. 

This is very much like a diner that you would go to back home, and this is off the strip so the prices are reasonable too. 

Will definitely return!

Having read the reviews on Yelp, I just had to see for myself what all the fuss was about. Well, I'm a big breakfast guy, and this place more than lived up to its reputation. I went with the country fried steak, which had the perfect combination of crispy and tender. I'm more of a hash brown fan, but their cubed breakfast potatoes were very tasty. And I have to pay tribute to the banana nut muffin; I don't even like bananas, but this was fantastic. To top it all off, my server Staci was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. Highly recommended.

Food was great while the service was so-so. I had the French toast with blue berries and bananas while my friend had the strawberry filled French toast. Both were extremely delicious and we cleaned our plates without hesitation. By checking in on Yelp we were also provides a banana flavored muffin which was a great appetizer to our meals. Definitely recommended to those looking for a good breakfast after a long night in Vegas!

I ordered the corned beef hash with the banana nut muffin. I've been hearing about how great their banana nut muffin and it truly does live up to the hype. It was light and fluffy and the banana flavor was subtle. 

The corned beef hash comes with ranch potatoes (think Tommys style fries with that red seasoning only diced up), eggs, and a side of watermelon and pineapple. The hash was served under scrambled eggs in a skillet. The ranch potatoes were crisp and flavorful. I just wish the hash was a bit crispier. Since the hash was made with a mixture of potatoes, the texture remained soft and did not create any contrast with the scrambled eggs. It had good flavor though. 

Lastly, the customer service is top notch. All the waitresses were happy to help and near the end of brunch, the owner/manager came over just to chit chat, which I appreciated.

Large Servings for Reasonable Prices. It is no wonder it is nominated the number one spot for breakfast in Las Vegas. I ordered a fruit plate and got a platter of pineapple, cantaloupe, honeydew melon, clementines, blueberries, watermelon, grapefruit, & strawberries, it also included cottage cheese (or yogurt) a side of toast, unlimited coffee, & a small orange juice. This will be a must stop among many when out in Vegas!

I really don't understand the hype with this place and why it is so packed. 
The food is mediocre and the portions are so large that it's unhealthy. The service is also pretty bad. When we arrived the hostess seated us at a  with unraveled silverware and a five dollar bill still sitting on the table. She gave us our menu's and left the money awkwardly sitting there. 

When we finally got to put in our orders our waitress recommended that we take a half portion of our cheese, egg and veggie skillet breakfast dish and I'm so glad she did. The half portion was like a full portion and I could barely finish it, as it had so much thick sticky cheese on top. Also, the seasoning that they put on the potatoes tastes exactly like Dorritos and I felt like I was eating potato chips (not in a good way). 

Also I just wanted to note something that happened while were waiting for our food to come. The waitress hastily sat us at a 5 top (it was just my bf and I). A family of 5 came in about 10 minutes after us and she tried to sit them in the table next to us which could not accommodate anymore than 4 people. She grabbed a chair from our table to try and seat them there, but the family was really unhappy, it was especially awkward as we were sitting at the only table that could fit them. She then moved them somewhere to the other side of the room. I saw the family leave a few minutes later out of frustration. 

The food is really just standard fare, nothing to write home about. On top of that it's incredibly unhealthy. I understand that Vegas has very little breakfast joints, but I would rather make my own omelet at home. Your health will be better for it.

So we slept in and missed the breakfast buffets, that left us looking for good local food and bingo! we found Egg & I. Great friendly service, good food, just what we needed, thanks for the hospitality. It was a little chilly but we wanted to be outside on the patio so they pulled over one of the fabulous patio heaters and we were warm and toasty and well feed.
It's ok but expensive for what it is.  Food is good. Service is great.  Had better breakfast off the strip.
Love, Love, Love this place!!! Every time I go its so delicious. Especially the steak and eggs. And the service is fantastic. Thanks Liliana!
Our server Chance was awesome!  She was very attentive and catered to our needs. Highly recommend her and Egg and I!

We're from Los Angeles - on vacation. The wait wasn't as long as we had expected - but a much longer wait would've been worth it! Liza was super attentive, friendly, & warm. We highly recommend this place to anyone in Las Vegas area. We had Mimosas, stuffed French Toast, & the Works Chili Skillet; simply the best!!!
Seriously the best avocado bacon omelet in the city and the WORST service, from the get go! I love the omelet but check back say hello look like you care??????

Wish this place was in California! Gotta get the banana nut muffin. I've only had the country fried steak here, but refuse to get anything else. The potatoes are so bomb here, Airways finish it! Service is great and is always crowded. The 4.5 stars on Yelp are definitely deserved!

One of the best breakfast places I've been to. The customer service is absolutely fantastic! We had 3 different people helping us throughout our meal and they were all very quick, happy, and extremely nice. 

I ordered the Works Veggie Benny which is easily the best eggs benedict that I've had! The portions were huge too! The potatoes are amazing and they even sell the seasonings inside the restaurant, so stock up! 

The place is pet friendly on the patio and they have a list of rules to follow so that you, your pet, and the other customers can have an enjoyable meal. 

Also, take advantage of the check-in offer! Since we were so full, we took our muffins to-go, but don't doubt that they'll stay in their boxes for long!

Thanks to my server, Rachel and the rest of the folks working hard here to everyone's experience remembering. Definitely the next time I come back here, I need to come with a real appetite as depending on what you order, it can fill you up pretty good and quick.

Whether you go to Egg Works or come to Egg & I you'll probably have to wait a bit if it's a prime breakfast hour. 

There are so many great sounding items on the menu deciding what to get can be difficult, but the good news is, you really can't go wrong with anything you choose. The wait staff is always really nice and accomodating. I almost always order the same thing the bacon, cheddar and avocado omlette with egg whites and sour cream.

I was introduced to these breakfast spots my aunt who lived in Vegas for over 20 years and for the most part the customers are all locals so if you're in town and wanna get away from the tourists, check out these breakfast spots.

A hidden gem in the sea of places to eat in Vegas. Great breakfast spot and we even drove out to this place two days in a row on our last trip.

Don't miss the banana nut muffins as they are delicious.

First time eating there I ate the prime rib poached eggs ssndwich.  Very different style of presentation.   Food was cold when receiving it.  Potatoes were nothing special.  But what was the kicker for me was their salsa.  Thank goodness I didn't dump it on food without tasting it first.  Tasted like vinegar.  They had table tent advertising to vote for best breakfast of Las Vegas.  No I couldn't do that at all.  Service was excellent.   That's only reason I'm giving 3 stars.
The food was amazing!!!!! Raul is honestly the best server I have had. He was very funny and charming. He got our order right and had great recommendations for us. Awesome place to go

How I'd never heard of Egg&I until last night, I'll never know. I love off-Strip, local establishments where I can get my grub on, and this is definitely on my list now. 

I intended to get my butt up at 5 am and be at their door at 6 am when they opened, but my brain determined I needed sleep more than food and I ended up putting my name down at noon-thirty, at the height of brunch/lunch time. I was told the wait was about 15 minutes; I waited a solid 20 (which isn't bad when "15 minutes" usually serves as code for half-an-hour) and was promptly greeted by my wonderful server. I had my food about 10 minutes after I placed my order.

My late uncle was a gourmet chef, and my earliest, fondest memories of Vegas revolve around eating his cooking. Biscuits and gravy were on the usual menu when my family and I made our annual road trip out here, and I have purposely shied away from ever ordering it because nothing could ever come close.

But, for some reason, I ordered it anyway here. Was it as good as my Uncle Ray's? 

Does the free show in front TI have anything to do with pirates anymore?

Exactly. But that said, I would probably order it again. I regret not remembering my server's name, but she's one of the best I've had in a LONG time, and as someone that waited tables and bartended her way through school, my standards of service are ridiculously high. She was awesome, and was warmer, more attentive and professional than any server I've had elsewhere in Vegas, even in those pretentious "five-star" restaurants you'll find in abundance in this city.

Keep in mind they're open from 6 am - 3 pm. I was told by a girl at the host desk that the best time to go was 6-8 and after 1:30.

Overall value?

Price: 3.5
Service: 5
Ambiance: 4

= 4.17. But Yelp! doesn't offer a decimal rating. So a solid four stars from me. Worth visiting at least once if you want a tasty meal in a casual atmosphere without the pretentious attitude.

There are many breakfast-themed places in town, we were in the area and decided to try this place. Place was full but no wait on a Saturday for 2 adults, a toddler and an infant. We had the Banana Bread French Toast which was good, but had similar texture to the Banana Nut Muffin that came with it (should have gotten some other side dish). But don't get me wrong, both we're good. The muffin was served fresh from oven with steam coming out as you break it. We also got the avocado omelet with cheese and sour cream. This was good but what we really loved were the side of potatoes. Just the right amount of seasoning to keep you interested. Overall very good experience. Service was excellent.

Food... Eggs'cellant !  (sorry) had to do that.  Agree with the other reviews here, the homemade banana-nut muffin was worth the drive.  Served warm...and I'm not a banana 'anything' lover,  but I'd order it again anytime.  This review is more about our Waitress, her name is Linnea.  We were seated promptly, and quickly thereafter a smiling young woman appeared at our table, offering water and taking drink orders.  Each time she returned to our table she had such a  genuinely  engaging smile.  "Now there is a young woman who is one of God's Happy Creatures" I said.  She truly was delightful!

Five stars for service and portions, this def hit the spot ! Reina our server was very nice and attentive, everyone who works here seems to be in a great mood and social, which is rare these days. Keep up the good job management!

I have been coming to Las Vegas for YEARS! My father moved to Las Vegas almost 20 years ago. The one place that is MUST for us to go to for an amazing breakfast is the Egg & I restaurant. 

This last visit was no exception to any of the past visits. The food was so fantastic. The options were endless. Who knew you could prepare eggs so many delicious and wonderful ways?

Lindsay our waitress was very friendly and helpful. We brought our youngest son on this trip (for his 21st birthday) and he was having a hard time making a selection. Lindsay took the time to answer all of his questions and gave him a great recommendation of the country fried skillet. He LOVED IT!!! Thank you LIndsay!

All I can say is - if there is a line or a wait (and there most likely will be) then take the time because it is worth it. The coffee is fresh and hot and the banana nut muffins are a MUST (unless you are allergic of course).

We only waited about 15 minutes and our food was on the table - pipping hot. I ordered my favorite - the Greek scramble. FOUR eggs, chicken, spinach, mushrooms,and feta cheese make up this belly busting breakfast. It is served with choice of toast or muffin (I got the muffin) and breakfast potatoes. 

My hubby ordered the Chili omllete and he had a choice of chili's. His came with the same sides only he ordered toast instead of a muffin. I have no idea why because that muffin is served warm with butter. YUM!!!

Cost is a little higher than say a Perkins or iHop - but the food is SO much better! Expect to pay about $ 15 per person including a beverage. Serving size is SO BIG that you could almost split something and share.

it's good to check-in to see if they are offering any deals.  I got a free banana nut muffin which was very delicious!

corn beef skillet was okay. salty even with the eggs on top. it needed a better balance.

veggie works Benedict was very good. something I will probably order again instead of trying something new only because it's fulfilling for me. 

service was good. nothing to complain about but nothing really to rave about either.
Great food excellent service. My waiter Patrick was very helpful polite and gave us amazing service. Thank you.
I made the wrong choice and got the tacos, which were so salty I could not finish them. I also prefer authentic Mexican tacos, so no go for me.
really good salsa. portions are enormous. Food came out clean (little grease) and was delicious.  Prices are a tad high, but goes along with giant portions.

Solid breakfast joint!

We decided to go off the strip for breakfast this past weekend to save some money. I swear we always spend at least $50 on breakfast when we eat in the hotels. Breakfast at Egg & I was under $30 :)

They were busy when we arrived and we waited about 15 minutes to be seated. They put us on the patio, luckily it wasn't too hot yet and there was one table left with shade. It was tolerable.

Service was decent but not over the top. They have a system where if you need something you flip over a plastic egg on the table and the waitress will come back. Seems like they never check on you unless you flip the egg.

Breakfast was good. I had the eggs benedict with bacon instead of canadian bacon. One of the bacon slices was too fatty and not cooked enough, but the other one was good. The hollandaise was tasty, although a little runny. The potatoes on the side had a nice flavor to them.

BF had their daily special, which was Cinnamon Roll French Toast. It was really good, had a custard batter. Too sweet for me, but he enjoyed it a lot. That was also served with a little cup of yummy cinnamon apples. I liked those very much.

You pay at the register, which is kind of annoying because that area is already super cramped with people waiting and there isn't really anywhere to stand in line to pay without getting in somebody's way. Overall though, a good breakfast place. If you're willing to drive a couple minutes off the strip to save some cash, I recommend this place!

Found another bomb breakfast place in Vegas!! this place is on the Zagat list so that's why it gets a lot of ppl there every morning!! we ordered the steak benedict n the corned beef. Let me tell u this... the steak benedict was sooo good lots of steak in it so I was really full after! but the corned beef was even better!! My gf ordered that one wanna swtich with her hahah kinda far from the strip but its worth the drive tho!!

Wow!  Decided to eat away from the tourist spot.  I found a coupon in one of the LV booklets you get at the hotel, it was buy one get one free breakfast. This place is definitely worth going to.  It's about 10mins from the strip.

Food:  Corned Beef Hash and eggs, Eggs Benedict Florentine,  Banana muffins.

Corned Beef Hash:  husband really enjoyed the "real" corned beef in the hash!

Eggs Benedict Florentine:  Yummy!  The sauce was delicious, I think I would stick with the original eggs Benedict.  The spinach was served fresh and not sautéed which I was expecting.

Banana Muffins:  this is what they are known for!  Must get them!! They were so good, we ordered 6 to take back to the hotel!

The service was AWESOME too :)

I HATE breakfast food... And I like this place :) I have found that after a night out, everyone always wants breakfast foods. This is a great place to take your breakfast-loving friends and still get what you want!

Must try:
Muffins- They are to die for! Try the banana nut, AWESOME!
Cincinnati Chili- It certainly isn't Skyline, but at least they are trying :) 
Fruit Plate- Fresh and someone else did all the work cutting it up for me. 

Skip:
Salads - I have tried two different salads here. Although there is enough to feed a family of 4, bigger portions don't make a better salad. I found the chicken really boring and dry. I will be trying something different next time. 

The service: It has always been the same. I get greeted by a friendly person, served by an even friendlier person and bid goodbye by an even friendlier friendly person. I think they have conquered good service. I love their happy eggs on the table :)

Food, okay. Service, good. 

With the long wait/line, I had high expectations. 

The server, Darla, was on it, as was the rest of the staff. However, that is where the "WOW" factor ended for me. 

Being from Hawaii, an order of the Loco Moco was placed, along with the Ranch Club.

The ground beef on the Loco Moco was hard and a bit bland. The Club was okay and unfortunately, the onion rings were average, at best, as I am used to panko onion rings which make it flaky crispy.

I can't say it was bad, but not what I had expected based on the reviews and the long line outside.

We love the Egg and I every time we eat there. They have an extensive menu and large portions. Today I had something that wasn't even on the menu. My nephew said the stuffed French toast was the best he has had. We had a great server named Carole Ann. She was as accommodating as the servers we have had at the Cracker Barrel, and they have the very best servers.

Good, clean place. Food came as ordered and in good timing. Jessica, our server,  was nice and attentive. Food portion was reasonsble, and priced as expected. Four stars only because the food was "ok." Nothing I couldn't get elsewhere. Overall though, I would come back!

The food there is always outstanding.  The banana bread french toast is amazing. Beyond delish. We are from michigan and it's a must to visit the egg & I every trip, most of the time it's everyday. My daughter gets the stuffed french toast and it's always amazing. Very filling. She eats half. So the serving sizes are huge. Worth every penny. Great prices for great quality food. It's our favorite breakfast in vegas.
BIG fan over here. The country benny? Aces. Eggscellent food and super friendly service from Erin.

This morning I brought my mother and daughter in for breakfast. We had Oscar as our server. Oscar had a great attitude from the second he came over to our table. He was very attentive and friendly the whole time we were there. Food was awesome as always, just wanted to make sure Oscar was recognized for his great service.

The Egg & I was a very nice breakfast spot for locals and visitors.  Our server was BREE.  She was wonderful and provided us with outstanding customer service while recommending several breakfast dishes.  We were pleasantly surprised to see that they had Portuguese Sausage.  For anyone that has been to Hawaii, it was a great treat to find.  If you go, ask to be in the section of Bree, she is wonderful.

Great breakfast! Stopped in on I our way to Utah. The veggie omelette was delicious and he loved his stuffed French toast. Their home fries though!!! Yum!  Crispy and perfect seasoning. The service was great too. I believe we had Chance as our waitress she was very attentive and quick. Def be back next time we're in town.

Tamara is such a sweet waitress! Very helpful and nice. I like how you get to put a sign when you need a waitress to help you. It made it very easy to get help. 

I loved the food here. I got the enchilada omlette which was good but I wish it tasted more like tomato sauce rather than chili. The banana muffins are soooo good! That is a must.

Always love coming here. This place rocks! Great service and even better food! Even went on a double date for Valentines here! 
I can honestly say that the steggs(steak and egg) is better here compared to babystax. They don't have red velvet pancakes though, don't come here for that and be disappointed. Egg works bennys are farrrrr more tastier and better than babystax. It has much better flavoring. The potatoes on the side is seasoned really well. Can even preach that their potatoes fries taste better than babystax potatoes fries. The price here is cheaper than babystax. The only downside is the pancakes. Their pancakes and banana nut muffin was not good at all.

Damn this banana nut muffin is delicious. And for the portions, sizes, and service, it's quick, and inexpensive. Whether you're coming in hung over, or looking to feed and fuel up... DO IT. I love this place for their courteousness and most importantly their delicious breakfast. Also, if the wait gets too long, go across the plaza and hit up Zia records and check out their vinyl, cds, DVDs, whatever you're into :)
yuck! food was not worth the good service
Unbelievably great food! Banana nut muffin is sinfully good!  Breakfast was amazing.  Our server Reina rocked!  Definitely no sad egg face here.
AmaZing best american brunch/ breakfast ever! Prices are reasonable. thank you Karla she helped us to find out the best ones in the menu! Easy to park! 4 miles to stribe dont be lazy is worthed

I dig the atmosphere of this seemingly mom and pop breakfast joint. The food is good but nothing to write home about. It was packed with a line out the door on the Saturday morning we went.

I was able to try the combo meat skillet, beef hash skillet, and the stuffed french toast. Everything tasted homemade which places it above chain breakfast restaurants, but I think all cities have some sort of a joint that serves similar tasting dishes.

One thing that stood out was their banana nut muffin. Choose it over the toast, when asked what you prefer. This was the only thing that was better than anywhere else I have tried. I'm not a big fan of BNut, but if it tasted like the ones here, I would choose it every time.

Decent breakfast joint, decent prices. I might hit it again to try out different dishes to see if anything that can knock my socks off.

I'll be honest this last visit to Vegas blew like a hot, lung collapsing desert breeze in your face while taking a whiz off the side of Zzyyxx Road. Between the bitch slaps I endured from Willy Wonka, Frodo Baggins, and those hags from Sex and the City I had enough and wanted to back flip off the Stratosphere without a bungee cord. Instead of eating more diarrhea inducing gobbledygook at the Caesar's food court my wife dragged my sluggish brown behind to the Egg and I. Thank God she did. Sorry no dancing ghetto looking dancing Despicable Me minions or card slappin' faux-porn peddlin' hombres here. What you will get though are those amazing banana nut muffins. The spinach benny I had was my saving grace, I doused it in hot sauce and devoured it Melissa McCarthy style. The waitress gives you your own container of coffee to refill your own mug instead of having to wait for her to come back. Jesus H. who does that anymore!!?? It's such a simple but awesome concept! Not these little doggy doo doo Denny's around where I live in the barrio, that's for sure.

Well let's start with the service. Tamara was our server and we would like to give her 10 stars.
The biscuits and eggs were also a 10.
They have so many people working everything is do smooth. Packed house but a short wait.
Best breakfast place in Vegas.
We will be back!
Great breakfast and service. Very friendly staff, especially our waitress, Liza. We'll be back!
Perfect breakfeast or lunch place.  A little noisy but good service.  Best eggs in town.
First timer and what can I say good quick service,friendly wait staff also thanks to Karla for a great experience definitely coming back
The Eggs Benedict were amazing!!!!  In fact all the  food was incredible. Our server Amanda was awesome.  Can't wait to come back!!!!
I just had the steak and eggs,  it was cooked perfectly. My server Earl was awesome,  very polite and friendly.

Great time, excellent food.  Paula our server was fun and attentive and threw in a Banana Loaf for our friend who was celebrating his birthday.  Highly recommend your trip to Las Vegas include a visit here
Literally the best breakfast ever!! Raul brought us a to die for muffins for being first time customers.. He also had excellent customer service.. AGAIN BEST BREAKFAST EVER.

We went here earlier this month not realizing that we'd been to their other Southeastern location in April 2010.  We were thrillled because we loved the food!  The coffee is so good and strong and love anywhere like this that leaves the urn on the table so you don't have wait for refills (I hate that!).
I had the Taco Rancheros which was a flour torilla covered with scrambled eggs, seasoned ground beef, refried beans, cheese, sour cream and salsa. I put the fried potatoes on top of it and it was awesome! 
My boyfriend had the Reuben Sandwich and he loved it.
This is one of those places where you get so much food that you don't need to eat again until dinner!

This place is absolutely AMAZING the strawberry stuffed French toast was DELICIOUS I WOULD CALL IT ORGASMIC HAHAH no seriously so good took me a while to decide everything in the menu seems delicious n it's so cheap wish I lived in Nevada so I can come Here all the time and let's talk about the server "EARL" great server super friendly and very attentive :) nice guy

I went there today around 11:30am, this was my 2nd time here, had a great experience last time so I had to come back again for some more great food!!

It was pretty packed inside so u can tell this place does a good job satisfying the customers, one of the waitress was able to seat me right away since I was by myself.

I was gonna order the stuffed French toast AND their Ultimate Skillets but the friendly waitress said she could do half portion of each since she said their portions are pretty big, so I agreed and ordered half n half. 

The food came and they look amazing!! The skillet was delicious, their potatoes were very flavorful, the stuffed French toast with eggs and syrup was yummy. Maybe I was just hungry, I felt like I could handle the full portion of BOTH next time. My waitress was really friendly, always have the smile on her face. Would definitly be back next time when I m in town. 

Want to buy their groovy t shirt but they don't have size Large. Maybe next time.

This place is great!!! 

The Staff is friendly
The food portions are perfect
The prices are spot on


Must try!!!
Awesome and well worth the wait.  Egg's Benedict was wonderful and so were the home fries!

Best breakfast place in Las Vegas!  

Banana nut muffins are awesome and so are the eggs benedicts.
I normally hate buttermilk pancakes everywhere but the pancakes here are stellar honestly! Everyone should eat here, super affordable and delicious. Send Paula to Disneyland she's awesome

It's a very busy place always crowded but it's well worth the wait. The last time I came I only waited 10 minutes which was shocking I usually wait 20-30 because how crowded it is. The customer service Is pleasing for a busy place! They always make you feel welcome. Their potatoes has to be one of the best things there. What ever I order I make sure the item comes with potatoes or I get them in the side. If you are a fan of banana but muffins then you will honestly love theirs. Always moist and fresh out the oven. I've been to Egg works which is the same business but for some reason I prefer the Egg and I more.

Yelp pulled thru again! Delicious on all counts. Great service, fast food delivery & everything spot on.  Banana muffin was as promised. Went Fri around 10:30. Only had to wait a few min. Weekend will probably be too busy but we may try to go back.

Delicious food. I had the bacon and avocado omelette. Hella good! Came with potatoes and toast. Bomb. The rest of my party enjoyed their food and we walked away full. Good price for quality of food. Good service too.
Alexa was a fantastic server, super accommodating to our food sensitivities, amazing with my kids, and just fun all around! The food was AMAZING! we all loved it! Thanks Alexa:-)

It was okay nothing special...pancakes were dry didn't eat it. Got that with bacon eggs and potatoes and toast! The staff was good friendly, it took a while for the food to come out but it was expected for a Sunday. Food wasn't terrible but I wouldn't come back.
Big tasty servings :) Really quick and kind staff, specifically BreeAnnDa :) Super clean :) Everything I want in a dinning experience.

Our amazing server Jessica was super helpful at providing us with recommendations (loved the waffle with strawberries and whipped cream), super attentive at providing us with water refills, and super caring by checking in on us periodically during our meal. As always awesome potatoes- good job Egg&I and Jessica!

A groupon and good reviews lead me to try this place in Vegas. Normally, I do not go off the strip to eat. I don't think this place is as good as the reviews lead it to be... the place was packed when I went though, around 11am. It took about 30 minutes or so for a table. Looking at the menu, LOTS of stuff looked good and I had trouble deciding what to eat. The menu is a newpaper, which is actually really cute and different; also, there is a lot of word-play on the menu which I thought was cleaver. I ended up getting the chicken fried steak skillet and my brother got the carnitas skillet. Both did taste good, but I did not think it was spectacular. Portions were a good size, a bit larger than average. My chicken steak was tender and crispy and the gravy was good... but the house potatoes it came with was way too salty. I mixed everything together to try to lessen the salt taste, but in the end, I couldn't finish all the potatoes because, well, it was just too much salt. I think they need to put less of the seasoned salt on it. I'm a total potato lover and I couldn't finish my potatoes. My skillet also came with 2 eggs, anyway you want and a muffin or toast. I chose the muffin. It was good-average. I tried a bit of the carnitas skillet... but I'm not a big Mexican food fan... so it wasn't to my liking really, but my brother liked it. His did not come with a muffin or toast though. I also ordered coffee, thinking it was going to come in the interesting cup I see posted... it came in the ugly typical diner coffee cup...

Personally, I think Hash House A Go-Go has much better food and better prices... and way bigger portions!! My brother agrees with me too. 

I don't think this place is worth the wait... it didn't stand out in my mind. Just an average breakfast place. Prices are fair... my chicken fried skillet was $10.50 and the carnitas skillet was about $11. 

Go to Hash House A Go-Go if you want special yummy breakfast food... this place is just average.
Dawg.... Amazing. Their omelette's are 5/5. Stuffed French Toast is amazing as well. You'll love this spot.

We ate here on our last day in las Vegas. We were looking for a place to eat off the strip and I'm glad we found this restaurant.  The portions are huge, more bang for your buck. I ordered the half portion of the southwest omelette and my husband ordered the chicken fried steak and we both were satisfied.

Always a favorite! Every time we come to Vegas we come here on Sunday morning! The wait varies depending on the time you come but it's always well worth it. 

This time we got the Stuffed French Toast and it was amazing!

The banana nut muffins are always warm and fresh and the diablo skillet potatoes are perfect!

Our waitress, Liza, was awesome as well. Very attentive, friendly and fun!

I didn't take pictures because we are so fast! Maybe next time! 

Thank you Egg and I!

My husband and I have been wanting to stop by here for quite awhile but it always seemed so busy. The service and the food were great! I ordered the veggie omelette and he ordered The Works scramble. The portions are giant so we had a lot to take home :-) We also tried their awesome banana nut muffins!
Good food, large portions, great service. Awesome place for breakfast!

The Egg and I may look like just another run-down, strip mall diner from the outside, but when you step inside, you're greeted with a breakfast oasis in a sea of Vegas locals. This place has just about anything you could think of for hot breakfast, (except oatmeal) and some items you would never dream of.

The newspaper-style menu is a breakfast gazette of headlines - like carrot cake French toast, pork carnitas burritos, and just about every type of omelet and pancake you could ever imagine.

Liza was our fabulous hostess on our dining journey. This woman is the epitome of a multi-tasker, buzzing around and paying attention to every little detail, from the quality of our food to the assurance our glasses remained full... and even the fact that I was rubbing my arms and she instantly picked up that I was cold and turned the air conditioner up a few degrees, without me asking. 
This woman is amazing at customer service! 

All of our food came out together (for seven people) and it was all piping hot! We were never left unattended and were quite entertained at how Liza perfectly orchestrated her tables (including our own).

Some of the dishes at our table included:
* Stuffed French toast - like a deconstructed monte cristo with bacon; delicious!
* Vegetarian crepe - filled with veggie goodness.; so fresh and so clean-clean.
* The Classic - hot scrambled eggs, toast and ham - American style.
* Pork carnitas burrito - mexitastic pork in a verde sauce wrapped in a soft flour tortilla; to die for.
* Egg whites and short stack of buckwheat pancakes - both cooked with no oil...  I was trying to watch my caloric intake, and The Egg and I was happy to accommodate me.

It's a bit of a drive from the strip, but so worth it! Bring your clan and ask for Liza!

Super friendly staff, busy but not too busy, great food. 

We ordered the waffle with fruit and one of the skillet dishes. Both were extremely satisfying. 

One complaint is that the skillet dish was at the salty end of the spectrum, despite special request to hold the salt. 

Get the banana nut muffin.
I always enjoy the food here.  A little busy inside kind of cramped but overall it is a good experience consistently

Got here on a Saturday (5/16) around noon for a late breakfast. The wait was about 30 minutes but went by fast. The food was great and loved the banana muffin. It comes out very warm and moist... delicious. 

What was best was the service. All staff were all very helpful and attentive and seemed truly happy to work there which made it a good experience for us.

Banana nut muffin is moist with a great crust. They dont skimp on the canadian bacon when it comes to the eggs florentine benedict.  Hollandaise was on point; not too much salt and is not too creamy, complementing the egg yolk. Potatoes were seasoned perfectly, although they could have been crispier. Had a bite of the chili relleno, overriding flavor was the chili, which is a plus. Coffee left me wanting, but we were there for the eggs!

Great service, no wait to get in, overall great place to have breakfast off the strip.
Great spot for an amazing breakfast. Bring your appetite! I always stop in here when I visit Las Vegas!!

As good as it gets!

Came here in April to meet up with an old friend.  This place was very cute and spacious. We got seated right away.  The menu is like a newspaper, but not. I thought that was really neat and fun, quite creative if you ask me.  The corn beed hash is very up to par with what I consider a good corn beef hash. Trust me, I'm very nit picky about my hash & how I like them.  I really enjoyed the potatoes as well. Brownie points for endless coffee.  It's all you can drink so that's nice.

DON'T forget the MUFFIN!!! Melt in your mouth good. GET THE MUFFIN!

love this place ,, food it's great !!!.. great customer service from "koko"..CHILE RELLENO OMMLETT it's a must try !!!. Love them potatoes !!!.. ohh and the prices are awesome .. it's a great restaurant for all the family , kids meals plates are huge at great prices.. wish I had taken a picture ,.. but we couldn't wait to eat .. lol..

We were in vegas for the weekend heading to Mt Charleston looking for breakfast. This had great reviews and was crowded so we proceeded. They have great service but i am not a fan of tex-mex or southwestern food so i could not rate it higher.
Best breakfast anywhere.  I lived the skillet.   And make sure you get the muffin.

Simply fantastic place to eat. The service was 5 stars and the place was packed. Our server checked on us constantly, when he found out it was our first time he dropped off two free muffins and never stopped making sure we were good with everything. 

The Chile relleno omelette was fantastic and it came out hot and delicious. Normally packed restaurants suffer in service but it was quick and ready and service was on point. No wonder 2000+ hits gave it more than 4 stars. 

Stop by and you won't regret it.

Server's name was Ulises. I wish you luck in winning your Disneyland trip for 2. I love the idea of flipping a sign from happy face to sad face and your server will come over. Very creative. Portions were large. Price was reasonable. I got a veggie skillet with two eggs. BF got the French toast stuffed with Omelette. The banana muffin was yummy too.
What a great meal and Karen was a great waitress, very attentive and smiling. I am a person of few words. I write reviews both good and bad.

I love this spot. It is one of my top 10. I can eat break fast all day. I love there potatoes. I usually get a skillet with meat and potatoes. Perfect hang over food, for me any way. Only thing I don't like is this place is always packed. Many locals know about this place. I haven't ate inside yet, I always order over the phone, and pick it up. It stays busy for a reason.
Always a great breakfast and super service. They give you the whole pot of coffee! Banana muffins so good and great deal! Portions are huge. So split if u can.

The coffee is good, service is great,banana muffins are great, they add a ton of cheese to the top of the scrambles:/ and the house potatoes have too much seasoning on them but now I know and what to adjust. Overall experience was great.

Tasty and great friendly service by Breeannda!

The chile relleno omelette and the sunrise mountain (open faces croissant sandwich) were good choices.... Among the many many choices on the menu!

This place is by far the best breakfast/lunch restaurant in Vegas...great quality food and service was amazing! The staffs works as a team to make sure you have everything you need! Highly recommend!!
Very good food, excellent attentive staff. Our waiter was very nice.  I am happy I left the hotel to come to this great place with my family. I recommend if in Vegas stop by.

Fantastic breakfast! Because it was our first visit, our waitress gave us free banana nut muffins. Man, were they good! The restaurant was busy, but we were seated right away. 

They did not skimp on portions, and the prices were decent. The biscuits and gravy were tasty, and I loved their carrot cake french toast. So yummy! I received breakfast potatoes with my order, and I wasn't expecting them. I'm so glad, though, because they turned out to be my favorite thing on the plate. I've bookmarked this restaurant so I can visit again next time I come to Vegas.

This is indeed an awesome place for breakfast/brunch/lunch.  The food that they serve is excellent, and the portion is generous too.  I personally enjoy the Stuff French Toast and Omelet.  The banana cake came for free when you check in using Yelp, they are very moist.  However, some say the OJ is good, but we tried it.  I'd say... it's not my cup of tea, although they are also fresh squeeze.  We suspect they have put sugar or ice to mix them together since we drink freeze squeeze juice at home very often.

Yes, for any city or town I go to, I check for The Egg and I because as much as I love IHOP, The Egg and I is amazing!  And the one in Vegas has everything you could ever want in a restaurant...great food and service so great you'll want to stop by every day.  Stop reading this now and GO!

I have to say, this was a outstanding breakfast, right down to the coffee. I had pork chops and eggs that was so tender. We also had the corned beef hash which was outstanding. Wherever you are at in Vegas, this is worth the drive. It is now a must have when I come into town. I was outstanding
Our waitress Alexa was very nice and efficient and made our experience a really good one!

Come here with an empty stomach and an appetite or be prepared to take some food home. The portions are huge! The breakfast menu is one of the most diverse that I've ever encountered. 4-egg omelettes and scrambles seem to be the rule in Las Vegas. The Egg & I omelettes were delicious and loaded with cheese. We had a veggie omelette and a veggie scramble. The potatoes were seasoned just right. Reading prior Yelp reviews beforehand, I doubted that the banana nut muffins could live up to the hype. Boy was I wrong. Excellent. Fluffy and not too heavy on the banana. Prepare for a large crowd and a wait on the weekend. The hostesses were very pleasant and friendly. The bus staff too. And our server, Tamara, was a delight.
Stacey,  our wonderful server couldn't of made it any better,  positive and helpful. Food was excellent can't wait to come back.

Delicious inexpensive breakfast with excellent service and outdoor seating. 

Portions are HUGE and the banana nut muffins are addicting. I left eating more than I wanted to, and I'd do it again. 

Will definitely return on my next trip. Apparently it gets really busy on weekends, we went on a weekday and there was no wait, but the place was full.

Egg & I had really great food. We got the EGGS-PLUS which included 2 eggs cooked to order, ranch potatoes, toast or banana nut muffin (get the banana nut muffin... makes a great appetizer!!!), and choice of bacon, sausage or ham (get the sausage links). Service was good. Food came out quickly. A few miles/minutes off the strip. Definitely worth trying out. Will definitely go back here when we go back to Vegas and would recommend!
Gut filling satisfaction.  Diverse menu and old standards.

Was in town and saw the reviews here so decided to come try it out. We got there early (7am) so it wasn't packed. I ordered the strawberry cream cheese stuffed french toast and it was really really awesome. Huge portion and just really well done. Also got some OJ and it was nice to see that it was freshly squeezed. Prices were affordable and service was friendly. I'm not a huge breakfast person, but if we had this place back in LA, I would definitely make it a point to become one!

Great food, large servings and if your lucky, Dariesia will serve you.... If your lucky.

:)

A return trip is required.

Great breakfast spot! Consistent service and the food is delicious. Brad's omelette is my go-to, but if you're feeling courageous, the loco moco or the haole moco are both amazing! The potatoes are always good.

Great breakfast place. It's not on the strip but if you can, make the trip out. I had the Loco Moco and it was great. The banana nut muffin came with the meal and it was the best banana nut muffin I've ever had. It actually may be the best any muffin I've ever had. The staff was friendly with prompt/quick service with reasonable prices. The potatoes that come with most breakfast entrees were really good as well.

So - my bestie who's a local told me and my other bestie to go to this place on our way out of Vegas.  I'm SO happpy she told us about this...

I got the shredded corned beef hash with eggs.  WOW is all I can say. So good, exactly what I wanted. 

For the price, the portions are large.  Total deal.

Hazelnut coffee was fabulous.  

The menu is huge, so if eggs aren't your thing there is plenty of other things on the menu to pick.  That was probably the hardest thing for us - was to actually pick something off the huge menu.  

Clearly this a locals place, it's off the strip in a strip mall.  We missed it when we were driving there.

Awesome breakfast. Skillets great, omelettes were awesome and the potatoes
Not enough time on this trip for a return visit, but will be back

Probably one of the best breakfast places I've ever had in Las Vegas! My husband and I ate here on a Friday morning but thought we would have to wait awhile because it was full, however, we got seated right away and our food came out fast. I ordered the classic and it was very good. Our server Chance was very nice and made us feel welcome. Their bus boys are very efficient as well, as soon as people left they cleaned the tables in no time so that people who were waiting didn't have to wait long. Overall, very happy experience :)

After many years of coming to Vegas and being condemned to expensive hotel breakfasts, we decided it was time to venture out. A 10-minute drive from the Strip is this breakfast gem. The menu is a small newspaper. Literally. A massive selection of eggs and other breakfast favorites means there is someone for everyone. 

We both ordered egg dishes and they were huge portions at reasonable prices. A little more than $20 for the two of us; and you can eat here cheaper than we did if you want. 

It's a no-nonsense diner-type atmosphere inside focused on fast service. The staff was fabulous. Our server, Karla, was like a best friend from the moment we sat down. They have these "smile and frown@ signs on the table. If you are good, you put up the smile. If you need anything, you put up the frown. They watch for it and respond quickly. 

There's a great outside patio and its dog-friendly. It's also a very kid friendly place. Plenty of space even at prime breakfast time and there was no wait. They turn tables quickly. 

One thing of note:  they give you a pot of coffee. But on other drinks, refills are not free. Fine by us since the drinks they serve are very large. 

What a great find!  Thanks to Karla and the staff here for giving us a place to come back to when we are in town again.

If you go at the right time, and you ca beat the rush it is completely worth it.  The Egg & I was very filling, and priced well.  If you are caught in the breakfast rush time, it can be slower, but it is still very good.  

The Eggs Works I think is owned by the same company, as both logos are on the shirts of employees, but that place is a little lighter for breakfast.
Great food and great service from Chance!  Definitely worth the shirt drive from strip

I came here for breakfast with a few people the other day. The restaurant was packed and we had to wait about 10-15 minutes. I ordered the corned beef hash which was homemade. Good flavor and lots of it! My niece really liked it and ended up eating about half of it. My niece actually ordered the waffle with bananas on top (strawberries were out of season). This girl can eat but is skinny as a stick. Kids! One of the other ladies had Portuguese sausage, rice and eggs. They give you a whole sausage and it's pretty big. Whoa now, I'm talking about food! The other lady had spam & eggs which she really liked. We all got the banana muffin with our meals. YUM! We had a good breakfast and may be back again when we're in Vegas.

We discovered this gem of a restaurant and was pleasantly surprised.  The menu is amazing.  I had the eggs and chilli relleno which was amazing.   Erin our waitress was incredible and provided us the most friendly pleasant service.  All the way around the experience was awesome.  I can't wait to go back.
Liza was a really great server. She was very attentive and everything was brought promptly. The food was really good. I will be leaving a decent tip and can not wait to come back again.

Made a Togo order. Breakfast Burrito. Waited 23 minutes for the burrito and my order was wrong. Waited another 12 minutes for a simple correction to order and finally cancelled. Do not recommend take out.

Great food. Great service. Dog friendly patio. Huge portions.  Will
Be back for sure.

It was busy on a sat morn but the food and service was great!  There was a variety of options!  I like that the pancakes can come with fresh fruits.  A group of 5 ate here and we were satisfied with the food and service.
The food here was really good. We got a free banana muffin for checking in. sooo good

The Egg & I has the freshest eggs you can get at a breakfast restaurant! My scrambled egg whites were fluffy, light, and delicious! Their homemade banana muffins were yummy and their fruit was fresh! The restaurant itself is quaint and adorable. And you can't beat the price (especially if you've spent the weekend shelling out tons of money for food on The Strip!) This place is definitely worth going out of your way for if you're visiting Vegas!
Food was excellent and large portion. Tabitha was excellent. Attentive, genuinely friendly. Highly recommend.

I'm not sure what the fuss is with this restaurant.  Whatever you do, DON'T order the hash browns (vs their Diabla potatoes) .  I was served the exact same hash brown patty that McDonalds serves.  The food was good but average at best (including the free banana nut muffin).  Sorry I can't go with the masses with this review

MY FAVORITE BREAKFAST SPOT ON THE PLANET!!!

Okay, maybe a little extreme, but you get my drift. I LOVE eating here. The staff is ALWAYS helpful, the food is always great, and the Chile Relleno Omelet is the bomb.com. PLUS --- the coffee is strong - its the perfect place to take visitors to a local Vegas spot, or just for your regular hangover cure - this place will do the trick JUST FINE, trust me, I know from experience lol

Second time here, and I have to say it's average. The previous visit, we went and it wasnt crowded.   This time we went on a Saturday, around 10ish and the wait wasnt too long maybe 10-15 minutes.

Previously, the service was very attentive, but this time service was was very mediocre at best.  I ordered the Taco Rancheros again.  I feel like this time around something was missing,  it tasted kinda blah, or in comparison something that I would find at Dennys.  Tho, the ranch potatoes still were quite tasty!  

Next time if we come back, I'm going to try something different. Sigh.

I would easily say that we received the most amazing service from the most incredible server in the world.  I only wished  i lived in Vegas to get the chance to have brunch here at least once/week.  the banana nut muffin was very fresh. The Chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes were perfectly fluffy and pumpkin was fresh, and teh chocolate chips were just right (not too much, not to few).  The Fried chicken skillet was also AMAZING!. Cooked just right, with a thick and creamy gravy, with perfectly cooked potatoes, and an egg, just how i asked for it. even the OJ carafe tasted fresh, and it probably wasn't though, but it had me fooled.
Again the prices, service and quality of food were amazing. (only thing is that this particular Egg&I restaurant was a bit far from our Hotel on the strip, but definitely worth the cab ride). Even the General Manager came by our table  a few times to ask how everything was. (my receipt says the  server is Mandy but i believe her real name was thiereny (shes getting married soon)).
And they have an amazing GIVEAWAY trip to Disney

Came here for Father's Day a while back and expected it to be super crowded. With no reservation, the three people in my party waited about 45 min in the morning and luckily we were seated inside and escaped the deathly Las Vegas heat. The free banana nut muffin was a great little appetizer for our breakfast and the food was overall tasty. The highly reviewed corned beef hash was delicious but a little heavy/salty for the morning

Whenever I am in vegas I always make sure that this is the last place that I hit up before I hit the road. The breakfast menu is really good and there is so much to choose from that it makes it hard to decide what you really want to eat because everything sounds so good. It is reasonable priced and the portions are large. So be sure to go on an empty stomach, cause you will walk out of there stuffed.

The service is great. Very mom and pops style. Only thing that sucks is that the cashier takes a while to ring up your stuff. She is pretty slow.

When you go make sure to have soem of their breakfast potatoes and their waffles are deliciuosly huge.

This is a great place for brunch!  Excellent food,l and large-generous portions.  I would have given 5-stars however, we didn't get refills on our water and had to ask a couple of times for our half and half for coffee.  Excluding those two minor issues, it was great!
Massive portions drowned with pots of decent coffee. Service is prompt and cheery. Great for groups
Great service! The waitress was nice and gave us free, warm banana nut muffins. The food was also delicious! I had the special, the Las Vegas omelet. I would definitely go back!

The Egg and I has been a staple of Vegas breakfast dining for years and is consistently lauded as one of the best places in town to getcher morning grub on.  It's easy to see why - this is just great, unpretentious food.  While it's fun to dine well in a dinner environment with tiny gourmet portions and fine presentations, for me breakfast is all about big portions and perhaps a little less regard to the appearance of the food.  It just needs to taste good and help wake your sluggish butt up.

The Egg and I offers breakfast staples - eggs, toast, pancakes, waffles, crepes, french toast, omelet, sausage, bacon - in various combinations and specialty skillets and frittatas as well.  Everything is always fresh, cooked to order, and served by a friendly wait staff.  I wish I lived closer, because I'd probably have their eggs benedict every day.

Eggcellent food, had the chicken enchilada omelette, delicious!  Ask for Darla to be your server, she provides Excellent customer service, keeps you updated , is very warm and friendly, makes you feel very much at home amid the busyness of the place. I would definitely patronize this establishment again when in Vegas.
Depends on what you are looking for. This is by no way a fancy place... Like your I hop or Dennys but better food. So if you're on strip looking for a fancy place, this is not where you should go.

Good breakfast place but not unlike most places you get eggs and coffee.  Food was good and came out very quickly, I didn't particularly care for the side of potato hash that come with the meal. The staff is attentive but not overbearing seeing as how they are so busy and they have a little egg dude on the table that frowns when you flip him over so you can get service ASAP. A solid 3 stars.

Egg and I is a hearty American breakfast place off the strip. My friends and I had the prime rib benny, cordon Bleu skillet, chicken fried steak skillet, biscuits and gravy , and breakfast burrito. We had coffee with our meal. Reina was our server and she was awesome and attentive. The biscuits arrived  cold and she immediately got us a replacement.  The food itself was great and the coffee was serviceable and generously flowing. Definitely a good day after brunch spot!.

Breakfast was excellent, I had the avocado omelet. Server Lisa was great checking on how the food was. I think the managers name is Marc, have to give him credit too. Banana bread very moist. good luck getting to SoCal Disneyland

Ok. Love this chain. Not sure about this location. They seem to always be busy. Saying that.... 

Hire more help. Train your staff to help each others customers not ignore them.

Once our server Ashley came over things improved. Food came out quick. Tasted great. Score went from a * to a *** only because the ball started rolling.

Stopped in for breakfast. We heard great things about this place and they lived up to the reputation without a doubt. 

The staff is very friendly, polite and very efficient. They were always very conscious to our needs. 

The food was fantastic! We highly recommend this place.

I'm just sorry that we don't live here to come back soon.

My boyfriend was right, this place was egg-cellent! I really enjoyed my breakfast at the Egg & I. Perhaps because all over the restaurant, there were little cute drawings of eggs being all happy and that the menu was made of newspaper material with happy eggs all over it  :D.

I ordered two pancakes, scrambled eggs and bacon. The pancakes were really nice and fluffy, the eggs were light and fluffy too and the bacon...I gave to my boyfriend haha!

Good price, good food, fast service and friendly staff.
If you want 5star service ask for Amanda! I highly recommend this place to visitors! Their special are available whether you see them on the special board or not!!

I got the chicken fried steak, it was good but I've had better. The coffee was awesome!  We also got the blueberry pancakes and they were great!  My husband tried the prime rib skillet. It was really good. The only real complaint we had were that the potatoes were awful. Boring an way too salty!!!!

What an amazing find! We wanted the breakfast buffet at our hotel on the Strip, but found out that the price doubled on the weekend. So on our way out of town to the Grand Canyon, we did a quick Yelp search and found this gem. Being in Vegas, we thought it was funny that there were 777 reviews for this place, averaging 4.5 stars. It lived up to the hype! 

Definitely ask for the banana nut muffins, they are amazing. As are the potatoes. As are the omelettes...heck, it was ALL great! I ordered the chile relleno omelette (yes you read that right) and it was dee-lish. 

Our server, Alyssa, was friendly and made sure everything was to our liking and topped off. The manager, Gia, stopped by our table to check in on us and ended up giving us some great ideas of places to check out on our road trip.

After the crazy hustle and bustle and falseness of the Strip, it was great to eat at a down-home style diner. I liked it so much I wanted to buy a T-shirt, but they were out of the tie-dye one that I wanted. Which is probably the only non-five-star thing I can say about this place. We will definitely be back here again the next time we're in town!

Holy moly! First of Karla is the best. You'll be lucky to be a table of hers. Not from Vegas but I'll be absolutely coming back anytime I'm here in town. Banana Nut Muffins...enough said. Just what everyone needs in their life.

The Biscuits & Gravy, so good!! 
The staff is very friendly & know the menu like the back of their hand.

Not the best breakfast/brunch place I've eaten at.  The pancakes were average and a bit too sweet with the strawberry cream cheese (and I have a huge sweet tooth).  And their famed banana nut muffin was maybe too hyped up, so my expectations were not in line with what I actually tasted.  Not to say that it wasn't good. You do get a lot of food for the money though, considering you're in Vegas, so it's a steal. And the service was very friendly, like being in a diner where everyone knows your name. So if you're looking for a fix of good old fashioned, artery-clogging American breakfast, this would be a good option in Vegas if you don't want to break the bank in a casino establishment.

The entire staff was super nice. Tamara was our server. She constantly Chechen in on us and was patient with is considering we took a little longer than usual to order since it was our first time there. The food was fresh and it was clean. It was cooked quickly and perfectly. Even the turkey bacon wasn't dry, which is usually my issue with other breakfast restaurants. Definitely recommend and will come back.

You will want to eat everything on the menu here and you can't go wrong. I had the chile rellano omelette and it was amazing. The service also is like a 3 Michelin star restaurant. Very attentive, happy, and fast. Our server Curtis was extremely helpful and attentive and they even gave us free banana muffins without us even mentioning the Yelp deal. I will be back every time I come to Vegas.

It was our first time in Vegas and relied on yelp to find out what might be some great places for breakfast. We came across this cute and delicious spot and didn't regret anything! I ordered the banana walnut french toast and my boyfriend had a skillet. Both were extremely good! Potatoes are a must have. I repeat, YOU MUST HAVE THY POTATOES! Also, I asked for my ham to be warmed up b/c it was cold, but she offered to make me a new one. Minutes go by and turns out they forgot my ham. BUT DON'T FRET! Not only did she get me my ham ASAP, she took it off the bill AND free muffins to go. Yum! Can anyone say, awesome service???

I had a couple hours on Sunday morning and decided I'd give Egg and I a chance.  I had heard it was pretty good.  My server, Breeannda was extremely attentive.  She made sure my water glass was full the entire visit.  (About 6 glasses worth)  I ordered the biscuits and gravy and asked to have extra sausage cut up and added to it.   The food was really good.   I recommend stopping by for breakfast if you are in the area.  I will be back.
Este lugar es el mejor para desallunar lo malo es q por tan bueno q es esta siempre lleno y hay q esperar bastante pero esta muy bien

Friendly folks, lots of seating, good food and coffee - my only complaint was that the potatoes were very salty.  Other than that, tasty and good - it was great to get away from the Strip on our trip and just be with the locals.  Our server was lovely and it was an overall great breakfast experience.  Would definitely return.

OK
You must go there, if only for the CHICKEN FRIED STEAK.
I can't imagine it being any better

Chicken enchilada onlet was the !!!
Liza our server was excellent!! Good luck hope u win a trip to Disney!!

We went there with a group of four. The service was amazing as we had Mabel for a waitress. Also, they have an egg system that you can turnover if you need anything and its all hands on board as all servers help out.
We each ordered something different then passed it around, All were good some better than others. Their menu is quite extensive. you can oder anything you like.
The Bloody Mary's were excellent as well. We would go back as the price is fair as well

Favorite breakfast place ever!!!  Served by the AWESOME waiter BRADY wearing Viking's jersey, always following up with his customers, way to go. Checking in on yelp got an extra all time favorite banana nut muffin, yummy... Chicken  fried steak skillet & the works omelette to complete  the meal. Generous servings!!!

We came as a group of 7 on Friday around 1:30pm and only had to wait for about 15minutes. Thank goodness the wait wasn't too long because by now we've been on the road for 5+ hours and we're starving!!! 

I have a feeling that this place is super busy all the time--the restaurant is packed with people and the service is also super duper speedy, like the servers here are always on their toes to get people in and out as quickly as possible. But they're still super friendly, so I'm not complaining because I love the efficiency of this place. 

F O O D:
Honestly the food here was a pretty big disappointment. For some reason the food here was very very salty--the ham, the sauce, everything. Eating this makes me feel super gross and pretty terrible about myself. Especially because the portion sizes here are HUGE! My friend and I shared the Stuffed French Toast and we couldn't finish it (sorry potatoes :( ). So I recommend sharing just one thing between you and a friend or you can always take it to-go. I thought the Stuffed French Toast was really delicious because it wasn't salty at all, but our friends that got the Eggs Benedict dishes weren't so lucky :( 

P A R K I N G:
There is a parking lot right out front so no worries about parking! 

Don't forget to check in for the free banana nut muffin! It's warm, it's wonderful, it's amazingly good!

Man everything here is pretty bomb.
They had my turkey bacon too. The good Godshalls brand. Oh my.
Food was awesome as usual.   Had the cheese and sausage omelet,  son had the avocado cheese omelet.   Both excellent.   Breeannda took fantastic care of us with her huge smile.  Great meal.

More like 3.5 stars for me but I'm going to round it up to 4 because of their yummy banana nut muffin and breakfast potatoes which are the stars of the show here!  I ordered Brad's Very Special Omelette with spinach, mushrooms, tomato, and cheese which was about 3 stars to me - good but not the best I've had.  I chose to have it with their famous muffin and potatoes which are delicious!  

Got here around 1 p.m. on a Thursday afternoon and there were plenty of available tables.  Service was good and prompt and prices pretty low so for those reasons I can also round up from 3.5 to 4 stars.  I definitely enjoyed my food and overall experience here more than at Hash House A Go Go, so save on waiting time and come on over to Egg & I!

This was my first time and I absolutely loved the food and the service. The food was delicious and the servers were very nice. The portion size definitely matches the price. The banana nut muffin and the potatoes were the highlight for me, it was so bomb. Although the wait was long (20 minutes), it was definitely worth the wait!
My friends and I were in Vegas and looking for a great breakfast spot. I ended up finding this place and must say, AMAZING!! Great service and yummy yummy food... Well worth it.

Nice breakfast!! Veggie Omelet was soft and great with cheese, Stuffed French toast with egg, cheese and ham--great idea and turns out a good match!! Steak and eggs---so tender and well cooked!! Good place with family and friends, nice choice for a fulfilling brunch. Would like to go back again.

First I think most of the bad time was due to our waitress Ashley. She had a bad attitude from the start and was more than slow. I tried to order a mimosa which I was then told that even though it's on the menu they don't have them. Ashley took offense to that as well. It took a while to get our sodas, she never came back for refills. After a bit she came to take our order and didn't get that right either. My sister ordered a burger with a muffin as an appetizer,  the muffin never came. I ordered a pesto veggie sandwich (came out without pesto) but Ashley didn't know that because she never checked on our food once it cane out. My mom asked 3 people for mustard, by the time she got it her burger was cold. Overall less than happy with the experience. Cheers, hope yours is better than ours.

Liza was an amazing server and made the group feel at home. The food came out in good time considering the whole place was packed from front to back. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. Great experience overall. The works omlet was amazing and i highly recommend it.
Love the breakfast. We got the stuffed toast and the bacon avocado omelette. Portions are pretty big. Well worth the price. The potatoes on the side were really good!

Our server forgot to bring utensils til we got our food. I know it could happen and isn't a big deal, but she disappeared for a while. So we have to find other server to get utensils.

She appeared again, and she gave us check at the moment we just had some bites. I looked around to see people with other servers whether they had a check, just in case "it's the restaurant's style." But only people who seemed already finished got the check. I felt she wanted us to leave asap. After giving us the check, she had never came our table again.

It sucked. Better train the girl again.

The Banana Nut Muffin deserves 5 stars on its own.  Its soft, it melts in your mouth and it goes so well with my morning coffee.  Besides the muffin, egg & I is a wonderful breakfast spot because their extensive menu has something for everyone including someone like me who frowns at eggs.  I had their breakfast sundae which is basically some yogurt with granola and fruit and it was just fine.  The wait can be long but it goes fast and the staff is trained to get you in and out of their place in record time.

I'm from out of state and this was my first time at this restaurant and id have to say i was not disappointed. My sisters and I found this restaurant online and decided to check it out for the breakfast. I had the country fried steak and it was one of the best country fried steaks I've had. The banana nut muffin was actually the best I've ever had. Our server Tamara was very sweet, she took very good care of us. We will definitely be coming back upon our next visit to Vegas. If you haven't already been sold on this place you need to just go. Great food and amazing service.

AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME food!

A normal trip to Vegas for me and my girlfriend tends to be limited to the strip, but having driven out from San Diego, we decided to venture away from the concrete jungle for breakfast.  I looked on yelp, found this place and we started driving.

Here's all you need to know:

1. There were a lot of people waiting outside, and we almost just left.  For a two-top, we waited 20 minutes (which seemed more than reasonable for a Saturday morning).
2. The food came WICKED-FAST.  Like, 5 minutes MAX.  2 orders of eggs bene and a plate of pancakes.  CRAZY FAST.
3. I am an eggs benedict officianado, and theirs was MAGNIFICENT.  The eggs benedict was probably the best I've ever had, and the "ranch-style" potatoes that accompanied it were fantastic as well.
4. The prices were very reasonable.

100% Guaranteed that I will come back to this place next time I'm in Vegas.

RANDOM NOTE:  After picking up our pup from a doggy hotel near the airport, we considered driving way back to this place for breakfast one more time.  By PURE LUCK, we saw a sign for "Egg Works", stumbled in and discovered that it was the SAME COMPANY.  1 in a million chance and a very happy ending for our trip.  The food was equally as good as The Egg and I.

Eggceptional! If you're visiting Vegas, get off the strip and try this one. I wasn't a huge fan of the prime rib Benny but not because of how it was prepared. Just isn't my taste. The country Benny was great, as was the service.
We always come here and recommend all of our friends even when we are not in town. Our server BREEANDA was very attentive and helpful. Thanks for your great service!

If you can get off the strip, you need to try the breakfast here. Staci was our server and she helped to make this a great dining experience.  She was friendly, helpful and professional. I ordered the pulled pork taquito, served with eggs on the top. Oh my, this was delicious and humongous. It served with a green salsa which I don't normally like but this was good. If you like a little Mexican with your brunch this is a dish worth trying. My partner had the homemade corned beef hash.  Also delicious, big chunks of meat. The meal started with their muffins. So Good, I wish we saved one for later.
GET THE BANANA MUFFIN! You cannot leave without trying it, it was awesome! Everything here is really good, hands down one of the best breakfast joints i've ever been to.
Great food and service. Pancakes were very good and so was the ham and cheese Omelette. Just be aware. If you're are coming from a hotel on the strip it's a 25 dollar cab each way.

Thanks Yelp for another great recommendation.  Wide variety, good food, good service.  The blueberry pancakes were very good, and the turkey sausage was great.  An excellent breakfast choice if you have a car

Had the western omelette and pancakes. Pretty crowded for a Tuesday. This place is off the strip. My main dish was 4 star but t honesty the pancakes were not that great. I liked the papitas. 

Wife's review: 

The potato fries were salty and the service was mediocre.

Great service, very delicious foods, a big dishes and very friendly staffs.  Our family loves breakfast and when to so many places in different states, and this place is the one of the best place!  Love "Egg & I". I definitely come again!
Just finished breakfast Amanda are service was fantastic!   We sat outside enjoyed the nice weather and savored out banana nut muffin!!
Never been disappointed in the Egg & I on Sahara in Vegas.  Chance took really good care of us.

Wife and I had an early Friday morning breakfast here and really enjoyed it. Wait staff was extremely nice and attentive, and giving honest and candid suggestions from the menu.  I don't like nuts so did not have the banana nut muffin (wife loved it) and waitress said blueberry one is not homemade so beware - she was right. There are half portions to the large portions, and my wife had the half omelet.  Veggie skillet was great as well. If you need wait staff help, you flip a little egg stand on your table.

Best omelette I've ever had in my life, and the free banana nut muffin for checking in is amazing as well. Thank you guys for the outstanding food, and service. I'll always come here for breakfast whenever I'm in Las Vegas.

Our first breakfast in Las Vegas! It was good. The eggs with cheddar were delicious and the waffle was very well done. My bf had an eggs benny and he really liked it. Overall, it was the best breakfast we had in Vegas and I would recommend it. Kept us full for the majority of the day.

I'm not really a breakfast person but this place was suggested by someone and my friend and I decided to check it out. It's such a cute little place, with delicious food. The environment was super cozy. It's a must if you go to Vegas for a little vacation.
Place was good my eggs were scrambled and I got a,free banana muffin per yelp which was nice had an overall great experience

We were heading to Jamm's for breakfast and my wife said, I think we've been there before, so she suggested we try something else.  This place was on the way.  Turns out, we've eaten here before as well.  It's really good, portions are plenty from a guy who likes big portions.  I had the chicken fried steak breakfast and my wife had the stuffed French toast with sausage.  Telling the truth, I was really looking for something that came with pancakes because I like a big breakfast, this place really didn't have many options.  It didn't need it.  You get a mountain of little diced up potatoes that are nuggets of seasoned fried heaven, large main potions that pancakes would put you in food coma.  Coffee is really the only thing that I would say could be better.  Good, but not spectacular.

This was my first time here and I have to say th he food is awesome. The service was great Tamara made us feel right at home. She answered all of our questions and had the patience of Job when it came to my young ones ordering.

We went on a Friday morning during Spring Break around 10:45am. It was just starting to fill up and we only waited about 5 minutes. The food was delicious and Linnea was our server, who was excellent. It's not that far from the strip and totally worth getting away from all of the over priced stuff on the strip.
