I ordered the chicken fried steak scramble and added mushrooms and spinach. The rest of my party  had an omelet and blueberry pancakes which were all really good. I highly recommend this place!
This place never disappoints!!!! Consistently great food & service!!!! Best place in Vegas for breakfast!!!!

Good diner and very close to the strip. Went with my friend after a long night and they offer good portions at a good price. Checking in alone gives you a free banana nut muffin that was delicious. I had the country fried steak and eggs as well as the corn beef hash and eggs for brunch. The corn beef hash was very good and better than the country fried steak and eggs. Although the reviews rave about this place, it fell just short of my expectations but it was still delicious. Would probably think about coming here again when I am back in Vegas, but it wouldn't be my first choice

Amazing customer service as well as food. On our very first visit there was a problem with my order. Not only did our waitress not hesitate to bring me something else, they did it quickly AND brought us a free "gift to take home" - an entire loaf of yummy banana bread! I was pretty blown away by how nice they were to us.  They go out of their way to make sure you leave with a smile on your face. I wish all restaurants had customer service like this place. We loved the food as well and will definitely be back for more.
This place is delicious! Finally decided to stop by after passing by it. I tried the stuffed French toast!!!! The Diablo potatoes with syrup on top are awesome as well!
This place has the best breakfasts. Potatoes are simply award winning. Servers are always nice and on point. Atmosphere is relaxed. Props to our last server, Maggie, for being awesome.

I love all day breakfasts! In fact, I have a hard time going anywhere that has Eggs Benedict and not ordering it. So I tried the Spinach Benny with Canadian bacon (ham) and a side of Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes. My husband had The Classic with 2 basted eggs, seasoned potatoes and toast....,they both were good but not egg-ceptional as advertised
They have these eggs that you turn over on the tables if you need service (see photo) which is a cool idea but our server was swamped and really was so far away with other tables that she couldn't take care of us well.
We went to the oldest location and although it was busy, it really could use an update and maybe even a day to shut down and be cleaned from top to bottom.
TIP FOR YELPERS! Check-in online for a free banana nut muffin. They are HUGE and delish!
Omg this place is so good.... The staff is great too....my boyfriend and I were in Vegas for a few days and I will say that this was the best meal I had during the whole trip! You got to go here !
Best breakfast place in Vegas for the price. Our waiter, Oscar, killed it. This guys should own the place. We come here everything were in town. Bobillinanate

10 Stars = Service
Menu selection is on point when it comes to eggs, but it's the service that speaks volumes at this establishment! Patrick is THE MAN! And use the happy/sad egg service sign, they come running!

This is a great breakfast and brunch place. Always busy and packed especially during weekends. 

I tried their Eggs Benedict Florentine and it was delicious and a hefty portion. It came with potatoes and side of fruits. My friend had steak and eggs and she liked it. The steak was flavorful. 

Will be back!

Love this place. Great diner-style breakfasts along with some Mexican-inspired section. Also lots of veggie-heavy options, which are delish. Really excellent service too. Despite crowds and lines most days, I have never had to wait more than 15 minutes. Highly recommend for a great off-the-strip breakfast!
First time here. Such great food. Very great service. Def a must if your in Vegas. Got the black prime rib Benny it was fantastic. Dariesia was a great server. A+++++++
Paid a recent visit after probably ten years since my last meal here. Just as good as I remember. Skillet breakfasts always satisfy. Good coffee. Friendly and prompt service.
Awesome! Huge selections! Food was delicious. Banana muffins are the best. Stacy was are server and she went above and beyond in service. 5 stars service

Delicious food, the reviews are no lie! Came here for brunch while passing through Vegas on a cross-country road trip. Tried the:

1) Crazy Chicken Omelette: very good! The chicken was tender, there was a good ratio of guacamole and mushrooms, and the omelette was smothered in cheese and sour cream. Ranch potatoes on the side were fantastic, as expected.
2) Sausage gravy + sausage patty: a little on the salty side, but I thought it had a good balance of chunkiness and creaminess. I'm a bit of a sausage gravy aficionado (haha) though, so it may be that my standards are oddly high.
3) Banana Nut Muffin: needs it's own category, even if it's a side! Delicious delicious. Moist and warm, not too sweet.

I would come back! The service was great too. Even though we came right at brunch time and the place was packed, there was only a 5 min wait for two.

Real good stuff.  Eggs benedict was super tasty, their hollandaise sauce is amazing whatever it is.  Ask for extra bread or english muffin so you can mop up the extra sauce.  

Home potatoes are delish.  Not far from strip, great place for a bunch of guys.  Traveler friendly.  Watch what time you come in, can be busy if you show up too late.

So excited we got to eat here! We traveled to Las Vegas with our two young children and NEEDED a family breakfast spot.  I read tons of Yelp reviews and decided to come here.  So glad I did!

They were pretty crowded when we arrived but they somehow had a table available and sat us down right away.  My 1.5 year old was super cranky and everyone who worked there smiled and tried to get him to lighten up- no eye rolling or snippy comments.  

The kids got super cute menus that looked like little books/newspapers and crayons.  It kept my daughter well entertained.  Our server was friendly and super quick.  I got the eggs benedict and I'm not sure why.  I had never had it before.  There must've been a picture of it in the menu or something.  But let me tell you, it was SO good!  I've since ordered it back home in Chicago a couple different times and NOTHING compares to the one I had from Egg & I.  

Each table has a little egg figure on it.  One side is a happy egg and the other side is a sad egg.  If you need ANYTHING you just turn your egg to sad and someone IMMEDIATELY tends to you- even in the chaos of a super busy day.  We needed more napkins and had more than we knew what to do with within seconds.  

The food was great.  The price was average.  The service was amazing.  The place seemed very clean and had fun whimsical decor.  They handled being very busy and I was not uncomfortable as a customer at all.  If we ever head back to Vegas, I'd come here in a heartbeat- and possibly more than once.
Great service.  Interesting menu.  Food was well prepared and tasted good.  Ambience lacking but the food more than made up for it.
Great breakfast for a great price. Good quality food and a nice relaxt athmosphere accompanied with excellent service by Amanda our waitress

Went here expecting a typical breakfast but was pleasantly surprised! Our server Patrick was extremely helpful and gave us an amazing service. I ordered the waffle works which turned out delicious. Patrick recommended trying the Habla potatoes which were awesome, they were seasoned perfectly! With the great prices, amazing service, this is one of the top breakfast joints I've found here in Las Vegas!

This is a phenomenal place! Not only for egg lovers but for everyone! We had stuffed French toast, mashed potato omelette and California crêpe which was beyond amazing. Oh and don't forget to order some mimosas!

First off, I had the cordon bleu skillet, and it was great! Their house potatoes are pretty good, a little salty, but not too much to make me not want to eat them. I would say borderline on the seasoning. The service was great for a Saturday morning, and they were very busy. I recommend sitting outside in the morning, it is quite pleasant with the misters on. The food was very tasty, and the portions are excellent for the price. I will definitely be going back here again.

This unassuming place is rated so high for a reason! Everyone is so sweet and cheerful and Lisa our server was an absolute doll. Don't forget to mention its your first time there, you get a free banana muffin.. warm and delicious! 
I got the Sunrise Mountain.. Four scrambled eggs on an buttery croissant with sausage and cheese... SO GOOD. Definitely stop by if you're going to Vegas.

tip: 15 minute wait on a packed morning is super efficient.

breakfast crepes were out of the ordinary.  it's basically an omelet wrapped in a crepe; a must try.  too much home style potatoes.  good coffee.  flip the happy face egg to a sad face egg for prompt service.

I was soooo excited to try this place but it ust did not have anything special for me, I do love breakfast dishes but maybe getting a table in the outside patio in a windy day at 55 degrees without heaters, was not a good idea to enjoy my experience. 

We waited for around 40 minutes to get our table and were surprised they did not have heaters. 
If they know winters are on the cold side in Las Vegas, not sure why they don't invest some money  get a few of them.

I ordered the Crazy chicken omelette ($11) and it added up to my non enjoyable experience. It was flavorless, and the chicken and mushrooms were inexistent. 
Overload of flavorless cheese on top of my omelette. 
The habla Diablo fries were pretty good.

The banana muffin was the best part of my . It was warm when it came out and got a second one as I checked in in yelp! 

My boyfriend got the Corned beef hash and it was good but again not the best breakfast/brunch I had in my life!

I might come back just to try something else and figure out if it was my meal that wasn't good. However, I don't feel like recommending it to anyone. 

Cheers!

We are visiting the area and came across this place on Yelp. This is a great breakfast place. I had the Jose's Breakfast Burrito. It was good, great chorizo. My hubby had bacon & eggs. They have great customer service. Everyone was very helpful. Our waitress gave us a banana nut muffin to try, that was sooo delicious! OMG to die for. It was hot, not too sweet and went perfect with my coffee. We are hoping to make a stop tomorrow before we drive back home!

Ohhh this place is soo good! I've tried the eggs Benedict, ultimate skillet, pancakes and the muffin. Yes, it was a lot of food. Yes, I felt like a heifer after. But it was so worth it. 
I also brought my puppy dog bitch and she sat quietly outside with us. I like this place and can't wait to go back.
This place is the bomb. Great food great prices. We sat on the patio and it was perfect. We will definitely be back. Karla is a wonderful server. Enjoyed everything about it.

This is a fantastic place to go for breakfast, especially if you want to spend a little time off the strip. The omelettes are amazing and loaded with cheese and toppings. One of the unique things they offer here is a fresh baked banana muffin that you can choose as an option over toast for a side. Take the muffin. It was still hot and tasted delicious. Large portions of very good, homemade breakfast food.

My family and I decided to go into Egg and I after it was greatly recommended by a good friend. Everything was great! There was a descent line at the door when we entered but we were still sat within 5 minutes. Our server was Gloria and she was such a delight and extremely helpful. The food was some of the best breakfast food you can try for the price. On our way out we got to meet Sarah the manager and she was more than kind and professional as she thanked us for coming in and asked how everything was. We will definitely be back!
Great place for breakfast, the waiting list goes real fast, the food is awesome and my server Brady was always there when I needed something

This place caught my eye as I was passing by due to the great number of people who were congregating outside waiting for a table so I decided to try it. It also was a good sign that local firefighters were walking in to eat there. The menu was newspaper style and some of the menu items were original like chicken quesadilla omelet and chile relleno omelet. My boyfriend ordered the carnitas skillet and it was flavorful. The service was quick even though it was a packed house. You definitely get your money's worth. I wish they had this place in the L.A. Area. Word of mouth is that the owner is considering it! I am crossing my fingers!!'

Monday at 11:30am waited 10 minutes for a table.  Can only imagine what it's like on the weekend.  The banana nut muffin is as good as they claim. Light and moist and very tasty.  Servings are generous.  Had the Veggie Works bennie, enchilada omelet, hash and feta veggie omelet. Everything was excellent.  Very fast service.  I and out in less than 30 minutes.  Definitely recommend this place!

The best cure to a hangover and it's Vegas so chances to visit Egg & I are high! It was so tasty that I actually came here two breakfasts in a row. This restaurant will definitely show you the sunny-side of your day. ;)

The servers are really nice, and accommodating to custom orders. The menu is a cute, reminiscent of a newspaper so it give you an old-timey diner feel of reading a paper in the morning. The little black and yellow egg sign was cute too, just flipping it let the server know that you needed their attention, so many eggs everywhere it was a bit on the cheesy  side. The extensive menu did not help my indecisiveness, everything is equally good and largely portioned. I loved the country style potatoes, the seasoning is perfect so I recommend getting that if you can as a side.

Don't forget to bookmark this place or the yolks on you!

This is the best breakfast spot I've ever been to in Vegas!

They are very accommodating with small changes, fast and generous with their portions.  The restaurant is clean and there is ample parking.  

If you're staying in Vegas and have access to a car - then for sure - get off the strip because you won't find anything that beats Egg & I.

Everything was perfect! Banana nut French toast and the eggs Florentine with a side of corned beef hash was all amazing! Carla was very helpful and attentive to our needs!

My dad came to Vegas years ago on a business trip and while I was on my vacation now he strongly recomended my coming here. Fantastic and great!!
Good coffee...good food...good service...great banana muffin.....reasonably priced with large portions....I recommend!!!

I had a Sunday morning breakfast at the egg and I yesterday.  The place was super busy, and the hostess wrote my name down as milassa (it's Melissa) and when I told her it Was spelled Melissa,  she said "we'll figure it out" thankfully,  our server,  Kelcey was awesome!!!   She made sure to do her quality check, even though she had several other tables to take care of,  and when I had an avacado issue,  she took care of it and the manager stopped by the table to make sure everything was okay.  The only thing that I was displeased about was that this one location does not serve bloody Mary's (the other 5 do) or any alcohol in general.  I was seriously looking forward to a bloody with my eggs benny.

A great location for breakfast. They handle substitutions well and don't care if you order big or small. They roll with the punches and just bring what you've asked for. The Diablo potatoes are particularly good and they are happy to substitute cottage cheese of tomatoes if you are watching you weight. My wife order the Eggs Benedict and she got it with American Bacon instead of Canadian without a problem. Good show. A nice restaurant.

Before everything else, I would like to give five stars to our server. My mom and I were at the restaurant in the morning of Sept 27th. According to the receipt, the server's name is Card, not sure if that's right...She was pregnant and had some tattoos. Very helpful and attentive, especially considering she was carrying a baby around too!

Back to the food, best traditional brunch place I have been in the States. We tried the banana muffin, spinach/avocado/veg omelet, gravy biscuits, pork, and sausage. Excuse me that I don't remember the exact name for the plates. Everything was good, so feel free to order anything that interests you on the menu. But make sure to pay attention to how much you order; the portion is very generous here.

I was amazed by this place!! I love visiting local spots, not doing the typical hanging out on the strip.  I found this on yelp and saw the reviews.  I got the half order of eggs bennie and stuffed french toast.  My goodness!!!! What a meal!! I also had the coffee and all I added was two creamers, no sugar needed (I was getting enough from the french toast). The waitress was sweet enough to suggest half orders on the dishes.  My husband had the enchiladas and he loved them as well.  I didn't care for them as much- maybe since I wanted the sweet stuff.  This place is a must for anyone in the Vegas area.  It's obvious that they don't need my review- they are packed, but it's nice to be able to visit a great place like this. You will be amazed by the food and the service was great!! Thank you Egg and I!!!

We went to have brunch at egg and I this past Sunday. Fast service really good filling food. A great option to the buffets while visiting in Vegas. This will definitely be a place to go whenever we are in town. Our waitress was also really nice. Can't wait to go back to have the biscuits mmmm!

We came to Vegas to celebrate our friend's bachelorette party weekend, and stopped by here before leaving from our trip back to Cali. We arrived around 11am, and the restaurant was PACKED. However, upon checking in, the lead hostess informed that the wait was surprisingly only 15 minutes... Talk about efficiency!! They got it down here! Amazing customer service!

Of course, Vegas is extremely hot and we were in a rush to eat and leave, so we were flexible with our seating. Outside was fine, and that's where we ended up. The outside patio was hot due to the weather, but they had some machines that automatically blew out cold must which helped a little. OSCAR- (woot woot!) our server, was absolutely AMAZING and provided exceptional customer service, making out group feel very welcome. He was extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and gave us some great suggestions for breakfast and lunch. Our entire party was beyond satisfied with the service, friendliness, and quick arrival of our food. Oscar provided us with the best banana nut muffins, which were served warm with butter. I had the breakfast burger with a fried egg on top, a side of delicious seasoned fries. They also serve stuffed French toast, and you have the option of getting half country potatoes and fruit, instead of full order of one or the other. Food was delicious and we will definitely drop by the next time we visit the Strip. Hands down, this is one of the best breakfast places I have been to!

Really great place for breakfast. They have really cute newspaper Menus and give you free banana nut muffins for your first visit! These were the best muffins I've ever had, I'm usually not a fan of banana nut but these blew me away. I also really liked their potatoes, they were crispy and seasoned really well. The bacon and avocado omelette was also to die for! It was our first time there and the waiter was really nice and helpful.

This place is good as long as you come at the right time. Too late, and you're doomed to wait a long time for a table on a Saturday or Sunday morning. Timing is key. The food is good and so is the service. We never walk in the door without a coupon. You can find them pretty much in any newspaper, city guide or Entertainment book, so be prepared.

Staci, our waitress, was the bomb!  The service here is great. Everyone is so friendly. The food was great. I brought my husband and brother-in-law and they loved it!  Egg and i never fails to impress!

Our server, Genesis, is the bomb. Cheerful and attentive. Great recommendation of the bacon avocado omelette (lots of food). 

Quick and great tasting.  Patio seating is shaded and with misting system.
Lil busy, a good amount of people. About 15-20 min wait. Crazy big selection if you love eggs. Very filling portions. Food was delicious!! Definitely a must try for brunch!

I was searching for a solid brunch spot while in Vegas and came across Egg and I.  It was about a 30 min wait for a table on a Sunday around 11am.  I ordered the Country Benny and banana nut bread French toast to share.  Both were delish!  If you're a fan of biscuits and sausage gravy then the Country Benny is the way to go.  The French toast was great with the apple syrup they give on the side.  Service was fast and friendly.

First...amazing banana muffins.  Simply delicious.  The food is great with a large number of options.  Staci, our server, was an amazing server.  I watched her explain items to us, as well as others.  She was very attentive and personable.   The only issues I would have are these.  1) I wanted a pancake and they only have large portions and no option for a single normal pancake to add to the side of a large omlet.  2) the potatoes were very salty...tasty...but too salty.  I don't mind a bit odd salt or spuce...but these were over the top with salt.

Great place for a nice breakfast.

Give Staci the trip to Disneyland!

Wonderful place to get breakfast!  Bree, our server, was attentive and friendly.  She had great suggestions on the menu and was always refilling drinks and making sure we were satisfied.  The stuffed French toast and works skillet were awesome!!

The food is excellent, the service is iffy but then again they are super busy so I guess it's hard to get it right & knock it out of the park all the time. Pancakes are awesome, eggs of course are great. Bacon tastes good (pork chops are goooood, Pulp Fiction reference). 5 for the food, 3 for the service (4 overall). If you're visiting Vegas, come here as you will leave with your stomach more than satisfied and your wallet won't take a pounding like it would on the strip!

3 words. Banana nut muffin. Sweet, soft, fluffy goodness.

I had the pleasure of dining here for brunch. Make sure to come early to beat the long lines because this place can get packed. Their menu has a wide variety of choices that you can choose from. But whatever you order, make sure that you get the banana nut muffin.

1. Sundance Omelette: It's the ultimate healthy veggie omelette. With feta cheese, spinach, tomatoes, and other deliciousness. I really liked the omelette. It comes with potatoes and your choice of toast or muffin. Get the muffin! All plates are pretty hearty, so this choice makes me feel less guilty of eating a lot of food haha (5/5)

2. Cordon Bleu Skillet: Comes with seasoned chicken breast, diced ham, swiss cheese and delicious potatoes. This one tastes great with easy over eggs. Very flavorful and savory. Overall, a great one to choose from (5/5)

The service here is friendly. Prices are reasonable as the portion sizes here are HUGE. Credit cards accepted. Plenty of parking.

I have a few things to say about the dishes I've tried:

- Egg's benedict: flavor explosion in my mouth!  I was recently introduced to the benny and can't believe what I've been missing out on. There are so many sensational flavors in this dish that you just have to try it for yourself!  And those potatoes - I'm not much of a potato breakfast person but could not help stealing these off my friend's plate!

- Strawberry stuffed french toast: I am more of a 'sweets' type of breakfast girl so I typically order french toast. You get 2 slices of toast stuffed with strawberry cream cheese goodness.  Unfortunately, this dish starts to become a little TOO sweet at the end so it's a struggle to finish the last few bites.  (I've had to confirm this by ordering this dish twice.)  If you can share this dish with someone, that'd work out well.

- banana bread muffins: you pretty much have to try this when you go there. I'm so confused because sometimes, I've been given the muffin for free and other times I've had to order it...but whatevs, you gotta do what you gotta do!  The muffin is soft and when served warm = bomb-dot-com.

** ALSO, must note on the service. All the workers are very polite and friendly. If you ever need something, they have this egg face you can turn over at your table. When the egg is black, you're fine.  Need something? Then turn the egg over so it's yellow. I have to say, this system totally works. Because the few times we've need a coffee refill or something..flip over the egg face and *BAM* someone helps you out right away!

This is one of my breakfast spots of choice (another is Baby Stacks) for good, consistent, yummy breakfast food.  Prices are decent too!

This place is horrible. There was five in our party and four of us got waffles and the other one got biscuits and gravy. This gravy was so salty that she couldn't eat it. The potatoes are way too overly season salted also. It tasted like they dumped that whole container of salt in the gravy but when we complained about it to them they didn't apologize or anything, three different wait staff just simply said, "Oh we get that a lot. " One even said that everyone that gets it complains but no one here is going to actually tell the owner/cook that it tastes horrible and that no one likes it except the owner.  Service was slow, we had to ask several times for some items. Not sure why this place gets so many stars.

Our server Tamara was excellent and kind! She made the overall experience here really awesome, and is probably one of the kindest persons i have met in Vegas! She has made the overall experience in Eggs & I wonderful and fulfilling, even as far as creating a cosy and comforting experience while i devour my breakfast in the most unglamorous way I love you Tamara you are the best

OMG. Friendly service, in fact, one of our party ordered something that didn't come with the banana nut muffin so she brought extra so everyone had one. These muffins  are super moist (and im picky about that) and are the best restaurant banana bread that I've ever had. Portion sizes are huge. Everything we ordered was great tasting. Their salsa is great.

Awesome food, fabulous service, decent prices.  If I can I would give them 10 stars.
Inside is insanely busy, but totally enjoyed sitting outside in the cool brisk afternoon air. 
Rachel is a fantabulous waitress.
Thank you so much for an awesome experience.

OH goodness this place rocks!!!!! Ask for Chance, she is an awesome server.  Thanks for the directions. 
The banana nut muffin is the best I have ever had

Erin, our server, was so friendly and kind! The ham & cheese omelet w/ biscuits were excellent! I checked in w/ Yelp for my free banana nut muffin, but had to take it to go, cuz I am so full! This is our second time here, but it was at another location. My ONLY concern is the country music...I'm not a fan :(

Best breakfast I've had in a really long time!  The banana nut muffins and the Diablo potatoes were outstanding. Carole Ann, our fabulous waitress, was a huge help in navigating the many choices on the menu.

Love the food here. Great service. Our waiter was Karla. She was sweet, friendly and helpful. Every time I'm in Vegas this is the best place to stop for breakfast. Hangover or not u need to try this place out! U will have an awesome time!
Huge portions.  Great prices.  Service was excellent.  Amanda was an excellent server. Would recommend.

The Egg and I is truly the BEST BREAKFAST in Las Vegas ! !  Food is HELLA GOOD and the wait staff, especially our server Kelcey, were very attentive.  The restraunt was very busy as it was Sunday mid-morning, but they were very speedy without rushing people to get out. The Chile Rellano omellet was delicious !  I'm going back again tomorrow ! !
best breakfast place ever from service to quality wish i had one on the east coast. can't wait to get back to vegas for this again.

Been here multiple times. JUST NOW realized Egg and I and Egg works are the same company. That was amazing to find out. Overall just friendly wait staff, did I mention the recurring banana nut muffin checkin deal! The waiters are so nice friendly too. Always will come here when I crave a hearty American breakfast. GREAT JOB

We went searching for a Village Inn after checking out of our hotel. We never found it, but on the way back to the highway, we passed this place and decided to U-turn it back here. 

The service (except for the older woman at the register completely not seeing us and helping 2 people after us as we were trying to pay), was good and fast. The food was a little salty, but it was good. 

They were pretty busy for a Thursday morning and I'm guessing that's for a reason. Give them a chance if you're nearby! :)

We love having breakfast here every time we're in Vegas. I love the Asian breakfast selection that they have on a separate sheet. I always get the spam and eggs. It comes with white sticky rice. Yum! Reminds me of home. I have had the Brad's Very Special but it's not my favorite. My hubby and brother in law always get either the Mexican Omelette or the Francisco's Scramble. We love this place. It gets very busy during peak hours  so get there before 9am. But, it's a pretty big place and it has a huge patio. So, we never have a long wait. If you want a great breakfast head over here. This is also our favorite location. They have really good service here. The Egg Works is not as good as this location.

Loved it! Awesome waiter, service and food. Big portions for great price. Yummy food. I got chile relleno omelet. Oh and I got to use a coupon buy one get one free. I got the coupon from this lil book all cabs carry

We were in Vegas for a day and needed a place to take the family of 7 to breakfast.  Checked Yelp and this place was rated #2 for the area.  So we drove over.  When we arrived, the restaurant was full and there were about 20 people waiting outside.  To me, that was a good sign.  We put in our name and waited only about 15 minutes to get seated.  

We were immediately greeted by our server Kat and while we were looking at the huge breakfast menu, she was busy slinging our coffee and juices.  It is really hard to make a selection off of their menu.  Everything sounded really good.  Even Kat (the server) couldn't narrow it down to the "best item."  She said the best she could do was a "top 10."  

We all ordered something different.  I had the Blackened Prime Rib Eggs Benedict.  It was really amazing.  The Hollandaise sauce tasted exactly how it was supposed to taste.  The Prime Rib could have been a little more blackened for my taste buds, but it was still very good.  Other members of my group had the Hawaiian breakfast with Portuguese Sausage, eggs and sticky rice.  Also ordered was the Chicken Fried Steak Skillet, the Blueberry Waffles, Blueberry Pancakes and your basic egg, meat and potato dish.  Everything was good.  Everyone at the table was raving at how good the food was and how they were all happy with their choices.  The banana nut muffins were an extra special treat.  

One more thing.  The service was amazing.  Kat was great...and the manager even came out and checked on us.  Great service!  And, to top it all...all seven of us and were out the door in under an hour even though it was a packed house.  

So if you are visiting Vegas and looking for a place to go, forget those expensive buffets and places on the strip and head over to this place.  I guarantee you that you won't be disappointed!
This place is awesome. The food and service are great. Whatever you do,  pick the banana nut muffin.  It's incredible!!!

Me and my dad have gotten the chili relleno omelet numerous times ! It is amazing ! I like to add avocado to mine! 

They have several many locations in the Las Vegas valley - those are valued Egg Works. Egg and I appears to be the original in my eyes, being born and raised here as well .

Another omelet I like is the mashed potato omelet ! 

The other thing , they have red bull - sugar free ! That is awesome !
i am never in Vegas as I live in San Diego, but this place is definitely worth drive if you want some good breakfast food off of the strip. The service is amazing as is the food.

A great place to bring the family for breakfast. They gave great servings for my plate, I got the waffle works with extra banana and it has a big piece of ham, great amount of eggs and a enormous waffle topped with whipped cream and bananas.

First things first, WOW! The service was amazing our waiter was Raul. He was a very friendly waiter very quick and was checking on us frequently and quickly got a lot of food for four people and it was only $60. I highly recommend it

Probably the most reviewed business off the strip, what's more inviting than that?

Arrival wait pretty much sucked, did not help that the hostess was on the rude side.

Lo and behold our waitress (Paula) came through to save the day in the service department. She was great from the get go and stayed consistent providing excellent comfortable service that you'd want to get from a breakfast spot after a looooong night out.

Food:

The Check-In Muffin: Meh, nothing great. I'm a big carrot raisin muffin person and this was okay. Complimentary so am I allowed to give it a 2/5? 

The Big Omelette: If it's not called that then it's some synonym of the word big. How impressive can an omelette be? Order this and you'll find out. The way that the ingredients are actually layered in between the eggs is a unique alternative to the usual blanket style omelette. Ingredients a plus. 4.75/5

Potatoes: These need a review of their own. Eggs and I let me know I was not crazy for expecting good side breakfast potatoes everywhere else where I've had them. The seasoning extraordinary...cooked to perfection..add a little catsup and you've got the best potatoes I have ever had at breakfast. 5/5

French Toast: I got hit with an avalanche off the high that I was on. There was something wrong with these. Not so the taste but more of the texture. Even the berries and the whip could not save these. 2/5

Orange Juice Carafe: It seems bottomless for two, good deal, good taste. Freshly squeezed I think. 4/5

Not disappointed with my meal here. The hostess and the french toast need to be reworked a little, get her to shadow Paula and steal Blu Jam's recipe, maybe?

Oh yeah, the salsa :/ taste like taco bell sauce but does not come with a witty packet message

The best breakfast i ever had.
U need to wait to get in there. Worth wait.

Any Omelet here is awesome wit
Sides Cajun fries or french fries.
Fruits on the side.

We ordered 7 different omelets. Each and every person have their own specifications. All our orders are perfect. The waiter's here are pretty cool. If i stayed back in vegas and longer i would eat my Breakfast only here.

They offered us the Banana Muffins after our meal. Thats really awesome. We couldn't eat them so they gave us ToGo.

Searching Yelp for breakfast restaurants, I found Egg & I. With four star reviews and excellent quick tips, I had to try it. Arriving around 10:30am, the place is packed (which is always a good sign), yet there was only a 10min wait. Very friendly staff and waiters/waitresses. I got the Kay's Omelet (w/added Chicken). I was offered the choice of toast or banana nut muffin. I went with traditional toast. The omelet is simply the best I've ever had. It had the perfect combination of spinach, artichoke hearts, tomatoes and topped with feta cheese. Brilliant

Now, to the matter of the toast. Fortunately, one of my companions ordered the banana nut muffin. Even more fortunate, she offered to share. Not an over powering banana taste, more of a whole grain taste, yet just nutty enough, with a hint of chocolate bitterness. 

While I loved my experience, I can't give five stars, as some in my party were not as happy with their dishes as I was with mine. I do look forward to trying more from the menu very soon.

Seen this place so many times while driving and thought nothing of it.  Today was my first time inside for breakfast at 1:30pm.  So glad I finally stopped in!

All the reviews talk about their bannana nut muffin, but more on that later, first - the eggs...   I ordered the biscuits and gravy which comes with a side of 2 eggs (I chose scrambled) and a side of potatoes (the server allowed me to sub half of the potatoes for fresh fruit.

Everything on my large plate was done perfectly.  The eggs were warm, tasty, and not under or over done.  The biscuits were deliciously moist and puffy (best I've had in as long as i can remember) with a very nice sausage gravy.  The potatoes were original and had a nice texture but the seasoning was a bit much for my taste.  And the fresh fruit was very sweet and well, fresh!  I really don't have a single complaint about the food.  I'd go here regularly for breakfast if it were closer to my house.

For first time goers you get a banana nut muffin on the house.  I don't care if you aren't a big fan of banana nut muffins, I'm really not.  But just eat it!  You won't regret it.  I don't know what they put in this pastry (sprinkled crack maybe?) but it was amazing.

As far as  the employees go, they all seemed happy, smiling, and they were genuinely nice.  There was no wait for me although I heard i just missed a rush.  everyone from the hostess to the servers to the cook did everything just right in my opinion.

Prices are fair for breakfast.  My large plate with an iced tea came to eleven bucks and change.  More than what I'm used to paying for breakfast, but worthy for the quality of the feast, and I'd happily hand it over again.

Food is excellent if you can get it.  We had a table of 7, and 6 received their meals within a reasonable amount of time, except me of course!  Not one word was said to me, so we put an unhappy face on Mr Egg, but I still had to flag down our waitress, which took at least 5 minutes.  She seemed pretty annoyed when I asked where my food was. She said "we can only put 4 orders on one ticket, so yours will take longer". Hmm so why did 6 orders came out???  Finally, someone else came out because of the unhappy face on Mr Egg, and asked what she could do. I said everyone is almost done with their breakfast and I don't have mine. She went to check, making sure that we put the happy face back on Mr. Egg.. A few minutes later, our waitress came back and said that they were still baking the biscuits, and promised that she was watching for my order. Hmm, by then 3 people at my table had finished their breakfast. After another 5 minutes everyone was done eating , Finally a different person brought my order, with the explanation "they poached the eggs, so they had to remake it with my cooked eggs".  Ok which one of you clucks the truth?  So I got to eat while 6 people at my table watched me, so needless to say I ate pretty fast and didn't get to enjoy the egg-cellent food.  I'm pretty easy going when it comes to food orders, as normally we all do our best, But by the time I got my food and had to listen to 3 different reasons, I really did expect for them to take my meal (and only my meal) off of the bill. Was that too much to ask? Well I left with egg on my face, no discount...not even an apology. All I got was a "there now you have your breakfast, you are all set".  Really??? No we won't be going back to that location.

Was in Vegas last weekend and It was great to get off the strip and sight see. Stopped in for breakfast. I always love to see a place with turkey bacon or sausage on the menu so that was def a plus for me. Ordered the Sunrise Mountain which is funny because I love a butter croissant it came with home fries turkey bacon eggs n cheese and I should have shared with my boyfriend he ordered stuffed french toast & he didn't finish his food either. 

Both dishes were great, service was great and fast which is always a plus.

Love Egg and I. We needed a pick-me-up after a bad doctors office visit. Took 2 hours for 2 mins of doc attention so we were pretty annoyed. This lifted our spirits, because we both love breakfast foods. We drove a few miles to go to Egg and I simply because I wanted to try it based on the great Yelp reviews.
We were not disappointed. Everything was great for my first time ever eating here.
We walked in at 1215 and were immediately seated on a Thursday lunch hour. There were plenty of tables inside and out, and since it was a sunny calm day we decided it'd be nice to get out and get a little sun after being stuck in the doc office.
I went with the "This Little Piggy" omelet and it was just the way I like it. Lots of egg, lots of cheese, and plenty of meats. It comes with chopped up bacon, chopped up sausage, and chopped up chunks of ham, folded in half and smothered with about a half pound of cheese!!!! Also comes with the country potatoes which I was expecting to be orgasmic based on reviews, but let me down just a little bit. Don't get me wrong they were really good, but maybe my batch just wasn't quite cooked long enough and they were a little softer than I like em. Also I got the banana nut muffin with my meal, (this thing WAS OUT-friggen-STANDING) and she brought it out before the meal, which I thought to be a little strange. But i was really hungry so it was just fine with me.
My honey got a breakfast burrito and she said it was really good, looked to me like it had a ton of peppers, which isn't my favorite thing in the world, but she enjoyed it. Had to take half of it home because she couldn't finish it all, this thing was pretty big and also came with the country potatoes.
This was a great breakfast experience and can understand how this place can get pretty busy at times. We were very happy with the food and mostly happy with the service, she was just a little slow a couple times and we were only there for about 45 minutes. i.e. forgot to get a sprite, and never really came back to ask us if we needed anything after our food was brought out and if it was cooked ok. After she brought the check we decided to get a refill to go since the sprite was $2.50 and brought late and we waited for a few minutes to see her but never did. In the end it worked out, when we paid we asked the cashier if she could help us in getting the to-go refill and she politely went and took care of that for us with a smile. :)
Thanks Egg and I, we will be back for sure!

Went to Egg & I for brunch and it really exceeded my expectations.  I heard good things about this place and the reviews are are spot on.  It is located off the strip.  Located in a plaza with other businesses and there is plenty of parking.  

I ordered the new york steak and eggs.  Steak was tender and juicy.  Eggs were cooked perfectly.  Served with country ranch potatoes.  The country potatoes are basically small fried potatoes squares with ranch seasoning.  My GF had the cajun shrimp eggs benedict special.  The fresh fruit plate contains blueberries, madarin oranges, pineapple, cantaloupe, and honeydew slices.  Fruits were fresh and it was a great way to start off the morning.  Expect to wait a few minutes if you have a party larger than 2.  Luckily it was just me and my GF and we were seated right when we arrived.  The staff were fast, friendly, courteous, and they were as accommodating as much as possible.

Egg & I, you guys are now one of my favorite breakfast / lunch places to visit when I am around the Las Vegas Area.  Thank you for the great meal.

Bon Apettit

Tired of the Strip and hotel fare, we checked Yelp for a breakfast place nearby.  We found great reviews for Egg and I so thought we would give it a try.  We loved it.  It was easy to find and the staff was very welcoming and friendly.  Very professional and efficient. The restaurant was very clean and well cared for.  The food choices were all very tempting and our server, Karla, was very helpful, even recommending an egg breakfast for my husband that included everything he wanted for a better price than what he was going to order.  I had the Southwestern Cobb salad and it was delicious....very fresh and the chicken was hot off the grill! The banana muffin that came with my salad was yummy.  Lots of variety on the menu....but since I am not an egg lover I was glad there were plenty of choices that didn't focus on eggs.  We would highly recommend this place and will definitely come again on our next visit to Vegas.  Karla is the kind of server you love to have...she's friendly, efficient, knows the menu, is really helpful and gives you the perfect amount of attention while dining. Great start to our day all around!

Lisa was fantastic! Everything about this place is fantastic. 

Service

Attentive quick. Within fave minutes drink was served and with in ten food is served. Just right amount of check ups and right after we finished the bill and Togo box is served. 

Good

Ordered the works omelette and beef hash, with muffins and potatoes as sides. The banana muffins are simply amazing. I'm not a big fan of baked goods but the muffins are something else. 

The potatoes tastes like squared fries and delightfully crispy. The actual omelette and the beef hash are tasty with just the right amount of seasoning. 

Did I mention bottomless coffee? Omg this place have everything! This will be my new favorite spot when I come to Vegas

I  Love a good breakfast!!! My BF had read a few great reviews about the Egg and I recently and suggested we try it after sitting in out DR. office appt. for 2 hours; needless to say it made us hungry.  The day was warm and not too windy so we opted to sit outside on the patio.  Nothing impressive but it did just fine.  The newspaper style menu was fun and different.  Right away I saw about 6 items I would like to try.  As did my hungry man.  I finally decided on the breakfast burrito.  And he picked This little piggy omelet.  Our food came very quickly and looked great!! The burrito was huge and looked great.  There was 4 scrambled eggs, cheese, peppers, onions and huge side of   their breakfast potatoes.  There was also a side of salsa that was tasty and not too spicy.  My BF food looked yummy as well, I knew this when he ate it all with few words.  
The only thing that could have been better was a more attentive server.  We had to look around for a water and soda refill.  I hate that.  She was however very sweet and seemed a little new.  I will defiantly be going back to try some of the other dishes that made my mouth water.  Overall, the Egg and I is a sure fire great breakfast experience.
This place makes some of the best omelets I have ever eaten!  They are huge too, a 4 egg omelet stuffed with everything imaginable. The staff is very cheerful and attentive.
Very good place for breakfast.  Had the taco skillet and it was decent.  The pancakes and banana muffin looked amazing.  Our waitress Samantha was great.

So glad I ate here... Our server was excellent! She must've had like 12 tables and still treated us like we were the only ppl in the restaurant. I had the French toast... OMG! TO DIE FOR! Search no more. You don't need to go to the strip for breakfast. The egg and I nailed it!

Wow what a amazing place. Food great big portion and prices are fabulous . Clean /fast. The wait time wasn't that bad , would have waited a hour if it needed to be , it was that good  !!!
Get the muffin the best !!everyone is so happy , I would think they are all family , not a sad face around , not one server complained about anyone , we sat right by the kitchen , but they could have a complain spot in the back , lol, that we don't know about ..
Our sever Amanda was so helpful , are glass of drinks filled  constantly, food brought out with a smile , very pleasant when taking our orders , Amanda joke with us , and she was busy , took the time to be helpful , thank you !! coming in from AZ , we should have hit this place from the first day , to bad we are leaving .next time here first ,to start our day off right .
Head over fast, wish had more stars because that's what they should get 10  of 10

Showed up at 1pm on a Sunday and got seated within 15 minutes with a 4 person party. They sat us outside which we didn't have a problem with. Though usually you get asked if this is okay by the host. Our server seemed to be busy with the number of tables he had but soon took our orders. I orders the Blackened  Prime Rib Benny with potatoes. It was exactly what I hoped for. The prime rib was cubed and well seasoned way better than what I expected (a slab of prime rib that would have been difficult to eat with my eggs benedict). Two of my friends got the crazy chicken omelet and loved it and the other got a simple breakfast with biscuits and gravey. The side of fruit was pretty legit as well. Over all a great brunch!

This was our first time eating here. We found this gem using Yelp and were not disappointed. Our server Carole Ann was awesome. She was very friendly and professional. The food was delicious and the banana nut muffin was even better! 

We will be back.

Coming from Ohio, we had no idea where to go for brunch until my brother suggested The Egg & I. The food was awesome! Oscar, our waiter gave us the best service possible! The other staff members were so nice as well. We waited, but not long considering it was Sunday morning! The banana nut muffin is delicious and the portions we received were huge! Great place to go if you're looking for a breakfast/lunch idea!

Finally after months of wanting to try this place, I got the opportunity when I was in town for EDC. 

My friends and I walked in on a Friday afternoon and were seated immediately. The host and servers both gave us a warm welcome. My favorite part of the table set up was their egg signal at the top of their center piece. It was a photo of an egg that you could flip to indicate to servers that you needed something. No one waving your hand to try to get the servers attention, they got a system down!

Next, the food, I ordered corned beef hash and eggs, while my friend customized her scramble with chorizo plus biscuits and gravy.. The bf got some avocado omelette. All were delicious and the portions were huge! It looked like I barley made a dent in my food, but I was stuffed. The biscuits and gravy were probably some of the best I've had... And their banana nut muffins are worth a try for muffin fiends. Straight out of the oven to your table.

Good service, good food, and great company.. All for a reasonable price. I think this place is going to become a must stop for all my Vegas trips from now on! Thank you Egg & I!
Fantastic service from Thynara, the Brazilian waitress!  Amazingly delicious food, fast and friendly service.  I love her.  So far the best I've had to date!

I only got to try the banana nut muffin and the traditional eggs Benedict but both were delicious and I think that says a lot about this place. The muffin was very moist and sweet with few nuts, just the way I like it.

The eggs Benedict, though traditional and simple, was perfect and filling. It made its way to the top of my list of favorite eggs Benedicts. The hollandaise sauce was one of the best I've had. This dish alone will have me coming back if I ever make a trip back to Vegas.

Our server was also very accommodating to our party of 9 and super friendly.

Eggs & I is a popular brunch spot for locals in Las Vegas.  We had to drop by the airport and chose Eggs & I as our go-to food spot afterwards.

The menu consists of a variety of eggs benedict dishes, omelettes, hash, and other breakfast items.

Service is homey and the vibe is definitely casual here.  The menu comes out printed on newspaper stock so perhaps their items change frequently.

We started out with their signature banana nut muffin which accompanies many of their dishes.  Light, soft, fluffy, and not too sweet, the banana nut bread was a hit and a great starter.

Our entrees included a mish-mash of their popular dishes:

Prime Rib Benny (or Benedict) - the highlight dish entree was an Eggs Benedict version made up of prime rib.  It replaces the traditional muffin with a croissant and is definitely a large portion so was plenty to share.

Florentine Benedict - a version made with spinach and ham.  Pretty good.

Chicken Fried steak - I only had a few bites, but I liked it.  It's a calorie killer though.

Kay's Omelette - another signatuer omelette, it had plentiful cheese, ham, and egg.  Kinda plain and not sure why this is so popular.  You could make similar omelettes at home.

Brad's Chili - wasn't sure which chili to order and was recommended this one.  It came out lukewarm, had a bland flavor and was generally forgetabble. 

Eggs & I is a decent brunch spot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.  They take credit cards, including American Express.

Super great experience. Seriously. 
It's Monday morning, 11am, and there was a brief 15 minute wait.  Place is packed!! 
My carafe of coffee was a perfect start and I admit...I really enjoy just good diner coffee.    (You can ask for flavored creamers if you want them, just FYI.)

We were quickly greeted by Kat and trainee, Mariah, and it was just ideal from start to finish. Kat was personable and accommodating, something that could be easily missed in a place as busy as this.  

Our yelp check-in brought the tasty banana muffins and I'm glad they did.

Everything. We. Ordered. Was. Great!

I had the breakfast burrito, hubby had pancakes/bacon/sausage/eggs.
Just good ol' fashioned FABULOUS food.

Anytime I am in Vegas, I ALWAYS stop by the egg and i.

I don't like eating breakfast, esp. for breakfast... but I'll make an exception for the Egg and I.... My fav dishes are any from the 'mexican section'... but you can't go wrong w/ any dish here.  They have the 'most bestest' home fries ever!!!! Most of their plates come with a side of home fries.

There's always a line anytime I come, but it usually goes fast.

Excellent place to eat!!! No matter which location I go to, they're always busy. It's worth the wait! 
I love the chile relleno omelette and their warm banana nut muffins are worth fighting for. 
The coffee is good too. Overall a great place to eat!
Delicious I loved it big portions great prices we all got skillets and you get a free muffin which is also delicious

This is my favorite breakfast place i've been coming here since the day they opened the food is always good and the service is just as good, my waitress today Tamara remembered my order just the way I like it and everybtime  friendly no better breakfast place in town.

No wonder why this place is #1 on Yelp. Service was awesome; Carole Ann the server provided an excellent service. Checked - in on Yelp and got a free banana muffin and it was delicious. I would recommend people to order their banana muffin. Ordered prime rib benedict and it was delicious; meat was tender, good combination of veggies in the mix with the sauce and crossant. Oh, and the potatoes that came with it was nicely season and tasted fresh unlike some breakfast places, potatoes are soggy and no flavor. I would definitely go back whenever I'm in vegas. I left a happy customer.
Best local breakfast place in vegas, I love the small time mom and pop atmosphere, the food is five star, their seasoned potato square cut are amazing with the breakfast

This is a great breakfast spot in Vegas if you are visiting the strip and have a car. If you want to avoid long lines or expensive buffets, this is a great local alternative. Be prepared to wait in line! There is usually some time of wait in the morning to brunch. I would definitely recommend trying to get there as early as possible. When I first walked in, I thought...hmm this looks like a glorified Denny's. However, the painting on the wall was cute but the the rest of the restaurant was a bit dated in decor. However, it was easy to ignore all of that and realize that every seat was packed with a combination of locals and visitors to the great city of Las Vegas. 

Being a more health conscious eater, I ordered a egg white veggie omelette. My husband ordered the combination of eggs over easy and banana nut pancakes. Both were excellent, high quality ingredients and well made. The best part was getting the bill which was just a little over $20. That amount would barely cover one person's entrance into a mediocre Vegas strip brunch buffet.
I love breakfast. And this place perfect for it. Cute place fun to come with friends or family and yummy. I go there every once in a while.

My wife and I came in on Sunday, 11/11/12, at 10:00 a.m. This was our first time here. There was a wait, but considering all of the Zagat listings on the wall, we didn't mind. When we were seated, the server was prompt and attentive. From there it was all down hill.

It too 30-40 minutes to get our food. Really? For egg dishes? Our food was cold. I had asked for my eggs basted medium. They came fried, sunny side up. The salsa that came with my wife's huevos rancheros was bland. That was better than my tasteless food. The cream cheese for my bagel was in a small metallic packet. It was so cold I could barely get it out.

Neither of us finished our food. I don't know how anyone could want to. I was still tasting my greasy "cordon bleu skillet" breakfast hours later.

Maybe I was just unfortunate, but bland, cold food and an unreasonable length of time to have the food delivered to the table means this is the 2nd time we will go there: first and last.

I'm always shocked at how busy this place is.  Omelettes after all are pretty easy to make.    Having said that the service here is good and the food is solid.

What is unique to this place in Las Vegas, is the Cincinnati style chili. A chili with no beans and I believe has cinnamon.  The chili is normally had over spaghetti with mounds of cheese and for those of you that have no one to maks out with,  get it with onions and beans.  Yummy!  During this trip I decided to go low carb and get the chili over an omelette and of course bacon.

Most of the dishes here come with theIr seasoned country fries.  They are delicious.   Since I'm a fry connoisseur,  I can really appreciate these delicious cubed and fried pieces of carbs.

Usually only come out to Vegas for gambling on the strip, but somehow always end up at Eggs & I. Love their breakfast burritos and friendly staff.

If you enjoy playing credit card roulette with friends use amex and you'll always win (They do not accept amex).

Just like always both food and service is good!!!  But this time I decide to pack some banana muffin back to LA and share with my family. Our server Curtis is really patient to take my complicated orders.  Overall, everthing is really good. Will be back again next time when we are in town.

For me I just cant eat here again. Wholly cow, the omelettes are way overloaded with cheese and their home fries are salted more than Doritos chips. I didn't feel right for the entire day after having breakfast there. They did give us a free loaf of banana bread and that was nice of them but I wish I had been more vocal in regards to not being charged for my meal. It just wasn't right. I was told that in the future I could request less cheese and less salt so that is good. If Egg & I management is reading this, May I please have a refund for my meal? Please? I can provide the date and time and amount. I charged it on my Chase Visa. I will update everyone later

This is one of my regular stops for breakfast. Normally a great breakfast joint but not today. The greeter wasn't friendly and the food was average. This place has been around for a long time with a good reputation. The kitchen needs to try harder and they need a friendly, happy greeter. It will be a while before I go back.
This place is a a a amazing I had there omelet and muffin omgeee the muffin were the best thing going. Bomb.com loved it I will Def recommend.

Randomly chose this place based on a breakfast yelp search. I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet with a banana nut muffin. The muffin was very soft and moist, almost melt in your mouth. Very delicious. The skillet was also exceptional. The country fried steak needed a very light push of a fork for it to break apart. It was very tender and juicy. 

The service was very friendly and welcoming. Our server Oscar was also very attentative and refilled our drinks before we finished drinking. That always scores huge points with me. This will definetly be a Vegas staple whenever im in town.
Breakfast was amazing. Brought friends from out of town and they said it was the best breakfast they'd had. Koko was great and really fun!

Ive had this place several times, take out and dine in!! My best experiences are truly dine in! Mashed potato & cinni chilli omlette to die for!!! I love this location best servers have to be alyssa and bree!! Dont mind waiting as the food and service always wows me!

What a find. Came here yesterday for our first time. Saw the line and thought there would be a long wait. To my surprise, it was only 15 minutes. Had the center cut pork chops. Cooked to perfection. Our waitress was Tamara and she was very friendly and attentive. Came back today for another visit and still packed, but seated quickly. Oscar was our waiter this time. Suggested the Bloody Mary's. Very tasty. Nice suggestion. Oscar was very attentive as well. Staff is great. Having the Country Fried Chicken Steak today. Kudos to the ownership. Man, what a goldmine. Great food and great service equals great success, but they already figured that out !!

Absolutely love this place. It's a must stop pit stop whenever I come to Las Vegas. 

The basic breakfast is great. Eggs any way you want them, fluffy pancakes, sausage /bacon is good. Nice homestyle potatoes. Amazing french toast. I'm sure they have waffles. Try the Country Fried Steak, do the muffin, not the toast and thank me later.

Cents here for breakfast due to a coupon we got for buy 1 get 1. My wife and daughter shared a waffle and egg meal. I had the chile relleno omelet. 

We left feeling full and the meals kept us going all day long. We never needed or wanted lunch.

The food was very good. The potatoes were a little salty, but not overly so. The hot sauces they provide added just the right flavor to the omelet. 

The waffle looked huge and was crisp despite being topped with strawberries and cream. 

Very good value for the money. Well be back next time we're in town.

Pluses:
Fast & friendly service
Gigantic portions
Home-fried potatoes 
Banana muffin
Fruit came on the side of every order in big pieces, not some crap salad.
Not on the strip

Deltas:
Hollandaise was shockingly tasteless for the amount of fat it presumably contained.
Food was frankly notable only for portion size.

Wow, what a great place for breakfast! This little mom & pop restaurant that is out of the way from the busy strip and expensive breakfast prices! 
We found this place from one of those Vegas pamphlets they hand out with a 2 for 1 coupon in it. 

And by the looks of all the other reviews, I would say that everyone knows about this place too. It was packed when we showed up. 

I got the corn beef hash with two eggs over easy and their banana nut muffin. The corn beef was fresh and their banana nut muffin was really good! Now I see shy they were famous for them. The ranch potatoes were a little too salty for my taste. They need to tone it down on the salt and then they would be really good but really didn't eat them 
because I felt my blood pressure go through the roof! lol.. 
My BF had the Chicken omelet and he gave me a bite and it was really de-lish especially if you are an avocado freak because there was a ton of avocado stuffed in the omelet. 

The service was really good even for sitting out on the patio. I would definitely go back for breakfast when I come back into town!

The wait to get a table at 9:35am was THIRTY FREAKING MINUTES.  Plan ahead.  The menu is huge, and a little confusing, as the staples are towards the back (eggs, pancakes and waffles) while they seem to push several styles of eggs Benedict and four-egg omelettes (not a fan, blech.)  Service was what I expect from a half-decent diner - fast and punctual.  My waffle was not served with real maple syrup, which was a major bummer.  The potatoes that are included with the standard egg breakfast were small squares but were cooked perfectly and tasted a lot like French fries from Fuddruckers (heavy on the Thyme, which gives them a reddish, golden-brown color.) There's a little stand at the table with two metal egg badges. The first, in black, is a happy egg face which states to the wait staff that all is well.  The second is an egg-face in bright yellow with a somewhat consternated egg-face which signifies to the wait staff that you're either unhappy with the meal, but mostly tells them you need something.  I was in a particularly crappy mood, so I kept flipping the egg-face to the bright yellow unhappy egg-face, and the waitress was getting perturbed with me.  The turkey sausage was pretty tasty, so I'd recommend people order it if they decide to eat here.  In general, take it or leave it.

The only reason they get a 3 star and not 4 is because because i was expecting them to be as good as there counterpart egg works. Unfortunately not so. It was good, better than Ihop but not that stellar amazing flavor Im used to from these chains. Anyway the service was quick and the waitress was very personable so ya if Im in the neighborhood I will go again

My wife and I came here and our server was Karla she was really nice and she didn't rush us to order food like some waitress. I ordered the mash potatoe omelette it was just like a bake potatoe except in an omelette. My wife ordered the chicken tortilla soup and a breakfast tostada . The breakfast tostada had refried beans , scrambled eggs , cheese , potatoes , salsa , olives and sour cream . She enjoyed it !! I recommend this place because the staff is friendly , the food isn't expensive and you get a large portion

Amanda has a very infectious smile.  What a great start to our day having her serve us breakfast.  The coffee is particularly good and I appreciate the flavored creamers.  If appreciate an almond or soy milk option and a Stevia option but a boy can dream.  The omelettes are huge and our coffee pot was always kept at the right levels for a perfect breakfast experience.  Thank you!

This was the ideal breakfast spot off the strip! We ordered the breakfast combo with pancakes, eggs, and sausage and the southwest skillet with chicken, chorizo, eggs and potatoes. They were delicious and the skillet was so filling I could not finish it! Reasonably priced for good breakfast food, and the staff was friendly. Will make this a go to breakfast place anytime we visit Vegas!

We were on our way out of Las Vegas and it was lunch time when we actually arrived.  We were really hungry though and were craving breakfast.  

Atmosphere is down-home.  Food is very good and there is alot to choose from.  Service was a little slow, but our waitress wasn't being lazy.  She was just very busy with lots of customers.  All in all it was a unique breakfast house and we'll return!

I just love social media! Well after my review the manager Katy contacted me and told me she had my cousin's purse holder. She claim she didn't have my contact info I had left with the employee I spoke with. Since then that employee has been delt with. I'm happy that she reached out to me. I passed on the info to my cousin and she apologized for the whole incident......I'm grateful to say she sent my cousin her purse holder. She said she could tell it was valuable and put it in a safe. She was a woman of her word and I thank her. I glad of the turn out, because the food was good and I would love to dine there again.  Now I will dine there and spread the word. Next time I'm there I would like to meet her and thank her personally. There are some good people in the world.

We came here for breakfast and for some reason the tuna melt looked good to me for breakfast,  anyway the tuna melt on rye with lettuce and tomato was awesome, the tuna had no pickle relish in it , a plus for me  . The thing that put it over the top was the bread , it looked and tasted like they grilled the cheese on the outside of the bread, it was crispy, like when u make a grilled cheese sandwich  and some of the cheese melts and gets cooked  in the pan and u peel that cheesy goodness and pop it in your mouth , yum.
         I have to go back and find out for sure, the waitress was busy, so I did not get the chance to ask about the bread.
         The fries were very good , shoe strings sprinkled with the the same seasoning they put on there breakfast potato's , it tastes like BBQ seasoning to me. I would not hesitate to have this meal again for breakfast and...... call me crazy for lunch? ;)

What a delicious treat! We waited about 15 minutes at 11am on a Saturday. Our server Karla was pleasant and attentive. We ordered the works scramble and the carrot cake French toast. Oh my goodness! The French toast tsa a decadent treat, but not overwhelmingly sweet. So moist syrup isn't necessary. The omelette was cooked to perfection as were the potatoes. My mimosa was a great compliment to my delicious meal. We'll definitely be back!

Went to this place in Vegas when my boyfriend was playing in a basketball tournament. We were crunched for time and we decided to go there. It was really busy but we put our name on the list and we were seated really quickly to our surprise. We sat down and right away I ordered some banana nut bread with our drinks and it came right away! I recommend everyone try the banana nut bread, it is SO good! Anyways we ordered our food and the service was pretty decent. Had to wait a bit for our food but that's just cause it was busy. The food was good, nothing crazy special, and the price was about average or what is expected to pay in a place like Vegas. Overall I suggest going here if given the chance!

Great service, awesome food. I asked our server Erin for a side of rice and she asked if I wanted soy sauce on it... how did she know? I thought I was in Hawaii again.  Erin was very friendly.  It was an excellent breakfast/brunch experience!

absolutely delicious . I am glad I came here early in my vacation ,so I can go there again . I had the cheesy omelette ranch potatoes and a banana nut muffin.  I was looking at the stuffed strawberry French toast, no really I literally was staring at it, the lady probably thought I was a creeper, but I am getting that sometime this week, with a side of ranch potatoes.  However, the chicken salad sandwich sounds good too...I did not get to stare at it to report back...sorry.  Whatever you do...order those ranch potatoes!!

The place was full. The waiting line was out of the door but even as we we're told the waiting was going to be 20-25min long we didn't wait that much. At first we were greeted by Carlos who brought our coffee which was hot and delicious. Then our waitress, Paula went over the menu with us and recommended some dishes. We ended up with Sundance omelette that was delicious. My sister had the corned beef hash that was freshly made and tasty. The banana nut muffin was also good so you should totally get it. I got toast but it was just standard store bought sliced bread so definitely go with the muffin. Overall was a great breakfast. We will come back next time we are in Las Vegas.

Review - Egg & I


If I were looking for a reason to move to Las Vegas the Egg & I would be the reason.  Funny thing to say when speaking about a location that has something to offer for everyone and a few of the best dining experiences that money can buy. 

The Egg & I is simply a great place to enjoy breakfast and that's because it is simple.  Everyone who knows me knows that I love breakfast and can almost always be found at my favorite breakfast place in Corona, CA every Saturday morning without fail.

The Egg & I is a place that locals visit and has a lot of regulars.  It's located in a small strip mall that is way off the strip.    The interior is what you would expect in a diner that intended for locals.  It's a large open space with lots of tables and country-ish decorations on the walls

The menu is consists of many different egg dishes, pancakes, waffles and some incredible looking skillets.  On my first visit I tried the Works Omelet, which as you would expect has a list of ingredients including bacon, sausage, ham, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers, mushrooms, cheese and sour cream.  It is served with Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes and a choice of toast or a house made banana nut muffin.    

The omelet was cooked to perfection.  It was served hot, light and fluffy. The cacophony of ingredients came together to form the perfect symphony of deliciousness.   My preference for breakfast potatoes is hash browns.  I love them!  The Habla Diablo potatoes were a treat and a nice departure from the hash brown rut I'd been in.  The high point of the meal was however was the banana nut muffin(s).   They serve one almost like an appetizer when sit down before you order.  You get a free one with a Yelp check in.   It told our waitress, Chance (awesome Las Vegas name) how much I liked them and she sent me home with a couple of extra.  Bless her!  I'm not a huge fan of bananas.  In fact I hate everything about them but the banana nut muffins here changed my mind.  It's worth a trip to Egg & I just for muffins.

To summarize, great food, fun local ambience, extremely friendly staff.  I'd repeat and repeat and repeat and repeat...

I know there's a lot of other breakfast places 2 eat at, especially the buffets in Vegas but I can only take so much of all u can places.  That's y we chose here, w the help of yelp of course!  It's kinda "retro" in there.  The waitress we had wuz nice.  She kept coming back & giving me coffee refills.  I ordered chicken fried steak.  It came w 2 eggs, ranch potatoes & the best banana nut muffin.  Omg, it wuz 2 die 4!!! That wuz yummy!!!  The place gets busy so try 2 come early.  Located off the strip.  I love breakfast places like this!!!

In spite of its obvious chain affiliation, the food is better than average.

First, there is the Chicken Fried Steak Skillet.  Just so you know, the CFS has a crispy crust, cut into bite sized pieces and placed on top of their mini crispy potato cubes.  Topped with a good tasting, creamy gravy, this dish is really good.  I had to restrain myself from ripping it away from my son.

The Hanks Scramble contains fresh spinach, mushroom, tomato, and cheese.  I don't know where they went wrong, but I have had much better tasting vegetable scrambles.  It was a disappointment mainly because it tasted way to bland. Dumping their house salsa on it redeemed it considerably.

Then there were the pancakes and bacon. Decent pancakes, but nothing that stands out.  The bacon was salty but not smoky tasting and rather flaccid.  I like crisp.  Good, not great.

The Waffle and Bacon combo was similar, neither the waffle nor the bacon were crispy.

I really liked the serve yourself carafe of coffee left at our table. Got it hot.  Got it exactly when we needed it.

The service was excellent. Maybe part of that was because they did not need to run around filling coffee cups instead of taking care of more important matters like getting food out of the kitchen fast. Smart.

This was ok, but we shall continue to search for the ultimate Mom and Pop places in Vegas.

So I saw this place on Man VS. Food and I just had to come here when I was in Vegas. This place closed a little early (around 3pm) so make sure you get there before it closes. Eggg-citing! The decor inside is absolutely adorable. There's little dancing eggs everywhere, which was egg-cellent. (excuse the puns please) The people here are really nice and its nice being somewhere in Las Vegas where not everyone there is a tourist.

 So I had the eggs florentine which was really good. My motto is the more fattening the better. The hollandaise sauce was creamy, buttery and probably loaded with saturated fat, which is completely fine with me. The eggs were poached just right, where it's firm on the outside but soft inside. The side of potatoes are really good too. This place is a must when visiting Las Vegas!

I woke up with a massive hangover and needed breakfast food STAT! Buffet wasn't going to cut it... I needed comfort food. We came here on a whim and now it's on my list of must go to spots in Vegas. It's your typical breakfast joint... no more than a 20 min wait even when the  masses are outside the front entrance. There's a plethora of breakfast dishes... american style, mexican style and even islander style! Oh yes... LOCO MOCO. I know Aloha Kitchen is just right there... but when hubs wants Hawaiian and I want Mexican... well then, you gotta find some way to compromise. Egg & I did not fall short with their Loco Moco... it definitely hit the spot... and so did that side of spam!

Great bang for your buck. Carole Ann was our waitress and she was epic.. we had the French toast and the sunrise mountain. Both were good. Lots of food so heads up. The vanilla capinchino is quite sweet but yummy !!! Overall great. Would come again.

Found this great breakfast diner. I had the Country Benny. It's like Biscuits and Gravy on Steroids. Layered biscuits, sausage patties, eggs to your liking smothered in sausage gravy. Served with their great Ranch Potatoes. It's a killer meal. Try it out for yourself. You won't be disappointed.
Really disappointing. Had great reviews on Yelp so I drove here. I had a skillet which was cold and the potatoes were horrible. It gets one extra star because the serving staff were were very good

This place is simply delicious! Nice size portions for a decent price. There can be a bit of a wait , but its well worth the wait. Just thinking about it makes me all tingly on the inside. LOL. 

a nice hidden jewel away from the strip, but for us locals who drive by on our way to work or church...we know what kind of gemstone it really is@ 

Most importantly, it is kid friendly. For people who have two young ones and who also has friends who has two young ones...its a good fit for us. 

yummmie...

This was my first time here and everything was amazing! I had the Works Scramble and it was delicious. The potatoes are some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were so crispy and delicious. I was brought here with a friend and her family and they raved about the banana nut muffins. I'm not a huge muffin fan, but omg these are a must have! SO MOIST. Our waiter Patrick was the best! He was so kind and very attentive. He made the experience that much better. Definitely recommend! It gets pretty packed, we waited about 30 minutes for a table, but it's so worth it!

I hate to do it, but i need to knock this down just one star. Every time I'm here, while the service is great and friendly, the place is just packed and I find the breakfast to be lackluster, compared to Egg Works.

The seating is pretty crammed, even when you get there early. We're often bumped by servers and patrons as they're making their way to tables.
