I also don't love how they *only* have those season-salty potatoes and not fresh hashbrowns. They have them, but only those frozen hashbrown patties. Meh. I like homestyle potatoes, but these really seem like they're dumped out of an Ore-Ida bag.

The last time we went, I asked for my poached eggs well in my eggs benedict and they came back *very* runny both times. I can handle a little runny, but these were like, runny to the point of being almost chilly inside the yolk.  It's a texture thing and it skeeves me. I know I'm not the only one. 

They were really great when I sent it back the first time, but the second time, I felt like a total pain in the ass and was embarrassed having to ask them to redo it, even though it wasn't my fault. They were gracious and took it off our bill and the 2nd time they made it, the eggs were cooked well enough. (Yes, we tipped on the full cost of the bill.) 

I also am not wild about how they completely drown their eggs benedict in hollandaise to the point you can't even see the bottom and the english muffin gets really soggy. 

My boyfriend's blueberry pancakes weren't that awesome either.  Kind of spongey and flavorless.

For the hype this location gets, it wouldn't be my first choice. But I know it's popular and beloved, so if someone else wanted to go, I'd go, but otherwise, I'd recommend one of their other locations.

Someone call 911, because I'm in a food coma over the Banana Bread French Toast. 

It should be illegal its so good. I'm guessing that batter frying slices of Banana Bread is only legal in Vegas. 

Lots of other goodies on the menu. My wife got a savory crepe that was delicious with a side of their seasoned potatoes that you don't want to stop eating. 

Escape from the strip and go here for breakfast if you are in town. It was so good, I went twice during our stay. 

Service was good. Everyone is attentive and mostly smiling (which is rare to find). They give you your own pot of coffee which is a huge plus in my book.

Listen up people, if you have the pleasure of going to Las Vegas... hit this place up. I had the three pigs omelet. When I checked into Yelp! I got a free Banana Nut Muffin  hands down the best banana nut muffin  I've EVER HAD. Five stars from me for great service and great food!

What a great atmosphere!  Even though we were in Las Vegas, this could have been a small-town diner anywhere in the US. 

We had a great breakfast with banana-nut muffins, of course!  We were going to share a chile relleno omelet, and asked for an extra muffin, when the waitress told us that we could order half orders of just about anything on the menu - the cost was half of the menu price + 50 cents.  We did that instead, order half an omelette and half an order of grilled banana bread french toast. So I said - well, we won't need the other muffin, but the waitress said - no charge! - I'll bring you an extra anyway.

The food was excellent. The breakfast potatoes need some work - they were just hard fried "bits" of potatoes - but everything else was great.  A carafe of coffee was left on our table so that we didn't have to keep asking for refills, and cream/flavored creamers are on the table to make a perfect cup of coffee.

It was delightful - a trip back in time!  Don't miss it if you have a car in LV!
Delicious food, excellent atmosphere but a bit crowded. Our server Reina "The Queen", was awesome and very helpful.

About a 15 minute wait for a table on a Sunday, but it was well worth the wait!! The biscuit and gravy breakfast was delicious! The gravy was a tad salty, but still good. The biscuit was amazing! Fluffy, thick, and perfect. The potatoes seemed to come with just about any breakfast dish and they were great, crispy and they had a great seasoning on them. My husband had the Cincy chili. He said that was great as well. The service was exceptional, especially considering how busy they were! Definitely putting on my list of must visit places in Vegas!
Food was awesome! Service by Chance was both great and entertaining!  Thanks for the input on the Nikon lenses at no extra charge.

Stopped by for breakfast before our trip back to LA.. We got there at about 10:00 A.M.  The wait was about 10 minutes, our server was Linae (spell check) she was really nice and attentive, 5 stars to her! The food was good. I ordered the huevos rancheros and the BF had an omelette.. I can't remember the name... The potatoes were yummy.  Good price.. It got a bit crowded and it was very difficult to stand in line to pay at the register when all the parties waiting to be seated were standing right there.. Some old man even cut in front of us.. I guess he thought we were waiting to be seated.  By the time we left it was packed! Did I mention it was a Monday!?!  Will Definitely be back when in Vegas, I enjoyed the food and everyone was super friendly..  I'll try it a bit earlier with less of a crowd next time

Love this restaurant! Excellent service, and the food was amazing! We recommend the avocado and bacon omelet. Their muffins are fabulous! Our server's name was Claudia, she was lovely! We highly recommend this restaurant!

The food here is excellent.  Out of town and found this gem using reviews from yelp.  Our waiter on the second day named raul ended up bringing out a different plate from what I had ordered.  It took a few extra minutes for my original ordered plate to come out, but it was so fresh tasting I really enjoyed it.  He felt bad about the whole situation that he gave us a complimentary fresh baked banana bread.  That extra effort to ensure great customer service made my morning.

Cute menu in newspaper style. Reminds of people in the old days perhaps that they wake up in the morning with breakfast and newspaper in hand. 

I ordered Blacked Prime Rib Benedict, my bf ordered stuff french toast and we got banana muffins for free. Both of our dishes came with home potatoes, just mine was too salty, his was fine.

I have had better egg Benedict at Bill's cafe in our bay area, the prime rib was salty for me, but the stuffed french toast was very unique and tasty. Also the banana muffins are really good.

Overall a nice place to eat breakfast off the strip with very reasonable prices and friendly service (Thank you, Paula!)
If you love breakfast, you will love this place! Closes early of course. Their dishes are great! Diner style. No pretense.

Place is about 10-15 minute drive away from strip. There was a short line when we arrived Monday at 9am. The line went fast. The server we had was prompt and accommodated our special request. My friends bday that day, she made something special for him with the famous muffin. The serving is huge and can be shared by two people. Food arrived fast. They have a wide selection of omelette, Benedicts and breakfast menus. Check in at Yelp to receive free muffin which I took mine to go, ate it the following day and still tastes good.

Back again on a Sunday after trying on Saturday but the line went around the building. Today we have a very sweet server / manager Carole Ann and the food tastes even better. People make or break a restaurant and this gal is tops.
Great place for breakfast - served any time!  The omelets are just the right size.  Get the fresh fruit on the side; very good.
Not sure what else to say that hasn't been said in the 1187 reviews! Great spot for breakfast off the strip!

This is the best hangover breakfast spot in all of Vega$$! 

The following reasons will state "how come:"

BIG MENU
HUGE PORTIONS
DELICIOUSLY GREASY PORK PRODUCTS
FRIENDLY STAFF
EXTREMELY INEXPENSIVE
CLOSE TO FREEWAY

Just go already!

excellent customer service. very fast and friendly. staff here knows how to make customers happy: get them seated quickly, take orders right away, bring their checks early, and let them pay at the front when they're ready to go. no extraneous wait time so you can just sit, eat, and leave. food wasn't overly spectacular though. simple tasty meals with eggs utilized in creative ways, but nothing that really wow'd me

This place is so amazingly good. Their food, service    And everything. Our server, Tamara is so friendly and attentive; makes us feel right at home. We have been coming to egg and I  ever since we found out about it a couple years ago. We are from Los Angeles and as far as I'm aware of, there is nothing like this place in LA. So whenever we travel to Vegas, we have to come here for brunch. In fact, we have visited the restaurant 2 days straight this time. Love love the veggie skillet with their exceptionally delicious seasoned potatoes! Expecting the next visit already!
Great casual breakfast.  Everything we ordered arrived quickly and was very good. Loved the potatoes--bought some seasoning to take home.

Excellent breakfast place off the strip.  Busy but minimum waits.  Food came out remarkably fast considering how busy they were.  Veggie eggs Benedict was great!  Maryanne didn't let my coffee get cold and seems to be a mind reader :)

This was the second time eating here when I'm in town.   I'm usually in Vegas for work once a year and this spot is on my way to the convention center.  Service is always nice and friendly without being overbearing.  I ordered the Blackened Prime Rib eggs Benedict with the home fries.  The eggs were poached perfectly and the Prime Rib was flavorful.  I love Hollandaise sauce, and while this is not the best out there, it was pretty decent.  The home fries were a little bland, but I do like the touch of adding some red bell peppers and spinach along with the prime rib.  It adds a nice bit of sweetness to the dish.  I'm sure I will be back again next year.

Wow...this place is amazing. One of the best breakfast meals I've ever had. And for those who say "its too salty", (it wasn't btw) this is not a place to get a fruit plate! If you want that go somewhere else.

Best breakfast place in vegas. I'm a local and I always recommend this place to any of my friends coming from out of town. Their skillets are my absolute favorite but I have tried their omelette and it is also tasty. Service is great if you need something just flip the egg to a sad face and anyone around will come see what you need.

If you are interested in big, hearty, country breakfasts, this is your place.  If you are looking for delicate flavors or subtlety, no way jose. 

He ordered EGGS BENEDICT.  It was served in a baking dish so I guess the restaurant feel compelled to fill it with sauce.  It was completely drenched in "Hollandaise" if you could even call it that.  It was creamy and yellow, yes.  But there was no butter taste, or lemon.  Moreover, the slice of ham on the benedict was so thick and strong flavored that it was the predominant flavor.  

I ordered the HAM AND MUSHROOM SKILLET with TWO EGGS OVER EASY.  It's a baby skillet, with the bottom lined with the restaurant's ubiquitous Ranch Potatoes, mixed with diced ham, sliced mushrooms, topped with a handful of shredded cheese and topped with 2 eggs, any style.  It's all very salty, cheese, filling and pretty good actually. 

FYI: the Ranch Potatoes are diced taters completely drenched in Lawry's seasoned salt and they use it anywhere potatoes might be needed.  The result is ..seasoned salt EVERYWHERE!

Stick with basics like pancakes and eggs and these skillet-y things.  Don't get anything where skill might be needed to cook it.

There is a reason this place is rated as one of top places to eat in Vegas. The service was really good with a very kids friendly environment. The prep on food was really good with great vege. Options. The potatoes had a special spice to them which tasted really good. We ordered the skillet and omelette and kids ordered pancakes. One suggestion for owner to consider are floors, very slippery for chairs.

Fabulous little dive off the strip. Go early for breakfast. There was no wait on the Saturday morning I visited. This breakfast was very well worth the Uber drive. My waitress, Tamara, was awesome. She recommended the Bandito (if you like spicy food!) and was SO right! The house breakfast potatoes are amazing and you must take advantage of the Banana nut muffin offer on Yelp. Even if you are full, take one home! Absolutely a must do when you are ready to escape the lavish buffets of the strip!

Egg & I is a super-cute local breakfast joint away from the strip. It gets SO crowded and busy on the strip for breakfast/brunch whenever I've visited, and it makes people even hungrier and grumpier while waiting. My advice? Take a cab or drive over to this place for a REALLY tasty meal.

My group and I of five people waited about 10 minutes for a table. Once seated, we were serviced immediately. Food only took about 10 minutes to be ready, and the staff were very attentive and worked together to address our table's needs. They have a little egg sign that you can flip to the sad-face yellow side, which indicates that you're in need of something. We did this a couple times to test it out, and it worked! Lightning fast.

Great food, great service. I recommend the Biscuits and Gravy! The Ranch Potatoes (their regular side of potatoes) are very flavorful and filling. A must have. Oh, and their Banana Nut Muffin was soooo sweet and moist!

I just may be back when I'm in town. If I can get outta bed next time after a long night, that is. Tehe.
The food here is amazing! I had the tuna melt and felt like I was chewing on heaven! Our server, Lindsay was so sweet and personable. I really liked her! Great service and great food!!

The one thing I love about this place is the fact that it's off the strip, and it serves up the classic homey style feel, rather than the over-glamorized you would expect in Vegas. Yeah you come this city hoping to escape into another reality, but it's nice to come down from the clouds once in a while.

The one thing I have to admire is there amazing variety of amazing egg selections. I Decided on going with their Chile Relleno Omelette, which was on the money, but their Banana Nut Muffin is THE thing to get. 

Listen, if you feel like wondering off the strip for some good home eatin', why not here??

My favorite breakfast place to bring out of town guest.  The biscuit and gravy was way too salty today.  The crepe was good.  Too big to finish for one person.  Service was lacking when the place got busy.  Ask for a to go box and had to flag down another server via the smiley face after waited 15 minutes.

Friendly staff, regular customers addressed by first name, oh and great, fresh food.. Banana nut muffins were great, waffles with heaps of blueberries, potatoes tossed in spicy cajun seasoning, and the chicken guac omelet (decided to go light) definitely hit the spot. Worth it if you don't want the crowd and headache of casino buffets.. Why would you, if you can have this! Will be back.

Great service!!!

Waitress showed patience even when we couldn't make up our minds as to what to order.  
The food was great tasting.  I go back here to eat breakfast no questions asked.

Best breakfast I've had in a long time these guys n gals know what customer service is all about. The French toast is amazing they know how to keep a drink filled, they're fast and all for a reasonable price. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
I love this place. You have amazing selection of eggs, i recommend eggs-plus. The muffins are terrific!

Had a wonderful experience for breakfast with Liliana. Very delicious food. The Black prime rib benny was so very tender. The hash browns are so addicting with their Habla Diablo potato seasoning. If you like some kick and added flavor, top it off with their Habla Diablo sauce. Yummy!

we were in vegas this past weekend for a very short trip. of course there are bazillion places to eat on the strip, but i wanted to check out some place off strip, to get away from the craziness of driving in bumper to bumper traffic, waiting for tons of people to cross the streets and then to wait to eat. 

Egg & I is located off strip, east of the 15 off of the sahara exit. its located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. there is indoor and outdoor seating. there were a few people waiting when we arrived but we were quickly seated. the place was full with a few tables empty. we were expecting to wait but it was already about 10AM by the time we went. 

i ordered the strawberry and cream french toast which was thick slices of soft french toast with a strawberry whipped cream cheese and strawberry preserves on top. it was pretty good. i liked that it wasnt too sweet like most french toast/waffles with fruit toppings at other restaurants.

the bf ordered the fiesta skillet with chorizo. it had green chili, onions and salsa. i thought it was gonna be sausage type of chorizo but it was the ground kind. if you've ever cooked or bought it at the market you know what im talking about. when you cook it, it pretty much just melts. so the skillet was as if it had chili on top. it was pretty heavy and greasy. i could probably do without the chorizo next time.

the bfs bro ordered the country fried steak skillet. this had chopped chunks of country fried steak with their homestyle potatoes and eggs with white gravy on top. it was pretty good. it tasted just like a regular country fried steak plate but all chopped up for you, if you dont mind your food touching (i know some people who dont, like my 5 yr old nephew...).

bfs bro's fiance ordered the stuffed french toast. this was two pieces of their thick sliced fluffy french toast with an omelet in between. the eggs had lots of bits of bacon in it which made it tasty but it was pretty firm. i felt like it was over cooked. maybe it was all the cheese. it tasted good though. it tasted good with either the syrup and/or ketchup. sweet or savory, whichever you prefer. 

we had also had a side of the banana nut muffin, which was pretty good. it was large on top. it wasnt too sweet which was nice. it came out moist and warm. yum!

the service was good. everyone was pretty friendly and the food came out fast. we had ordered coffee and they gave us a pitcher of coffee. they take credit card but you have to show your ID and pay at the front.

They were amazing. It was a 25 minute wait, which they handled smoothly. The menu is inventive, unique,  and enticing, and printed like a newspaper. The waitress was helpful and wonderful, and the manager was reallt great with mt allergies. Even though it was crazy busy, our food came out fast and perfectly made. For coffee and tea, you got your own pot at the table for refills, and the mix drinks were just awesome.

Thank you for a great time, I will definitely be back!!

Great little gem in Vegas! Whenever I'm in town I always make a stop here for a quality breakfast. This time, our server Karla, was great. She brought our drinks and food out quickly. She didn't was attentive and did not rush us. My boyfriend left his sunglasses at the table and when we went up to pay she brought them right up to him. This place is a must when your in town or looking for great food with a decent price.

I've been to the Egg & I several times, and each time breakfast has been great.  Went once with my wife and I and sat outside and enjoyed one of their excellent scrambles and a delicious benedict, both of which we really enjoyed.  

The second visit was this past weekend with my parents and brother and sister in law.  Food and service were both fantastic.  I had the chicken and chorizo breakfast burrito, while others enjoyed the cordon bleu skillet, a chorizo skillet, a french dip sandwich with cajun fries and an eggs benedict.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food, which was brought very quickly given how packed the place was - talk about an efficient kitchen.  Our cups (water and coffee) never ran dry and the waiter struck the perfect balance between leaving us be to enjoy our meals and making sure we got what we need.  Will definitely be back in the future to this outstanding place.  Love it!

Our favorite place to stop for breakfast when we make the trip from L.A. to Vegas!  Always delicious and consistent! The Egg and I never disappoints and Our Server, Alyssa was awesome! She was very friendly and was quick!! I think everyone should take the trip off the strip for some French Toast Banana Bread!!

My bf got the Denver omelet and thought it could use more ham. I got the Crazy Chicken omelet because the menu said it had guacamole. I was disappointed to find it only had avacado.

The banana nut muffin that came with the omelet was steaming hot! The "free muffin" that we hot when checking in with Yelp was not hot. Insist on the hot muffin if you like your butter to melt!

We did get the carrot cake loaf to go. We are in town until Saturday!

My favorite Sunday Brunch location. This location is always busy, so make sure you are willing to wait 10-15 mins to get your seats. 

Banana nut muffin is one thing you shouldn't miss, it blowed my mind the first time I tried it. It's not over-sweet and the aroma of banana smell so damn good.
Came here due to their great review but the food was just too salty. Staffs are great but food is ehhhhh
A must stop at egg and I when I'm in Vegas! Best banana nut muffin, pumpkin pancakes and any skillet you get. Also the burgers here are amazing. Great service .

Definitely one of my fave breakfast place in town. I used to get the steak and eggs before I turned Pesco-veggie, and it was gooood. My bf and I grabbed breakfast here a couple days ago and I just had two over easy eggs, wheat toast, and blueberry muffin. Muffin is always moist here and it's served warm so butter is a must. My bf got the steak n eggs with ranch potatoes and said he still loves it. Ranch potatoes are always flavorful here. I also suggest the tuna melt here--delicious. Service is good, we're so used to coming here so we don't mind the inconsistencies they have with their service. Although it would've been great if they wouldnt have alot of turnovers with their staff. It was great coming in here and the staff knew our names. But ever since the turnover we don't know anyone anymore except the host lady. Once again, food makes up for it so we shall be back regardless.

We came here with high hopes because of all the choices, loved the potatoes. The coffee had a burnt taste so we asked for a fresh pot but it still took 3 sugars to make it drinkable. The skillet my wife had with the Portuguese sausage seemed over salted and gave her a stomach ache and sent her to the bathroom several times. Our waitress was forgetfull and not very knowledgeable about the menu.  We probably wont be back for a while as long as the Omelet house is still in business. Sorry Eggs & I

Such a wonderful establishment! Great service, prices and food. If you are in the mood for a nice, hearty breakfast while visiting Vegas then I highly recommend making a stop to this restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

Off the strip breakfast diner. We waited forever!!! for a group of 10..so I guess I should give them some grace...but still... 
Some of the food was good, some of it was OK. I had a french toast something that was drenched in sauce and I was not happy b/c it was too sweet. I've had better breakfast at other places. They did get listed for top burger tho interesting enough. I would not go back for the mere wait, drive, and quality of food. Servers were nice tho. :)

I came on a Wednesday and it was not as busy as a Sunday would be and the service was extremely slow! Multiple people including myself complained about the food taking to long. I would suggest going to Egg Works on Rainbow same thing just faster service.

Stopped here on our way out of Vegas. We were looking for a tasty breakfast spot and we definitely found it. The portions were generous, the coffee was just right, and the flavors were spot on (with the exception of the potatoes- they were great at first but as the meal went on the saltiness took over. I will say our server was exceptional, she was attentive without being pushy and was genuinely pleasant. I would recommend this place for a good homey meal away from the strip.

Egg-Zactly what you want in a breakfast place only 2 miles off the strip.

We got drawn in by the great reviews and the buy one get one free coupon in the current Las Vegas coupon booklets that are in every taxi everywhere so we whipped on over .

What SEPARATES the eggs here from other breakfast joints is the foods we tried were prepared with care and were NOT GREASY , YEAH success! and they offer many things that surprise you that are different that you won't see anyplace else also VERY REASONABLY PRICED .

No yoke we had the chile Relleno omelet  (a whole green chili stuffed with cheese inside your omelet covered with sauce and cheese) and the chorizo skillet eggs  , both were enough for two people each and both were tasty delish! I picked the house made banana muffin over the toast and it was a really GOOD real banana muffin not a mix .

This place cracks me up , they are GOOD eggs!

Excellent breakfast! I had the spinach Benny which was really good.  We also ordered the French toast sandwich.  Oscar was an attentive sever.  It had a really extensive menu of egg dishes. Usually you find a menu loaded with pancake plates, but this was at least 3 pages of eggs!

An early arrival to Vegas gives us an opportunity to go off the strip and enjoy a couple of breakfast eateries. The Egg and I has a cute name and an old cowboy ranch feel to it. The menus are newspapers and the servers are friendly!

Food (4 Stars): I ordered the corned beef hash with over medium eggs and the banana nut muffin. I'm usually not a banana nut fan, but this muffin changed my mind. It was full of spice and flavor, you can definitely taste the banana. The corned beef hash was pretty good with the shredded style corned beef. The seasoned potatos were DELICIOUS and I wish I could've had more.

We ordered the Cinncinati 4 Way plate with onions. It is pretty much spaghetti pasta with chili and onions on top. Our group was intrgued by the ingredients so we ordered it. It was amazing!!! Who knew that chili and spaghetti pasta can go together so well?? Topped with cheese and onions, this is my dish!

We couldn't finish all of our food due to the large portions, so definitely come with an appetite. The food is still good after being reheated.

Service (4 Stars): Our cute server was friendly and humorous. She frequently checked up on us and refilled our cups, she even got us another table because ours was cramped.

Bottom line: Hungover? Hungry? Feeling like stuffinf your face? Egg ans I will satisfy it all.

Usually a very busy place.  But food and coffee always hits the spot and is really good, ask for half potatoes and fruit.  If you don't you will get a lot of potatoes.  Great coffee and great service!
Egg- ceptional! The country Benny is fantastic! The blueberry pancakes, with the extra berry sauce was yummy! The small fruit plate is big! Waitress Jessica was great! Will return
Great food! Homemade style, fresh, flavorful. Loved the mashed potato omelet, hash browns, and banana nut muffin. Big portions and fair price. Fast service.
Wow service with a smile! No long waiting the biscuits and gravy are incredible worth the drive for really good coffee too!

Carole Ann was wonderful! Cheerful and helpful! Food was good. Potatoes were good but I couldn'd eat all of it. A bit salty after a while. Had the Crazy Chicken Omelette. Was good but rich. Banana nut muffin was the best! I'd give the server 5 stars and the food 3 stars (banana muffin saved the rating).

OMG!!!!!! This place is the by far the best breakfast I've ever had!!!! Tourists don't waste your time going to expensive breakfast buffets or high end restaurants when visiting Vegas. This place will fill your stomach and pleasure your taste buds. It's INSANE!!!!! We had the chile relleno omelette and holy ****, I felt like I was having a party in my mouth! I've never had anything like it! And the potatoes and homemade banana muffin seriously! Our server Alexa gave us the best service. She was very nice and attentive. Even the bus boy Jesus was on it. He came by at least 3 times to make sure that we were ok. I noticed he went around to a lot of the tables since the restaurant was so busy. Alexa and Jesus should tag team most of the tables. This place would be even busier! Loved this this place! Please open up in Southern California! God knows we could use some good breakfast! PS You can send Alexa and Jesus to open it up
This place is fantastic, can't believe I never stopped in before. Biscuits and gravy off the hook good. Great service from Amanda!

My in-laws came to visit for Father's Day weekend (2016) and on Saturday June the 18th my father-in-law wanted a worthy hefty breakfast badly. We all got halfway through our meals and almost needed to go boxes already so hefty indeed especially with the seasoned potatoes they serve with most of the meals. We decided to give Egg & I a try and we are in awe! MY father-in-law had the Blackened prime rib benny and he automatically fell in love. My husband had the Cordon bleu skillet as he is a huge cordon bleu fan and he now knows exactly where to go to have such a delicious breakfast. I had the Cabo breakfast burrito, the sauce that covered it went extremely well with the burrito. I am a HUGE fan of Banana muffins so of course I got one before our meals came, we all shared it and it came warm and SO soft. When we arrived it was full house WITH a couple families waiting in front of us. Not even 10 minutes and we were seated. Not even an hour and we were on our way out the door fed, bill paid and happy while it was STILL packed, fast service. Only one thing, you guys should get bigger Orange juice cups, it's about half the size of the water cups and it's good juice so it was gone in 2 mins.

You got to try this place. This place is off the strip and not something that most visitors are aware of. It's a gem of a breakfast/brunch place that is filled with positive energy and awesome food. They have a pretty diverse menu for all kinds of taste buds. The service is very fast hey doesn't take long for the food to be ready. Portion sizes are very generous and the price is more than fair. With The fresh taste of all ingredients combined with endless  fresh coffee in the morning, this place pays really well for the crazy day you're about to spend in Vegas. This place is a must try

First off our server Paula was great. Very friendly and brought us extra banana nut muffins because it was our first time here.  The three breakfast items we loved were the Sunrise mountain, stuffed french toast, and Cabo breakfast burrito. All hits.

This place is amazing for breakfast. We went on a Sunday morning and the line was out the door. Only waited 15 minutes though and we were whisked right in to enjoy a big breakfast. Crazy enough as it is to say, i had eggs benedict for the first time and it was super delicious. It always looked so gross to me cause i thought it was pretty much mayo on top but the waitress was really cool and brought me a sample of the hollandaise sauce to make sure i would like it before i ordered. The service was very good and the waitresses were perfectly attentive. The home fries were awesome that come on the side and breakfast that sunday was all i had hoped and more.

I know this place can do without another 5 star review, but I think I want to move to Vegas just for Egg & I. We came in a group of 10, but service blew our minds away. At 1 pm on a Saturday, we barely waited 10 minutes. Our server took our orders quickly, and gave everyone a banana nut muffin on the house!

A couple of my friends and I split the blackened prime rib benedict (a must must MUST!), the strawberry cream-stuffed french toast (tasted like fair food), and an Italian omelette. Enormous portions priced right--felt so bad leaving so much of it uneaten, especially since it was so delish. Even the coffee was the absolute perfect diner coffee.

I don't think I can ever do a Vegas trip without the Egg & I. It's so worth the drive off the strip! And believe the hype--just stick to the blackened prime rib benny and you won't be disappointed.

The omelet was delicious and portion was generous, potatoes was really really yummy I couldn't stop eating although I was really full!! While many people recommended their banana nut muffin and we decided to give ourselves a try, turning out it was really good!!! Couldn't believe we can find such a cutely decorated, good and affordable brunch place in Vegas and just 5 minutes drive from the strip!!

Tried this place with a friend and had probably one of the friendliest waitresses I've every encountered. The selection of food is pretty amazing and fills you up. The waitress gave me and my friend two free slices of their famous coffee cakes and it was heaven. The breakfast food was ridiculously delicious. I highly recommend this mom & pops place if you want something different than what is on the strip.

This place is awesome and our server Liza's the BEST! My wife and I ate here for breakfast on our visit to Vegas. We at the bacon avocado omelette and country fried steak. Banana Nut muffins are homemade and melt in your mouth! Coffee also tasted delicious too, didn't want to stop drinking it! Place was packed but definitely worth waiting for. A must when visiting Vegas.
best breakfast in vegas, screw the fat ho bag buffets, this place was delicious, the tri-tip benedict, got handled! fresh, friendly, and tasty!

So disappointed....... Haven't eaten at this location in years, usually visit Flamingo. They took my name for 1 and then not only seated everyone before me, but 8 tables that signed in after me. They did it to another single before me too. They said they were waiting for a small table, but kept seating parties of 2 that signed in after me at the small tables..... They finally seated me at a  table for 4, go figure. And I waited all this time for ????? Horrible!!!

5 Stars for service!  Especially Amanda who is so sweet!  

For the food, I give it 3 stars, for good not great. 

However I did order something unusual and perhaps the other dishes are better.  I ordered a Hawaiian dish that was supposed to have sticky white rice, but it was just ordinary white rice.  The pancakes were a little under cooked.
The food was excellent and service was great. Brady was a fantastic server and started our day off right!
First time here, amazingly fast service (we were in a rush, too), server Kelcey was awesome, highly recommend to everyone!

Outstanding service, California Omelette yummy.
Fresh coffee and they keep it coming.
Perfect hash browns.

I will be back!!

Consistently the best breakfast in Vegas!  Best service and the menu has a huge variety of items.  You could go everyday and get something different every time, but I definitely recommend the Mexican omelet!
First time here with friends from out of town... our server Curtis was amazingly wonderful... we all ordered something different.. everything was perfect.. the only downside was it was very salty...
Cute little restaurant!  The food was wonderful!! I highly recommend the cinnamon raisin French toast or the harvest pancakes!!

This place went beyond my expectations! Food was great and the portion was large. Keep that in mind because I ordered too much haha. The service was wonderful as well, I definitely recommend! I got the sunrise mountain and it was so yummy--however there was so much cheese stacked on top that it was overpowering but if you like cheese this would be a great dish. Would come again!

Love coming here for breakfast as the portions are generous & the food is delish!  The banana muffins come out hot & fluffy.  Omelettes are huge & filled with yummy things.  The service is quick & friendly but be prepared for a wait if you come at peak hours.  The entrance is small so you will likely be outside enjoying the fine Vegas weather.
Tabatha is a great waitress!! Super helpful and a great help to decide and this huge menu! Thanks for the delicious free banana muffin too.

We ordered some kind of Mexican dish that comes with tortillas, and asked waitress for the corn tortillas,  because I'm gluten free, and we got flour tortilla inside, we asked again and second time they brought us flour tortilla, after we spoke with manager she proposed us to get extra muffin. Seems like she doesn't know what gluten free means

Great food but best of all is Server Tabatha!
Fantastic happy friendly service and spit on recommendations!
We had our brunch here with stuffed French toast. I really love the coffee here. Our server Card was very nice. It is a good place, and the food is great. The quantity is large for me, which is good.

Great food at a great value and the environment so home-y and family friendly. Our waiter was one of the best I've ever met--incredibly nice, attentive, and efficient. I ordered waffles with scrambled eggs and sausage and it was fantastic. I also got the free Yelp checkin banana muffin and it might have been the best muffin I've ever eaten--served warm, crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside with amazing flavor. Can't wait to come back here!
Perfect place to enjoy breakfast! Fair prices and large portions. Try the sundace with turkey bacon, delicious! Friendly and good service by Sayra. I will definitely come back again

Love this place!! Every time I come to Vegas I make sure to make a stop here and enjoy the banana nut muffin that tastes like heaven! The staff is always friendly and they place a newspaper style menu for you to look at. If you say it's your first time, most waitresses will bring you complimentary banana muffins for your table. But don't worry if they don't because most breakfast plates either come with toast or muffin..... Please go for the banana nut muffin!!! It's that good! For food I recommend the works skillet or any of their omelettes. They also have Hawaiian style food, which I haven't had the chance to try. The wait can go fast although it might take longer for larger groups. Parking can be a hassle during weekends. This restaurant will beat any overprice buffets on the strip, it's well worth it to go out of the strip for the food. And if you enjoy the muffin as much as I did, they sell banana nut loafs!

This place is da bomb! No accident it is the best breakfast in Las Vegas. This is the one location that does not have mimosas FYI. Had the Veggie Benny Works and it was beyond delicious. Huge chunks of avocado, grilled tomatoe, spinach and eggs done perfectly. Only improvement would be to have the English muffin more toasted. Coffee looked pretty watery but it tasted good. Service was excellent in spite of them being PACKED. Worth the 20 minute or so wait. A definite must visit next time we're here!

I usually don't take the time to leave reviews everywhere I check-in to unless there's  something that I have to say. I always come to the Egg and I every time I'm in town and the service here is always great. However, this time, I wanted to give a shout out to one of the employees named Elemar. Not sure if that's the correct spelling, but, as a pretty observant person, he definitely works above and beyond his regular duties, and should become a regular server! I've never seen someone work so hard at a restaurant. Thank you for being so efficient with your service!

Searching for a breakfast joint, we took these reviews to heart and checked out Egg & I.  We were ANYthing but disappointed.  The coffee/toast/butter aroma wafting throughout the restaurant was inviting in itself.  Our terrific server, Lindsey, volunteered I could have a 1/2 order of anything, as I was not up to 4 eggs.  I chose the chili rellenos omelette - PERFECT - and a 1/2 order was more than I could handle!  My husband had the bandit scramble - DELICIOUS.  Loved that a carafe of coffee was left on my table, so I could serve myself when I wanted more.  Loved that the cost was less than a hotel buffet -- and I didn't have to serve myself!  It is now our FAVE.

I love this place although it was my first time here my friends and I usually go to egg works but it is related and closer to strip so we came here. I had classic breakfast with hash browns that look like McDonald's  hashbrowns they are so good . Wait time runs about 30 min but it's worth it as it goes by pretty fast. I love how they serve the mimosas with its own champagne bottle and juice . Overall our server and food was great. Thank you Liliana for making our experience pleasurable.

This place reminds me of Hash house a go go, but a smaller size. The place is really pack when we went, and it seems to be pack most of the time. I got the Flapper and my friend got one of the omelet with spinach, chicken, feta cheese, tomato, and bacon. Both were alright, except I think the omelet was a bit salty probably from the feta cheese. It's a good breakfast place I think. Their banana nut miffin is pretty good. I think it's the best banana nut muffin I ever had because it's sweet - maybe honey and brown sugar and soft and moist and warm when we got it, but also a bit oily. Taste like cake.
Eggsellent banana muffin!!  Carole Ann waited on us and was very sweet. Portion sizes are big, shared the classic with turkey bacon and a side order of eggs between two people.

It was just about the most pleasant experience I have ever had at any restaraunt. The service was quick,our server was delightful, and the food was very satisfying! I would most definitely say this is my new favorite restaurant

Went there today for breakfast. I had the chile relleno omelette and James had the eggs Benedict. We were greeted in a timely manner by the busser who took our beverage orders. Waitress came by a few minutes later and took our order. Food came out pretty quick and you could tell it was picked up and delivered to our table right away. It was an awesome breakfast! The chocolate banana muffin was great with my coffee.
Best breakfast in Lad Vegas! Service is fantastic; Erin was the best. Thank you Erin for male our breakfast a great experience.

Eggs and I just like Egg Works doesn't disappoint. The food is great and at a fair price. It is much better than having breakfast at a casino. Their portions are big so keep that in mind in case you want to share. Their staff is very friendly, especially our server Jessica. She was attentive and professional the entire time I was there.

Solid, solid food!  Omelets are nice and fluffy, the muffins are all top, and the coffee pot is brought directly to the table in a big pot.  If you have a car in Vegas make your way out here instead of the touristy strip food to get in with the locals and save some dough for your budget.

All I can say is yummy!! Food was delicious and the Hanna nut muffin was to die for. Super banana-ey! Carole Ann, our server, was great! If you're staying on the strip, it's so worth the 10 minute drive!
Stopped in on a Sunday morning after reading the other reviews on Yelp. I was not disappointed! As a vegetarian, I had Kay's special which was delicious, and our waitress Karla was delightful!
One of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas off the strip. Must go here every time I'm in town!

My favorite breakfast joint in Vegas!

Thank the Yelp gods for throwing this gem into my search for brunch.  Best part is that it's off strip--meaning that the price is reasonable and not completely inflated and ridonkulous.  It's not too far off strip where it's a drag to get to, but you'll definitely have to drive or take a cab.

We've only visited during the week, so we haven't really ever had to wait for a table, but I can imagine that weekends can get pretty hectic.

Food for DAYS!  Portion sizes are pretty large + with most breakfast entrees, you'll receive a choice of toast or their incredible banana nut muffin.  If you choose against getting the muffin, you're BSC!  Their muffin is the shyyyyza, plus they currently have a Yelp check in offer for a free muffin!  DOUBLE MUFFIN!  I haven't strayed away from my favorite (chicken fried steak with their perfect potatoes), but their menu is quite extensive, and I'm pretty confident you'll be able to find something that you'll love on there.  But seriously, what's in those potatoes?  You've got me addicted, Egg & I!

The servers are attentive and friendly, but the tables also have a small egg sign to get their attention.  It's a yellow, sad egg when you need assistance (so cute).  Every time we've gone, we've never had to utilize this, since their waitstaff are so great.

Egg & I will always be on our list for breakfast eats when we're vacationing in Vegas!

Got to vegas frm san diego this is the first place we came to eat...the place is clean and easy to find..the menu was wonderful..a plus for me was that there was rice...the price were good and the portions were big...are waitress karla was wonderful and very nice started are day off positive....will tell othe
Great service and great food! I ordered the corn beef hash with over easy eggs. Reina is a very attentive, nice and quick server. Kudos to Reina!!!

This place is usually busy, but the wait isn't to bad.  They have indoor and outdoor seating.  

The service is great, the wait staff is friendly and they use an egg flip system on your table to help with the service.  If you don't need help, the egg shows a smile.  If you do need assistance, flip the egg and it shows a sad yellow egg to alert your server.  

They know how to cook eggs here!  It's hard to find a place that knows how to do a proper soft scramble and Egg & I does it right.  They have a great fresh fruit waffle and their crepes are really good.  They also have a Hawaiian menu with Loco Moco, Portugese sausage, spam, eggs and rice (the real sticky kine) and Aloha shoyu!  

Tip:  try the banana nut bread...ono!

We went on a Saturday around 10 am after feeling discouraged over the wait at Hash House a Go Go at the LINQ hotel. The wait was only 15 mins which was not bad at all. The service was attentive and polite. We ordered the works skillet which is potatoes mixed with green bell peppers, onions, ham, sausage over 2 eggs cooked any way you like. We also got half an order of carrot cake French toast- which we thought was too sweet. The banana nut muffin was terrific- very moist, fresh out of the oven, and not too sweet. Yelpers can check in for a free banana nut muffin if it doesn't already come with your meal. Overall a good place for brunch/ breakfast.
Fast service and amazing food! Price was was very good.

This was our first time coming here, and let me tell you it won't be our last! This hidden gem is off the strip, but well worth the time. It's located in a strip mall and it's obviously a local favorite. I saw a massive line, and thought is it gonna be worth the wait?? It's not a fancy place, it's homy and comfortable with lots of tables, staff and commotion of the morning rush. We were a party of 9, and expected a wait, 25 was all we waited! Our waitress was awesome! She was very attentive, and offered us a FREE banana muffins that were bomb! She took our order, and offered us some wonderful suggestions! The time of truth, the food was awesome, fresh and hot! The portions were huge! I loved this place and will definitely come back each and every time am in Vegas!!

I called to place a to go order. I took 5 phone calls to finally get someone to take my order. I was transferred to another phone that would ring for over 5 minutes without anyone picking it up. I was transferred over and over even when I would ask not to be put on hold. Very frustrating experience

Alyssa! OMG! You are awesome. Wish we could be regulars so you could be our regular server! Service was great. I got biscuits and gravy, awesome first bite but then a bit salty. Service made up for seasoning.
Wonderful place ti have breakfast.. Love the skillet menu and the attention that the server, Amanda, gave us today make it better!

Ordered avocado, they didn't put it on my meal. Told the waitress they forgot it and to forget about bringing it. She began to goad me on to get avocado, which was strange after saying no several times. I repeated that it was fine; at that point i didn't care for it. Eventually I submitted but asked for only a little amount of avocado. She brings me avocado and soon after - the check. I look at the check, no avocado charge. I was happy, and ready to pay. A few minutes later, she sneakily replaces the check with a brand new one. I hardly noticed that she had done that and after looking at the check again, a $3 avocado charge made me cringe. Wtf? If it was your mistake and I said I was fine on avocado, why would you goad me on to get it? Then give me a check without it (again forgetting, but this time you forgot to charge me so might as well leave it), and replace it with a ridiculous charge? And do not call your customers "babe", it's just weird especially when you say it behind them. "Thanks babe" - as I was holding the check in my hand. Thanks? No thanks lol.I wish I remembered her name, but she was some older red-haired lady. I was not pleased with this incident.
Also, their "Habla Diablo" potatoes, which comes with every meal, are horrendous. They taste like over seasoned, beyond-salty fast food potatoes. 2 stars for getting seated quick, polite service, and a banana "nut" muffin for a side, despite the fact that it was overly sweet and did not receive the slightest bit of nutty flavor. Be weary of such scenario as I have endured. For these reasons, I would not consider returning.

Good breakfast and service.  Our waitress was helpful and you can turn the egg card around when you need service as opposed to waving some waitress down.  Smart.  Meals were large and they immediate provide you with coffee and banana bread before your meal.  Don't get full on that though since their meals are very large and if you are tourist, you don't take leftovers.  It can get very crowded so go during off times.

We had a feeling this place would be good after seeing a line going out to the parking lot.  The works veggie benny was incredible (generious amount of avocado slices in it) and their banana nut muffin  (free with yelp check in) was the best I've ever had! Despite a packed restaurant, service was great and faster than expected.  This place definitely has their act together as no chaos going on with very competent and friendly servers.
Have no idea what people are talking about or hit it on an extremely awesome day. Disappointing. Ordered the huevos rancheros which was basically chili slopped on a tortilla.

Karla was our server today, she was right on time w/ her greeting us and was very nice! She was of course wearing green on st. Pattys day and suggested something new which most servers do not.. I tried eggs Benny! Loved it. Thank you Karla, see ya soon
good food, loved the breakfast selection
Thank you Karla for the amazing service, awesome attitude, and great food. For a party of 13 you rocked it! Get the steak & eggs!
Great breakfast.  French Toast stuffed with egg bacon cheese omlette was over the top.  Breanna was a super server.  Banana nut muffin was scrumptious.

This breakfast place is awesome! Their Habla Diablo Seasoned Potatoes were delicious. And, our server Paula was great. She tended to our needs right away and was very nice. We're definitely coming back here when we're in town.

Egg-cellent Food, Egg-ceptional Service! Definitely worth the 20 minute wait on a Sunday morning.  My wife was not feeling well and just picked at her food.  The manager came by to make sure everything was alright, we explained that Ellen was not feeling well, but the food was great.  Without even asking she took $4.00 off the bill.  Now that's Customer Care.  If your in Las Vegas and want a great breakfast, with caring servers, at reasonable price, go to the EGG & I.

My husband found this spot on TripAdvisor so we checked out out. There were many people waiting outside, so we were a little hesitant about wait time but getting sat took less than 10 minutes.

He ordered The Original Breakfast Burrito. It was very tasty and a good size. About 7" long and 3" diameter. The stuffing was tasty and just the right spice, the sauce on top was delicious. 

I ordered the Works Veggie Benny. The vegetables were great, English muffins toasted well but not so much that they hurt your mouth while you're eating. Eggs were perfectly cooked (I am so crappy at cooking eggs that this always amazes me). My only complaint was that I wasn't super happy with the hollandaise which is 75% of why most people order Eggs Benedict (I think). 

Both came with habla diablo seasoned potatoes which were very tasty. Both of us finished our plates. 

Drinks: Soda and unsweetened iced tea.

Bill: $27

Had breakfast yesterday, 20 minute wait, this place is always busy on Saturday mornings and it was no different on this visit. 
Prompt beverage order and delivery. Had the Cincy chili omelet, was good again. The Banana Nut muffin is the best-hands down. We had one issue with an omelet and this was quickly resolved by our server.

WOW What can i say about this place other than it was amazing! I ordered the chill omelette which was amazing and it comes with potatoes. Also the banana nut muffin comes with this and this muffin was probably this best muffin i have ever had. The service was great even with the place being busy. Just a heads up your gonna have to wait especially on weekiends, it was definitely worth the wait and i will be back here every time I am in Vegas.

This may be the best breakfast in the world. If I could rate it 6 stars I would. The banana nut muffin is awesome. I usually get the egg sandwich with a side of potatoes, the egg sandwich is solid and whatever the seasoning they put on the potatoes is like crack I can never have enough. 

On top of this, the service is great. The servers are attentive but not over attentive.

Paula was our waitress and the service here was beyond excellent.

Food was just regular american breakfast, but it's nice to know what the local's favorite is like.

Plenty of parking, decent prices, A LOT of food for you to start your day.

The shocking number of reviews is because the customers are incentivized to post a review on Yelp / Tripadvisor to help their waiter / waitress go to Disneyland.  Apparently, whoever gets their name mentioned most gets to go to Disneyland, but it seems like an unfair popularity contest.  What if I was a waiter and I had tons of Facebook friends to help me out.  Easy free Disneyland trip.  Management, it's a smart business move, but this is a bit unfair.

The Banana Nut muffin is so good, I'm glad we don't live on that side of town or I'd be there eating the stuff everyday. 

It's an awesome place for breakfast. Good food, good service. Just get there a little early because it can get pretty crowded.
This is one of my favorite breakfast spots ever! Seating is fast, service is excellent and plenty of options for people of all culinary persuasions! Raul was a great and attentive server!

I love breakfast. There's just something good about starting your morning off right. Where else can I get a banana nut muffin that's just fresh and oozing with flavor and goodness. This is the place that will help you get that fresh start right. Nice sit down cafe that makes the best breakfast out in Vegas. 

I had my first date with my gf here so this place always has a special place in my heart....

Great brunch, and clearly a locals place. Very friendly service--our waiter gave us free banana muffins because we were first-timers. I got the fiesta skillet with eggs over-easy--terrific, but next time I'd ask for much less cheese. Definitely worth the trip if you're sick of casino food.

Great place for that comforting desire of the south west. Service staff is friendly and accommodating. There are regulars left and right due to the variety of food served. One can order the American eggs and toast with a side of fruit as well as the Belgium waffle that is crisp on the outside and moist on the inside.
Their house banana muffin is awesome! Their potato fries and squares have an seasoning that has just enough flavor in it to mix perfect with your eggs. 
We had an excellent experience and will most definitely go back.

Came here for breakfast with my two girlfriends and Curtis was our server. It was pretty busy when we went but we never felt rushed and he made sure to tend to whatever we needed. The food was great and the service was even better. This was my first time coming here but i will definitely be back in the future!
We had a bit of a wait to be seated, but the food was worth it. And I love that they leave a whole pot of coffee at your table, very good!
this place is fun and with very tasty food and they offered Aloha Shouyu with rice, in Vegas.
Karla was the best server at this establishment. I had the 5-way with spaghetti and chilli. It was amazing.

THE BEST BREAKFAST!!! I love trying new places to eat! This is a winner!!! My husband and i were lost and he was mad because we couldn't find it. He wanted to just go to Denny's. I insisted to keep driving till we found it. (Wasn't hard to find) we made a wrong turn.  My husband left soooo full and soooo glad we went there. Atmosphere was great, food wonderful! I had Avocado Omelet with Portuguese sausage, and the muffin. Delicious!!! If you're in Vegas this is a must!!!

Wow what a great meal.We came here twice because the first experience was so good.Omelette's were great and Prime Rib Benny was outstanding.Service was equally superb as well. Reina our waitress was great both days !!!

First of I want to start of by saying Tabatha is by far the best! She was quick, friendly and knowledgeable of all items the had to offer on the menu, not only that but she definitely made all and I mean all of the breakfast sound as amazing as it was! Really enjoyed my "FREE"muffin by far one of the top 5 banana nut muffins on book! A must go to spot!! Egg works//egg &I
Awesome place for breakfast. Service was great and the good is amazing. Try the stuffed French toast. Aldo the muffin is good! Very moist! Best banana nut muffin I've ever had!

i absolutely *heart* this place!  i think its the cute egg mascots ;-)

been here serveral times.  one of my best friends moved to vegas years ago, and ever since she's been my vegas local guide to food.  its good to be in the know ;-)  we go here for breakfast almost every time i visit!  here's why....

service is always friendly.  the food is creative, homey, filling, and just a great homemade american breakfast/brunch menu.  there are heavy soul filling and hangover killing dishes like meaty hashes, great benedicts, all sorts of omelettes, and then there are lighter versions like the egg crepes and even the fresh berry parfait.  

its PACKED for weekend brunch, mostly with locals, but the wait isn't tooo bad, usually not over 20 min or so.  if u happen to be here on a weekday, or get up earlier than the rest of ur friends and wanna get off the strip, this is perfect place to sit by urself with the paper, coffee, and  a good breakfast.  not what u would think of when u think of vegas, in a very good way =D

p.s. must get the muffins!

This place is amazing!  I've been dying to try it ever since driving by once and seeing the line out the door.

We dined on a Friday morning around 11 and there was a wait of about 15 minutes.  The menu is cute and read likes a newspaper. 

The portions are huge and we split 3 dishes between the 4 of us. 

Catherine's Scramble: chicken, mushrooms, spinach, feta and artichokes.  I was sold on all the ingredients and the dish was amazing and flavorful.

Bacon, avocado and cheese omelette: full of bacon flavor and packed with avocados.  Usually when I get avocado with my omelette it is served sparingly with just a few pieces on top.  They were not stingy with it and filled it completely.

Corned beef hash: the good stuff, not canned corn beef.  Eggs and toast were included.

All the dishes were served with a side of ranch potatoes, which is amazing in itself.  I would eat the potatoes alone!

 Priced well with large portions.  I will definitely be back to try other dishes.    
.

Fabulous place far from the strip's chaos. The works skillet I got was fabulous and the French toast stuffed with bacon and eggs was one of the most delicious breakfast items I have ever had.
We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas

Visited on Wednesday and the kids liked it so much we went back on Friday. We were only visiting vegas and this is honestly such a good breakfast place I have been so many times to vegas with out kids and have never had a decent breakfast. I will definitely come back when we visit again (with or with out kids) the food was really good , I got an omlette and asked for avocado they are very generous on their portions. They were busy but the food and service was fast.our waitress Liza ( hope I got her name right) was such an awesome server! And she remembered us:) she is another reason I would come back when visiting vegas.
Awesome food. The banana nut muffins are great. Have not had a bad meal here yet. Highly recommended.

Went there twice while visiting here from NY. Not many places to eat just a simple breakfast that won't break the bank. I like the omelet and the egg skillets. What I wasn't crazy about were the potatoes, which did not seem fresh cut, but rather from a prepackaged bag. The service is excellent, efficient and attentive. When in Vegas this restaurant beats the overpriced buffets and hotel restaurants.

What a great place for anytime meal, but we came for breakfast...and make sure you yelp and check in you'll get a complimentary banana nut muffin....great start! 
I chose the Ensenada Burrito which was a great meal in itself but wonderful mix of mild Mexican flavors!! Our service was fantastic!! When you're looking for a great dining experience, stop in the Egg and I!!!

This is a great greasy spoon joint. Not really for the health nut but if you want big portions and great flavors for a good price this is the place. The muffin was kind of sticky like they pull them out of the freezer to thaw. So we didn't enjoy that but everything else was spot on. 

My husband had the mashed potato omelette and my dad had the biscuits and gravy. I had the veggie omelet, all of the above were great!

Ate here about 2 weeks ago. The name caught my eye and I read a few reviews and decided to go for it.

The omlettes were just OK.. they say they are 4 egg omlettes, but they were on the small side.. looked like 3 egg omlettes.. the omlettes were frikkin caked in CHEESE.. I like cheese but it was too much! The coffee was ok.. they give you a carafe like IHOP. I like that.. you don't have to bug the waitstaff for refills. The potatoes were good.

I also ordered a short stack of pancakes. The pancakes were frikkin delicious and HUGE! I ate half of them.. 

I'd go back again but it will probably be a little while. I'd get the Pancakes again or try something else like French Toast or a Scramble.

I did leave this place full as if I was leaving a buffet.. ugh!
Great choice for breakfast when visiting LV since it is clearly a favorite of the locals. The food and service are very good and the portions substantial.
Big portions and tasty too. The works skillet was awesome. Would highly recommend for breakfast.

Had a coupon so we broke from our usual habit of hitting our neighborhood Omelet House and tried this place.  It's a winner!  Comfortable restaurant, friendly staff and great service.  And, oh, the food is really really good.  Prices a bit high but quality and portions are excellent.  My wife had the cheddar cheese omelet....it looked so pretty you almost didn't want to eat it.   Light, cheesy and oh so good.  Banana nut muffin equally good.  I had the piggy skillet....layered with potatos, ham, sausage, bacon and cheese, with a couple eggs on top.  Delicious.

Service was great. Be prepared for huge portions and an equally robust menu.  We are from Cincinnati so imagine our surprise when we saw Cincinnati chili on the menu. The waitress was kind enough to bring us a sample (it's spicier than skyline) but quite tasty.  The chocolate chip muffins were divine.

Egg & I is always a favorite and is most always the first breakfast spot we hit during our ventures to LV.

I can't seem to get myself to order anything but the Egg Crepes, I guess it's just because it's that good, not to mention, I can't order anything like it from anywhere else!  I forget which one I usually order, I think it's called the "Collision" or something?  It has mushrooms and bacon in it.

The Ranch Potatoes are like like Potato Chips, you can't help but pop one after the other, after the other, in your mouth.

But, it's not like I can finish it anyways, because of that damn freakin most delicious Banana Nut Muffin I have in the beginning.  Oh my gosh, slap a little butter on it, hell, slap a lot of butter on that warm muffin and it's freakin heaven.  I'll need to ask the next time I'm around if I can actually order some muffins to go.

Egg & I is definitely worth it and I'll keep coming back every time I'm in town.

I went for lunch. I got a pesto scramble and I have to say this was one of the best flavor combinations I've had in a while. There were eggs, pesto, whole spinach leaves, cheese, and I think some tomatoes scrabbled to fluffy perfection.  My fiancé got the western omelette and he said it was the best he's ever had. 

We bought a groupon at $24 for $40 worth of food so it was a good deal too, but I am definitely coming back in the future.

Wonderful breakfast - what a gem of a place! Our server Staci was friendly, the banana nut muffin was to die for, and one of the best omlettes I have ever had!  My new breakfast place whenever I visit Vegas!

What a great breakfast place! We had about a 20 minute wait on a Saturday at 915am which was expected.  It was our first time there and our fabulous waitress Alexa brought us all these delicious, warm and fresh banana nut muffins for free since it was our first time! The Bloody Mary and coffee were both good! On our table we had huevos rancheros, the biscuits and gravy and the avocado bacon omelette--all were great. Portions were more than fair and the food was fresh and tasted delicious! We will definitely head back here on our next Vegas trip!

BANANA NUT MUFFIN you MUST!!
The service was eggsellent ;] Our server was very helpful and fast. 
Food is delicious.

I ate breakfast at the Egg & I on Sahara in Las Vegas, NV on 11/23/2014.  I was my 1st time there.  There were seven of us.  Everyone had something different.  I had their western omelette.  This place is connected with Egg Works and has the same menu.  Plus, I took photos.
Banana Nut muffin was the best. Had Traditional Bennett as really good. Our server Maggie was great. When in Vegas will be in again.

Best breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas that nobody talks about.  It isn't a coincidence that their reviews are so solid.  Great food, great service and great prices.  All the waitresses are good but Carole Ann is the real deal.  Super friendly and easy going!  Do yourself a favor and give this place a try.  You won't be disappointed.

Love this place--it's like Cheers, everybody knows my name!
Been eating here since I was in Elementary school....did you know this place opened up in 1983? Just a little food for thought! :)

Anyway, about the food...I love and highly suggest the:
-Italian skillet
-Corn beef hash
And my new favorite...
-Pork Carnitas!!!!!! (Drool)

Do yourself a favor and give this place a shot, it's an oldie but a goodie! :)

This is still my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas.  It is my first choice and the food is as good as it had always been.  The service is also excellent!  I have to admit that I've never had anything on the lunch menu before because no matter what time I go I always order breakfast - it is that good!

Absolutely amazing food! The service was also outstanding, I went in for breakfast with my girlfriend. The waiter that helped us was very attentive and sweet not considering that she was very much pregnant. Hard working woman, 5 stars to her and everyone else. Definitely returning to eat there again.

This is the perfect breakfast and brunch place! The service is great. They have this happy egg and sad egg system. If you turn the egg at you table sad in a second a waiter or waitress will come and make your egg happy. The omelettes are too die for and the coffee is great. The servings are huge and the potatoes are very tasty. I wish they had one of these back home. It was a great expierence.
Yummy! Muffins, and Karla is the best she really deserves a trip to see Micky Mouse! The portions are large and the price is low, service is great! Perfect combination.

This place had a lot of variety in their menu. One of the best omelette S I've ever had. They have the most amazing banana nut bread. It was my favorite part of the meal, and best part it was free with a Yelp check in!!

Just like most other reviews say , the banana muffin is great- the potatoes are as well- the wife & myself both had the skillets , they were good . Plenty to eat , service was good staff was friendly , food came out quick- a good place off the strip
In love with the potatoes for breakfast, well seasoned and don't even need Ketchup if you ask me. That's a first : D

Weekend trip to Vegas and I wanted to avoid the strip and hotel restaurant breakfast scene. Yelp recommended this place so the wife and I gave it a try. 
Pretty busy for a Monday morning. Were seated within 2 minutes, great. Server was friendly and attentive. Wife had the strawberry cream cheese stuffed french toast...yummy. Very good with a nice sized portion. 
I had the corned beef hash. Good stuff, also a nice sized portion. I love corned beef hash and this was homemade. Excellent. Hit the spot. Great food, good service, reasonable prices.
I was not too fond of the location ( I felt it was a bit far) but I wanted to avoid the strip so I guess I shouldn't complain. 
The only CON for me was the lack of info on the server's part. I love pancakes, and always have them for breakfast when I dine out. I asked for pancakes instead of toast and was told they could not do that. Okay, no biggie. Not the first place that does this. However, the pancakes were HUGE and 3 came with the order. I barely even touched them because I was almost full from the hash. I was pretty upset that I dropped $6.25 for an order of pancakes that I had less than 1/4 of because of the shear size. I feel the server could've let me know they were huge and given me an option. Service is a big part of the experience when dining out. If I wouldn't have dropped $6.25 on uneaten pancakes our server would've gotten a nicer tip.
I love it here. A lot of food for friendly prices with amazing customer service. Our server Amanda was the best!

This place has to be related to Egg Works because they are literally exactly the same. From the decor to the menu!

It's a Sunday morning so we came into it assuming we would be waiting at least 30+ minutes. Although it was packed we probably only waited between 15-20 minutes. For breakfast on a Sunday morning that's really not bad.

We got seated on the patio which is what we wanted at the time but honestly we froze to death. If you're eating breakfast before 11AM sit inside or wear like ten sweaters.

We both ordered omelettes. I had the mashed potato Omelette and my friend had the bacon and avocado omelette.

Huge, huge portions! And very tasty! I had half of my omelette left over to take home!

It's a pricier place to eat breakfast you're probably looking at between 11-15 dollars for breakfast and OJ but it is very much worth it!

It was a 20 minute wait to be seated inside. The hostess and waitress was friendly. I asked for a low carb option and told her about my daughter's nut allergy and she was great about substituting and pointing out other options.  You    get a free banana nut muffin if you check in with Yelp. The blueberry muffin was good even though it's not freshly baked. The Pancho's scram, chicken enchilada omelet, Cincinnati Coney dog, and kid's chicken fingers were good. My husband enjoyed the side of potatoes and the fresh fruit was good too.  We enjoyed dining here and it's nice that the prices were good as well.

The better half just said.... And I quote..."oh my god I'm eating way to fast, but it's so good I just want to shove it my face hole!" In regards to the veggie Benny she was enjoying. I had the Mexican omelet with potatoes, skipped the toast or muffin. Still so much food. But omg it was so effing good. Saturday morning 7:30, walked right in. Service was awesome and food came fast and to hot to eat. Very clean and not your typical diner greasy smell. Nice job!!! Guess that's why they are rated number one on yelp!

Large portions [especially the "work potatoes"]. We were told ten minute wait and it was about right [Sunday mid-morning].  If you put you name in, ask to see the menu - it is extensive.
The eggs are offered up to four (4) per plate, so you'll not go hungry.  Service is about what you'd expect from a busy place.  Can't go higher on the stars for what amounts to a large plate more than half covered with potatoes, and the eggs fixed as you usually get eggs in a restaurant.

I always loved the Egg & I. My dad used to take me here when I was a child, and I've been coming back ever since. I drive about 30 minutes to get to this particular location.

I had an egg-crepe with mushrooms, bacon, and cheese- breakfast potatoes and banana bread sides. Although I wasn't impressed with the "crepe", it wasn't the fault of the cooks. The eggs came out perfectly cooked and of course I polished off every morsel of fried potato on the plate and considered picking a couple cold ones off the floor that have been there since we stopped in. YES- THAT GOOD! So back to the crepe, it was like trying olives for the first time in a restaurant and deciding you don't like olives. It's not their fault you don't like olives.. I don't like egg-crepes.

The banana nut muffin.. Oh man.. Would it be terrible to walk in there and order a loaf of banana bread and just eat it all for breakfast? Probably for your arteries, yes- but it's damn good for the soul.

Everything here is delicious. EVERYTHING!

Whenever we come to Vegas, we make sure to stop here for breakfast. Everything tastes phenomenal and the amazing breakfast potatoes top it all off. All of the staff has been great! Reina even went out of her way to change an order at the last second. Definitely go here. You won't be disappointed.
Cute little place, good service. Probably the closest thing to a diner you'll find in Las Vegas. I had a very nice, fresh breakfast for about $7!! We even took home a souvenir mug.

What an awesome place. 

First off, they give you a complementary banana nut muffin when you order your breakfast and it is SO GOOD. It's always warm and always fresh. It's a dream come true for your taste buds. My mouth is watering right now, no joke. 

The omlettes are delicious and they are very generously sized. The french fries rock. 

The french toast is amazing too! 

I've been here a bunch of times and I look forward to going back.
The hype is REAL!!!!! Mushroom, cheese + avocado omelette- ahhhhhmazing!!!!! Huge portions backup the reasonable pricing. Once you go The Egg & I you'll never want to go anywhere else!
Love this place.....! Love my Egg Sandwich......yummmmmmm! I can't wait to come back to Vegas and eat there......
Not a good place. Potatoes taste like barbecue potato chips, way to salty. Benedict was watery. Straberry French toast was good but that's it Not sure why the place is highly reviewed.

I was glad that I only ordered a half serving of Ultimate Skillet - because the serving was GENEROUS!!!!! Ultimate Skillet was definitely a classic and very satisfying - A flavorful combination of sausage, ham, bacon, mushroom, onions, tomatoes, spinach and bell pepper, topped with a perfectly poached egg. Ohhh.... and that's not the end of it! All order came with a banana nut muffin that was moist and soft.......

Yummmmmmmmmm...... definitely worth the wait!

Just had our usually great experience here with one HUGE exception - our server, Stacie, was Fabulous!! Helpful - telling us things we never knew - beyond friendly and welcoming.  It truly made our Sunday morning breakfast egg-ceptional!

And, of you are not aware (we were not), EW (Egg Works) makes terrific hot sauces - we bought the chipotle!  Gotta try them!

The food at Egg and I is good if you order the right thing. I had the scramble and it was just ok. However, the turkey sausage, French toast Diablo potatoes are great. The homemade banana nut muffins are to die for. I was most impressed with the muffins and our server Roman left nothing unattended.  He's one of the best I've had in any restaurant.  Great customer service all the way around.  If I'm back in Vegas I'll come back.

My number one breakfast place.

I usually get omelets and have never been disappointed.  Plus, the coffee there is a smooth coffee, not bitter or acidic.  The home fries are consistently cooked to perfections with a crispy brown and warm soft center.

Several large screen TV's so you can watch the news or sports.

My original eggs bene was pretty yummy. The Canadian bacon was a little too smokey for my taste, but the English muffin was tender and easy to cut and the egg was poached perfectly. And there was plenty of hollandaise. My boys enjoyed the kids meals and we had plenty of food to go around. The best part was our server always had a smile on her face and was very friendly. (Even when faced with a family with five young boys.)

Towards the end someone started smoking on the patio so next time I would definitely wait for a table inside.

An amazing gem. We discovered this during our trip to Vegas. My BF is a picky eater and he enjoyed the skillet with season fries, banana muffin, and even straight down to their coffee. It is truly a service with a smile as we had a wonderful server, Karla. It's so good BF wanted to go back again before we left and he usually doesn't request unless it's good. Fo those of you who like bloody marys, it's a must. Even I liked the taste not being a big fan of it. The best part of our vegas dining experience.

Wow. I have never had banana nut muffins quite like the ones served in The Egg and I. It was freshly made and still hot from the oven. The next time I come I need to make sure to get a box to go!

As for the breakfast plates, my boyfriend got the omelet and I got the usual potatoes ham and eggs. We also decided to get the "short stack" banana pancakes. Let me just tell you that when we asked just how big the short stacked pancakes were, the server made this hand gesture that indicated it was small so we went with that. Guys, the short stack was, STACKED. It was huge! It's bigger than the regular pancakes in Ihop and Denny's! Plus it had REAL bananas in them. Holy smokes! 

We were IN LOVE with the potatoes! It had the best seasoning - a somewhat Cajun flavor? The ham was a large chunk and my boyfriend loved his omelet. This place is perfect! Would definitely come back for more!

10/10 would bang (the door) again

There's a reason this place was totally packed when we arrived. Even though it was packed, we were seated in a couple of minutes. The waitress was fantastic, fast and attentive. AlThe food is amazing.  Best potatoes I've ever had.  I can't wait to go back!
