Amazing Amanda at the East Sahara ...This place scores 5 stars on every count and Amanda deserves 100!

This is a cute little place with nice people here.  We didn't order much and we got it to go.  They are only open until 3pm for breakfast and lunch.  We came around 1pm during the week and it seemed like there was a long wait to be seated.

I came across this place when the bf wanted to find a "local place" for a recent Vegas trip, and I must say it is definitely worth the trip away from the strip!

From the outside, the place looks very unassuming. Not even busy. But right when we opened the door, crowds poured out, and we had to wait nearly 20 minutes for a table for two. The wall decor by the waiting place was cute. There were cartoons as well as sayings about eggs. Finally, we were led to our table by a super friendly and bubbly waitress.

The menu is printed like a newspaper - cool!! I've never seen that before!! (Yes I took a picture with it.) The selection is pretty extensive considering that every single item on the menu are made with eggs (like skillet items, omelettes, etc), so it took us a while to decide. I forget what we ended up getting - it was a while ago, pardon me - but I remember it being soooo good! They also customize your order so that you can have whole eggs vs egg substitutes vs egg whites, etc... Definitely get the fresh banana nut bread!! We almost got a loaf to take home back to LA even though we weren't leaving for LA yet.

The service was superb. Our waitress kept coming by to check up on us. When the busboy accidentally tossed our leftovers, the waitress felt so bad that she went back to the kitchen and got us some other foods to take with us. This was one place where I seriously went in not expecting much and left completely satisfied with the full intention of coming back next time I am in Vegas.

An awesome local breakfast diner, a couple miles off the strip on Sahara.  Lots of cool touches like the newspaper style menus and the little flipcharts to let the server know you need something.

The breakfast skillets are superb here, served hot on the skillet with a layer of ranch potatoes.  I have tried both the Chili skillet and the Ultimate skillet, both were excellent.  I also recommend the banana nut muffin side.

I would, however, advise against ordering from their Mexican inspired menu.  They should definitely leave the chorizo con huevos to the Mexican joints.

Overall one of my favorite Vegas dining spots, for breakfast or a late night snack (they are open til 3AM).
Great service, and the food was AMAZING! I had the Santa Fe skillet and it was delicious!
Really good food and a really great waitress. Our server was fast and prompt. She made sure we had everything we needed before we even had to ask. Thanks Alyssa for the awesome service!

The food here is good just the amount of food And everything came out hot. Service was better than some of the other places we have been to. 
  We would come back here to try the rest of menu
We always make it here when in vegas. In fact, it's a big part of why we come. The banana nut muffins are to die for and our server Stacie was very attentive!

5 stars for the amazing service from our server LINNEA! She defiantly deserves to win the trip to Disney!

1) Linnea went above and beyond when it came to serving. When we order she would ask additional questions like, would you like flavored creamers? And give additional recommendations towards the food choices.

2) Linnea would always check on us and see if we were doing good, always having a cheerful welcoming smile on her face and the way she talked made us feel very welcomed.

3) When there was a slight mistake, because my friend ordered steak and instead of eggs they wanted an omelet, which never happened before and Linnea brought out my stuff French toast and apologize for the confusion and mishap, that the steak was cooked inside the omelet and apologize for the confusion and wait... Which we didn't even wait long. About 3 minutes the steak and omelet was brought out immediately. Still apologizing... It didn't matter too much to us and for the fact that they were sincerely sorry. Wow what exceptional service. 

4) I was going to stop at 3, but since Linnea went above, she not only brought us our check but a "sorry" gift of banana bread wrapped and gifted nicely. I was shocked to see such service!!! 

THIS IS WHAT YOU CALL AMAZING SERVICE, someone who went above and does more than just servicing you! Thank you Linnea!!! We enjoyed our visit and defiantly will be coming back! I hope you will be in Disney by than!!! :D
We Ate at Egg and I.  I had the fiesta scramble and changed the eggs to over medium and added sausage. They took my adjustments in stride.  Ashley was our server.  Great service and yummy breakfast.

I come here every time I visit vegas, which is about 8 to 10 times a year.

I love this place,  their food is amazing!

Don't be fooled by the big crowd outside waiting, they are so quick with serving that people are constantly getting seated.

Servers like Dariesia make the restaurant experience fun and enjoyable! Servers should learn from her and Crack a joke once in a while. Haha.

Highly recommended! Just don't come at the same time as me, might have to fight for the banana nut muffins... :)

If you want some pretty awesome breakfast food with great portions and a friendly staff, then this spot is just for you.  I ordered the Prime Rib Benny and was more than satisfied at how generous the portion was along with how delicious it tasted!  Now I know a Prime Rib Benny isn't something that sounds all too familiar to anyone who hasn't been to this restaurant, so picture this:  juicy and flavorful pieces of blackened prime rib chopped up with poached eggs crowning an open faced buttery croissant, which is then drizzled with a rich and creamy hollandaise sauce.  It's like what traditional egg benedicts dream to be some day basically.  Regular eggs benedict is Carlton Banks, Prime Rib Benny is Will Smith.  You get the picture.

Besides the entrée itself, my order of OJ was fresh squeezed and just right.  Their lemonade was great too, which is a definite plus in my book.  I also had a taste of their French fries and Portuguese sausage, which my cousins ordered and both were very tasty, too!  The fries were thin, crispy and flavorful.  While the Portuguese sausage was not overly oily and fatty and was cooked just right.

Service was verygood, as our waiter was attentive, friendly and always available.  They have this nifty little feature on your table where there's a sign of a sad face and on the other side of it, a sign of a happy face.  When you want your server's attention, you just flip the sign to show the sad face and you'll be helped right away.  I found this to be a very memorable and smart way of the restaurant going the extra mile to offer as much quality service to its patrons.

Best breakfast in a long time!   Huge menu, wonderful and friendly staff and the food is excellent.  I got great recommendation from the manager as I was paying, which was to order smaller servings so I could try more of their dishes!  Yep, I will be back before I leave Vegas to do exactly that!

We came here specifically because of the Yelp reviews and boy they were spot on !!!  This place is an excellent local spot for breakfast and everything on the menu is incredible.  I had the eggs florentine and it was awesome, we also enjoyed the Chili Rellenos omelet !!!  10/10

Drove well out of her way to chase this place down because of the yelp reviews. It did not disappoint. Food was yummy price was good service was good.  If you're in Vegas and around the area I highly recommend it. I like everyone else got the muffin for checking in but like a dummy I left it sitting on the table. I wish I could tell you if it was good or not!

Great food and great service! Carol Anne was awesome! This is a must if you're ever at Lea Vegas! Best Banana But bread I've bet tasted. Great skillets too. But their best one is the BANANA NUT BREAD FRENCH TOAST!!!!! You won't be disappointed!

Based on the general consensus, here on Yelp, I tried the country fried steak.

I've had a many country fried steak in my life...and this is one of the better one's!  We were warned by the server, but it was indeed salty, but not extremely (albeit I prefer more sodium than most).

To me, flavor was great, consistency of the gravy was perfect (not too thick or thin), country fried steak was moist and very crispy, eggs were prepared perfectly and the potatoes were very crispy (potatoes were moist and seasoned well - but also salty in a good way!).  

More over...the nut muffin, as others ranted about, was very fluffy, moist and flavorful!  This dish was spot-on for breakfast.
Nice place to eat. HUGE brunch menu to choose from. Eggs all different ways and great pancake/waffle/crepe options as well. Service was good and food was good.

I looooooooooove this place!  Amazing breakfast/brunch. If you love eggs ANYTHING, this is the place to go!  Good portion, cheap price and friendly atmosphere. Everyone should try the taco style omelette!  It's to die for!!!
Amazing food, amazing service! We received complimentary banana nut muffins - delicious! The servings are huge! Erin was a fabulous server, always offering drink refills and great service!

Fast & friendly service.  Good selection for kid meals that include a drink.  I got fruit instead of potatoes and it was worth it.  Fresh slices of orange, pineapple, watermelon, honeydew and cantaloupe.  Very delicious!

Egg and I, WHY ARE YOU NOT IN CALIFORNIA?

Stopped by here when I was hungry and visiting Vegas. I ordered the stuffed french toast, and let me tell you, it did not dissappoint. Absolutely delicious. Was expecting hashbrowns as potatoes, nope. This place goes above and beyond and gives you some of the most delicious breakfast potatoes you will ever eat. Our server was extremely sweet. Wish I had gotten her name, she reccomended dishes to us and was super helpful. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.
Great food. Had the orig. breakfast burrito with sour cream and salsa. Great! Got it out fast too and it was busy!

My sister worked for this chain in TX- but the NV locations are completely different, with a country twist and a more innovative menu that includes Cincinnati chili, of all things?! I rolled my eyes at all the four- and five-star reviews and then I went for myself. 

CHILE RELLENO OMELET: Huge and delicious. Wish there was a bit more red chili sauce on top but it's oozing with cheese and packed with green pepper strips and flavor. Side of RANCH POTATOES is addictive,  banana but muffin was a nice sweet treat.
BF had the daily special, a BRISKET BENEDICT, which was also solid- tender meat, perfectly oozy eggs, and more of those crack-style potatoes.

I get it now, guys. They execute massive portions of tasty food with a side of genuinely friendly country-style service. This place makes me miss home.
Wide variety of dishes sure to please all tastes. Biscuits and gravy were very good. It was very busy but Linnea and the rest of the staff did a great job of meeting our needs. I will eat here again.

My ritual before heading home. I head to Egg and I and have a breakfast feast. I enjoyed everything that I have tasted there. From fried eggs to the pancakes to the seasoned potatoes. It has a very homey feeling. 

It is nice to get away from the strip and get used to life outside of Vegas before heading back home. I love the staff here. Super nice!

Saw this place on top places to eat BF in Las Vegas . Called and asked if there was wait time they said no when actually it was 25 minutes but totally worth it ! Service was GREAT Paula did an amazing job order was messed up they fixed it faster than anyone ever has ! Food was superb! Fresh squeezed OJ! Also I have  active 1 year old and Paula handled it well thanks Paula

Good food, great service. They were recommended by a local family member and will likely visit again when visiting LAS in the future. My husband thought omelette was good, but skimpy (not very full) with potatoes, which he and 6 ,y/o thought were really good. I had pancakes, scrambled eggs and bacon.
This place had a good breakfast reasonably priced.  Thermos of coffee on the table, good service, nothing fancy just a good breakfast.

Egg & I makes for an amazing breakfast spot -- unbelievably savory morning foods. The menu is very extensive, which is surprising, because they do most of the items on the menu VERY well.

Between the 4 of us that tried Egg & I, we each got different dishes and were all very happy with the food. The portion size is huge as well. If you're not that hungry, share with someone. The omelettes are made with not 1, not 2, not 3, but 4 eggs. FOUR EGGS. It's a beast omelette among eggs.

Three things I will highlight: The eggs benedict, the banana nut muffin, and potatoes.
--Eggs Benedict: Order this and you will not be disappointed. The hollandaise sauce that's drizzled over the eggs is something that most places mess up, but at Egg & I, it's made to perfection -- smooth, creamy and seasoned just right.
--Banana Nut Muffin: They give this to you when you order and omelette, and don't miss out. It's the most airy, soft, moist -- yes, moist -- muffin you'll ever eat. It's like they fold air into the batter before baking. THAT GOOD.
--Potatoes: MY GOD. These are the best side of potatoes I've ever had. I'm convinced they have to be fried, but I'm not sure. The exterior is exquisitely golden crispy with a perfect seasoning blend on the outside. Best potatoes west of the Mississippi; hands down.

Pros: Breakfast food for gods
Cons: Can get busy, limited parking

Darn, a Yelp disappointment for me.  Karen, my server, was nice.  The food was just okay, though.  My waffle came out barely warm, I requested extra crispy bacon but they still had chewy fat on 'em, scrambled eggs were ok.  3 stars versus 2 because the coffee was good.

If you're looking for a decent & in-eggspensive (well, at least by Vegas terms) place for breakfast, let me suggest the Egg & I. The service is very friendly and attentive. If you're looking for a nice break from The Strip, this is a good choice.

The food is decent. Not gourmet, but certainly not bad neither. There is a wide array to choose from. I particularly am fond of the omelets, which are quite tasty. The skillets are quite good also.



Oh yeah... don't pass up the Banana Nut Muffins... it's eggscellent.
A very nice surprise.  We went here because of a food network recommendation and we were not let down.  It is a basic breakfast, but very good.
Excellent breakfast love the works fruit plate!  Kiddos love it too good selection for them at a reasonable price.
If you are looking for a good food and big portions this is the place to be. Don't forget to order the banana nut muffin, it's very good. Service is okay.

Venturing off the strip in Vegas this morning was the best decision we made all weekend. In a funky Sahara strip mall lies the Egg and I. Without our love and faith in Yelp, we never would have found this place.

Nearly every table was filled on a Monday morning. Our servers name was Debra and she was prompt, friendly and very knowledgable  about the menu items. 

The menu is pretty extensive. They do just about anything you can imagine with an egg. I ordered the bacon and avo omelette and my husband had the chile relleno omelette. We ordered a side of Diabla sauce, which came warm and was the perfect compliment. Our omelettes were moist, perfectly cooked, and stuffed with fresh ingredients. The potatoes at Egg and I were nothing short of addictive. It took what little will power I had on our last morning in Vegas to push away from my plate.

We will come here for breakfast every time we are in Vegas now.

這間距離俗稱主街的拉斯維加斯大道有段距離、專賣美式餐點 的餐廳，其實是在當地相當著名且開設多間分店的。趁著某天在賭城早起的日子前來朝聖，自以為是早起的鳥兒有蟲吃，沒想到前頭排隊的人群已經滿到餐廳外了，看來美食還真是有能讓人早起不賴床的吸引力。

服務生的速度迅速態度也親切，入座後就可以感受到親切的招呼。在大份量的餐點外，這裡另外一項最出名的特色就是保證讓人看了眼花撩亂的豐富餐點種類，印製在像是「報紙」一樣的菜單中。

加入烤牛排的班尼迪克水煮蛋Eggs Benedict本身就已經是口味鮮明，再加上大量的奶油蛋黃醬汁，還有一些包括甜椒、蘑菇、波菜在內的炒青菜，是一份讓人吃完能感受到飽滿精力的餐點。

加入培根和酪梨的美式蛋捲，不但是本身就以旁大的份量著稱，搭配得馬鈴薯也是給得相當慷慨，滑嫩透香的蛋卷餅與穌中帶軟的馬鈴薯，絕對是一份讓人早餐吃完也能飽到午餐的美食。

在食評網站Yelp上打卡，還會贈送這塊外表釉黑的香蕉蛋糕，雖然外觀其貌不揚，但濃郁的香味從端上桌起就久久不散，味道也是香甜可口。

下回來到賭城，無論是早起還是尚未入眠，來杯香醇的咖啡，加上濃稠的蛋汁、滑順的酪梨、鬆軟的香蕉蛋糕，透過各種看似樸素的美式早餐元素，保證是讓人吃在嘴裡，滿足在心底。
So bomb! Got the apple walnut chicken sandwich with fries. Fries were a little over seasoned but sandwich is so good.

I visited Egg and I before heading home on a Vegas trip. Hands down the best food I had the whole trip. Maybe because breakfast is my favorite? I had The Classic with bacon- two eggs over medium, bacon, potatoes, and a banana muffin. Everything was great, but the potatoes stole the show! So super crispy and seasoned marvelously! Seriously, so good. Now I have to figure out how they made the potatoes so crispy! Definitely will visit on any future Vegas trips. The service was also top-notch. My waitress was very friendly and attentive.

This place was a big letdown. I guess b/c I had such a great experience with EGG WORKS their sister place I had put this place on such a high pedestal and they fell off... and no all the kings horses and all the kings men couldnt put this bk together again. 

ENTREE: my bf got the franciscan scramble. sounded really good and he's a professional order-er. Its amazing to watch him work. Everything he orders always comes out spectacular and the best tasting dish at the table. not me.  I had a the tostada last time and I had really wanted the cobb salad but was torn. So this time cobb salad was my only request. 
disguisting. 

COBB: I love cobb salads. This was just plain GROSS. they probably gave me 3-4 lbs of ICEBURG LETTUCE. really? iceburg? gross.  the croutons were the 99 cent croutons with the green specks on it. They gave me 1/4 of an egg... at a a place with the word EGG in it.. i was very disappointed. You'd think theyere 'd be at least a full egg? maybe 2. no.
on top of my salad was a lil bit of shredded cheese, and some deli sliced sandwich meat turkey and ham (not even cubes) and the box of sprouts sittong on top of my salad. i ordered blue cheese dressing, they brought me ranch. anything that could go wrong did. 2nd worst meal i've had in las vegas since I've lived here. 

Maybe its my fault? my fault for ordering anything that wasnt scrambled so early in the morning. I take some responsibility in that I guess. my bf's omelet was delicious. the potatoes were good.. so was his banana nut muffin.. (while my bran muffin was gross) it was just the perfect yin/yang of good vs. evil... , er mavs vs the heat, the cowboys vs the 49ers, egg works vs egg & I... and yes good food vs. bad food. 

The only reason I gave them 2stars was b/c of the bfs food was 4 stars cancelled out by my zero stars.. to equal 2. :) 
Here's hoping you gleam something from my review... please do not order a salad at egg & I.

For years, the Egg & I was our "go-to" spot to take visiting guests for breakfast. But it had been a while since we stopped in. Good to know that when we took two friends to eat there on their recent visit, nothing has changed. Same huge menu; same great service; and same fantastic seasoned potatoes!

I had the bacon and avocado omelet, and my husband had the Cincy chili omelet, both with sides of potatoes (of course!). One of our friends ordered the Country Benny, and the other had an order of potatoes with a side of brown gravy. We all left pleased and sated, and my husband and I had leftovers as well!

Everything on the menu looks fantastic, but I suggest getting an egg dish (seeing how the name of the place is "The Egg & I"!) The "Three Pigs" and the mashed potato omelets are good bets, along with all the other items mentioned above. And definitely get the seasoned potatoes. Although my husband thinks they're overseasoned, I humbly disagree. To me, they're the best in town!

Nothing like Egg and I to complete a wonderful vegas trip with my friends. I ordered the Western omelet, which was just the sustenance I needed for the drive back. Not only that but I was lucky to have such a great server this time too. Amanda is one of the best servers I've ever seen in a long time. She's friendly, efficient, and extremely courteous :). SHE'S EGGCELENT. IF YOU EVER GET HER BE EGGCITED!

Had a great experience here considering it was noon on a Sunday in a place that serves hangover food.  We were seated right away, service was attentive and friendly, and prices were decent. The menu is vast, with all the traditional breakfast options as well as some unique ones like the "crepelette" an omelet/crepe hybrid. They offer dozens of lunch items too.

I had the "Flapper" breakfast platter ($8.95) which consists of 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, and 2 sausage (your choice of pork or turkey). The eggs were perfectly cooked (I like 'em over easy). Any place that offers a turkey sausage option is awesome for me as a non pork-eater. The real star of the plate was the pancakes. They were perfection! I am usually more of a french toast/waffle person so this was a gamble for me. The pancakes were piping hot, spongy yet fluffy in texture, and really flavorful! Served with a side of hot maple syrup too.

I would highly recommend Egg & I to anyone looking to get away from the Strip for an inexpensive and tasty breakfast.
I am a local and I come here almost everyday to see my favorite people and waitress Karla.  Great place to go everyone won't be disappointed.

I gave a 5 because my server " REINA " was on POINT... First time as a family of 5 and the customer service was excellent... Our breakfast was nice and hot and we enjoyed our time here!! Thank you for being super friendly! Atmosphere was great from the time we walked in!!! We will be coming here again!! #vegaswecamehungry #anditwaslegit #thanks

This place is great on a early morning on ur day off everything is soo good even their coffee i love the southern eggs with sausage gravy its so delicious!....But is it just me n the hubby but we think the diced potatoes are soo salty !! =|  .....portions are great!, food is awsome!. fast service A+ ....ooo ya but there seems to be these young girls as host all the time i go and their face always looks like they smelled a bad odor....my thing is your the first thing i see when i walk into your establishment ...because of faithful and new patrons you are able to thrive and grow....least u could do is fake a smile for the 8 hrs of ur shift....I work in the hotel business when a guest walks into my workplace i make sure to make the guest feel welcome.....customer service 101....im just sayin biggest pet peeve ever.....If your so miserable call in and stay home.Only negative thing i have to say...but after u get by the yuck faces its all amazing from there....

PS: bin here 4 times cant say u were having a bad day.

This place was absolutely adorable : )

The service was very quick & friendly, food was reasonably priced and delicious!

I had to bring home an Egg & I mug

I didn't think that this restaurant deserved the four star rating it has for several reasons. The potatoes were basically over seasoned fried potatoes squares. My breakfast was good but overpriced for basic breakfast food. The muffin and service were the only highlights.
I love it lots of food, great service and a pot of coffee!

Huge portions, plates are enough for two. Definitely get the banana muffin as a side (comes with most entrees). Great coffee, very friendly staff. And yes, the ranch potatoes are awesome, don't substitute it with fries no matter what your kids say.

We had fresh vegetable skillet and it was great. We should have taken their suggestion for a half order. There was a plenty of food with a full order. Totally agreed with others about their hot banana nut muffin. It was so good. We went there around 11am and were seated right away. 

The place was in an old strip mall and needed some remodeling. However, the food was scrumptious. Definitely would recommend.

My wife and I found this place via Yelp and with the help of the turn by turn navigation, discovered the BEST breakfast we ever had!!  The banana nut muffin comes before the meal and it is SUPERB!!  Everything we ordered was FANTASTIC!!  The eggs (over-easy), the bacon, the link sausages, the pancakes, and of course the waffle (loaded with strawberries and whipped cream) could not get any better.  We visit Las Vegas at least 3 times a year and this time we were celebrating our 7th year anniversary.  We've done the hotel dining thing at most of the 4 & 5 star rated places and they don't even come close to being as good as the Egg & I.  We do have to thank Denny's for being so awful the morning before and that is what led us to the BEST BREAKFAST in fabulous Las Vegas.  Being from Hawaii, it was a pleasant surprise to see a "hawaiian" section in the menu.  A lot of Hawaii people visit the 9th island and we will definitely be telling our friends about this wonderful eatery on West Sahara.
Alyssa was a great server today. Cheerful and attentive.  I enjoyed the banana bread French toast, but probably would have preferred something else.  We will be back!
The best thing in this place was Raul our waiter. Nice, adaptive and always checking.

Absolutely amazing! The place was busy but we were still seated right away. We didn't have to wait at all for our food. Our banana nut muffins were so fresh they were still warm. We all got different things off of the menu and liked everything we had. Lisa was our waitress- she was very friendly, and very efficient.  We will definitely stop here again when we visit vegas!

A couple of weeks ago, I made my way back to our semi annual trade show. I got the little free booklet you get from taking shuttle from airport. I flipped through and saw this place called Egg & I and their other location Egg Works. It looked interesting and the reviews sounded good plus had coupon for one meal free with purchase of another meal. Cool..I will take my co-workers there. Big mistake! They know best known for banana nut muffin served warm with butter but it had this weird taste as if they used artificial sweetener or perhaps the blend wasn't right because it tasted like metal or whatever it just tasted awful. It was nice to give all 6 of us free banana nut muffin but my guys wouldn't touch it!

 I ordered classic eggs Benedict, my fav breakfast choice. I was excited plus the potatoes versus hash browns. The potatoes had too much of that lawry seasoning...ugh. Then worse, my hollandaise sauce was the worst thing I have ever had! They didn't properly make the sauce and then to make it worse, the whole dish was slathered in it! I literally used a spoon to scoop out the sauce just so I could eat everything else which wasn't much better but I needed to eat. Would never come back even if I was paid to do so plus I read other reviews where this place was actually busy and needed to go early, well we were there Saturday morning around 8am and it was not busy at all!

We searched to a good breakfast place here in LV. So glad we went, the Eggs Benny was delicious and their potatoes were amazing! Our waitress, Chance was wonderful! She was courteous and efficient. We will definitely come back for another yummy meal to start our day in Vegas!

Huge portions and good food, but long wait line for breakfast. We were seated rather quickly (about 20 min) considering how many parties were ahead of us (about 8)
Be prepared to be put in a food coma...
I had the sunrise omelet with chicken and could only finish half of it. The thing I liked about the omelet was that it wasn't too oily like in other omelettes I've had. Cheese was a little too much for me as well.
My friend and I split the strawberry cream cheese French toast. If you don't mind having gobs of strawberry jelly and whip cream on your French toast, this is definitely for you! The taste was spot on, but can be overwhelmingly goopy for some.
Overall, good food, good service. You definitely could feed a small family with just a couple of entrees!
Service was average at best. Taste and food quality about the same. I had to wait to be seated though so they are popular.

This was a very quaint breakfast place with excellent service. They have this cute little idea where if you need to contact the waitress, you flip a card shaped like an egg on the table to a sad face to request service. I got biscuits and gravy with potatoes, eggs and bacon. The potatoes and bacon were very good, but the biscuits were a bit too salty for my taste. The coffee is also pretty good quality. My parents got similar food; the only problem was that the food is a bit more pricey than our standards, but compared to some restaurants on the strip the price was not bad. Overall, I would come back again when I come back to Vegas for vacation.

This is a great place to try right before you leave for your drive home. Definitely off the beaten path and away from the strip. 

Went on a crowded Sunday morning.  They sat us very fast on the patio.  Our food arrived equally fast. 

I would have given it five stars, but our waitress wasn't the best.  She was bussing our table and actually did the finger wave for me to hand her my plate across the table.  I know, I know, is it really worth taking a star off? But yes! I was a waitress for years and that's just a big no no.

This is the quintessential breakfast spot. I got the corned beef & hash with eggs. & of course the banana nut muffin. Simply perfect. The place is clean & inviting. Perfect for a couple. I was alone. Maybe next time.

Like everyone else said, the banana nut muffin is a must have.

I would also like to point out the potatoes! They're seasoned to perfection and given in generous quantities.

Aside from the food, the staffs are friendly and very responsive despite the number of guests. Great overall experience, would recommend and definitely go again!

Ate here unfortunately I chew into a plastic material on my eggs, brought it to my server Alexis attention and also involve the manager. They offered another entree but I declined as I kind of kost my appetite. They gave me a whole banana cake too for the incident. Very nice and generous.

Our Server Breeannada (Bree) WAS AMAZING!

She was attentive, respectful, and a model of an excellent server. She knew her menu front to back - and it's a big menu!

The food was delicious - this was our first time here - if we lived here in Vegas we would be in here all the time! 

Next time we come out here  we will definitely be back!

Great food, Great service. This place is located not too far from the strip so if you're not driving and don't wish to take an uber you can always catch the city bus here. There is a stop right in front of the restaurant. 

We checked in and received a free muffin. It was delicious. The server even gave my friend one even though I was the o to one that checked in. I had so much food leftover. Didn't realize he portions would be so big. But it was wonderful. I will definitely be revisiting this place when I come back to Vegas.

I ordered the Sunrise Mountain and boy was it a mountain. I didn't even put a dent in to, but it was the Bomb.

Just another ordinary breakfast place.  I didn't think this place was anything special.  The restaurant is located inside a plaza.  We went on a Saturday and we got seated right away, no wait.  But as we left, there was a line and that was around 1:00pm. I love corn beef hash and so I had to try their corn beef hash.  It came with eggs and toast (can choose muffin instead of toast) and if you check in on yelp you get a free banana muffin.  Our waitress forgot ours but we didn't make a big deal about it.  Corn beef hash was shredded style and I thought it was below par.  Not the best corn beef.  The place reminded me of another Dennys. Dennys being better. The restaurant also sells merchandise and sauces at the entrance.

Came for breakfast on a Saturday morning just because its our last day in vegas and we wanted something different from the complimentary breakfast we have from our hotel.
Was surprised to see that the place is packed and hopping at such an early hour.We waited for awhile for the server to arrive to get our orders. ORder came after 15mins. The corned beef was good. Portions are generous.
would recommend.

Overall the best place you can go for a breakfast in Vegas. Their muffins and potatoes are to die for! That's actually the reason I keep going back lol. Oh and of course they're superb customer service. 

I think to run a restaurant business you need three things:
1. Great customer service 
2. Amazing food
3. Great atmosphere to enjoy that food

This well run food joint has it all covered and makes me keep going back and others as well. There is always a wait to be seated but not a long one. 

Enjoy!

Ok...so the food here is awesome! I would give it more stars if the customer service had been better; the Egg & I getting 2 stars is over the most ridiculous thing! A couple weeks ago we went there and I have been there a lot, I enjoy their food. My friend and I both ordered sandwiches; we asked to skip the bacon and bread for a healthier meal of course. We all know even though you skip stuff off the meal ordered, you end up paying full price which is fine. Well we asked if we both add avocado to both our meals in place of bread and bacon considering those items are priced higher. After going back and forth with our server who claimed it was against their policy to sub, a veggie/fruit item for a meat/bread item, she brought out the manager. The manager explained that they have two different accounts where they order meats/breads from and where they order veggies/fruit from and they could not, in fact they refused to sub it. We got over it, added the avocado and enjoyed our meal. It wasn't about having to spend the money for it, it was the principal. I bring a lot of friends and family to this place, therefore I expected them to sub it out for me because in the end, it was actually more cost effective for them. I thought it was silly and ridiculous, she actually looked slightly stupid for coming out and to explain the reasoning as to why we couldn't sub it. I actually laughed. So although the food might be at least 4 stars, their service and policies were not and I doubt it was worth it for them to do that to my friend and I earning this some-what bad review. There are a lot of great breakfast spots in Las Vegas so I will hunt down one to take people where they don't fret over silly substitutions on sandwiches. I am very open-minded and understanding; in fact I have ran a restaurant for yrs in the past and know when it is worth it to suck it up and do the substitution.

Service was egg-cellent. Sorry, couldn't resist. I ordered the house specialty: corned beef hash. Got wheat toast instead of their special banana nut muffin because I got a free muffin for checking in! That muffin was warmed and was moist & delicious. Corned beef hash came in a ceramic skillet with 2 fried eggs on top. Tasty meal, but a little in the pricey side; around $11 for the dish. However, I would definitely come back because their food quality was good and the service was egg-cellent. Shit, did it again.

Chance was an awesome server!  She had great vegetarian recommendations for me.  I ordered the 1/2 Fresh Veggie Skillet and JM had the Pork Carnitas Ranchero.  The food was great and the service was even better.  Keep up the good work and we'll see you again soon!

Great breakfast place... Banana nut muffin was great, no too sweet, just right...
Had the Spam, egg and rice which hit the spot. Spam was cut thickly which I liked...  Prices are so reasonable too. Definitely will come back....

Loved this place for breakfast off the strip!!!  Wish there was one in San Jose!  Check out the back page for the Hawaiian Portuguese and eggs.  IT was awesome!  Mom (old school Hawaiian Japanese) loved it big time with eggs and 2 scoops of rice!  Coffee and banana muffin was excellent.  We bought one to munch on the plane ride home.  Excellent friendly service.  Definitely a can't miss in Vegas!!!

There were four of us that went here for lunch/breakfast. The menu is printed as a newspaper which is cute and they have a LOT of options for food. If you haven't been here before it is worth a try but it isn't die hard must have breakfast/brunch/lunch cuisine. The menu, although extensive, had a lot of repeated ingredients that were just served differently. I'd like a smaller menu with a little more creativity. 

Their biscuits and gravy are delicious though.

All around, it's a good casual place to eat with friends and family.

Never in my life have I ever eaten a banana nut muffin that made me want to kill a unicorn so that it may get a leg up in the race of All Things Magical.

Godspeed, oh glorious muffin!
Huge portions of amazing food! Try the Banana Nut Muffin for sure! Our group had an assortment. Crepes, Sausage n Biscuits and Pancakes- all of us had the same expression "this is the best..."

My family loves this place! Everything we have had is absolutely delicious. I am always surprised at the speed of their food even when the restaurant is packed! The banana nut muffins are fantastic. Alexa was our waitress this morning and was friendly and made us feel welcome, while being super attentive and speedy. Thanks for a delicious and delightful experience! We dined at the West Sahara location
Best breakfast that I have had in a long time. The country Benny plate is really good. Karla was an excellent server. Good experience. I would go back.

I had read about this place, and really just wanted to check it out with my family. We were not disappointed! And, the place was packed...always a good sign. The food we ordered was delicious. The staff was very friendly and the service was quick and helpful., Prices were very reasonable and the portions good sized with delicious homemade flavors!  It was the best tasting skillet breakfast we ever have.
....Just a great experience all around. We definitely want to go back there again.
Our waitress DONNA was amazing. Genuine restaurant and server. All the food was fantastic and the only thing better than the food was the marketing for a cafe style restaurant. Very impressed

The place was ok...we went on a Tuesday afternoon around 12pm. We waited about 30 mins. They sat other folks who arrived after us with the same # of party. I had to go back and question the hostess, they sat us right away. We wanted to sit outside because inside of the restaurant was a Lil small and not enough ventilation. I did not want to smell like food.

Now we waited an additional 20 mins just to place an order and then another 20 mins for our food. Omg I was so hungry, when my food came out, I only took 3 bites. 

But our server Karen (I think that's her name) she was very nice and friendly. She did bring us 3 banana nut muffins which were yummy! My friend's breakfasts were much better then mind. The server also took my order off since it was not that great.

Over all, I would not have any interest in going there again.

This was a really cute brunch spot. I found it by the recommendations off Yelp. I drove by on the weekend, and boy was it packed, with even 10 or so people waiting out front! 
I ordered the steak and eggs breakfast. The steak was good, and cooked just the temperature I ordered. The eggs tasted fresh. Breakfast also came with a banana nut muffin, which I actually enjoyed! It was moist and warm. 
The potatoes were well spiced and served well with the rest of the breakfast. 
Great service! I would come back.
Thank you so much Alexa for your service you did an amazing job on serving us and being concerned on our order we hope to come back and have you as our server again.
If you are really hungry for a big breakfast, this place is the spot!  Incredible portions and the banana my muffins....OMG....the banana nut muffins...!

I just had to add in a 5 star review for this place.  AMAZING food here!  Waaay to much on the plate to eat at once, but wow, your going to get some fresh well made yummy food here.
A+
The spinach Benny +avocado..Delish! And our waitress Chance was very cool and her  menu recommendation was spot on. Great breakfast place off the strip

This place was great!  Not terribly expensive, great selection, good service and we would definitely go back.

As a note, we learned you could get half portions on most of the egg items.

Cute restaurant. I love the daily specials bc they use fresh ingredients. ABSOLUTELY get the banana nut muffin. Coffee is good. Eggs are the best, duh that's what they are famous for. Pancakes aren't that good, but that my opinion.

Great breakfast food for your typical breakfast joint. Awesome service and a lot of options. You can even get the potatoes gluten free, which was nice when with somebody who has gluten allergies. Very accommodating and nice. Highly recommend!!! We had Tamara as our waitress. It was her first day at this location and we were blown away with how great she was.
A must stop in Vegas! Love the banana nut muffin. All food is great here!

Ate here with hubby while visiting Las Vegas. They had a newspaper-like menu, which I thought was different and cute. If they ask if you want toast or banana nut muffin, choose the muffin!!! The muffin doesn't look appetizing, but boy was it delicious! I had the traditional benny. Decent portion and very satisfying. We had a really nice server, Roman, who was attentive and checked on us often to see if we were doing okay.

At the behest of a good friend (who has great taste in food), our group headed out here for breakfast.

Upon entering, I was completely taken to a different place, away from all the lights, sounds of Las Vegas.  I felt like I was almost at home. From the greeters, to the servers, service was awesome.  Served with a smile and genuine people, I was more than happy here.

And the food...oh...so tasty.  I had a prime rib skillet, which was freaking huge. I absolutely enjoyed my meal (the potatoes....SO GOOD), although I have to admit I think my friend's country steak stole the show, and I will be ordering that next time.

And there will be a next time :D
This place is s must for your Morning start.. Today we came on a Monday and it was pleasant not to have to wait a long line..although we would do it any time because it's worth it...

I came here three years ago and loved it.

I came again and fell in love again.  I had the Key Largo crepe and it was flavorful, delicious, filling and succulent.  That along with the muffins.  I wish heaven had an Egg and I.

I made a reservation for 12. My family got here first and they refused to seat us before the entire 12 people were here. They were extremely rude and I was told that the reservation will be canceled if the group didn't show up in 5 mins. I felt disrespected.

This place was packed when I went.. The food was great, I enjoyed the el Diablo potatoes, it had a nice crisp and was well seasoned. I ordered steak Benedict. Very flavorful and had some spice to it. Service was great as well..

I'm a proud Egg and I supporter, I own a bright purple Eggeriffic shirt to rep my new local breakfast jam. I wasn't always that way. I'll explain my Egg & I experience.

I wanted to run away when we pulled into the shopping center, located past that road where the palms hotel is. Its like a used car dealership wasteland on this street. That is how I found this place, while doing some car shopping all morning and finally getting so desperate for food we ventured down the road. Not somewhere you think you find a great breakfast place. Or so I thought.

You walk into what feels like a family style diner greeted by a cute older woman who reminded me of my own grandma. Always a plus.

Get seated and scope out the menu, 
lots of great options for omelets. We loved Canadian bacon or what my boyfriend likes to call bacon from Canada, ordered that. Preferred the waffles over the pancakes. (Learned that from my first trip there.) Order two orders of skillet potatoes (one for me and one for Adam.) They are literally that good. Each bite is a perfectly seasoned little bite of french fry / hash brown combination. Fruit platter with your choice of three berries. Lots of orange juice because I'm a sucker for pulp and vitamin c to start out my day. 

After 5 times here I've realized, it's really great for what it is. A alternative for some Denny's or Ihop because I'd rather support a local business owner. This place has breakfast down and I plan on eating here whenever I'm craving those skillet potatoes. Chya Boy!

Our server, Linnea, was great. Dined with my husband and another couple. Everyone loved their food. They were out of prime rib so we had to substitute steak for the prime rib Benny. Hubby and I split it and it was plenty for us to eat. I also got a free banana nut muffin which was AMAZING! Menu is diverse enough that everyone can find something to eat. Will definitely be back!!

Holy crap where do I start??? Tldr: if you're reading this, just go there as soon as you can. 

We went on a Sunday morning, for a lazy brunch and that's exactly what it was. 

The menu options are EXTENSIVE. Lots of sweet and savory options. We ordered the Brad's Scramble and Waffle with a banana nut muffin on the side. I'd read tons of reviews about the muffin so I wanted to know what the hype was all about. 

And I was BLOWN AWAY. This is one of the yummiest, tastiest muffins I've had in my life. And this set the bar really, really high for me. 

Then the waffle - with a nice layer of whipped cream and blueberries was perfect. 

Scrambled eggs were great as well. The potatoes were really excellent! Cooked perfectly and coated with the Hablo Diabla spice, not too spicy - just right. 

When we went to settle the check, there was a mixup and they charged us with someone else's bill. But they handled the situation well, and fixed the goof up very humbly. 

The staff was always nice and sweet. 

This is in stark comparison to the fancier places we dined over the weekend, where the staff was very curt and hostile at best. 

Will definitely come back, just for those muffins awww man.

Have came here several times with the family, service is always friendly and they are as fast as they can considering they are PACKED! But thats not a bad thing , food is good and portions are huge, we love coming here when we are in Vegas after a hard night of Partying the Egg and I delivers the goods!!

We were sat quickly, and served promptly by Tabatha. She was quick without rushing. The banana nut muffin really is as good as the hype. We enjoyed our prime rib benny and classic. 
We would come back during our next visit and hope for Tabatha to be our server again!

I was here a few months back for EDC weekend and I will DEFINITELY be coming back.

We barely waited at all to be seated given that it was a weekend with a lot of traffic, again due to EDC, even though we were a larger group. It was so great! I had the skillet and my husband had one of their burritos and we were full for the rest of the day!

However, the highlight of our meal was the banana nut muffin! Oh my goodness was it the best muffin I've ever had! I love this place and will be back for sure.

This place was packed when we walked in but didn't have to wait too long (for a party of 2). They sat us outside. The tables were big and they had misters, so that was cool. I checked in on yelp and got a free banana nut muffin, which was delicious! I ordered the country fried steak and my husband ordered the fiesta skillet, added chorizo to it. Both meals were served in big portions, on a hot plate, and they were delicious! Our waitress was attentive, which we really appreciated. The OJ was a little pricey ($3.25) but other than that, the prices were decent. The only reason I'm knocking off a star, is because we asked for a cup of ice to-go, (we're from CA, and planned on driving home after our meal. Wanted the ice for water on the road) and when the ice melted there was some sort of dirt in the bottom of the cup. I'm not sure if she gave us a dirty cup or if they have dirty ice. Either way, it was gross.

Ashley was such a sweet server. The service is great & the place is well kept. They have so many choices here & cater to many different likes even though it is a breakfast joint. The potatoes are greatttttttt. Love it here!
Great chile relleno omelette and the sliced avocado and cheese omelette were very good.

This place has the best breakfast in Vegas. Portions are proper and not over the top (you're not throwing half of it away but still paying for it). Oscar and the other servers are great and on top of serving you. My favorites are the cabo or santa cruz buritto. The bananna nut muffins are awesome too. They sure know how to make the 6 hour drive worth it.

Found this place on Yelp. What a great place! A big  menu, friendly staff, and great food!! My wife had the classic breakfast. Two eggs, bacon, Habla Diablo potatoes, and choice of toast or a banana nut muffin.  The waitress recommended the Works omelet - stuffed with bacon, ham, sausage, veggies and topped with cheese. Very good!!!  We even got a free muffin for checking in there on Yelp! Check this place out. It's off the strip west on Sahara Ave.

I'm leaving another review because the second time I ate here during my 4 day stay in Vegas was even better than the first! Yes I had to wait 40 minutes but oooohhh it was worth it. I had this veggie Benedict meal which was a healthy indulgence. Fresh perfectly cooked poached eggs atop of FRESH spinach, yes fresh not cooked like other places do a spinach Benedict. Then the tomato slices were grilled and with fresh avocado. Once again I subbed the fruit for the potatoes. So impressed with the array of sliced fruit. My family loved the huevos rancheros as well as the huge chocolate chip pancakes. I must mention that our server Linnea was delightful and sweet. So attentive and friendly. If you are in Vegas, you must go here.

Wow! All I can say is incredible! Karla our server was amazing and super attentive! I ordered a Michelada with the Chile Relleno omelette and they were both epically awesome! The Michelada was huge and the chile relleno omelette was sheer cheesy goodness! My fiancé ordered the stuffed French toast and looooooved it! Definitely will come back! And the banana nut muffin was so soft and delicious! Must try!

The breakfast potatoes were so good, I bought the seasoning they sell at the font counter register.

The food here is generally good, and if you do a Yelp Check In, you can get a FREE muffin (I had banana nut).

This place has better service than most places. I only ate here once and would like to try it again and again. Very friendly staff and great hospitality. Unlike places like the Big dogs draft house and Peppermill, the servers at the Egg and I are extremely on target. I didn't have to wait 20 minutes for food and got my meal within 10 minutes. This place is very awesome.

Cute family diner. I had a great experience at Egg and I. We came here around 12 which was to my benefit because I cannot stomach anything during the morning time. It was so hard to choose something from the menu...everything sounded so good! They have something for everyone. I had the the "Egg-Ceptional Omelette" with a side of country potatoes and my, was it exceptional! The omelet was loaded with sausage, diced ham, onions, tomatoes, sliced mushrooms, bacon, and cheese...and topped with sour cream. yummm! My husband had our usual...eggs benedict...and that was very delicious as well. The portions are huge! My husband eats like a beast...and I, like a man...and we still couldn't finish our food. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She came back periodically to tend to us with a huge smile on her face. Also, the food came out very fast! My tasty and fulfilling brunch definitely prepared me for a long and crazy day-night on the strip.

Yum. Great food. And really personable staff. 
Need creamer? Which kind? All of them? Sure! No problem. 
Worth the drive off the strip.

Is it just me or does the person working the register always have an attitude. went there today (12/31/15)  and the lady was treating the people in front of me rudely. Tried to do the same with me, ridiculous!



Food is very good, waitress was awesome ! But please, for the registers girl ... When someone's check is $26 even and you get money and a "thank you goodbye," for my breakfast .. please don't say "really" as I'm half way out the door! The tip is on the table for my waitress! Not you.

Really cool location, great food and service by Breeannda!

Make sure to bring some waiting time during breakfast rush hour!
Fantastic local breakfast spot. Locally-owned. Great food. Ample portions. Its sister restaurant, Egg Works is also a great breakfast spot.
Great Breakfast place. Omelette a are wonderful. Patrick our server was the best!  Try it you won't be sorry.

This is a great place for breakfast. Huge portions, great banana nut muffins, fast service. They leave a huge pot of coffee on the table. Even the glasses of water are big. We were leaving to go back home and our super-efficient waitress, Jessica, even made us waters to go.

First time here and it was delicious.  Reina was super friendly and our food was amazing. Our order came out quick and just the way we wanted. As a server myself I was very pleased with the service we received. We usually go to Babystacks but we drove past this place and we wanted to try it out. Glad we did. Super busy but we didn't wait too long for a table.

I had the Chile rellenos burrito and my boyfriend had the eggs benedict. Both were delicious! The service was great! My boyfriend made the comment hope he wished his meal came with one of the banana nut near muffins, so our waitress brought one out for him too, since it was our first time visiting the restaurant. Great food. Great service. Great experience.
Really good service by Sayra and excellent food  we had the abundance special omelette and choc chip pancakes.. Everything was so good and the service perfect.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE Breakfast. Its my favorite meal of the day and i'm glad The Egg and I did not disappoint. Cute name btw. 

I ordered the Egg's Benedict Florentine.  As soon as I read fresh spinach, poached eggs and bacon, i was sold. I'm not usually a fan of ham (since i'm sensitive to salt. Anything too salty and i wont like the food) but this canadian bacon was perfect; not too salty. Eggs were nice and runny. Hollandaise sauce was flavorful. Fruit were far and few but I can't complain. 

I checked into Foursquare and was treated to their banana nut bread/muffin. OMG it was sooo good. This is the one time i'd have to say Give me MORE muffin tops. Fresh Warm and Delicious!
Our waitress Tabatha was very lovely and helpful. the food is great. We enjoyed it a lot.
Liliana Liliana Liliana, she was awesome and not to mention the food. Awesome food, awesome taste but most of all the best service. It is a must
Always the best, hands down the best breakfast in Vegas!

Just for reference, I don't write 5 star reviews unless they're very well deserved.  But this place consistently rates high with us.  This was out third visit.  We recently visited Egg & I for breakfast with a group of six.  We arrived about 10:30 in the morning.  There was a considerable waiting line.  However, the hostess was very sweet and efficient. The estimated 20 minutes wait was actually more like 10 minutes.  Our waitress (sadly I didn't get her name) was incredible, attentive without being overbearing, quick and efficient.  Once our orders were taken, the food arrived fairly quickly, no mistakes or wrong items.  We pretty much all ordered something different.  I had the house made (not canned) corn beef hash and eggs.  Excellent.  Can't remember what everybody had but all raved about their food.
Avoid the strip with it's lines and cheesy buffets and overpriced breakfasts and check this place out.  Just a short drive from the strip.  Mostly locals and a few visitors.  A gem!

Great breakfast stop! Had the spinach Benedict really good and you can't beat a fresh warm banana nut muffin. I also tried some of the corn beef hash! Let's just say the next time I come back I'm getting that!

This is an egg-cellent choice for breakfast off the strip. Don't forget to check-in on yelp to get your free banana nut muffin! 

There were 5 of us and despite it being busy they seated us in less then 5 minutes. I had the mashed potato omelette which was delicious. Little pieces of bacon in the potatoes made the dish complete. Other people at my table were satisfied with their omelettes and loco moco.

They have a sad egg face you can display if you need service immediately, but we didn't have to use it since our waitress Genesis was on the ball. 

For 5 people to eat, grab juices and coffee it was under $80, a true bargain compared to our other meals in Vegas. 

Eat here and make your belly happy  :-)
Love the four egg omelet and the marbled rye toast. They leave the pot of coffee with you so you never run out. More food than I could eat. Service is fast and friendly. Love this place.

Solid breakfast, a local hangout.  It does have outdoor seating.  Breakfast is always good and the place always accommodates changes in the menu.  I do like it and come back again and again with my parents, who have been coming here since the 80's.  The service is always good.
Amazing and great food!!!!!! Stuffed French Toast a MUST!!!!!!!!! Wow came here from Hawaii this morning and an amazing way to start my Vegas trip!!!!!
Excellent food. Our server, Patrick was very friendly & went above & beyond to be sure we were happy.  Highly recommend.

This place has a real vibe to it. At first, the goofy murals on the walls seemed a bit overly cheery for me but after perusing the huge menu and talking a bit with our friendly waitress, a delightful pregnant English lass, i really started to get the theme. This place is all about freshness, growth, and fertility. Our waitress mentioned it and i remembered reading a review saying they always seem to have pregnant women working there. I think that's beautiful! Celebrate life, ladies!
Good service. Small pancakes were ginormous!  Little egg signs on the table to notify the server.

I love eggs. I love egg jokes. And I also love a great Eggs Benedict. 

They delivered! I ordered the Florentine out of desire for something a little more healthy. The food was great as expected, but the food alone didn't make the experience! 

Our waitress was amazing. She anticipated our needs before we even noticed something was missing (sauces even before the food came out), and even offered me a free muffin because the rest of the party had received one with their meals whereas I had not. (The banana nut muffin is amazing) 

I left feeling eggcellent!
Eggcellent breakfast. Incredible service by Amanda!  We'll definitely be back.  Ordered the Carrot Cake french toast. Yummy.

Went here twice in the same week and it was delicious! Gets really busy on weekends but the line moves pretty fast.  Service was awesome.  We got free muffins because the waitress thought the food was taking too long.  We ended up taking muffins home with us because they were so good.  Love this place for breakfast!

A group of 15 girls arrived here on a HOT Saturday morning. Half of us were hungover, half of us were starving and all of us were in a rush. We had bachelorette duties to attend to in oh about 1.5-2 hours. The place was really busy and didn't seem possible to get a large party seated and fed within our time frame. Surprisingly enough, we got seated in about 20 minutes. We got right down to ordering and in about 20 more minutes, our food was in front of us ready to be devoured. We ordered the Chicken Fried Steak, Eggs Benedict Florentine, Ultimate Skillet, French Toast and of course the Banana Nut Muffin. The portions were huge and the food was tasty. The best part of the brunch was the service. It was very friendly and fast. We got out of there with satisfied tummies and within good time. This place is definitely worth the trip off the strip.

I like coming here for the breakfast, and the service is always good:: 
Food is usually average, I just don't like Luke warm stuff but it's breakfast so I can't complain:: I'm usually to tired too  ( one eye open) .. 
I drink my 50 cups of coffee cause they give me a pot! It's usually so so:: but drinkable--
I guess I really just have to complain about the most simplest thing which is :: H2O:: 
Man does it taste like metal or is it just me?? It's horrifying water man:: beware:: 
If anyone is awake enough and feels the same would probably give you props if you say something:: 
Over all a good in the hood place for some morning grub::

Overall our experience here was probably the best on our trip. The customer service was great...almost to the point where it was annoying. 

The banana nut muffins are the best I've ever tasted and I don't even like banana nut muffins!

We got the greek style omelet and eggs benedict florentine. The EB were some of the best I've had. My omelet was good, but I should have ordered the everything omelet as our server suggested. The home potatoes were very good also.

You can tell this is one of the places that Las Vegas locals go too. I'm realizing sometimes the further off the strip you go, the better.

This is now on my top 3 breakfast places...

The service is very friendly, the menu is huge, and the food is massive, but that's kind of it. We ordered a variety of food (mashed potato stuffed omelette, chili over hash, and french toast), and it was all huge and heavy. The banana muffin that comes with everything was delicious but very sweet and oily. It's a lot like Cheesecake Factory meets Vegas breakfast dinner. I would recommend "eat." far more for a place with stunningly delicious food.
Great place for Sunday brunch.  Good food, fast service. The banana nut bread is delicious. It's busy but they move quickly so the wait isn't that long.

We are from CA and found this place based on YELP responses. We visit this restaurant every time we come to Vegas. Service and food were both great (once again). My aunt and I shared the huevos rancheros while my mom had turkey bacon and eggs. Kudos to Amanda, our waitress for exceptional friendly service and with a smile. Great place to have breakfast.

No strip fans, so we tried Egg & I out. 
Very friendly people inside, huge portions (which we don't like, sorry !) and a very good taste. The guacamole was - unfortunately - not good at all.
Regular coffee was very good.
We will come back to try out something else.
yelp comes through again, banana bread is awesome service is great oh and don't forget the breakfast

In a city full of great breakfast places, the Egg & I is definitely one of them. Seriously, though, it's very good. And relatively cheap. Very unpretentious. And the banana nut muffins are amazing. Our server, Amanda, was the best! Very friendly and attentive and never once rushed us even though we took our sweet time. 

If you can make it off the strip, this place is definitely worth it.

This place was just ok. It's not worth the trip off the strip. I do like that they give you your own carafe of coffee. Much appreciated after a night imbibing in vegas. 
Unfortunately the food was nothing special. I got the egg, ham and cheese croissant they brought it late because they had accidently made it with bacon instead of ham but it was still disappointing. it just wasn't very flavorful. They have better ham and cheese croissants at Dunkin Donuts.

My husband was also disappointed with his eggs benedict. The hollandaise sauce was good but the benedict was drenched in it. Moderation people!!

Came to Egg & I for lunch, was seated promptly and the server Partick was extremely informative and told us about their service system. Sat outside where the water misters were spraying to keep the atmosphere cool in the Vegas heat. Food came within 15 minutes for a group of 6 and food was delicious. Will be back again !

What's with the hype of this place???!
My dad and I came by, early in the morning, on our way to Salt Lake City. The place was dead, but we waited about 6 minutes to be seated. We sat down, received our complimentary banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp and drank some coffee. I kid you not, the coffee tasted like beef broth. It was gross. The banana nut muffin wasn't really anything special, but hey, it was free!
I ordered the veggie works eggs benny which saved Egg & I from a 2 star. It was really good, but I was expecting a lot from the outstanding reviews on Yelp.  My dad said his breakfast was "ehh." 
We paid our bill then headed to SLC. 
I can assure you I won't stop here again on my future routes to Utah.

Great breakfast stop! The most delicious banana nut muffin I have ever had the pleasure of eating! I have to agree with some of the other reviewers who suggest that when dining here with company it would be wise to split dishes as the portion sizes are very generous! I ordered the Hobo scramble which was a special and not available on the regular menu. I am sucker for a scramble however the superior quality of the muffin has convinced me to sample the sweeter items (waffles) on the menu the next time I visit this place. Lots of people rave about the potatoes and I have to say that they were not what I personally am looking for in a potato. They are covered in seasoning and I just prefer a simpler potato flavor. The coffee was great and I cannot say that about many places! Here it is a good strength with a good flavor and it comes in cute mug with two happy eggs on it! Probably my favorite thing about this place is the little egg sign at your table that you can flip from happy to sad when you are in need of something. It beats having to pay close attention to flag down your waiter whenever they walk by. On our visit we didn't even have to use it because the service was so good!
The food was delicious . Yet the service was mediocre. Had to ask for utensils , napkins, etc. They weren't even busy, yet it was difficult to get the waiter's attention.

The reviews on this place really set the bar high for me.   I was slightly disappointed.  The food is good diner food, but the reviews set me up for something else.  The service was fine and the best part of my meal was the thermos of coffee placed on the table next to me.  Low maintenance food that probably tastes great after a night out on the town...

Great place! I "Yelped" breakfast places on the strip because I had already eaten at the Hash House. This place came up so we stopped by it before we headed home. I am so glad we did. When we pulled in there was a line of people outside waiting. Despite the line we only waited 10-15 minutes to be seated. The menu was bigger than I thought. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs. I didn't take a picture of it normally because I was 3 or 4 bites deep before I realized I didn't take a picture. The portions were large and the food came out fast. The wifey said she loved the banana muffin. I didn't get it. I can't give an honest opinion about the muffin because I don't enjoy muffins. Back to the portions, they were so huge this chubby boy couldn't finish it. The potatoes were seasoned just right and not overly covered in seasoning. I am picky about my gravy and it compares well with my aunts gravy. This place is a no fluff breakfast joint. Highly recommended!
Amazing and contains a really creative menu.

Third time is the charm. We love love love this place. Servers and waiters are super friendly. Tamara especially sweet and nice . She gave us two banana muffins for checkin on yelp. Foods are super comfy and feels like grandma's cooking. We will keep coming back for more for sure.

5 stars for the BOMB homemade banana nut bread.... SOOOO good.  yes, sooooo good.  so good that I ended up buying a loaf and bringing it home as a gift to the guy who eats like cookie monster (doesn't eat only cookies like him, but devours food like him)!!!

All the other breakfast foods are good, eggs are cooked to perfection, clean restaurant, fast service - what more could you ask for?!?!

I find myself reading another review about this place I didn't know that I've been to so many locations but if you haven't read my previous reviews then all I can say is go here because it is phenomenal 5 stars awesome service amazing food great price go to this place to do it now
So completely awesome. Love the table service interactives. Makes things so easy. The food was delicious with great portion sizes.

I never expected these kind of breakfast to be any more special than other breakfast shop, but their food is just extraordinarily tasty. I like their egg work newspaper. Very creative and cute, Remember to order their omelet, super awesome!

Had brunch with my daughter there on Sunday after church. They were full of customers and was very pleased at how fast we were seated. The food is very good, served hot with large portions. The sever Linnea was prompt and friendly. Great   overall experience !!
Great breakfast food and excellent service.  I had the Veggi Bennie with hollandaise on the side . It was delicious. Wasn't planning on eating the potatoes but couldn't help myself.

FYI: While this offer lasts, check-in for a free Banana Nut Muffin, you will not regret it! 

What a gem to have in Las Vegas, definitely one of the best breakfast spots I've ever had. After looking up a few places, ie. Denny's, Hash House a Go Go, we decided to come here even though it's off the strip. We took a Lyft from Venetian and the ride was only $11. 

With a party of 10, we thought that the wait would be around an hour, hour and a half, but amazingly, it was only thirty minutes. If you are coming here though, expect a long wait, so be patient, but it's worth the wait! Once we got seated, they handed us menus which looks like a daily newspaper. Deciding what to eat here was probably one of the hardest decisions I've had to make since there are 8 pages of food to read. Took a while but I finally decided on the Santa Cruz Skillet. 

Santa Cruz Skillet: The order came with toast and butter (since I got the muffin with the check-in) and sunny-side up eggs. The potatoes, chorizo, Santa Cruz sauce and the runny yolk was probably the best breakfast you could ask for after a night of drinking. Portion-wise, you could easily share this with another person but I was able to finish it on my own. 

Service was amazing throughout the meal, they have a system where you flip the happy egg to a sad egg whenever you need something, genius! I would have subtracted a star for them bringing out the 2 Bloody Mary's and Michelada after we almost finished the food, but they didn't charge us for the drinks in the end. On top of that, 7 of us checked-in for the free Banana Nut Muffin. I can't stress this enough, don't forget to check in! Will be back here for sure to try the other items on the menu. 

Beware: You will get a food coma after eating here, we all ended up taking a nap in the room afterwards, but once again, soo worth it!

I went to The Egg & I after a night of debauchery in Las Vegas (recovery breakfast) and I have zero regrets. I was excited to pull up and see roughly 40 ppl waiting outside as that generally means deliciousness awairs. After a 20 minute wait,  my friend and I were sat in Amanda's section. Amanda was a very knowledgeable, amiable and capable waitress. She got our orders correct and our food came out promptly. 

Speaking of food, I ordered the mashed potato omelette and my friend got the chicken fried steak skillet. Whoever though about putting garlic mash inside of a bacon omelette is a genius. Either that or they have grandmothers chained up in the back putting elbows and feet in the food. Absolutely amazing!! Will definitely come back when in the LV area.

Breakfast served by Karla. Crazy Chicken Omelette and  Huevos Rancheros with carnitas. Very good! The carnitas could stand on their own in taste, but nicely accompanied by an egg and, of course, their signature seasoned potatoes. Mmm, mmm! The Crazy Chicken is good for protein lovers, with a devilish addition of guacamole and cheese. Very good in a less spicy way. Exactly what I was in the mood for! Karla, our server always came with a smile and warm attitude. This is our go-to place and the food and service once again didn't disappoint.

The food was honestly just okay and bit over hyped in my opinion, especially for the wait. The prices were great though so I really can't complain. Its a short distance away from the strip, so if you want something that feels more normal and less vegas like this is your spot!

This place is awesom. It's a breakfast place with a southwest twist on the flavor for most dishes. My favorite is the country fried skillet. Price is a bit high but you get a ton of food. 

The service is always good. Never an empty cup. Worth the wait if there is one.

My first visit here. I would definitely come back and eat here. They have friendly staff. Really good food. I had the prime rib Benedict Eggs - delicious. My wife had the biscuits and gravy - she loved them. My daughter ate the Cordon Bleu skillet and enjoyed it. To anyone traveling with their dogs. They have a pet friendly patio.

Our server Staci was awesome, and made us feel cared for as guests.  I appreciated that she asked whether we wanted full amount of cheese on the omelette or butter on the toast, as it's nice to be made aware of some healthier changes to the food when dining in Vegas.  I took one star off for the potatoes that were too salty to eat, but otherwise everything else was great.  I had the veggie omelette with added avocado and banana nut muffin.

This place is delicious. I'm sure everyone who knows this place knows this already.  The banana but muffins are awesome.  But I'm mostly writing about our server Amanda.  A young and friendly face that made our experience above expectation.  Her kind and always helpful manner left us in a good mood and ready to enjoy our day after breakfast.  Never in my life have I ever had such a positive server.  She really made our day.  For that I wanted to leave this review.  So if you're ever in town and want a great breakfast, come to the Egg and I and definitely ask for Amanda.
The food was AMAZING - and Liza had the best customer service - we will be back...!!!

Just your average breakfast diner.  I saw Rachel Ray talk about the place on her Tasty Travels show and I thought I'd give it a try and get out of my "usual" Vegas routine.  But after going to three Rachel Ray recommended places (Vegas, LA, and Denver), I think I'm done trusting her judgment!

We went on a rainy, Saturday morning around 10:30 and had to wait maybe 15 minutes in a small waiting area which was crowded w/ folks trying to avoid the cold rain.

When we were seated I already knew what we were going to order b/c I had Yelped the place and read their menu online.  I ordered the Ultimate Skillet for the b/f (he likes breakfast skillets), and the large Cashew Blueberry Pancake for myself.  

We had the "famous" banana nut muffin as our bread choice with the skillet, and let me just say, it was a regular ol' banana nut muffin.  I was gonna buy a whole loaf if it turned out to be good, but really, it was nothing to write home about.  Very average.

The b/f noted that the skillet was made up mostly of their potatoes (another thing that ppl rave about).  I hardly got any of the other ingredients in there so I was disappointed in the skillet, too.

The pancake was alright.  It *WAS* big, as others have commented, but again, no big deal.  It was served with blueberry compote and I thought that helped b/c it tasted sorta dry.  The b/f thought some of the pancake was undercooked b/c he could taste the batter.  Maybe I should've gone w/ the silver dollar sized pancakes?

Also, I think cashews don't really work w/ pancakes (unlike walnuts and macadamia nuts).

The "large" 12-oz glass of OJ was pretty small so the b/f thought it was funny they would call it a "large."

Breakfast with tip was around $25 I think.  Not cheap for what you get.

I think I'll make Dunkin Donuts my new Vegas breakfast routine whenever I'm in town again.

First, no cream for my coffee. They didn't ask or bring. Checked menu on line before we went, but this location did not have the crabcake benny. My daughter ordered a coke, they brought diet. Yuck! Food came but no forks to eat it with. I got the veggie Benny. Too much lemon in the hollandaise. Probably would have been great with the crabcakes. My daughter got the buttermilk pancakes. Chewy?  And they said that can happen when you add syrup. Really? Doesn't happen at I HOP. The manager was very concerned we didn't like our meal and took off the pancakes since they weren't eaten. The only reason I gave 2 stars. We did have 2 servers, and the 2nd was better,  but I won't be back.
Our server Lannea made a few great suggestions that hit the spot! Fast service and the best omelet I ever had. Next time in Vegas we'll be coming back.
Karla is the best server who deserved a trip to Disney!!! Eggs are the best in town!!!

I am very please with this place. I ordered the chile relleno omelette & I could not believe how delicious it was. A lot of places take a wack at Mexican which usually ends up tasting like nothing more than Pace picante tossed on top; not this plate! I can't call it authentic but it's pretty close! We also tried the chicken fried steak & eggs, yummy!! It was nice to sit Outside on their patio and enjoy the Day I'll be back!

It was a Thursday morning and our second day in Las Vegas. I have not had any GOOD food yet! (Mad Greek and the Rio Buffet were pretty bad from Day 1).

My husband told me that he used to eat here with his grandparents when they lived in Vegas. It's located in an older plaza and from the outside did not look busy.  We arrived around 9:00AM and it was pretty packed inside, but we were seated at a table right away.  I ordered the Sundance Special (veggie omelette with spinach, mushrooms, artichoke hearts folded with Swiss cheese and a special Works artichoke cheese filling, topped with Feta cheese and fresh tomatoes). I also got potatoes and a banana nut muffin. 

Our server was really nice. The food was so good! Honestly, the best veggie omelet I've ever tried. The banana nut muffin was also a delicious treat and so moist.

My husband did good bringing me here to make up for the awful food we had the day before LOL. Thumbs up.  :)

I'd definitely come here again when we are in the area.

105/100 Reviews for 2016
My favorite place to visit when on vacation in Vegas. The food is delicious and service is great! Tamara is a really great she's super nice and always on top of things!

First things first, I have to recognize our server, Amanda. She was, by far, the best server I've ever had. I'll be asking for her section next time we come here. My husband and I decided to come here, last minute, after seeing a picture of their Grandma's Biscuits and Gravy on google. While neither of us ordered that specific dish, we did order some delicious meals. My husband ordered the Original Breakfast Burrito which was absolutely amazing. I ordered the Chicken Enchilada Skillet. Oh my goodness... SO GOOD! I already can't wait for our next visit to Egg & I!!!
