Great breakfast here the first time we ate at here, but the second time seemed like the staff was either overworked or very inexperienced.  Our table of 10 didn't have a waitress at it for 10-15 minutes, the food was good though, albeit it that too came out extremely slow.  Overall it was a good experience, but we'll see the if we come here a third time or not...

This is always a must on trips to Vegas.  Food is amazing, portions are huge and prices are reasonable. Our server, Raul, on this visit was great, and very attentive.  Why waste your time on the strip?

Still great all these years after the Rachel Ray review. I ventured to the Hawaiian section at the back of the menu. The Portuguese sausage with eggs, sticky rice, and a banana nut muffin (of course!) was delish. The sausage was juicy and well grilled. It's a great off-the-strip brunch spot.

...and I'm writing this at the restaurant using their free wifi!

Mr. Egg. Mrs. Egg. And Egg Kiddies are all here.
Yeah theres usually always a Wait  Line. Foodies who Really Really Really LOVES Breakfast needs to Eat Elsewheres. To ever relieve Egg and I constant Lines.

Look around if you Eat here. Everyone is always A Smiling. Is it the Huge Delish to Max Bannnnnnana Muffins??????? Ans before you buy a Dozen, do Yelp checkin for one free. Hope all family members have Yelp App.

Egg and I have won like 20 awards.


Myself.... prefer Hash browns rather than seasoned potatoes! Too salty for my taste. Other with us liked the Biscuit Gravey... I had much better. More Flavorful. Less Salty. My bacon was soft and oily.

This my second time over the years. 3 stars total both times. OJ, Muffin 5 stars. My selections choice could have been better.


Place here always packed AM. 30 minutes wait

This local Nevada chain offers a wide range of specialities from Hawaiian local dishes to the standard breakfast foods. The food here is focused on wholesome, comfort food that appeals to the masses. The Egg and I is a great spot for families, brunch dates, and even pet-friendly. Customer satisfaction is a number one priority, which doesn't offset how great the food tastes. You need to try this place when visiting Las Vegas, which is only 10 min off the strip.

What an off-strip gem!

Hubby and I stopped in here after a couple of days on the strip and it was just what the doctor ordered. 

Him: Corned beef hash with two eggs over medium and Hablo Diabla "works" potatoes. So freaking delish.

Me: Breakfast burrito sub turkey sausage for bacon (because I'm watching my waist line... *crickets*). Heaven. 

Although everything we had was delicious, what really made a mark was the homemade salsa they served and the Hablo Diabla seasoning they use. So delicious and one of a kind. One of a kind is hard to find these days with so many restaurants out there in competition but these guys really do have something special.

Service was prompt and cheery. 

As we drove away to head back to SD, we promised that the Egg-and-I will be a ritual breakfast spot when we're in town.
Best breakfast in Vegas! Lindsey was phenomenal! Made awesome recommendations. Service was great. Please open one in loma Linda California!!!
Great food!  Great service!  Liliana was also great!  I'd come back with my wife any day!

Not sure what all the high reviews on this place is about. This is your standard ordinary breakfast place. The service is excellent, very friendly and nice waitresses. The menu is great, lots of variety to choose from. But the food was just average. I was really disappointed in my bacon and avocado omelette. I thought they seriously forgot to add the bacon. I dug through the omelette for it and finally saw tiny small crumbles of it in there. The egg was thick and dry and the only good thing about it was the avocado chunks inside. Big pieces of avocado. That's IT.  The potatoes it came with were not good. Just deep fried potatoes. The side of fruit was much better. The corned beef hash was mushy and had a lot of potatoes. Was disappointed in that too. Why the heck all the stars, yelpers?? 
Ok ok, the muffin was probably the best part. They give you choice of toast or muffin. Get the muffin!
Really really good savory stuffed french toast. Very good service too! My mum loved her omelette, and she's a fussy critic. I will definitely stop here again the next time I'm in Vegas.
We ordered Works Skillet, Traditional Benny, and the strawberry stuffed toast. All orders come with a large portion, and the most important is: they are very very yummy! Best Breakfast in Vegas!

Great breakfast food and excellent service from Rea!

Food came out quickly and was perfect. 

We'll be back next time we're on Vegas.

LOVE THIS PLACE! I think I have found my new favorite breakfast place. Move over, Hash House!

I've been wanting to go here for a long time and was so happy that my friend's house is only a few blocks away! I got our food to go since we had to start driving back home to LA and it only took 10 minutes. 

I ordered the bacon avocado and cheese omelette. Yum! The ranch potatoes on the side were effing awesome. The seasoning had just the right amount of kick to it. I gobbled everything up. You get to choose between toast and the banana nut muffin so of course I got the muffin. Holy moly! Delicious! It was so soft and moist I could have eaten 5 more. I wish I got some to go. I don't even like bananas!

Joe got Kay's special which has spinach, swiss, artichoke. It was pretty good but I liked my ABC better. :)

Get the orange juice. So good! Just the right amount of pulp, sweetness, and tartness.
Not too shabby. Only complaint I have is the wait, it's rather insane. The food is excellent, I recommend the Veggie Benny for any vegetarians. Their potatoes rule!!!
My wife and I ate here twice on our recent trip to Las Vegas. The food is very very good! Service was good, and friendly. The prices aren't bad either. I wish we had one where we live.
Nice brunch spot with solid skillets. Coffee is meh, but the food is really good, incl the banana nut muffins.

Went for breakfast with my family of 5 after reading some great reviews online!  The reviews were spot on! This place was great- we were seated right away and ordered right away..  The breakfasts were huge, I got the chicken omelette it was really tasty, a bit too many of the mini potatoes, would have been better to have more omelette but still plenty of food.  One of my kids got the chocolate chip pancakes and they were great!.  Also they had something for everyone, our youngest only wanted chicken fingers and French fries at 8:30am and they had it available.. My wife had the rancho scramble and it was amazing!  This place lived up to its billing on the Internet, best breakfast we had in 3 days in Vegas!

Just got here been going here all my life so good it's always amazing nothing here is bad it's all great and the staff are cool but they get busy and I mean busy like line out the doorbut the shit is good lmao
Amazing! The food was great and the service was awesome! Banana nut muffins!!!! It seems they get really busy Friday-Sunday so make sure you give yourself enough time. I will for sure be going back!

I love brunch and there are wonderful savory and sweet options!

This place gets packed and for very good reason! The line is always out the door. But, the line moves quickly and is worth the wait.

Tip: Not conveniently on the strip, but I would head there on the way to Vegas or when you are heading back home.

Everything we tried was really good, so I don't feel like you can go wrong! Perhaps share entrees so you can try more of all the goods.

When they have a 30 minute wait at 9am on a Thursday, they must be doing something right.  I got one of the skillets with chorizo.  I honestly don't remember which one because I was in a food coma when I left.  I will for sure get comatose there again soon I hope.

Had a late breakfast here with friends during Wizard World Las Vegas in April 2015, and left a very full and happy man. Everyone at our table, from the carnivorous 12 year-old with his eggs-and-bacon with a side of bacon to my health-conscious friend with her fruit and egg whites to my own delightful blueberry pancakes was very happy and satisfied with our food. I only wish they had one of these in my hometown - I'd breakfast there often.

Big thanks to our server, Carole Ann (I believe I have the name right). She was friendly, served with a big smile, gave us some good Vegas tips, and made sure our coffee/tea was always full. You can't ask for much more.

Absolutely delicious.  Our server, Genisis, was wonderful & even took good care or our dog while we dined on the outdoor patio.  I highly recommend the omelettes, pancakes, & potatoes.  The banana nut muffin was warm & soft, crispy on the outside, & so good that we ordered a third one!  Much better than the high-priced bland Casino breakfasts.  Worth every penny!
I have one word: Karla!! This was my first time visiting and it will now become a staple when in Vegas!  The food was GREAT (the banana nut muffins!!) And Karla took the cake!

Kept hearing about this place so my wife and I came in for omelettes. They have so much more! Everything was great especially Liza our server. Friendly and attentive, never had an empty glass. New breakfast spot when visiting Vegas.

The Spinach Eggs Benny and the cream cheese stuffed toast were so delicious.  Definitely a great place.  Not only the best breakfast place in Las Vegas, but the best I have been to in a while anywhere.  Hopefully you get a sweet lady named Karla.  She is a fantastic server.
The eggsperience was eggsactly what I had hoped for.  I had an eggsempalry server "Genesis" who I would love to see win the Disney trip!  Eggselent service and a great menu!

Ordered porkchop center cut and it was tender and tasty. Banana nut french toast is the bomb and so is the banana nut muffin. Kudos to Troyce for an excellent service. She even helped cut the food of an elderly customer seated close to us and assured him she would cut his food anytime he comes in. 2 thumbs up to Troyce!

Our server Tamara gets 5 stars but the potatoes that came on the side of my veggie Benny were salty so 4 stars for that. Tamara was attentive and very sweet. I substituted the English muffin with croissant and it was good! It costs extra but that's fine. Our wait was about 15 min, not too bad on a Sunday morning. The eggs on the dish were poached perfectly and the hollandaise was delicious!

Decided to give this place a try during our Vegas stay and its actually really good! The banana nut french toast was amazing!!!! Great presentation and delicious!! Our server Alexa was very friendly and attentive! Would come back if I wasn't leaving tonight!

The breakfast game in this city is no joke. After looking at the reviews I had to check this place out. The menu is lengthy with so many omelets, classic dishes and so much more.

The service is friendly, like most locals spots in Las Vegas. despite showing up on a Sunday Morning at 10:30 our wait for a party of 5 was only 20 min. The server was with us quickly and the food hit the table shortly after that. they have a ton of televisions around the main dinner so you can catch the get as you grab brunch. 

The pork chops were good, as we're the potatoes and eggs. I would say I've had better, and like I said up top, breakfast in this city is no joke. if not for the limited wait despite the busy morning and the amazing service I'd probably be dropping a star on the Egg & I. 

side note, they sell the hot sauce they have on the table. The hot sauce is great.

The best thing about Egg & I is the seasoning that they put on their potatoes!  It's fantastic!  Large portions, and otherwise pretty tasty breakfast food.  I love that they give you the whole carafe of coffee!

I know "what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" but this place is too damn good not to mention !

So, what so "EGGsellent" about this place?? 
- Friendly Service
- Large portions 
- Big Menu
- Free parking
- Quick service

The list can go on and on cuz this place is so "Egg-mazing!!!" However, let me tell you one thing you must order is the "Banana Nut Muffin". Order one or a dozen to go, TRUST ME!

Though the place is a bit off the strip but it is totally worth the drive, TOTALLY!

Excellent stop. You Yelpers steered us right again!! Very clean, country appointed, quick friendly service....what else do you need??

Had the hash with eggs with shredded cheese and onions. Wife had the egg sandwich on ciabatta brad....both excellent. Banana nut muffin also good.

Not a fan of the diablo potatoes. For as fresh as this place is... Taking a short cut and using food service potatoes....would have thought better..but not enough to drip a star!!  

Thanks Jessica...great job!!

Yelp did not fail us on this one! The food and service was awesome! The whole restaurant was packed but we only had to wait for about 10mins until we were seated. Everyone at our table ordered something different and they were all delicious. 

I'm very satisfied with their service! Although it was super busy, our server Ashley picked up on things we were mumbling to ourselves, thinking she would ignore us like any other server would on a busy day but she didn't, and got our request right away, which was nice. 

I got the Sunrise Mountain which was eggs, cheese, a choice of meat on top of a fluffy croissant. Served with their delicious seasoned potato bits! Yum! Definitely recommend this one if you love cheese an eggs! It is also a very reasonable price and perfect portions.

I'm definitely going to return for breakfast when I'm in Vegas!
The portions are huge, the food is delicious! Alexa was a very helpful and friendly server. Great place to eat well and pay less off strip!

VERY MISLED by Yelpers here. No accounting for taste....

We had the tuna melt, the Sundance Special, and the flavored coffee (partner's idea). The Sundance Special, a veggie omelet with thought behind it, was actually pretty yummy (artichoke, feta, spinach...great flavors), but the potatoes that come with were pretty yucky. Just cubed potatoes that are overly seasoned and taste previously frozen, not that fresh.

The tuna melt was the WORST I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE. SOOOOO BAD! The "cheese" looked like a non-melting version of Velveeta. I'm not sure it was real. I had to scrape it off; it was disgusting. Also the tuna salad part was the worst tuna salad ever. It was a mushy, wet, flavorless glob of mayonnaise mess. The Parmesan bread it comes on is super-salty. The matchstick fries it comes with don't taste that fresh and are overly spiced.

I picked the sandwich to pieces, and most pieces remained on my plate. I ate my partner's Sundance Special, because Vegas portion sizes allow for that. The server didn't even bother to ask how our food was, just slapped the check down and didn't comment that I had barely touched my plate.

The flavored coffee (hazelnut) is really gross. Bad idea to order it, but it tastes like the bad idea it is--overly sweet with its sweetness covering up that burnt taste that most diner coffee has.

This is the kind of place that automatically brings straws with water and gives you styrofoam for your leftovers.

I absolutely LOVED this place and would recommend it to anyone staying in Vegas! We had a group of 6 and the wait was fairly short. The food was amazing and our server Tamara was great! Our drinks stayed full and she made some great recommendations! We will definitely making this place a part of our Vegas tradition!

Our service from Alyssa was awesome! Our food was delicious.  The California club was amazing and cajun fries hit the spot. Alyssa also started us off with the banana nut muffins that really hit the spot. Great service and excellent food. Highly recommend!

Great potatoes an great omelette , they actually use four eggs for their omelettes that's a lot of eggs!! I don't know if it is by luck or chance but we actually saw a bodybuilder named Dexter Jackson and also Jim manion. Must b the portions ! Would come back again . Sitting in the patio when it's great weather is so nice. I would recommend waiting for a patio seat.

Everything is good here.
Go here everytime im at vegas because it's cheap and delicious.

I've had the avocado sour cream omelette and the country fried steak skillet.
Both are amazing


service is good as well

I've been to almost all five of the locations of "THE EGG & I" throughout the years. Mainly the one on eastern and sunset growing up. Today's late breakfast was the best service hands down. Earl was our server and I did double check the name since I suck at remembering. Me and a friend came to catch up on things and I recently recruited her to Yelp and had her check in. With the check in we each got the banana nut muffin. Which was a 5 out of 5 Yelp star rating. For breakfast I always stick to the basics so I usually always order "the classic". Which comes with eggs, one choice of meat (bacon, sausage and I must note each come in turkey too), potatoes & toast. My friend got the "Country Benny" which she was very pleased with. Earl checked on our table throughout our whole visit. Also, if you've been to any of the chain restaurants then you know they have this egg shaped smiley face that you can flip to a sad face to grab anyone's attention for service. Needless to say, we didn't have to use it. Oh and Earl kindly offered me each type of creamer they had for my coffee! So for the first time there I didn't have to have plan old half & half. 

To top it off they gave us a military discount for my friends portion of the bill! They actually check ID with your credit cards too here!!! #WINNING

Thanks for the hospitality Earl!

The place is very homey and cozy. There was a slight wait but not too bad. The menu is almost endless. Settled on the stuffed French toast and butterscotch pancakes which where the best pancakes I've ever had. Our server Amanda was awesome and very helpful. Definitely would recommend this place if you happen to be in Vegas.

The food was delicious! I had the original breakfast burrito! It came with a delicious side of home style potatoes which were seasoned perfectly and had a side of salsa, which also tasted amazing! 
The other entree ordered at the table was the chicken enchilada omelette which was also delicious! So the food is a big part of dining out, but then there's service which we all know can make or break an experience ...

Amanda was incredible! She was polite, friendly, and fast without being pushy! She encouraged us to take our time and when we were not quite sure what to order she offered recommendations which we definitely took and did not regret! The cinnamon roll and banana muffin were also DELICIOUS! 

An elderly impatient man sat himself behind us and after only a minute of being sat was incredibly rude and calling out for a waitress and coffee (despite not waiting to be sat by the hostesses). Amanda was calm and very polite when she greeted him which I can tell you, takes a lot when you aren't being treated with respect! 

So with food and service being on point, I'd have to say this place is a hit and worth traveling off the strip for while in the area! I'll definitely be back and recommend it to friends! Thanks again staff and especially Amanda!
This restaurant was the bomb. Amazing customer service on top of speedy and delicious food.

I would definitely come back here the next time I am in Vegas! The breakfast was great and our server Amanda was just as great! Nothing better then good food and service.  I am not a big muffin person but the banana nut muffin is a must try!
Best breakfast place in Las Vegas. I ordered the works skillet which was really good & the banana muffin is a must.

Awesome breakfast place!   Went here twice-  steak & eggs first trip, Italian skillet on second.   Perfect banana nut muffins, coffee off the scale good.    Great service.   A bit of a wait sometimes but soooooo worth it!

Infinite menu . Besides they'll make anything you want if they have the ingredients in the kitchen . I usually get a waffle with strawberries and whipped cream, sausages and scrambled eggs with cheese and bacon oh and the house potatoes you can't forget about those  . They have something for every taste guaranteed

The food was very nice,  nothing out of the ordinary but huge portions and good. However, the lines were long. We only waited 10 minutes though.  

What I did not get was why they did not seat more People outside as there were hardly anyone sitting there..

Every time we come to Vegas we make a point of going to Egg Works. This time we tried the Egg & I we were not disappointed. It is the best breakfast in Vegas! I had the Skillet with Bacon. Jim had the works Skillet. Our waitress Tabatha made sure the eggs were done perfectly she was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. The muffins are fantastic we get ours to go since you get so much food. If you want a marvelous breakfast at a good price with great service this is the place to go!!!
I had the breakfast burrito it was wonderful. .. super big I can never finish all my food here very large portions!  Great service every time I come in.. my kids and hubby love this place as well !

I love the egg and eye it's a fantastic place to just drop in anytime for a little bit of breakfast section they have a plenty of stuff to eat variety of choices and daily specials. They also have a selection of hot sauce is on the checkout at home when you can't make it in to the restaurant.

Never fails... I walk in and am greeted with smiles. I ask for my fav server CHANCE! She is truly an asset! She giggles because I know its a huge menu but the skillets are to die for and she knows what i want every time. What a great memory! Thanks girl!1
Amanda was our server.  Her smile is congatious and her service is exceptional.   Food is fantastic too.  Great way to start the day!!!

We came here based on the great Yelp reviews, and this place did not disappoint!
If you're looking for a big filling breakfast, this is the place.
The staff was friendly and our server was attentive and a total sweetheart.
The food is awesome! I ordered the egg-ceptional omelet which was huge and stuffed full of toppings and had the ranch potatoes as my side. It wasnt greasy or oily which was such a bonus, since you never know with a new breakfast place. The portions are big so I'd recomend coming hungry or sharing.
Great breakfast, reasonable price, great service and we were able to watch the football games.

To start off, this place has been on my list of stuff to try for a couple of months solely based on the name.. and after reading through the rave yelp reviews my expectations for the quality of food slowly started to grow. 

I planned to head back to socal early this morning and wanted to be the first one in the restaurant. I arrived at around 5:45 am and fidgeted in my rental car while checking the "closed sign." Suddenly another car pulled up next to me, the driver walked out and headed straight into the restaurant - the sign was magically on Open. Wtf... 

The hostess/waitress was so friendly (and at the buttcrack of dawn thats pretty impressive) that I think this partly made me enjoy not only the food but much of the rest of my day.

The front lobby is decorated with articles and reviews AND pictures of eggs in action shots which I found pretty amusing (sometimes it doesnt take much) but the main eating area is pretty diner-y so I kind of zoned out till the food arrived. Ordered the fender bender egg crepe with avocado and sprouts and something else in it and it came out surrounded by a mountain of delicious seasoned potatoes and the softest, freshest muffin i've ever had. The egg crepe is in a league of its own compared with any kind of omelet you can get at IHOP or denny's or some drive by diner. 

I sat there for a good half hour savoring the meal. At the end it was all gone - the muffin, potatoes, egg crepe and the bucket of coffee. For the amount of food I had, it was very very light and felt quite healthy. I didn't get hit by the food coma train on the way home which is a big plus.

As a heavy consumer of all things chicken, I recommend this place to everyone. Unless you don't have taste buds...then go to your local diner where your $4.99 omelet brings you to orgasm every sunday morning. If you have taste buds - go eat here. Pay a little extra. Its worth it. I would guess that this is the best "cheap" breakfast i've ever had.

Truly exceptional service! Came in for a Crazy Chicken Omlete, and it was truly a great experience even though it was simply take-out. Will definitely be bringing the nephews, the sister in laws, brothers, siblings, friends, my entire family and even my dog to enjoy Egg and I. (If thats allowable)  Two thumbs up!

we ventured out from the strip during our weekend in vegas since I LOVE breakfast.  I read the reviews about the corned beef and hash.  I tried that on the "first" day.
: - )
My friend and I went back to the others in our group and I had someone else join me the next day.  I added the blackened prime rib this time and it was great too.  there were a number of items on the menu i really wanted to try.  I can't wait until my next trip to Vegas.  Enjoy!

Looking for a place to eat? Breakfast Off the strip? I say try this place out. I must say their banana nut muffin is really good! The staff here are friendly and attentive. The food here is good! I've tried their Original Breakfast burrito, the Ensenada burrito, and homemade corn beef hash skillet. They all come with a side of country style seasoned potatoes. My hubs and I love them potatoes! Order yourself a lemonade (free refills) and chow down! I've only been here 3 times this year but every time that I've eaten here, I'd leave satisfied! 

Texas style French toast wasn't really a home run for us. We should have stuck with pancakes/waffles instead. There's always a wait especially on the weekends. They have a dog friendly patio.
Beast breakfast place I have ever eaten at. I'm from out of town and we ended up doing here twice because the food is so good!!!!

Me and my family went early around 730am or so and I have never been here before, the young gentleman who was really young was very swell and respectful and was caring that I had a infant and I thank him for being caring about him. Well mannered, our waiter was knowledgeable and very cool, I didn't catch his name but had a great sleeved tattooed on his right arm. The muffins are out of this world, they were so hot and fresh I was worried I want going to have room for my actual breakfast 
The eggs bennidict were so delicious had a great zest to the sauce. The potatoes would have been great but there was a large amount of pepper and there specialty El Diablo of some sort of spice they created but ask them for easy on the spice. Other that great food good price. Had to take the remainder of my portion a home and I would go back
Really good!  HUGE portions so beware and split if you don't have a huge appetite.  Great biscuits and gravy!  Excellent coffee!!  Service was equally good!

Found this on Yelp after deciding we wanted to venture off the strip for a last-days breakfast. Stuffed French toast was awesome! And the prime rib Benedict was amazing as well, it was the perfect balance of rich and savory with fresh spinach and peppers brighten it up. Our server Linnea was prompt, friendly and knowledgable! Will be back next time in Vegas.

Yummy breakfast.  Wait is as expected.  I ordered the portugese sausage hawaiian breakfast because other than in Hawaii this is the only place I have been able to find it.  It is a whole sausage they don't skimp.  Good food!

My favorite breakfast joint in the US of A.

This is the 3rd time we have visited The Egg And I - so worth leaving the Strip to get here - the food and service have always been great - and the people who work here are a pleasure to interact with. The place was jammed with a crowd outside when we came on a Sunday morning - but the wait was only 10 minutes and it was worth it. Food-wise the Fender Bender Egg Crepe was out of this world. (After I wrote the above, my girlfriend said "Oh, I forgot to order fruit instead of home fries" with her breakfast. The waitress of course said "I can bring you fruit" and didn't charge us for it. That's exactly what you would expect from a classy cool place like this. I made sure to Yelp it because we need more restaurants like this. And I repeat: every employee from the hostess to the waitress to the cashier was charming. Yes, yes, yes to the Egg and I. If I had the stomach for running a restaurant, I would do it just like they do.

Wonderful breakfast! Great service!
 Our server, Karla, was super friendly and helpful! The entire experience while on vacation was great!
 Our grandson enjoyed his mouse pancake  and bacon, I had the western omelette, and my husband had gravy and scrambled eggs..everything was delicious! And my banana muffin was warm and moist and very tasty!
The bacon avacado omlete was delicious. The food came out quick and hot. Great service too.
Food was great. Service was not so good. Got my food well after everyone else at my table. I would def go back tho for the breakfast

Great food! I recommend the traditional eggs Benedict.  The home fries are spectacular.  We had great food and excellent service, thank you Linnea for providing us with great suggestions and great service!

The Egg & I has got to be the best breakfast dining experience I've had in Vegas. The place is busy because the food is excellent for a really good price and the service is very good.

Food:
1) Banana Nut Muffin was the best I've ever tried so far. You could tell they used a lot of butter because it was so soft and flavorful!
2) Benedict - The eggs were poached perfectly and the hollandaise sauce was amazing. Perfect execution of this dish.
3) Ranch potatoes were FANTASTIC. They were seasoned perfectly and not overly salty. They didn't have that heavy, thick potato texture. It was lightly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

Service: The hostesses knew how to handle the influx of people waiting and the servers were friendly, helpful, and very efficient. We even got water refills without even having to ask.

Quaint and homey looking restaurant.  I kind of felt like I was getting a weird look at time, but it was probably in my head.  The food was delicious though as well as great portions.  The price was also affordable.  The breakfast burrito was quite tasty along with the turkey salad my girlfriend had.  The bran muffin was nice and hot.  The service was good.  I felt kind of pushed to get out though since they were closing soon.  However, it was still a nice and clean place with friendly service and good food.  Not much to complain about here.

Looking for a simple and amazing breakfast to brighten up your day? 

This place is it. 

Great food, huge breakfast selections, great service, and reasonable price.

The staff told us the wait to sit inside was approximately 30 min to 45 min, but our group could get a table now if we decided to sit outside. So we decided to sit outside on the patio and the weather wasn't too bad for a nice weekend breakfast.

Skillet breakfast - works (ham, bacon, sausage, mushrooms, onions, peppers, and tomatoes - $10.75 w/ banana nut muffin): One of the best banana nut muffin that you will find and very flavorful potatoes. The portion was enough to fill my tummy up!

It's egg-ceptionally good! And don't forget about the banana nut muffin! 

P.S. - Once you are finished with the meal, you will have to pay at the register.

If i could give more stars i would!

5 stars for sure , breakfast is the best!

I got the piggy skillet, so freakin good!!!!!! Trust me, go here, its a must go to for a breakfast on a vegas trip, you will be going everytime you visit vegas!

Potatoes are the best, skillet had bits of bacon, ham, sausage.  Topped with 4 eggs i had them overeasy.  U can get them scrambled.

They have coupons too, buy one entree get one free!? =) 

This made my day..trust me it will make yours too.

Best breakfast I have ever had from what i can remember
Our server was Tabatha.  She was super friendly and helpful with our order.  The food was great!  We highly recommend this place to Vegas visitors.

My wife and I were looking for a good breakfast restaurant with more selection and better prices than the limited offering at our resort. We were very pleased with The Egg and I. We both ordered breakfast burritos with potatoes and they were delicious and more than we could eat. The prices were reasonable and certainly cheaper than the resort restaurant. 

The menu was quite extensive with many options. Also must add that it is located a few miles off the Strip in a safe location in a small shopping center. The restaurant itself is nothing fancy, but if you're looking for delicious food served quickly at a reasonable price, look no further.

Must go to breakfast restaurant when in Vegas! 

This place is off the strip and it gets pretty busy but the wait isn't long at all, for three people is about a 10-15 wait but worth it!!

I had the beef hash with two over easy eggs and it was so flavorful and you can taste the quality.

Family owned restaurant where they care about their menu choices and how the customers experience. 

Would surely come back again! Thanks!
Great food but ambiance was very blah I thought. But, of course I love a really cute ambiance when I go to brunch

This place is egg-cellent if you are looking for an egg-traordinary breakfast that deals with eggs. Even though I am not much of an egg eater, I found it to have a nice balance between the sides and the main egg dish. A little crowded but hey, if you love eggs then try this place out.

There is definitely a reason why there is always a wait for this place...it is totally worth it!!!

I got one of the Egg & I specials - Chicken Fried Steak  which consist of 2 eggs, ranch potatoes, and a banana nut muffin which you can totally share with 2 people except for the muffin. Please dont share that. Get your own, damn it. Its too good to be shared!

Wait a minute! Did I say RANCH POTATOES???!!! OH HELL YEAH!!! Its the best tasting season potatoes ever! They are not like french fries nor tots but they are cubed shaped fries. I almost died when I put one in my mouth. This is why I scored this place a 5. 

The potatoes and banana nut muffin totally suckered me in for life! I dont even like banana nut flavored anything or muffins and this muffin was the bomb!!!

My chicken fried steak was huge and just perfect. Its not oily at all, just plump and juicy. 

5 star in my book. I think the service was good...I think the wait wasnt too bad... shit, I dont remember, I zoned out after my first bite of those delicious potato fries!

This spot has become a regular part of my Vegas experience! 

Their banana nut muffins are INSANE and their egg skillet meals are huge enough to keep you full for the rest of the day, easily. Boyfriend once finished a full chicken fried steak skillet and I feared for his cardiovascular health for a hot minute. As an added bonus, the coffee is delicious and I absolutely recommend the bacon avocado omelette and banana nut French toast. 

Service is excellent and we always feel cared for when we visit. Our server today, Bree, was awesome and attentive!

Ambiance is charming. This place isn't great for huge groups, but it is totally perfect for the family. Expect a line in the morning -- but the wait is worth it!

Amazing food, superior service.  Get off the strip and give this place a try.  A great experience!!

I was in town for a conference and my husband was able to join me for a couple days.  We always try to get away from the tourist traps and try to eat at local establishments.  This one was definitely a win!  

The food was plentiful - way too much to eat, but too good not to try.  The eggs were hot, cooked perfectly and served promptly.  The service staff was all very down to earth, stayed on top of every request, and smiled the whole time.  

Everything we ate was wonderful and all the plates around us looked great too.  Can't order wrong here.

I am acutally shocked to see how many stars people are giving this place!  We had to wait for a seat (which is not surprising given the # of stars people are giving this place), but the hostess and the waitress were really nice.  As soon as we were seated, we were approached by a man with very few teeth and food ALL OVER hs shirt!  He brought the cup of orange juice I asked for and the outside of the cup was covered with white gunk....not too sure what it was, but I was so grossed out I asked the waitress to please take it away.  I ordered the stuffed french toast because another yelper said it was like a "party" in her mouth.  I wanted a party in my mouth as well.......was it a party?  far from it.  It was just ok....and the potatoes were WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAY too salty.  Do not go here if you are not supposed to have salt or you will end up at Desert Springs Hospital....no joke!  The review below that compares the potatoes to BBQ chips from a bag is VERY true.....actually, my husband says it's worse than that.  This place gets 2 stars....
This place is ALWAYS busy so be prepared for a wait, but it's incredibly worth it. Huge portions and great prices!

If someone were to ask me where do you want to go to breakfast, I would always pick this place. The famous Habla Diablo potatoes are amazing. I always ask for food server Genesis. She is very polite, super attentive and has a great personality. They have an egg face on you table and if you need anything just flip it to a frown face and any one of the staff will come help you. I haven't had to use it because Genesis is always checking on us. I highly recommend this as a breakfast hot spot.

I love places like this that specialize in breakfast, so I was especially happy that the lady found out about and suggested (The) Egg & I on our second morning in Vegas.

Got there about 9:00 a.m. on a Tuesday, and although the place was busy, it wasn't packed, so there was no wait for a table.  Started with coffee which was surprisingly good - very mellow with a good flavor.  I even thought about asking what kind of coffee they use, but unfortunately forgot.

I ordered my favorite - corned beef hash and eggs, while the lady ordered country fried steak.  CBH was in a soft patty form.  The corned beef was of the finely-shredded variety probably from a can, so don't expect chunks from a brisket they brined and carved themselves.  I'm not complaining - the stuff was tasty.  The two eggs on top were done a nice over easy.  I wasn't a fan of their Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes, which tasted okay, but were a little too loose for me - like if you tried to scoop them with your fork instead of stabbing them, they would just fall off.  I like hash browns, home fries, etc. that stick together a bit so you can put them on the same bite as the CBH/egg/omelette/etc.  I can't believe it's just me.  Right?

The lady's country fried steak was tender and tasty.  Not out of this world, but certainly better than you'd get at an IHOP.  While I had wheat toast, she chose the banana muffin, which was great - just filling, so with the good portions of the rest of out breakfasts, we couldn't finish it.

Service was friendly, and the prices were reasonable.  I'd definitely come back.

Best breakfast place i have ever been to! We experienced great service , and good food.Ou waitress was super nice. I love chille rellenos, so i had to try their chille relleno omelet. OMG BOMB lol it was so good. i had to try their banana bread  muffin it was good! i live in cali ,but travel to vegas a lot. Every time we are out in vegas this will be our go to place for breakfast!
Love the egg & I! Consistently delish breakfast every time we visit. Try the chicken fried steak & fiesta skillets. Lovely service, especially Stacie :)

Once again I am hard on Breakfast spots. This place was pretty good they are not trying to reinvent the wheel. Coffee was good, food was good, service was above average. I will go back again but Hash House A Go Go is still my favorite outside a casino.
Tamara is the best! She is really helpful& energetic! She knows how to make her customers feel like they are getting taken care of! She also is really friendly!

We did not want to have breakfast at the hotel and we decided to give this place a try. It is a great place . Service is very nice and friendly.we had Darlesia as our server , I give her 5 stars. I highly recommend The eggs & I.
Great place, free banana nut muffin with breakfast for first timers! I got the western and wife got the stuffed French toast! Yum! Staff was very down to earth and welcoming!

Egg-cellent food & service. I ordered the Loco Moco, a Hawaiian stapled & gravy is the secret. Great job guys. Karla was super friendly & patient w/ our massive group during prime time brunch on sunday. She was soo kind as to anticipate our needs, service was efficient & everything came out hot & correct! Good work guys. Will stop by on our next visit soon!
Amazing place, really busy on Sunday's but there really quick on getting people in.  Our server Breeannda, was super attentive.  Great food and great service!!!  Will defiantly be back.
Great staff and customer service Food was fresh and Great First time Being here Definitely coming back thanks for the great Service Alexa
Great French toast. Overall awesome experience the food was exceptional and the service is on point. Uli was our server and he made sure we were pleased.  btw nice booty Uli.
Everything I've read about this place was true. Incredible food and Great Server "Card" was wonderful! I can't wait to go back!
Great service n food! Thanks Ulises!! I will definitely come back when in town thank you

Arrived on Wednesday at about 10 am and was seated immediately. Eggs and bacon were cooked just right  (I like my bacon really crispy.) Cinnamon French toast was delicious. Our server, Oscar, was "eggceptional". They offer so many choices and Oscar made some useful recommendations.  He was very pleasant. You can count on great service along with great egg dishes here.  BTW
we got 2 free banana nut muffins just for checking in on Yelp!  Thanks!!
Great food; I got the classic and added avocado to the toast! Fast service and everything was tasty and our server Carole Ann was AWESOME!!! :)

Good food, great selection, excellent prices and phenomenal customer service. 

Our server Bree was charming, helpful and attentive. 

Girlfriend got breakfast, I had lunch.   Huge portions. 

The Only reason I can't give five stars is they didn't serve real 100% maple syrup. Nobody gets five stars for breakfast with "table syrup"

But we will definitely be back.  My syrup snob GF will just have to bring her own.

They have everything you could possibly want for breakfast.  4 of came here, each of us ordered something different and all enjoyed it.  Pancakes, skillets, steaks and chicken fried steak where all winners with us. Those ranch potatoes are perfect with eggs.  This place definitely has breakfast right with something for everyone.  Definitely worth leaving your hotel and driving a short distance from the strip.

This place was recommended from a friend for cheap eats (seeing how Vegas likes to charge you an arm and leg at buffets). We came here for brunch after getting our asses drunk AF the previous morning. #HangoverFTW. It was 100+ degrees come 10:30am and we were waiting outside to be seated, luckily we didn't wait that long and managed to snag a seat at their patio (thank goodness their misters were on). The staff was amazing in accommodating our large party outside and they rocked taking all our orders and getting them out in a timely manner.

I ordered their fresh vegetable (vegetarian) omelette with egg whites sans cheese with a side of potatoes. The omelette was pretty good, although nothing terribly mind-blowing and it came with spinach and mushrooms. The house potatoes were not my favorite, but still eatable. It had way too much seasoning making it very salty.

The food was decent overall, would like to come and try their scrambles the next time I'm in Vegas. :) Can't go wrong with affordable mom and pop restaurants off the Strip.
Karla was our server, and totally fantastic. Incredibly attentive, fun to chat with, quick service. Also, really great food! Biscuits and gravy were amazing.

Yes there will always be a line, but you know that usually means where the good foods are. And the wait is so worth it for this place!!! The line moves very fast, and you will be sitting down with a yummy warm banana muffin. Portions are big, and you will be stuffed. I tried the cincy chili for the first time. It's an all meat chili with a sweeter taste. Then I had the best loco moco ever! Instead of the usual brown gravy, they use country gravy. And their homemade hamburger patty has so much flavor, and cooked to perfection.

This was my first time eating here and let me just say it was amazing. The service from Amanda was above 100%, and no sooner then sitting down did she have our drinks ready for us. After our drinks she was highly intensive even though the restaurant was busy it seemed that all of her tables were taking the best care of. Honestly the food as well was amazing, so would I recommend this place... Yes 100%

Great place for breakfast. The Works Veggie Bennie is absolutely fantastic. Checked in on Yelp and got a Banana Nut Muffin which was excellent as well. I will definitely come back for more when I am in Vegas.

Food is amazing! A list of everything we ordered.
Biscuits and gravy with potatoes. DELICIOUS!!! The gravy was tasty and the biscuits were so soft. 

Steak and eggs: decent piece of meat but enough food to fill up my dad

Chile relleno omelette: how creative to put an entire chile relleno inside of an omelette! 

Wild chicken: ok, I think that's the name of it lol it's an omelette with chicken, guacamole, mushrooms and covered with Munster cheese. Who thought of this and why did it take me so long to try it?!?!? It was INCREDIBLE!!!! 

Oscar was beyond amazing!! He was patient (family was a bit slow at deciding) and constantly checked on us. Five stars just for his service.

We arrived in Las Vegas very early and couldn't check into our hotel until 3 pm. I asked my husband to find a local breakfast joint and he immediately found Egg & I. I didn't think it was going to be good but boy was i wrong!

It's located off the strip and driving past it i honestly would not have given it a second look. We saw the reviews and they were good. 

The place had a nice crowd. We were greeted and seated immediately.

Our waitress Tamara (who was helpful and awesome) suggested the Bandito Scramble. It had pepper jack, cheddar, sour cream, chorizo, jalapeños and of course eggs. It came with a spicy sauce on the side and breakfast potatoes. Oh my goodness, it was wonderful. Oh and it also came with an AMAZING banana nut muffin...pure perfection!

Another thing I liked on the menu that I didn't try was they had Cincinnati chili. I'm from Cincinnati and everybody knows chili is our thing. I'll be back before I leave to try it and get another banana nut muffin.

My husband did great finding this place!

Got there and it was a good 30 minute wait before being seated. Ordered the chicken fried steak skillet with eggs. It was good but a tad much on the salt for me. If you like salt, you would love this dish. The egg on top did help balance it out. I don't care for the country potatoes and should have gotten the hash browns. Fresh squeezed OJ with pulp, very refreshing. Service was surprisingly prompt for a pack house inside. Water was filled when needed. 

On to the muffin - it's a winner, simply the best muffin i ever had and surprisingly with no salt added. It was banana nut but you wouldn't know by looking at it.  However, you can taste it. They should consider opening a muffin shop and just sell these as it would be a big seller imho. A 3.5 overall experience but I am rounding it up because of the tasty muffin and would come back again just for that.

We had Chase as our waitress. She was very on point with everything, very friendly & always checked on us to make sure everything was okay. Definitely coming back here again & my nephew loved her!!! Thank you so much Chase!!!! =)
Food was terrific! We went twice. Double check that they have your order correct. They had our mixed up both times.  Staff is friendly and welcoming.

This place is great. Big portions worth the price. We loved the banana muffin (I think there's a Yelp check-in for it). We shared half a chicken salad with a side of chili and the country fried steak. The bbq chicken salad was great and I'd recommend if you are trying to eat light(er). The chili was ok-- I think I've had better. Finally, the fried steak was the star. It's everything you'd expect and it's cooked right. We'd definitely get this one again!

The food was great and the best part is the server tabbatha. ....she must be new, never seen her before..let me tell you, if ur having a bad day and people being shity go see tabbatha she put a smile on my face she was great she treat u like ur family and always making sure we were ok with everything we were served.....she really knows service and making people comfortable at the restaurant after a long freaken night at work....thank tabbatha u rock...hope to come back with my whole family...

When the Hash House was packed on Saturday we decided to give this place a try and woo-wee it was worth it! No wait, breakfast until 3pm, and huge portions of delicious foods!!! The service was great and they have cute menus that look like newspapers. Their burritos are kick- ass waffles topped with fresh fruits are amazing and I highly recommend the corned beef hash. One of the best I've had. They also have fresh OJ and the best tasting homefries Ive ever had! I cant wait to go back to this  place next time Im in town.
Muffin was good, omelet and potatoes were amazing! French toast was not impressive at all. Over all good experience. Kind of expensive but it was big plates.

Came here for the first time today. Our server Carole Ann was in a word awesome.  My wife got the Cabo burrito and it was huge and quite delicious. The ranch potatoes were heavenly, and superbly seasoned.  I got the plain buttermilk pancakes, and they brought out not one but 3 pancakes the size of a dinner plate.  I'm a big guy, and was no match for the giant fluffy elliptical yummyness.  All in all a great place to eat.

Excellent breakfast. I had eggs benedict florentine. The eggs were a bit runny, but that added to the creamy flavor of the somehow still crispy English muffin. Ham was very tender and easy to cut. The homestyle potatoes were pretty salty, but not too much. Portion sizes were gratuitous. The service was prompt, nice, and attentive without being annoying. I'll definitely eat there again.

I got a skillet meal trying to get a taste for something different, I liked it but it wasn't really amazing as it looked in front of me. the flavors were mildly okay and the bread wasn't really toasted. I'll come back to try something else and hopefully give  a better review.

The food was good down-home cooking and we enjoyed every bite.  Beware, the portions are HUGE when you order a breakfast skillet ... big enough for two to share.  Our server Alexa was super friendly and she made us feel right at home!

This place is a gem. After a very disappointing buffet at a casino with a price tag of 32.99 per person. We decided to use yelp for our breakfast in the morning. Needless to say the reviews of this place are true. 


Let's address cons. 

It's off the strip 
It has a decent wait time to be served. Place was packed and it's worth noting but they clean tables and have people seated as fast as possible. 

Pros. 

Food is great. I have paid triple for similar food. And I had the cabo breakfast burrito which is and easy item to mess up. Sause was dryer and baked on so it did not cause the burrito to become soggy. Was crisp without too much grease. 

Great customer service. 

I will be eating here again before I leave is how much I truly enjoyed my self. 

Wife would want me to give it a 4.5 because they used too much cheese on her omelet however it said cheesy so I blame her.

This is definitely the best place for breakfast.  Lots of locals here so you know it's good.   Very good prices,  and great food,  but the best service of anyplace in Vegas.   Tried the bloody Mary, excellent! !!
Food was really good!! Service was really good! Heather was our server!! She was GREAT! This is the Breakfast spot!!

Awesome breakfast I had incredible huevos rancheros  and a biscuit with gravy. Yummy. Everyone in my party loved their breakfast. Huge portions I only ate half. Karla gave us wonderful service. If you are visiting Vegas a must place to have breakfast!!

Now, I understand why the ratings for this place are so high; people who eat here must be stoner's. That is the only explanation for the "high" rating for the food.
The wait staff are pretty nice.

Best breakfast I had in Vegas. You'll need a car to get there if you're staying on the strip, but it's worth the drive. The ranch potatoes are fantastic! Great food at a great price and good service, too.

Searched for a good breakfast place and found this spot. Read the menu and decided to try their Island Favorite - Spam, two eggs, rice & banana nut muffin, it was delicious! This is my usual plate to get when we travel to Hawaii and it did not disappoint. Service was great, our server Oscar was very helpful and friendly. This is our new breakfast spot when we come to Vegas.

Great hearty breakfast if you are not wanting the all-u-can-eat buffet.  The only thing this place is not drunk-walkable in am, it is a drive away - towards the "giant souviener shop" direction away from the strip.

Good service and good food. Every seat was taken in the restaurant. The hostess and waiters are all super nice saying "morning sweetie" and "how are you honey" seem to really enjoy working there.

All the food portions were HUGE! our table tried a little bit of everything: blueberry pancakes, choc chip pancakes, moco loco, breakfast burrito, omlettes.  their potatoes were really good - seasoned and fried!

Wish it was walkable from the strip - that would make it 5 stars!

Good breakfast food off the strip of Vegas. Price is reasonable (Around $10 per plate) and they give you a lot. Enough for you to take back home unless you are coping with a hangover and need all the carbs you can get. 

The Banana Nut Muffin is really as good as everyone says it is; especially with the spread. You can tell they bake it fresh as there is no complex presentation to it. It is just simply muffin off the pan. I ordered the egg-ceptional omelette and it was decent. Definitely worth the money but, not mind blowing. I would try their other items if I go again. My friend got the stuffed french toast and that looked very good. However, the ranch potato side were delicious and exactly what I needed after a long weekend in Vegas. 

Their high selling point is their super nice staff. They give you the perfect amount of chit chat and leave you alone time.

Use their egg signs. Yellow Egg means you need attention; Black Egg means leave me alone.

What a find! After having humongous buffets at various places in Vegas, this was a welcome change! Definitely give it a try on your way back. My husband had the eggs Benedict and I got the veggie omlette. Very cute little place.
Not bad. This is a great neighborhood joint with lots of locales. Muffins are delicious. Yummy large portions.

Amazing breakfast and lunch! I've been here a couple times during visits to Vegas. Huge omelettes, great skillets and delicious sandwiches. You can pretty much order anything you want your way, even a custom made side salad if you want! If you're looking for a big breakfast in Vegas, you can't go wrong with Egg and I.

Great tasting food and large portions were a nice part of this moderately priced place. We went there at noon, and it was busy, but they were getting people seated as quickly as they could. Wait staff was nice, professional and knowledgeable. We got the Mexican omelet and the bacon omelet. It had the right amount of cheese and the food came out hot. Potatoes were great- tasted fresh and hot, not chewy or old. We had our food to go. I'll definitely be eating here again next time I'm in Vegas.

It was fantastic, our server Bree was awesome and the food was great in quality, price , and it was very huge portion. I had the Brad's Scramble. This store is absolutely to recommend, easy parking, easy to find, great price and quality:)

The food is nice and hot with large more than you can eat portions. 

"The works" omelette is very filling as it is very well packed.

Don't think twice about coming here! Just do it! You won't be disappointed.

Jose was our server, did an excellent job!

The food was yummy. The restrooms and restaurant has a pleasant and clean atmosphere. Our server, Liza, was very loving and catered to our every need without an issue. The plain pancakes were delicious, along with the stuffed French toast. I'd recommend it to anyone headed to or past Las Vegas.
Awesome service, Chance rocked it! Get the skillet if you're hungry.  Keep up the good work guys!

This is a great place for a late breakfast. Their egg dishes are incredibly good. Their pancake and waffles are on the list too. My favorite is the Kay's special with the banana nut muffin. If you have a sweet tooth, you should definitely go for the muffin instead of the toast. It's fresh and moist.  This place is not on the cheap side (you know it's LV) but the food quality and service sure deserve it.
The food is always fresh and the service is great. Huge portions of quality food for a low price. Karla was our server this time and she did great.

Came here on a bad day. There were confusion in their kitchen and other customers were upset. We waited over 30 mins for skillet and waffle. Should not be there with high expectations. Food was normal. Bloody Mary tasted like ketchup. Staff were great but won't be back again..

I've been back a few times since my last review and my opinion is the same. It's average food with a local spin on Denny's breakfast menu. Someone compared it to the Pork Store in SF and I'd have to say that's a pretty close comparison. They also mentioned Mama's in SF and I'd have to say The Egg and I is not as nice and not as tasty. One things for sure, I'd choose Hash House a Go Go in Vegas any day over this place.

My BF found this place on Yelp after our first night in Vegas and I agreed to give it a shot based on all the great reviews. I had the mashed potato omelet and my BF had the country Benedict. Both were delish and a LOT of food. We also got a homemade banana muffin for free for checking in, and they gave us both one which was nice. They were delish too and so was the coffee! Our server was very attentive and friendly. Only con: we saw a few people who came in after us be seated before us but the hostess acknowledged the wait time and apologized.

Reyna was awesome from start to finish she made me feel very welcomed and best of all very friendly.. Service in general was one of the best and speaking about breakfast food best I had in vegas so far. I would recommend eating the stuffed french toast. :)

Skillet breakfast of seasoned potatoes, melted cheese, eggs, bacon ham and sausage is yummy delicious, worth sodium cholesterol detox for rest of week :) Banana nut muffin warm, moist and fragrant. Generous plate, be prepared to fill tummy... Friendly helpful server Paula tops a happy brunch!
$ Service was excellent. Veggie Benny was large with fresh vegetables and excellent Hollandaise sauce.

Was in Vegas for a little vaca and we wanted to get away from the hustle and bustle on the strip and I wasn't down for another buffet or spending $16 on breakfast at the hotel we were staying at.  

So I trusted fellow yelpers and hopped over here.  It was approaching noon, but I still had my heart set on breakfast.  

We were seated quickly.  The service was ok. I don't know in what order the food went in or what, but this is what I noticed. 

There were 2 tables in front of my view.  One table got seated 5 minutes after us and the other table seemed like they were wating forever for their food.  I'm assuming the manager, went up to the table and apologized for their food not getting there yet.  I then noticed the table who sat down 5 mintues AFTER us got served their food first.  I looked at the hubby and said, "how did that happen?" AND they were served way BEFORE the table that was waiting.  So something happened to communication from the servers and the kitchen.   

I got the chicken fried steak.  When we got our food I was lovin' the potatoes!!  My scramble eggs were over cooked and hard - really no flavor.  My chicken fried steak was good, but the put sooo much gravy, I had to take half of it off.   

Overall, the place is a good spot for breakfast in Vegas.  I wish I could get more of those damyn potatoes!! :)
My husband had the country benny and I had waffles. Both were delicious!! Wish you had one of these in So CA!! We will be back very soon!

We wanted to get off the LV strip and eat at a local place for breakfast so after reading the reviews I chose the Egg & I.
I was not disappointed as the food was fresh and the menu selection for breakfast was excellent. I ordered the veggie omelette and it was served with a huge portion of home fires. As others have commented the home fries are highly seasoned with seasoning salt so I enjoyed them. The veggie omelette had a generous amount of chopped veggies inside and they melt jack and cheddar cheese over the top. The meal is served with toast or their famous banana nut muffin and the muffin is light and packed with flavor. I was very hungry today but I left very full and satisfied. The prices are very reasonable and my breakfast inlcuding a drink came to a toal of $10.00. I will definitely be back on my next trip to LV.

Amazing breakfast place off the strip, def worth it. The warm banana muffins on point. The chilli rellenos omelette is amazing cuz of the sauce. The pancakes were good as well. Has a dinner type of vibe.

I always plan on having breakfast here while I'm in vegas. Great prices, Great food and Great Service. 

Carole Ann served us today and she was great. 

Worth the wait. If you have a group, Call ahead and let them know. They will try and get something set up for you before you get there.

Saturday morning in Las Vegas, really needed to score a solid breakfast. The eggs benny florentine was incredible, but the potatoes that came with it made the meal. 

Waitress came by to remove our plates and we just growled at her :). Sh realized we had a couple of potato morsels left and backed away.
Got in fairly quick. Order placed and meal delivered in a very speedy fashion. Omelette bigger than my head? Plus. Found this place accidently...pleasantly surprised. Will probably go back.

The veggie skillet and ciabatta breakfast sandwich were delicious! Great coffee and great atmosphere! Our server Chance was so nice and personable. Definitely recommend this as a spot to get an amazing breakfast!

Let's be honest here: the whole Vegas breakfast buffet phenomenon gets really old really fast.  Yes, it's all you can eat for $9.99, but how much can you really eat?  And how much do you want to eat every single morning?  Don't you want someone to bring you food instead of trying not to spill your bowl of oatmeal on a slow 80-year-old grandma in an "I live to bingo" sweater?

If you do, take a short drive down W. Sahara Ave to Egg and I.  You will not be disappointed.  Inconspicuously located in a nondescript strip mall, Egg and I provides a perfectly casual, hearty and homey breakfast without the pompousness and the hoopla of The Strip.

By now you're probably wondering what "Egg" looks like.  Well, Egg looks kind of like Humpty Dumpty, and "I" looks just like "Egg."  Just look on their website.  Might as well call the whole place "2 Eggs," although it would probably detract from the restaurant's country kitchen charm.  

We came in around 9:30 am on Saturday morning, and the place was absolutely packed.  We got a table right away, but every party that came in after 9:45 had to wait a little.  We had just gotten into town, and I was glad they brought us a whole pot of coffee.  You'd better believe I took advantage of the proximity and the unlimited availability of good coffee.  Even the yellow cups with the company logo were cute enough to use at home.

We couldn't quite decide on what to order, and our waitress graciously waited, while offering valuable suggestions along the way.  The menu is extensive and the portions are huge, so....  Also, breakfast is the most important meal of the day, so you don't want to make this decision lightly.

There was nothing light about my breakfast, however.  The Ultimate Skillet is not for the weak...that much I know.  A generous layer of breakfast potatoes had a Cajun flavor to it.  Paprika and something else gave those potatoes a light crunch and a reddish hue - pretty and delicious.  The Ultimate Skillet also featured mounds of sausage, ham and bacon, mixed in with bell peppers, onions and cheese.  The skillet wouldn't be complete with 2 scrambled eggs on top.  WOW.  

We also ordered one large pancake to share, but after getting through 3/4 of the skillet, I wasn't hankering for a pancake.  I did try it, and it was fluffy and sweet, but it was just too much.  I was ready to throw in the towel, which almost never happens to me.  On any other day, I can finish any breakfast, and have some of yours, too, but the Ultimate Skillet proved to be a bit much.  Order at your own risk.  That's a LOT of food for $9.95.

Great breakfast in a quaint setting?  I will be sure to make it my regular Vegas breakfast destination.

This place is wonderful. Our server Stacie was so sweet and cheery. How can you not smile in a place called Egg & I anyway?  Hint...come up with some "eggciting" comebacks. So much fun. Our Vegas trip was topped off with this place. Will be back!
Best Bfast in town, especially after a rough night in Vegas.  Very well worth the 4mile drive from the strip.
The ice coffee was good too. Loved the muffin. Server was very sweet. Hope you get to go to Disney Breeannda. I hope I spelled your name right :)

We had a delicious meal!  The banana nut muffin with a cup of coffee set the bar high for the rest of our feast.  My husband got the chili dog with the Cincinnati chili.  It was perfect!  Mustard, cheese, onions made it so flavorful, but the chili itself sets it apart from other chili dogs.

I ordered the bacon and avocado omelette.  It would have been a bit bland, but the habla diablo potatoes and some condiments made for a great dish!  

Our server Luis was so helpful and attentive!

Was on vacation and decided to eat here for breakfast. I was expecting something more..I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet..it had potatoes, chopped up steak, gravy and eggs throwed on top..it was ok..nothing to brag about. It was just ok.

Pretty good place, very busy even on a Wednesday morning, but we were able to get a table within 5 mins.

Veggie skillet was pretty good. You can get half portions which was perfect size for 1 person.

Banana pancake was okay, I'd rather have the banana slices on top instead of smashed into the batter.

You get a Banana nut Muffin with the free check in, but I wasn't a fan of it.

Customer service was a bit slow and forgetful, we had to remind her of a few things more than once.

Yay Egg! Glad I asked Mary W. for breakfast recommendations before the trip. When I got here there was already a line but the wait wasn't too bad, perhaps about 15-20 minutes. They have a cute menu that looks like a newspaper and a huge menu to choose from.
We ordered a corn beef hash and eggs benedict. Do me a favor and order yourself a corn beef hash if you go there, it's pretty darn delicious. The eggs benedict was alright, way too much hollandaise sauce, I wish they'd go easy on that. I do love the breakfast potatoes. Our waitress didn't take care of us too well but the other staff were nice and helpful. Serving was so big we didn't eat lunch that day.

This local hot spot takes pride in scratch made food. Ive been eating here for a decade & am happy to say they have added several new locations. Im addicted to Brad's cincy chili. Its beanless, sweet, smokey, & mouth watering delicious. I always have the 4-way, noodles, chili, cheese & onions. 5-way adds beans. I do not like kidney beans & dont like them forced into my chili. This dish is enormous & inexpensive. This dish is made with love, plain & simple. The entire staff is always welcoming. They know how to treat their regulars & irregulars.They have a prime rib benedict, health conscious items. When i eat there i am far from health conscious. i am down right unconscious & barbareick. They never laugh or stare when i have a couple entrees going at once. What can I say, options are hard cause there are so many good ones.

As expected five stars. I'd heard of the Egg & I prior to this trip to Vegas and was anxiously awaiting a delicious breakfast. The food was superlative and the service...well what can I say? Packed house and we were offered immediate seating outdoors or wait. I chose to wait and my group was seated within 5 minutes. Totally unexpected. Karla was our server and she was friendly and attentive. She really made us feel at home! Karla didn't even blink when I asked for my free banana nut muffin with my Yelp check in. That banana nut muffin! You have to try it. Best I've had. As a side note, even the man who brought out our food (he had a family first tattoo on his arm) was really cheerful and made us feel welcome. The price ia unbelievable. Very affordable. I'm coming back tomorrow! Vegas!!!

This is my go to spot every time I am in Vegas! I even bought myself a coffee cup! 

Bacon avocado omelet with sour cream, little chunks of bacon in the egg and slices of fresh avocados inside the omelet with cheese and topped with a nice helping of sour cream.  
Banana nut muffin x 2 please, I take one to go. 
Every bite has a crunch of nut, they serve it warm, which is the best way to eat it! 
My unlimited amount of coffee refills! 

The breakfast here is awesome and the portions are huge. I usually end up taking half of everything home, yes back to LA!

I had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated. 
Food was excellent. I had a great waitress that was very attentive I ordered the everything omelet.
For the price I paid for the food. It was really inexpensive and the amount of food that I received was great. Great customer service and great environment.
Best breakfast you will ever eat. You can tell the staff is friendly and on point and The food was amazing.

Very popular breakfast place in Las Vegas! So it's gonna be crowded there. I always get excellent service here. I usually come here with some real health nuts who have to have some seriously customized orders and they always get it right. They have one manager that even looked at our bill and showed us how we can order things a certain way and save some money.

I always thought this place didn't seem appetizing from what it looks like on the outside, but it's actually cozy & welcoming! The service is quick & food is delicious...especially their banana nut muffins & ranch potatoes. I will definitely come back & recommend this place to my family & friends.

I would just like to write a review about Amanda!!! She is seriously the best server I've ever had! She was so sweet and went above and beyond for my family even though it was brunch time and a little busy! Thank you Amanda for everything!
Loved the food and the service! Our server Reina was better then exceptional, checked on us every time she passed by. We will be back soon.

My favorite breakfast place . Egg works ,egg and I etc they are all the same amazing breakfast food , beats any breakfast place I've ever been too . Good service even with busy hours opens 5am-3pm . I try and go here at least once everyone I'm in town and always take my friends who all fall in love with it every time .

Found this place on yelp and it was great!! The reviews about the Banana Nut Muffins are true. Amazing. I got a breakfast skillet that was great. My friend got the key largo crepe and it was great too!!  Lily was our waitress and was very attentive and sweet!  Reasonable prices and delicious. We went on a Saturday morn and beat the crowd by getting there around 10.
Top eggs in Vegas. Not too far away from the strip, our server Tamara was really nice and efficient. The prime rib egg dish is AWESOME.

We love this place! We've been a few times and have had a great experience each time. Jessica was our waitress this time and was a great server! Definitely asking for her again next time we eat here. I recommend the biscuits and gravy and ALWAYS get the muffins!

This has become my common stop right before leaving from Vegas back home. I have been there only 3 times and have had chili skillet every time. Food is great. Even my veggie friends have loved this place. Service is really friendly and attentive. First time I went there I had 3 different servers coming to take my order. I am not complaining. Idea of changing the egg logo to show that you need something is really cool. They might have taken it too far with "EggCeptional" kinda stuff on their T-shirts. 
They have LCD TVs so you can watch football games while having breakfast (if you are sober enough). One star less for not having this in San Diego.

Omg this place this delicious! Had the bacon and avocado omelet and it was Huge, they definitely don't skimp on the avocado either.  Service was fast and meal was amazing, waitress Chance was attentive and brought everything quickly. I will be eating here every time I'm in Vegas from now on!

People talk about Hash House and others.   This places doesn't do all the crazy stuff; just quality breakfast food.   I had the skillet and it was awesome.  Lots of potatoes, "stuff" and bread on the side.   

I'd come here if you're looking for a really, really solid breakfast without the frills and upscaled food items.
It would've been good but they forgot my order. So I had to wait. The waitress did apologize and comp our meals but we took it to go and I lost my appetite. I missed my friend finishing her marathon.

We got tired of paying a premium for breakfast on the strip and checked Yelp for some local suggestions in town.  The Egg & I seemed to have decent reviews, so we checked it out.  On the day we went, New Year's Eve morning, it was busy.  We had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated, which was fine.  

Looking at the menu, I quickly locked onto the biscuits & gravy meal (with eggs and potatoes).  I'm a complete sucker for this meal and decided to give it a try.  

When I ate my meal, I discovered the biscuits weren't homemade (and were crumbly) and the gravy was unremarkable.  You can't really screw up scrambled eggs.  The potatoes were wildly over seasoned and virtually unbearable to eat. 

I rate the Egg & I biscuits & gravy as a "5" (on a scale of 1-10 with 10 being the best I've ever had, which is at Arthur's Family Restaurant located in Orange, CA). 

The service was fine and the food came out fast.  If I'm in the area again, I'll give Egg & I a chance to redeem itself (by choosing something else off of the breakfast menu).

Wanted to find a local place off the strip for a good breakfast! This place was the spot!! Had the country fried steak and it was one of the best I've had! Our server Karla was efficient and friendly our water and coffees were always full. Highly recommend and will def come back next time we are in Vegas! THANKS KARLA!!!

First time eating here and I must say I was very impressed with the service and our server Patrick was very nice and attentive.Knowing that it was our first time there he recommended some breakfast items which is alway a plus in my book.Oh and did I mention the portions are huge perfect for a couple to split.

Every visit to Vegas we have to have breakfast here.  Great food, super nice people and a nice change from the hectic Strip.  Our waitress today, Tabatha, was awesome.  As a mom herself, she understood the needs of our two young children and really helped us out.

Very good menu, good food, excellent ambience.
Would definitely go there again  when i visit next time.

I had ordered the eggs benedict which was recommended. Overall, it was alright, it was just smothered in hollandaise sauce and I got kinda grossed out after a while. Their potatoes were good and nicely seasoned. But the main reason why I gave them 4 stars was for their banana nut muffin. Sooo good, slightly chewy and a nice sweet thin glaze on top. It was the best banana nut muffin I ever had.

Great breakfast, off the strip but it's definitely worth it! Karla was a great waitress!  We enjoyed the eggs Benedict with prime rib, waffles, corn beef hash, vanilla cappuccino and mimosas. There's enough food to share if you're a group of girls like us.

The banana muffins were delicious. Free when you check in :)

I was super excited to have brunch here during my stay in Vegas. I loved the cafe/home ambience and it was cute to have an egg concept throughout the menu/place but the food was not all that great.

I had the eggs Benedict which did not taste fresh or traditional. The sauce was way too heavy for my liking. 

My boyfriend got the meat omelette but it came with more potatoes than meat itself. The potatoes were dry so it was quite disappointing.

Service was great though. We had more than one server check on us and everyone appeared helpful. 

I wanted to like the food here but it didn't work out.

This place was "ok" the service was friendly enough. I had the French toast sandwich and a side of their special potatoes. The sandwich was very good. Good portion size. The potatoes were bad. Instead of like "country potatoes" which go better with bfast, these were more like French fries. They were super dry and just too crunchy for bfast. I guess it's a matter of preference but I didn't care for them at all. Had I been eating a burger tho, I probably would have liked them more.

I don't think I'll go out of my way to go back though.

The Egg & I! If I could eat at one place for breakfast every day of my life, it would be this place. Granted, I've only been here once, but I can't stop thinking about the delicious food I ate and how I wish we had this place in LA. 

I ordered the Chili Relleno omelet and the Country Benny. They had the option of ordering smaller portions of the skillets and omelet dishes which I really enjoyed because the portions were fairly large and I unfortunately can never finish my food, no matter how hard I try.

The Chili Relleno was so extremely flavorful, the omelet practically melted in my mouth. And the Country Benny, the gravy, the sausage, the biscuit... Mmmm! My eyes rolled back with every bite. I wanted to order the banana pancakes but I think I was getting ahead of myself. 

Our waitress, Carla, was amazing. She was very helpful and attentive, and definitely made my experience more enjoyable.

I will go to Vegas again just to eat here. Can't wait to come back!

Came to breakfast with a large group while in Vegas for a Birthday trip. It was so nice to eat off the strip and have a great cooked meal. Everyone in my party loved their dishes. I had Eggs Benedict, which was wonderful. 

Why I rated it a 4... server wasn't great. She was nice, friendly, and polite but wasn't real attentive. We had a long wait to have our order taken too. The coffee... was not drinkable. I love coffee w my breakfast food so that was kinda a disappointment but the Eggs Benedict made up for it!!

Emily, our server was excellent from start to finish. Offering drinks as soon as we walked in. Took our order promptly once we were ready and checked on us a fair amount of time to make sure everything was good. On top of that, her personality and kindness was a plus. Thanks Emily for the service and thank you Eggs & I for the good breakfast.
I love this place.  Today our server Alexa was excellent and super attentive.  I always have the same thing either the concoct chili omelette or the Chili Relleno omelette.  Both are awesome.

My husband and I didn't realize how far this place was from the Strip. A little too expensive of a fare for breakfast! HOWEVER, this place is super yummy. We did have a wait for about 40 minutes upon arrival as well. A local favorite. Combine tourists like us with locals, you got a busy place! Look in the 24/7 guide for a buy 1, get 1 entree free coupon. The banana nut muffin is served warm and is a must eat. We both got omelets - love the unique variety! The homestyle potatoes are super tasty and you get a generous portion. Fresh squeezed orange juice - a plus! The little black/yellow egg flipper as a service indicator is fun and helpful. Within seconds of flipping it to the black egg (meaning we needed service) the MANAGER was over at our table asking what we needed and joking with us. Everyone here is friendly, upbeat and happy you stopped in. Good place, good people. Go.

I really love breakfast/ brunch places! I like the seasoning on the potatoes and fries!
Sometimes it is nice to eat at a place that is off the strip

Can't say enough great things about this place! I come here at least once a month for breakfast and every time I come the service and food is amazing!  They prepare everything so fast too. The eggs are always cooked exactly how i want them and the pancakes are so fluffy.  The prices are a little bit higher than some lithe places i won't name but everything is always good here.  It get packed on the weekends.

I have gone here for breakfast numerous times when I am in LV.  They have a large menu, service is quick and I have always had good food.  The only negative is that their coffee is low grade, just barely drinkable.  Its certainly worth the 10 minute drive for better food and lower prices than what you can find on the Strip.
Horrible experience. Bacon...cold and old.  Pancakes dense and hard.  Potatoes deep fried and extremely salty. Please go somewhere else. Their food is NOT good.
Had an AWESOME  experience with Karla!  She was extremely courteous and SUPER energetic!
